description: When Sally Cuneo Ajello and her husband, Tom Ajello, went house hunting a few years ago, their three children, now ages 9, 7 and 4, were uppermost in their minds. We wanted open spaces for them to run and play and a school district that we felt confident in, said Ms. Ajello, 39, a freelance marketing consultant.

title: Candidate Selfies as the New Souvenir
description: Forget the handshake. Clintons supporters want a social media souvenir this election season.

title: Would You Want to Go to a School Like This One?
description: The Midland School in Los Olivos, Calif., is a prep school that prepares students for entry into competitive colleges, but it also teaches them how to raise livestock, grow vegetables and chop wood. And meeting the basic needs like electricity, hot water and food are a big part of the students responsibilities.

title: In Muhammad Dahlans Ascent, a Proxy Battle for Legitimacy
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  Muhammad Dahlan lives 1,300 miles from his Palestinian brethren in the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip. His spacious home here in Abu Dhabi, in the United Arab Emirates, features plush sofas, vaulted ceilings and chandeliers. The infinity pool in the back seems to spill into the glistening waterway beyond.

title: How to Be Mindful With Your Cat
description: Cat people are different from dog people. We must accept that felines are independent, and also cherish the moments when our cat curls up and starts to purr. Cats make it easy to be mindful.  Nancy Scanlan, executive director of the American Holistic Veterinary Medical Foundation.

title: Hair by Sam McKnight, the Story of an Image Maker
description: LONDON  Somerset House, the lavish palace perched on the banks of the Thames River that houses restaurants, the Courtauld Institute of Art and numerous galleries, has been home to exhibits on Big Bang Data, Bjork and the possibilities of a future Utopia. But until this week it had never been a frame for  hair.

title: Morning Agenda: Wells Fargo Hit Again, Bygone Times
description: The dust hasnt even settled on the scandal over fake accounts at Wells Fargo. And now, the bank has even more bad headlines to deal with, with a $50 million payment to settle a class-action lawsuit.

title: F.B.I., Mosul, Standing Rock: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Guide to Getting a Bachelors Abroad
description: There was a time when the self-confident undergraduate took a semester or two abroad to taste an unfamiliar culture and dip a toe into the waters of higher education on a foreign shore. Today, tasting is timid stuff.

title: Hostels and Shared Hotel Rooms Take Root in America
description: Hostels, budget havens of the post-college European travel circuit, traditionally offer bare-bones bunks in communal dormitories. Now for those whose tastes have graduated beyond the backpacking years but whose finances have not, a new breed of hybrid hostel sprouting up on this side of the Atlantic bundles better design, lively bars and restaurants and even some private rooms, all still nicely priced.

title: What Ken Jeong Cant Travel Without
description: Ken Jeong, a doctor-turned-actor, was on the critically acclaimed Community and played the gangster Leslie Chow in The Hangover movies before starring in his own ABC comedy series, Dr. Ken, now in its second season.

title: Fitness Trackers Might Help Us Live Longer (if Only We Used Them)
description: Activity monitors could improve our health and extend our lives  if only we could be motivated to use them. Those are the conclusions of two new studies about the promise and perils of relying on fitness trackers to measure and guide how we move.

title: New York Today: Revving Up for the Marathon
description: Updated, 11:28 a.m.

title: Iowa Police Arrest Suspect in Ambush Killings of 2 Officers
description: DES MOINES  They were each on overnight patrols early Wednesday, a rookie police officer and a veteran a few miles apart in the Des Moines area, when officials say they had the lethal misfortune to cross paths with an armed, disturbed man whose life was unraveling. Each officer was gunned down in the drivers seat of his patrol car, without so much as a chance to unholster his weapon.

title: Why Republicans Dont Even Try to Win Cities Anymore
description: Ronald Reagan visited the South Bronx in the summer of 1980, when Charlotte Street was still lined with vacant lots and the rubble of toppling tenements. The place looked like London after the blitz, he said, and he wanted to do something about it.

title: Glenda Jackson Hopes to Scale Mount Lear in Her Stage Return
description: LONDON  Its one of the most demanding roles in theater, but Glenda Jackson, the two-time Oscar-winning actress, will open a new production of King Lear on Friday having not stepped onstage for 25 years. In the interim, she worked to keep a realm together as a member of the British Parliament; her first act in her return to the theater will be to play a monarch who breaks one up.

title: South Korean Prosecutors Say They Will Bring Charges Against Presidents Friend
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korean prosecutors said on Wednesday that they intended to bring criminal charges against a longtime friend of President Park Geun-hye who is the central figure in a scandal engulfing her administration.

title: Alibaba Earnings Show It Again Defying Chinas Slowdown
description: HONG KONG  Amid concerns about a slowdown in the growth of the Chinese economy, Chinas largest e-commerce company is showing that  for now  business on its platforms is holding steady.

title: Is Coals Political Heft Plunging? One State May Be Canary in Mine
description: BELLINGHAM, Wash.  The American coal industry, with its billions of dollars and army of lobbyists, has a storied history of muscle and might. But in this northwest corner of Washington, people like Christopher Grannis, a 69-year-old building contractor and stalwart in local civic causes, are standing up to coal.

title: Early Vote in North Carolina Seems Consistent With a Clinton Lead
description: North Carolina has become perhaps the most important state in the election. It has the potential to decide the Senate and the presidency.

title: California Today: The Proposition That Has Jerry Brown Up in Arms
description: Good morning.

title: The G.O.P.s Radical Supreme Court Talk
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: New York Times Co. Reports an Advertising Drop, Though Digital Results Grew
description: The New York Times Company on Wednesday reported a steep decline in print advertising revenue for the third quarter, adding to the newspaper industrys woes.

title: 2 Iowa Officers Killed in Ambush-Style Attacks
description: The officers were shot dead in their patrol cars in two assaults in the Des Moines area early Wednesday.

title: Europes Mosquito-Free Island Paradise: Iceland
description: They suck your blood and buzz annoyingly around your ears. Their itchy bites can turn a festive barbecue miserable or ruin a bucolic walk in the woods. The most baneful ones spread diseases.

title: Pope Says Women Will Not Be Ordained as Priests
description: Pope Francis said the Catholic Churchs ban on female priests will most likely continue forever. The comment came during a press briefing aboard the papal plane late on Tuesday.

title: Broadcom to Buy Brocade Communications for $5.5 Billion
description: The chip maker Broadcom said on Wednesday that it had agreed to acquire Brocade Communications Systems, a maker of routers, switches and other computer networking equipment, for $5.5 billion in cash.

title: Philippines Deal With China Pokes a Hole in U.S. Strategy
description: BEIJING  For years, the United States and its allies have struggled to contain Chinas ambitions in the South China Sea, even as China steadily seeded the waters with artificial islands and military installations.

title: Russia Extends Aleppo Cease-Fire and Urges Rebels to Leave
description: MOSCOW  Russia said on Wednesday that it would extend a moratorium on airstrikes in the Syrian city of Aleppo until Friday to give embattled antigovernment rebels a chance to leave the city and to avoid senseless victims of continued fighting.

title: What You Get for  $750,000
description: A contemporary in Memphis, a Queen Anne in Denver and a stucco cottage in Oregon

title: $750,000 Homes in Tennessee, Colorado and Oregon
description: MEMPHIS

title: Farmers Unchecked Crop Burning Fuels Indias Air Pollution
description: MAULVIWALA, India  Desperate to reduce the pollution that has made New Delhis air quality among the worst in the world, the city has banned private cars for two-week periods and campaigned to reduce its ubiquitous fireworks during holiday celebrations.

title: Former BlackRock Fund Manager Pleads Guilty to Insider Trading
description: LONDON  A former fund manager at BlackRock pleaded guilty to insider trading charges in a London court on Wednesday, the British authorities said.

title: 7 Fall Shows You Should Be Watching  And How to Catch Up
description: TENS of thousands of movies, thousands of TV shows, hundreds of channels, dozens of streaming services. There are more movies and series to watch than ever before and more ways to experience them. It can all be a little overwhelming. But were here to help. The New York Times recently debuted a website called Watching, designed to help you decide what to watch. British period pieces, Scandinavian crime dramas, sci-fi adventures, oddball dark comedies  tell us what youre in the mood for, and well help you find your next favorite show or movie.

title: Loss Haunts A Tribe Called Quests First Album in 18 Years
description: ENGLEWOOD CLIFFS, N.J.  On March 22, at 3 a.m., Q-Tip and Phife Dawg were on the phone. The two rappers  lifelong friends from Queens and half of the influential hip-hop group A Tribe Called Quest  were yucking it up, Q-Tip recalled, and talking about a project few people outside their inner circle knew was in the works: a new Tribe album, the first in 18 years.

title: Treating Battered Horses in the Shadow of Egypts Pyramids
description: GIZA, Egypt  In a dank stable in the shadow of the Pyramids, a stallion lay on the ground, his broken leg at an odd angle despite the cast wrapped around it.

title: 1966: Josef Stalin Makes a Comeback in Russia
description: MOSCOW  Soviet party leader Leonid I. Breznev today attacked Communist China and praised Stalin, a hero of Chinas current cultural revolution, as an Old Bolshevik who played an important role in the 1917 revolution. Soviet history books never have denied Stalins revolutionary role. But since the de-Stalinization campaign began in 1956, it has been extremely rare for any Kremlin leader to give unqualified public praise to the late dictator.

title: Why America Needs a Female President
description: GREAT FALLS, Va.  When I was in third grade, my teacher asked who among us wanted to run for class president. I raised my hand along with a few boys, and the teacher told me to come to the front of the class. He turned me around to face the class and slapped my hands with a ruler, hard, and said, Thats for thinking that a girl can be president of anything.

title: The Season's Most Cheery, Beachy Carryalls
description: Practically a holiday in themselves, these capacious totes can take you from day to overnight with room for shopping in between.

title: An Artist and a Poet Consider Failure
description: For Ts ongoing series, the artist Camille Henrot responded to a poem by the poet Erin Belieu.

title: Obama Says Alternate Routes Are Being Reviewed for Dakota Pipeline
description: President Obama, in his first remarks on the violent standoff over an oil pipeline near the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota, called on both sides to show restraint and revealed that the Army Corps of Engineers was considering an alternative route for the project.

title: Running a Marathon With a Daughter to Cheer Me on
description: Ive had the vision in my head for years: Im running the New York City Marathon and I find my daughter, Bee, in the crowd. Its a simple moment, but one Ive wanted so badly for so long, I get choked up just thinking about it.

title: What to Look For When the Polling Drought Ends
description: There have been surprisingly few election polls since the F.B.I. director James Comeys letter to Congress last week. The dearth of polls has actually been a pattern all year: The number of live-interview polls in the battleground states fell to 36 from 80 compared with a similar period in 2012, according to FiveThirtyEights Harry Enten.

title: Can You Take a Voting Selfie? States Wage Legal Battles Days Before Election
description: If youre hoping to document your vote by taking a photo of your ballot, you may be headed for a legal gray area that in some states has grown only murkier in the days leading up to Election Day.

title: Separatist Hong Kong Lawmakers Draw Fears of Intervention by China
description: HONG KONG  It started with an oath of office that two young, newly elected lawmakers altered to insert a derogatory term into the formal name of Hong Kongs sovereign ruler, the Peoples Republic of China, with one also adding a crude epithet.

title: Keeping Lee Krasner Visible: Foundation Chooses New Gallery
description: Holdings of artworks by Lee Krasner, a leading  though largely unsung  Abstract Expressionist painter and the widow of Jackson Pollock, will now be represented by the Paul Kasmin Gallery, the Pollock-Krasner Foundation announced Wednesday.

title: Nonprofit Employees, Already Underpaid, Face Special Challenges in Retirement
description: There are untold numbers of crusading Roman Catholics in the annals of world history, but there probably has never been one quite like Mary Brunson.

title: Maltas Emerging Capital by the Sea
description: People love to invade Malta. The Mediterranean island nation, situated between Sicily and Tunisia, counts among its unwelcome guests the Romans, the Ottomans, Napoleon and, in the early 20th century, hundreds of Russian aristocrats fleeing the fall of the czarist autocracy. For the most part, the Maltese were having none of this. Napoleon was forced out after just two years, and the Knights of Malta  effectively, and against all odds  defeated the Ottoman Empires much larger forces. In Valletta, Maltas capital, people still bring up the Great Siege with enormous pride, boasting about it as if they had actually been there.

title: What to Cook Right Now
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: The Creator of Rectify on Why You Cant Watch and Multitask
description: Rectify, the critically praised but sparsely watched SundanceTV drama, was never intended for halfhearted viewing. Languid and contemplative  the first season covered a mere seven days  it follows Daniel Holden (Aden Young) as he returns to the stifling confines of his rural Georgia hometown after 19 years of death-row solitude. His conviction for the rape and murder of his high school girlfriend, Hanna Dean, has been vacated because of new DNA evidence. But though he is free, hes not exonerated.

title: Why Sexual Harassment Persists in Politics
description: WASHINGTON  Senator Claire McCaskill, Democrat of Missouri, got her first tutorial about life as a woman in politics as a college intern at the statehouse in Jefferson City in 1974, when male lawmakers made lecherous remarks to her in the elevator; she took the stairs after that. When she became a state legislator in 1983, the lessons became more explicit when she asked the House speaker on the dais his advice for getting legislation passed.

title: Start-Ups for the End of Life
description: Death and dying can be costly, but they are rarely considered a business by consumers. Many would rather not ponder critical decisions about feeding tubes, funeral homes and other end-of-life issues until the need is thrust upon them.

title: Microsoft Puts Slack in Cross Hairs With New Office Chat App
description: REDMOND, Wash.  In the last couple of years at Microsoft, some old habits have been tossed away, like obsessively placing Windows software at the center of all the companys big bets. But the company would still dig trenches to protect Office, its $23-billion-a-year software franchise.

title: Put Your Phone to Work Doing Some Good
description: WITH the holidays upon us, some smartphone apps can let you help someone in need with just a few taps of your finger.

title: First Gentlemen Around the World
description: This is the closest America has come to having a woman as president, and to having a first husband in the White House. What would that look like, and what would Bill Clintons role be?

title: Video Feature: First Gentlemen Around the World
description: First Husband? First Gentleman? Presidential spouse? What will we call former President Bill Clinton if his wife, Hillary, wins on Nov. 8?

title: 'Kids' Director Larry Clark Lends His Eye to Dior
description: Plus: Are rental tuxes tacky? (Not necessarily.)

title: You Dont Need a No-Fly Zone to Pressure Russia in Syria
description: The Obama administrations Syria policy has collapsed under the weight of a brutal assault on Aleppo by the forces of President Bashar al-Assad and Russia. Shrugging off global condemnation, Russia and Mr. Assad have dispatched their aircraft to attack schools and hospitals, singling out civilian targets to make the city uninhabitable and force its remaining population to flee.

title: Obamas 3-Day Swing Will Try to Push Blacks and Millennials Hillary Clintons Way
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  With Democrats concerned about lagging early turnout among blacks and younger voters, President Obama on Wednesday began a three-day swing aimed at galvanizing a couple of the pillars of his political coalition in two states that could deny Donald J. Trump any route to the presidency.

title: Veterans, Feeling Abandoned, Stand by Donald Trump
description: The roster of retired military officers endorsing Hillary Clinton in September glittered with decoration and rank. One former general led the American surge in Anbar, one of the most violent provinces in Iraq. Another commanded American-led allied forces battling the Taliban in Afghanistan. Yet another trained the first Iraqis to combat Islamic insurgents in their own country.

title: Updated Uber App Will Connect Your Calendar With Your Ride
description: Uber has redesigned its app with new features that anticipate more of a passengers needs as the company works to differentiate its ride-hailing service in a crowded field of rivals.

title: How a Changing Climate Is Shaping a Leaf Peepers Paradise
description: IONA, Nova Scotia  A century ago, the flaming fall foliage in Nova Scotia would have long faded by early November. But today, some of the hills are still as nubbly with color as an aunts embroidered pillow.

title: William Weld, Libertarian, Sticks Up for Hillary Clinton, a Rival
description: William F. Weld, the Libertarian Party nominee for vice president, defended Hillary Clinton on Wednesday against attacks from Donald J. Trump, insisting her character should not be impugned by someone as flawed as he is.

title: Tech-Minded Performances Are Coming to the Coil Festival
description: With virtual reality, a multimedia take on Euripides and dance accompanied by 64 robotic instruments, technology will reign at the 2017 edition of Coil, Performance Space 122s annual festival of innovative theater, music and dance.

title: James Burke, Ex-Suffolk County Police Chief, Is Sentenced to 46 Months
description: CENTRAL ISLIP, N.Y.  The once popular and swaggering chief of the Suffolk County Police Department, James Burke, was sentenced to 46 months in federal prison on Wednesday for a series of misdeeds that began after a duffel bag belonging to him was stolen from his parked sport utility vehicle.

title: Obama Faults F.B.I. on Emails, Citing Incomplete Information
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  President Obama threw the power of the White House behind Hillary Clinton on Wednesday. He faulted how the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, handled new emails related to the investigation into Mrs. Clintons private server, and then shouted out to college students here in a pivotal battleground state that it was crucial that they vote because the fate of the world is teetering.

title: Daily Report: How to Think About Thinking Machines
description: If you cant invent the future the way you used to, maybe you can help us get ready for it.

title: Sleep Poorly? You May Eat Too Much the Next Day
description: Not enough sleep last night? You may overeat today.

title: How to Change the Way You Pay in Google Play
description: Q. How do I delete the stored credit card from the Google Play store on my Android tablet and change it to a prepaid Google Play gift card?

title: 3-D Printing Pioneer Goes Low Tech, With a $5,800 Watch Made in Brooklyn
description: Seven years ago, Bre Pettis established himself as a Silicon Alley futurist when he helped found MakerBot, a pioneering Brooklyn company that helped make 3-D printing more widely accessible with affordably priced desktop machines.

title: Gawker and Hulk Hogan Reach $31 Million Settlement
description: In fighting a lawsuit filed by the former professional wrestler Hulk Hogan, Gawker Media lost nearly everything  the verdict, its founder, its independence  but it maintained its resolute conviction that it would win on appeal.

title: For Schoolchildren, Weights Rise Along With Summer Temperatures
description: Summer is the season when children play outdoors tirelessly until nightfall, burning up all the energy they had stockpiled throughout the school year, right?

title: Volkswagen Parts Ways With the Historian Who Chronicled Its Nazi Past
description: BERLIN  Volkswagen has been struggling for a year to repair the damage caused by a scandal over its cover-up of diesel emissions, promising honesty and transparency. Now historians are accusing the company of reverting to secretive ways on a different subject: the Nazi past of German automakers.

title: A Big Life Change Is More Planning Than Magic
description: A big life change does not come easily.

description: To the Editor:

title: A Four-Bedroom House With Ocean Views on St. John
description: The hillside home, overlooking Cinnamon Bay from the islands north shore, is on the market for $3.299 million.

description: To the Editor:

description: A FOUR-BEDROOM HOME OVERLOOKING CINNAMON BAY IN ST. JOHN

title: Mosul Neighbors Wake Up to a Day Without ISIS
Black Votes Matter
description: To the Editor:

title: The Ballerina Who Got Away Comes Back
description: When the Pacific Northwest Ballet principal dancer Carla Krbes announced in 2014 that she would retire at the end of the next season, at 33, it came as a bit of a shock. Ms. Krbes, whose performances were a marvel of musicality and clarity, surely had many more years of dancing ahead of her. New Yorkers were especially stricken  they had had only a few glimpses of her in the past decade.

title: Reducing the Debt, Creatively
description: To the Editor:

title: A Game 7, and the Indians Ask Corey Kluber to Beat the Cubs Again
description: CLEVELAND  The last time the Cleveland Indians won the World Series, in 1948, they had two Hall of Famers in the rotation, another in the bullpen, and three more in the starting lineup. The Indians team that will try to win this World Series, in Game 7 on Wednesday night against the Chicago Cubs, is different.

title: Andreas Gurskys Vibrant Photography at Gagosian
description: The German artist Andreas Gurskys photography has given us aerial views of cattle in muddy Colorado stockyards and a serpentine Grand Prix racetrack in Bahrain. Now he has turned his lens on tulip fields. These works, along with several others never before exhibited in the United States, will be on view at Gagosian Gallery in Chelsea starting Thursday, Nov. 10.

title: Atlantic Theater Company Has a New Musical From David Yazbek
description: In 2001, the composer and lyricist David Yazbek, who wrote for Late Night With David Letterman for a stint in the early 1980s, told a Toronto newspaper: Id always wondered if I could write a song that could get the kind of laughs that a good sketch could get. His career in musical theater has made that possible, starting in 2000 with his delightful Broadway debut The Full Monty, a charming musical that was funnier than the 1997 movie. He has since worked in many mediums, including television and cabaret, but has written a new musical about every five years. His latest, which starts previews Off Broadway at the Atlantic Theater Company on Friday, Nov. 11, is another adaptation, this time of the movie The Bands Visit, about an Egyptian group that arrives in Israel to play a show but ends up stranded in a remote village after a mix-up at the border. Itamar Moses wrote the book, and David Cromer, who replaced Hal Prince, directs a cast that includes John Cariani and Tony Shalhoub. (atlantictheater.org)

title: Rules of the Game, a Multilayered Dance, Is Coming to BAM
description: Life can involve game upon game. Jonah Bokaer, a former member of the Merce Cunningham Dance Company, relishes choreographic games. And Rules of the Game, his new dance production, is a puzzle of artistic layers. It takes its title from a work by the great Italian dramatist Luigi Pirandello, as well as another play that is being rehearsed by actors in Pirandellos Six Characters in Search of an Author, who find themselves invaded by characters from still another, but unfinished, drama. Mr. Bokaer said that although his creation is plotless, his choreography subtly links each dancer to someone in Six Characters. It haunts the production, designed by Daniel Arsham (with new music by Pharrell Williams), with Pirandello ghosts. Mr. Bokaers program, which celebrates 10 years of collaborating with Mr. Arsham, also includes Recess, a solo, and  more games  Why Patterns, in which dancers interact with multitudes of table tennis balls. (Thursday, Nov. 10, through Saturday at 7:30 p.m., BAM Howard Gilman Opera House, Fort Greene; 718-636-4100, bam.org.)

title: Drones, So Useful in War, May Be Too Costly for Border Duty
description: GRAND FORKS, N.D.  Cameras on drones stare down at the Canadian border from as high as 28,000 feet, scanning vast stretches of mountains, rivers and forests for potential terrorists and drug smugglers.

title: Mary J. Blige and Maxwell at the Garden
description: Depending on the artist, when the personal bleeds aggressively into the professional, it can be a recipe for either messiness or motivation. For Mary J. Blige, the veteran R&B belter whos at her best when emotionally charged, heartbreak is inspiration. This summer, she filed for divorce from her husband of more than a decade and longtime manager, but instead of cowering from tabloid headlines, she has worked them into her live show. A recent single, Thick of It, from her coming album Strength of a Woman, is similarly defiant: Whos gonna love you like I do? Who will you trust? I gave you too much. That combination of vulnerability and resilience can be expected when Ms. Blige and Maxwell, the progressive soul seducer, headline Madison Square Garden on Thursday, Nov. 10, as part of their King and Queen of Hearts Tour. I dont hold back, Ms. Blige said recently, and theres no way I am going to start changing now. (ticketmaster.com)

title: Trump Advisers Slur Is a Sign of Things to Come
description: One night, after the Democratic convention, I caught a train back to downtown Philadelphia. Some men boarded the train a few stops after me, shouting about Hillary Clinton. I took out my earphones to listen. Shes a slut who belongs in jail, one of them said.

title: Deep Water, a Crime Thriller, Comes to Acorn TV
description: Fans of Orange Is the New Black know her as Lorna Morello, the hard-on-the-ears, sweetly delusional Litchfield Penitentiary inmate whose romantic travails have kept Netflix viewers in stitches for four seasons. But somewhere beneath Morellos ruby-red lipstick, cockeyed accent and histrionics lurks the Australian actress Yael Stone. And in Deep Water, a crime thriller debuting Monday, Nov. 7, on Acorn TV, shes virtually unrecognizable. Her face scrubbed bare and her vowels subdued, Ms. Stone plays Tori Lustigman, a police detective investigating a vicious killing with sexual undercurrents in a suburb of Sydney. But when a clue links the case to a similar one from 26 years earlier, Tori uncovers 70 possible murders of gay men spanning decades along New South Waless glorious shoreline  and the possibility that the culprit is back at it. Every day, Tori, you come to work prepared to give up your life to protect others, her boss says. But youve got a son. Why would you do that? Some secrets cant be washed away.

title: Fed Signals Its on Track to Raise Interest Rates in December
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve on Wednesday continued its slow march toward higher interest rates, signaling that it remains on track to raise its benchmark interest in December for the first time this year but holding off on an increase this month.

title: Wheres Outrage Over F.B.I. Disclosure? Not Among Voters
description: Hillary Clinton and President Obama are outraged about the F.B.I. director James Comeys decision to disclose further inquiries into her handling of confidential email, but are the American people?

title: 3 Big Shows for New Music in New York
description: Three important contemporary-music performers converge on New York, starting on Wednesday, Nov. 9, at Roulette in Brooklyn, where the harpist and composer Zeena Parkins will perform a solo called The Captiva Pieces, created at the Rauschenberg Residency on Captiva Island, Fla. (8 p.m., roulette.org)

title: Laura Poitras and Her Films at the Museum of the Moving Image
description: With the surreal election season about to end, documentaries move to the fore, starting at the Museum of the Moving Image in Queens with Pushing the Envelope, a program of nonfiction films that won or were nominated for Cinema Eye Honors. On Sunday, Nov. 6, Laura Poitrass so-called 9/11 Trilogy will be shown. My Country, My Country follows an Iraqi physician who runs for office; The Oath introduces a Yemeni cabdriver who was once Osama bin Ladens bodyguard, and his brother-in-law, a prisoner at Guantnamo. Citizenfour, of course, is her Academy Award-winning account of meeting with the former N.S.A. contractor Edward J. Snowden in Hong Kong. Ms. Poitras (and the cinematographer Kirsten Johnson) will take questions after The Oath and Citizenfour. (718-784-0077; movingimage.us)

title: The Worst Party of the Year? Election Night
description: Way back before the primaries, when the coming presidential election seemed like just another quadrennial exercise of our nations democratic ideals and not a referendum on our nations soul, Molly Rose Quinn decided she was going to give a party on Nov. 8.

title: A Cyberattack and Medical Devices
description: To the Editor:

title: Mergers Could Help European Investment Banks Compete With U.S.
description: Credit Suisses chief executive, Tidjane Thiam, is clearly frustrated with the investment banking operations of the institution he oversees.

title: The Last Word, an Imitation Speakeasy, Opens in Queens
description: By now, the imitation speakeasy is familiar territory. Dozens have opened in Manhattan and Brooklyn, behind unmarked doors, Potemkin coffee shops and hidden alleyways. But Queens is proudly behind the curve.

title: Opera Lover Apologizes for Scattering Ashes and Silencing the Met
description: The Dallas opera lover who scattered a friends ashes in the orchestra pit at the Metropolitan Opera on Saturday  causing a terrorism scare, and forcing the Met to cut one performance short and cancel another  apologized Wednesday in a letter emailed to Met officials.

title: Wearable Devices That Could Heal Themselves When They Break
description: A sports bra that monitors your workout. A suit that lets you swap business cards digitally. A beanie hat that tracks your newborns vitals. Smart garments like these hint at a future coming up fast, with wearable electronics integrated into our clothing or even our skin, capable of constantly monitoring our biology and tracking our social interactions.

title: Jacob Zumas Administration Should Be Investigated, South Africa Watchdog Says
description: JOHANNESBURG  A South African government watchdog group recommended on Wednesday that President Jacob Zumas administration be officially investigated for possible corruption.

title: Trump Probably Avoided His Medicare Taxes, Too
description: In the final debate, Hillary Clinton said she would secure Social Security and Medicare by raising taxes on high-income earners, including herself and her opponent, Donald J. Trump, assuming he cant figure out how to get out of it.

title: Hindu Temples and Homes in Bangladesh Are Attacked by Muslim Crowds
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  Crowds of Muslims attacked Hindu homes and temples in eastern Bangladesh this week, raising concerns that the authorities are not taking steps to curb rising religious tensions.

title: Review: Traces of Anachronism in an All-Steve Reich Evening
description: An inventor and master of Minimalism, Steve Reich turned 80 on Oct. 3. And proving that a composer in late career need not grasp at obvious innovation, he celebrated on Tuesday in the soaring Stern Auditorium at Carnegie Hall with three works  even a brand-new one  unafraid of seeming dated.

title: NYC Winter Jazzfest to Honor Thelonious Monk
description: The NYC Winter Jazzfest has announced its 2017 edition, which will take place Jan. 5 through Jan. 10, with about 140 groups drawing on a range of styles across 13 different stages. As always, the centerpiece will be a smorgasbord-like Winter Jazzfest Marathon, on Jan. 6 and Jan. 7.

title: Review: Jarrod Spectors Jersey Tour, Valli to the Boss and More
description: Scattered throughout Jarrod Spectors opening-night performance of Jukebox Life, his entertaining autobiographical show at Feinsteins/54 Below on Tuesday, were video clips of Mr. Spector as a child performer. There he is as an eager 3-year-old vaudevillian belting the Jolson standard Toot, Toot, Tootsie! (Goodbye) with the enthusiasm of the very young Michael Jackson, and as a 10-year-old singing Mack the Knife. His parents, he explained, were obsessed with Bobby Darin. Not surprisingly, the grown-up Mr. Spector has a knack for mimicry.

title: Swinging the Vote: Jazz Inspired by the Presidential Race
description: Nine months ago, when the term election fatigue had a much more hypothetical ring, the jazz pianist Marcus Roberts released a digital EP titled Race for the White House. It consisted of a handful of compositions inspired by the presidential field, each a character portrait in brief.

title: Charity That Begins With Spaghetti Sauce
description: Mention the name Paul Newman and many movie buffs will describe the charismatic actor with the piercing blue eyes who starred in films like Cool Hand Luke, The Sting and Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid. But many people will identify Mr. Newman as the philanthropic kingpin, whose Newmans Own food brand has raised hundreds of millions of dollars for charity.

title: The Modern Love Podcast: Issa Rae Reads Even in Real Life, There Were Screens Between Us
description: In this weeks podcast, the actress Issa Rae (Insecure, The Misadventures of Awkward Black Girl) reads Even in Real Life, There Were Screens Between Us, which won our 2011 college essay contest.

title: Black Church Burned in Mississippi, With Vote Trump Scrawled on Side
description: GREENVILLE, Miss.  A predominantly African-American church here was badly burned on Tuesday evening, with the words Vote Trump spray-painted on the side of the building, an episode that comes amid rising concerns over possible violence in the final days of a polarizing and racially charged presidential race.

title: In New TV Fare, National Geographic Sustains Its Climate Focus
description: Remember that wave of angst and suspicion among environmentalists when the Murdoch familys21st Century Foxpaid $725 million to form a for-profit joint venture with National Geographic? The logic of the move for the venerable publishing, education and science society lay in creating a predictable and large flow of money to support its work. The fears centered on the prospect that the Fox News approach to issues like climate change would spill across National Geographic, from the magazine to the TV programming. There were tough staff cuts right away, but where in media companies (including this one) is that not the case these days?

title: Mosul, Jacob Zuma, Federal Reserve: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Mark Rothkos Dark Palette Illuminated
description: One evening in 1968, Mark Rothko regaled the art dealer Arne Glimcher, who had dropped by his studio on his way home from Pace Gallery in New York, with the story of a visit from a collector that day.

title: The Campaign Tour: Pop Musicians Get on the Bus (Mostly Clintons)
description: It sounds like the lineup for an eclectic all-star music festival: Jay Z, Katy Perry, Jon Bon Jovi, the National, Steve Aoki. And it is, almost, though the musicians will be spread across political swing states in the coming days, volunteering their services in support of Hillary Clinton.

title: James Comeys Self-Righteous Meddling
description: There are two possible explanations for James Comeys decision to announce last week that he was examining emails that appear to be pertinent to the investigation of Hillary Clintons use of a private email server.

title: What Would Michelle Do?
description: Make Election Day a celebration of the style of the first lady.

title: Alasdhair Willis, Hunter Boot Man, Doesnt Mind the Rain
description: LONDON  Talking about the weather is a British national pastime. For Alasdhair Willis, the creative director of Hunter and the husband of the fashion designer Stella McCartney, inclement weather is a work-related subject of discussion.

title: Lifesaving Cancer Drugs May in Rare Cases Threaten the Heart
description: Powerful drugs that enlist the immune system to fight cancer can, in rare cases, cause heart damage, doctors are reporting.

title: Behind the Scenes of Athi-Patra Rugas Over the Rainbow
description: The artist takes T to a makeup trial, a fitting, a rehearsal and the final Performa event.

title: A Performance Artist Tackles South African Identity, for a New York Audience
description: Draped in billowing, Champagne-colored satin with a haphazard stack of tiaras strapped to his head, the artist Athi-Patra Ruga sprawled on a dance-studio floor in Brooklyn last Saturday, holding court. There are so many South Africas, and thats the story of South Africa, he proclaimed to those listening, the director and chief curator of Performa RoseLee Goldberg among them. He then paused to collect his thoughts; in Ruga time, both a stray millisecond sans speech and a minute-long interruption for dramatic effect seem entirely intentional. Maybe, he determined, I should start with the whole rainbow thing.

title: Accord Reached in Battle Over The Great Comet
description: An uneasy peace has broken out on West 45th Street.

title: The Best New TV Shows and Movies on Amazon Prime
description: Legally Blonde

title: World Series: Heres How the Chicago Cubs Won Game 7
description: CLEVELAND  Throughout more than a century of baseball in America, where teams have risen to championship heights and fallen to miserable lows several times over, and where cities have lost teams, gained them and lost them again, there was always the Chicago Cubs and their futility.

title: Tommy Hilfiger: American Dreamer
description: The designer and friends celebrate the publication of his memoir.

title: Gigi Hadid, Naomi Campbell and More Celebrate Tommy Hilfiger
description: On Tuesday evening, the Clocktower restaurant on Madison Avenue had a red, white and blue look. The walls were hung with vintage photographs of American icons: Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey, the Guggenheim, the entrance to Radio City Music Hall, Audrey Hepburn, James Dean and Muhammad Ali.

title: Fancy a Little Embellishment? Holiday Pop-Ups Are Arriving
description: Julie Heller, curator of the SoHo vintage gallery EraLuxe and the summer Hamptons multibrand retail space Cabana, is bringing the beach to Manhattan with a holiday pop-up opening Thursday. Youll find dreamy gifts like a 90s Tom Ford for Gucci blue velvet tuxedo ($895) and a Hunting Season navy lizard cross-body ($1,195). At 42 Hudson Street.

title: The Washington Legacy of James Galanos
description: The designer James Galanos, who died last Sunday, left a legacy of elegance and restraint to the fashion world. But he also left something to the political world, which is worth remembering, especially as we teeter on the verge of a new presidential administration.

title: Some Who Saw Change in Obama Find It Now in Donald Trump
description: GRANTVILLE, Pa.  It didnt take long for Jack Morris to regret voting for President Obama. A few months after Mr. Morris, a lifelong Republican, cast his first vote for a Democrat in 2008, he learned that the carpet company where he worked planned to lay off 36 people in Pennsylvania and move his job to Maryland.

title: Mary-Louise Parker: The First Time I Performed in New York (With Actual Egg on My Face)
description: I was 15. My dad brought me the newspaper, open to an article about an arts college. A whole department was devoted to what I secretly wanted to pursue, drama, but I was drawn to a photo of a boy. He was close to my age, with unruly blond hair, and looking like a badass while riding a unicycle and juggling. When I showed up for my first day of college two years later, seeing this boy in the flesh was like spotting a superhero in a cafeteria, eating cereal. There he is, I thought. Peter Hedges. That dreamy newspaper boy who juggles.

title: Review: The Attention Merchants Dissects the Battle for Clicks and Eyeballs
description: Does anyone remember when Rolling Rock beer ran a campaign on highway billboards back in 2008, promising that the company would project its logo onto the next full moon? It turned out that the whole thing was a hoax dreamed up by the advertising firm that handled Rolling Rock, though other companies, including Coca-Cola, had investigated this idea in earnest years before.

title: A Senators Bullseye Joke Echoes Trump
description: Echoes of Donald Trumps worst campaign instincts  on gun control and the news media  are registering down ballot in North Carolina, a crucial toss-up state where Senator Richard Burr, a Republican, is in a tight re-election race.

title: Samara Scotts Suspended Animation
description: The artist combines bits of discarded material and organic matter in liquid pools.

title: One Artists Curiously Beautiful Works, Created from Detritus
description: The week before her first Los Angeles show, on her first visit to the city, the Londonbased artist Samara Scott rented a car and slowly cruised around the dryness, ingesting the landscape under the presence of the sky that is so intense here that everything feels like a backdrop, like its been flat-packed.

title: Review: Big Baby D.R.A.M. Finds a Rapper-Singer in Whimsy Mode
description: D.R.A.M., the Virginia rapper-singer who crash-landed into pop last year with the earnest goof Cha Cha, is one of the first breakout stars of hip-hops whimsy era, a rapper and singer who switches without trepidation among vocal approaches, moods and stylistic lanes, but never loses his grin.

title: Cubs, Indians, Election: Your Wednesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Place for Family and Italian-American Cocktails in Brooklyn
description: When John Sartor came back from the Vietnam War, he and a buddy opened a bar in Cliffside Park, N.J., called R. Jays Pub, a no-frills hangout for his family and friends.

title: Bolshoi Gives Building Pass to Dancer Involved in Acid Attack on its Director
description: MOSCOW  The scandalous acid attack that has shadowed the storied Bolshoi Ballet here for almost four years took yet another bizarre twist on Wednesday, as the ballet confirmed it had allowed the dancer convicted in the assault to take practice classes there again.

title: No Tofurkey for You (and Other Thanksgiving Cooking Advice)
description: Have questions about recipes, cooking and food? My job is to answer them, as I have here with readers Thanksgiving inquiries. Ask me anything: foodeditor@nytimes.com.

title: Netanyahu Criticizes American Jewish Leaders Over Western Wall Protest
description: JERUSALEM  In a sign of a growing rift, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu criticized American Jewish leaders on Wednesday as a struggle over a stalled plan for equal prayer rights for both sexes at a Jerusalem holy site erupted with mutual recriminations and a tumultuous protest led by liberal rabbis wielding Torah scrolls.

title: Comparing Medicare Prescription Drug Plans
description: People covered by Medicare have a few more weeks to change their prescription drug plans, during the programs annual open enrollment period.

title: Bill Cosby Trial on Sexual Assault Charges May Be Held Earlier Than Expected
description: Norristown, Pa.  The long-awaited criminal trial of entertainer Bill Cosby on sexual assault charges could be held earlier than currently planned if pretrial hearings are completed on schedule in December, the judge in the case said Wednesday.

title: Universals Deal for Princes Song Rights May Bring a Wider Audience
description: For months, the most closely watched contest in the music industry has been for the songs of Prince, who died in April.

title: These Are the Bad (and Worse) Options James Comey Faced
description: When federal officials concluded their investigation into Hillary Clintons use of a private email server as secretary of state, the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, had a decision to make on how to announce that news. The choices he made in July set the F.B.I. on the path toward the predicament it faces today.

title: Facebook Defies Social Media Gravity With User and Profit Growth
description: SAN FRANCISCO  To paraphrase Isaac Newtons third law of motion, what goes up must, inevitably, come down. Now try telling that to Facebook.

title: Connor McDavid and Auston Matthews Are Hockeys Latest Legends-in-Waiting
description: TORONTO  The hype began to build hours before the puck dropped Tuesday night  unusual for an N.H.L. game just a few weeks into the regular season.

title: Robert Weber Dies at 92; His New Yorker Cartoons Twitted the Overprivileged
description: Robert Weber, whose elegant and witty cartoons about the privileged and the self-involved were staples of The New Yorker for 45 years, died on Oct. 20 in Branford, Conn. He was 92.

title: A Day Late for Hamilton
description: Dear Diary:

title: Stanford Lipsey, 89, Publisher Whose Nebraska Weeklies Won Pulitzer, Dies
description: Stanford Lipsey, a publisher who persuaded Warren E. Buffett to invest in newspapers and whose chain of Nebraska weeklies won a Pulitzer Prize for exposing fund-raising excesses by Boys Town, the charity for orphaned children, died on Tuesday at his home in Rancho Mirage, Calif. He was 89.

title: Don Marshall, Who Made Casting History in Land of the Giants, Is Dead at 80
description: Don Marshall, one of the first black actors to have a starring role on an American network television series, as a spaceships efficient, levelheaded first officer stranded on a mysterious planet on Land of the Giants, died on Sunday in Los Angeles. He was 80.

title: Serial Human Rights Abuser in Iran to Get 135 Lashes in Graft Case
description: A former high-ranking Iranian judicial official who came to symbolize Irans violent suppression of rights activists and journalists has been sentenced to 135 lashes in a corruption case.

title: Reaching the Top, the Cubs and the Indians Are Poised to Stay There
description: CLEVELAND  It is easy to imagine a World Series rematch, someday soon, of the Chicago Cubs and the Cleveland Indians. Both teams have young players just entering their primes, and several stars on long-term contracts.

title: Filling Harry Reids Nevada Senate Seat
description: The Senate race in Nevada between Catherine Cortez Masto, a Democrat, and Representative Joe Heck, a Republican, is gripping on several levels. Nevada is the only state where Republicans have a solid chance of winning a Democratic Senate seat this year. The seat has belonged for 30 years to Harry Reid, the current minority leader, who is not seeking re-election. A Republican victory would thus be not only a loss for the Democrats but a personal embarrassment for a venerable power broker. It would also be a triumph for the Koch brothers, who say theyre seeking poetic justice after years of being denounced by Mr. Reid for their conservative politics, and are spending lots of money to make that happen.

title: David Ross, Oldest Player in World Series, Ends Career in Climactic Game 7
description: CLEVELAND  For more than eight months, from the start of spring training to the start of Game 7 of the World Series on  Wednesday night, David Ross felt as if his baseball life had become the stuff of big-screen fiction, if not straight-up fantasy.

title: Readers React After Pope Francis Says Ban on Female Priests Is Most Likely Permanent
description: Pope Francis said on Tuesday that the Roman Catholic Churchs teaching that women cannot be ordained as priests was likely to last forever.

title: Collusion Caused Dodgers TV Blackout, Justice Department Says
description: Most of the Los Angeles market has been unable to watch Dodgers games on the teams cable channel since 2014, an impasse that this season deprived many fans of the farewell tour of Vin Scully, the broadcaster who retired last month after 67 seasons as the voice of the team.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: I dont want pity. I just want people to care. Do you know what your politicians are sending us to do?

title: College Is the Goal: Will These Teenagers Get There?
description: The Times followed three teenagers in Topeka, Kan., on their quest to go to college. Follow their paths here.

title: Outrage in Bronx as Barnes & Noble Is Set to Close
description: Every day after school, 4-year-old Nicholai Rose demands that his mother take him first to the park then to the Barnes & Noble in the Baychester neighborhood of the Bronx. There, they snuggle in a corner in the childrens section and, each time, read I Need My Monster, his favorite picture book.

title: Acclaimed Novels and Memoirs That Call the Bronx Home
description: While Brooklyn and Manhattan might be better known from book titles, the Bronx has been home to famous authors and host to venues that provided them with their muse.

title: City College Gets Interim Leader After Presidents Sudden Exit
description: Hoping to restore some stability to the City College of New York after the unexpected resignation of its president, the City University of New York announced on Wednesday that it had selected an interim leader for its flagship college.

title: Carousel Locale
description: THURSDAY PUZZLE  There is a point in developing ones solving skills where you finally get good enough to drop in quite a few answers without having to think about them very much and that, to be honest, is when most people get a little cocky. Theres nothing wrong with that; confidence is a wonderful thing, especially when youve spent so much time battling the grid.

title: Review: Anna Deavere Smiths Notes From the Field Delivers Voices of Despair and Hope
description: Just listen, if you would, to how she listens.

title: Review: Kingdom Come, About Meeting (but Not Cute) Online
description: Two lonely women search for connection online, with unexpected results, in Kingdom Come, a low-key but likable new comedy-drama by Jenny Rachel Weiner that opened at the Roundabout Underground on Wednesday.

title: Bronx Man Dies After Police Use Taser on Him
description: An emotionally disturbed Bronx man who threatened a neighbor with a knife died after a police sergeant used an electric stun gun on him, the police said on Wednesday.

title: Not-So-Ordinary Joe: Final Round for an Arena Named for an Athlete
description: The Detroit Red Wings have begun their final season at Joe Louis Arena. And when they move out next year, it will be the end for an arena with a feature that is exceedingly rare in major North American sports.

title: With Mosul Under Siege, ISIS Leader Breaks Silence to Issue a Rallying Cry
description: After a nearly yearlong silence, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the self-declared caliph of the Islamic State, released a blistering audio recording imploring his forces to remain firm in the face of the American-backed Iraqi offensive in Mosul and excoriating those who might consider fleeing.

title: Knicks, Lacking Coordination Against Rockets, Fall Again
description: Carmelo Anthony sat on the Knicks bench, sifting through another drubbing  a second consecutive double-digit loss on a second consecutive day  and addressed the frustration bubbling out. He soothed himself by once again taking the long-term view and by telling himself that it will get better for these Knicks.

title: Renewable Energy Grows in an Unlikely Place: the Sunny Mideast
description: LONDON  When it comes to energy, the Middle East and Persian Gulf are best known for their oil and gas. But across the region, governments, power companies and investors are beginning to exploit another abundant resource: the sun.

title: Energy Giants Turn to Drones and Sensors in New Embrace of the Digital World
description: When Chris Blackford started pitching Sky-Futures, the drone company he had co-founded, to oil and natural gas companies, there initially was not much interest.

title: Five Places to Shop Around Brick Lane in London
description: The sinuous, narrow streets and low-slung buildings around Brick Lane in Londons East End were once a part of a rough-and-tumble neighborhood. Nowadays, seedy has given way to charming, as scores of young Londoners gather on the sidewalks or sit on the curbs, happily eating takeout curry from a number of places. Indie rock music wafts through the air, adding to the festive vibe. With its bohemian flair and appealing mix of cultures, Brick Lane and the surrounding streets have become a destination for vintage lovers and trend-seekers alike.

title: A Global Climate Deal Was Reached. Next Up Is Pollution Monitoring.
description: The Paris climate agreement is, obviously, a very big deal: Last year, nearly 200 nations agreed to take on the challenge of a warming world. Their stated goal was to hold the increases in world temperature since the beginning of the industrial revolution to well below 2 degrees Celsius.

title: Why Light Bulbs May Be the Next Hacker Target
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The so-called Internet of Things, its proponents argue, offers many benefits: energy efficiency, technology so convenient it can anticipate what you want, even reduced congestion on the roads.

title: Pollution Accord Is Set for Global Flights, but Tasks Remain
description: The great and the good of world aviation gathered in Montreal last month to do something that seemed impossible even a couple of years ago. They agreed to cap greenhouse gas emissions from international flights.

title: Batteries That Make Use of Solar Power, Even in the Dark
description: HARTWELL, ENGLAND  A new cash crop has sprung up on Nicholas Beattys enchanting farm near here. Rows of gray solar panels range over about 25 acres, turning sunlight into electricity, as dog-size muntjac deer hop by.

title: Everyone Needs to Act: What to Expect From Climate Talks in Morocco
description: When representatives of 200 nations meet at a crucial two-week climate change conference in Marrakesh, Morocco, on Monday, their goal will be to put some force behind the pledges they made a year ago in Paris to reduce the emissions responsible for global warming.

title: Big Oil Slowly Adapts to a Warming World
description: In a warming world, Big Oil doesnt look quite so big anymore.

title: Big Question on Climate Crisis: How to Inspire Innovation
description: HAMBURG, Germany  On the edge of this northern German port city, the industrial giant Siemens is testing a way to offset the erratic nature of renewable power, by storing energy in hot rocks.

title: After the Florence Flood: Saving Vasaris Last Supper
description: FLORENCE, ITALY  In early morning light, the low buildings lining both sides of the Arno River here glow in their myriad shades of ochre, like the shallow river itself, which flows calmly through the city.

title: Chicago Cubs, Mosul, Jacob Zuma: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Whats on TV Thursday: All the Presidents Men and The Good Place
description: Email scandal? Gain some perspective with All the Presidents Men, Alan J. Pakulas Watergate classic. And Benedict Cumberbatch and Rachel Maddow chat up Jimmy Fallon.

title: Cubs End 108-Year Wait for World Series Title, After a Little More Torment
description: CLEVELAND  If you are going to endure years  no, generations  of futility and heartbreak, when you do finally win a World Series championship, it may as well be a memorable one.

title: With a Curse-Breaking Hit, Ben Zobrist Lives a Dream He Never Expected
description: CLEVELAND  As the clubhouse cleared out early Wednesday morning, after the Chicago Cubs had forced Game 7 of this rollicking World Series with the Cleveland Indians, Ben Zobrist was asked if he had dreamed of a chance like this.

title: Corrections: November 3, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: The Return of SalonQP
description: Britains premier luxury watch event, opening its sixth edition, continues to be a showcase for fine Swiss brands and a springboard for young independents.

title: Review: Netflix Does Queen Elizabeth II in The Crown, No Expense Spared
description: A pricey prestige drama about a British monarch? Should we prepare for an orgy of beheadings, sex scandals and battlefield brutality?

title: Word + Quiz: gnarled
description: 1. used of old persons or old trees; covered with knobs or knots

title: Let the Public See Police Officers Records
description: Mayor Bill de Blasio recently called on the State Legislature to rewrite a 40-year-old law that has been interpreted as barring the public release of just about any information from the employment histories of police officers  even some who have committed crimes. The law, the only one of its kind in the nation, is indeed overly broad. But Mr. de Blasio, who ran for office as a champion of transparency, has more latitude in interpreting it than he has thus far used.

title: The Election Polls That Matter
description: With just days left in the 2016 presidential election, Americans are wondering if polling is accurate or if well see a Brexit-style shock.

title: Trump Is an Existential Threat
description: There are only a handful of days until Election Day and an end to this phase of a nations  and the worlds  ebb and flow of anxiety. The day after the votes are cast and counted that anxiety will either dissipate or become a fixed feature. Which of these it will be is very much in flux.

title: 5 Reasons to Vote Trump
description: 1.) Who needs experience to be president? Its true that Donald Trump would have less public service experience than any president in American history, but knowledge is lame. Maybe the Know-Nothing Party in the 19th century captured this spirit in its name  and Trump is the apotheosis of knowing-nothing. In my journalistic career, Ive never met a national candidate as ill informed, evasive or puerile as Donald Trump.

title: Republican Candidates, Admit Its Hillary Youre Voting For
description: Look, you need a rest. Lets talk about the Senate races.

title: A Stronger Court for Crimes Against Humanity
description: Since it began operations in 2002, the International Criminal Court has secured just four convictions, fueling the perception that it has been largely ineffectual as a tribunal of last resort for the worlds worst criminals. Making matters worse, Gambia, Burundi and South Africa have announced their intention to leave the court, which some African leaders see as a vestige of colonialism because it has so far tried cases only from  their continent.

title: The Political Awakening of a Fashion Power Player
description: American fashion has never been afraid of declaring its political allegiance, at least in an insider kind of way. During the last two presidential elections, for example, numerous designers created pieces to raise money for the Obama campaign in initiatives called Runway to Change (in 2008) and Runway to Win (in 2012), and Anna Wintour, the artistic director of Cond Nast, is a famous bundler.

title: A Whimsical Slice of British Life
description: A Westminster School annual Shrove Tuesday pancake toss in London. A tar barrel parade in Northumberland. Hammering a nail into a mans shoe in Berkshire. The Grovely Forest Rights in Wiltshire.

title: A Whimsical Slice of British Life
description: Homer Sykes photographed local festivals and ceremonies that call to mind unusual and obscure sides of British society.

title: The Winning View From Chicago
description: Step into the crowd outside Wrigley Field in the bottom of the 10th inning, moments before the Cubs World Series win.

title: Hillary Clintons Juggling Act
description: Has the Democratic Party joined the Republican Party in becoming inhospitable to the accommodation of intraparty factions?

title: Carl Edwards Jr., the String Bean Slinger, Helps Cubs Get to the Finish Line
description: CLEVELAND  Just before Game 7 of the World Series resumed in the top of the 10th inning following a 17-minute rain delay, Chicago Cubs reliever Mike Montgomery turned to his fellow reliever, Carl Edwards Jr., with a prediction.

title: How a Philosophy Professor Found Love in a Hidden Library
description: AMERICAN PHILOSOPHYA Love StoryBy John Kaag259 pp. Farrar, Straus & Giroux. $26.

title: Im Not the Nanny: Multiracial Families and Colorism
description: SAME FAMILY, DIFFERENT COLORSConfronting Colorism in Americas Diverse FamiliesBy Lori L. Tharps203 pp. Beacon Press. $25.95.

title: Not All Rags Are Italian
description: Its just a complete rip-off of mapo tofu, the chef Tien Ho said. Ho was once David Changs chief lieutenant at Momofuku Ssam Bar in New York, and he was talking about the origins of one of the restaurants greatest hits: spicy pork sausage and rice cakes, born in 2006. We would always order mapo tofu from that Sichuan place on St. Marks, after work, he said, and Chang thought we could make something like it for the restaurant.

title: Letter of Recommendation: Pinky and the Brain
description: During an interview I did with Conan OBrien a while back, we drifted onto the topic of rules: when it was prudent, as a creative person, to flout conventions, and when it made sense to obey them. As OBrien saw it, only ever flouting, without a healthy dose of obeying, was unsustainable and, on balance, unfunny. To illustrate, he told me a story, one that didnt make it into the piece I wrote but stuck with me nonetheless: A well-known comedian with a raucous persona, interested in developing his own talk show, once sought OBriens advice. He showed me a prototype of what it would be: He comes out, he runs through the audience, hes never in one place. Hes everywhere, hes nowhere, hes wearing different clothes, spray-painting on the walls  total anarchy, OBrien recalled. And I said, O.K., heres my take: Youre a brilliantly funny person, but you need to be constrained, because when you break those constraints, its enormously satisfying.

title: Do Laws That Ban Offensive Words Make the World a Better Place?
description: Lawmakers in South Africa want to make hate speech a crime. Backers of the draft law say racist language can violate human rights and is not compatible with the nations values. Opponents say that criminalizing hate speech will erode freedom of expression and do little to heal the countrys racial wounds.

title: The Healing Powers of Laughter Yoga
description: Two decades ago, in a land of sensory overload and spiritual abundance, a doctor mixed together meditation and hilarity.

title: Want to Know What Virtual Reality Might Become? Look to the Past
description: The Scottish scientist David Brewster was one of those 19th-century characters with no real equivalent today. An ordained minister in the Church of Scotland, he took an early interest in astronomy and became for a time one of the worlds leading experts on the science of optics. He also harbored a great fondness for popular amusements, and at some point in the early part of the century, he began frequenting a theatrical horror show in the West End of London called the Phantasmagoria. He went in part as a debunker, a skeptic hoping to reveal the secret craft behind the spectacle. But he also sensed that something profound was lurking in the trickery. He suspected that the showmen were exploiting some intrinsic quirks in the human sensory system  perhaps, he hoped, rendering them more intelligible to the scientist. Brewster called the world of scientifically produced illusion natural magic.

title: Worth the Wait: A Westchester One-Bedroom
description: When Salvatore Di Vittorio and Santa Maria Pecoraro met nearly 20 years ago at Orvieto Musica, a music festival in Italy, he was splitting his time between New York and his hometown, Palermo, Italy, and she was living at home in her native San Diego.

title: Presidential Election: Melania Trump and Bernie Sanders to the Rescue
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump barnstormed across North Carolina on Thursday, each seeking to bolster support in a battleground state that has switched from Democrat to Republican in the past eight years.

title: Review: Doctor Strange and His Most Excellent Adventure
description: Most Marvel movies open like Robert Downey Jr.s stand-up routine in Iron Man before it goes south. They deliver quips and silky come-hither nonsense, only to end up like a big green monster stuck on rewind: Hulk smash! again and again, ad infinitum. In between start and finish, there are moments of levity and discovery in the machined product, but too often you cant see the movie for Marvels action plan. Its latest, the giddily enjoyable Doctor Strange, is part of Marvels strategy for world domination, yet its also so visually transfixing, so beautiful and nimble that you may even briefly forget the brand.

title: A Rare Moment of Unity on Capitol Hill, Thanks to Trumps Taxes
description: There may be a silver lining in the revelation that Donald J. Trump paid no federal income tax for years or even decades: a comprehensive overhaul of the nations loophole-riddled revenue-gathering system.

title: A Cashless Economy in Zimbabwe? With Little Cash, Theres Little Choice
description: HARARE, Zimbabwe  The time came for worshipers to surrender their tithes on Sunday morning. But instead of dropping bills into a collection plate, the congregants at a large Pentecostal church rose and filed toward the deacons clutching hand-held card-reading machines. With a swipe, they were done.

title: Five Possible Hacks to Worry About Before Election Day
description: WASHINGTON  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia dismisses the idea that he has the power to interfere with Tuesdays election. Does anyone seriously think that Russia can affect the choice of the American people? he asked during a foreign policy conference last week in the resort city of Sochi. What, is America a banana republic? Americas a great power. Correct me if Im wrong.

title: Questions for: Behind 2016s Turmoil, a Crisis of White Identity
Crypt Believed to Be Jesus Tomb Opened for First Time in Centuries
description: JERUSALEM  The only mystical power visible was the burning light from seven tapered candles. And yet for ages, the tomb that sits at the center of history has captured the imaginations of millions around the world.

title: How the University of Alabama Became a National Player
description: Its only fitting that the admissions tour for the University of Alabama starts in Bryant-Denny Stadium. On game days, the campuss iconic quad  a painterly expanse of lawn, majestic trees and bell tower  becomes a crimson and white tent city of numbered tailgating plots, some with electricity.

title: Bottom Line: How State Budget Cuts Affect Your Education
description: Higher education has been an easy target for budget cuts since the 2008 recession, forcing many public universities to lay off faculty and staff members, postpone investment in new facilities and raise tuition and fees (up an average 31 percent for in-state students). State support for public two- and four-year colleges  funding is nearly $10 billion below what it was just before the recession  has begun to recover, though officials at the nations flagship universities say that doing more with less is the new norm. Some are even finding fresh ways to ease the financial burden on students.

title: Those Hidden College Fees
description: The parade of fees on college campuses never seems to end. There are extra charges to start college, such as orientation fees and freshman fees, and extra charges to finish, such as senior fees and commencement fees. There are nickel-and-dime fees, like $8.50 at Indiana University to drop a class after two days, and large ones, like $3,049 to major in digital media and animation at Alfred State College, State University of New York.

title: The Strong Women of Star Wars
description: Leia, Rey and now Jyn Erso are the best known, but theyre hardly alone. And they all can match lightsabers with Darth Vader.

title: U.S. Election, Iowa, Chicago Cubs: Your Thursday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What We Know About Rogue One
description: Yes, a new movie in the Star Wars universe is coming to theaters Dec. 16. Yes, that movie, Rogue One: A Star Wars Story, will have rebels and droids and Stormtroopers. And yes, the Death Star factors in heavily. But it is the first stand-alone story for the big screen, meaning that it doesnt directly continue the saga unfolding in the previous films. Heres what else we know, culled from a variety of sources.

title: Morning Agenda: Fed Holds Steady, Teaming Up or Divesting?
description: Steady as she goes.

title: Trevor Noah: By the Book
description: The Daily Show host and author of Born a Crime travels a lot, but doesnt read when he flies: I cant stay awake when I try to read on a plane. Planes are for watching movies based on books.

title: Exploring the Speakeasies of Rome
description: Romes cobbled, snaking alleyways lend themselves to mystery, and todays best places to raise a glass in the Eternal City are fittingly clandestine, with entrance gained by a knock, a phone call or a membership card.

title: How Female Fans Made Star Wars Their Own
description: The premiere of Rogue One, the first stand-alone Star Wars film, is six weeks away, and fans have gathered online to speculate about what treasures the film will hold. Whats the deal with the set photo of a shaggy alien that looks a little like a robo-sasquatch? What are the chances that all the rebel heroes will survive to the end? Is Darth Vader going to murder any of them personally? Oh, and how is this movie going to treat women?

title: 10 Things to Know About Being a Sperm Donor
description: Dozens of sperm banks across the country are recruiting men to help them build up a supply of frozen sperm to meet the growing demand from women looking to start families.

title: New York Today: Our Citys Other Presidential Candidates
description: Updated, 7:20 a.m.

title: Brexit Will Require a Vote in Parliament, U.K. Court Rules
description: LONDON  The British governments plan for leaving the European Union was thrown into uncertainty on Thursday after the High Court ruled that Parliament must give its approval before the process can begin.

title: The Striking Humanity of Moonlight
description: Every once in a while a movie shows up that everyone agrees is perfect. This year, that unanimously adored film is Barry Jenkinss Moonlight, about one Miami boys coming-of-age. His name is Chiron. Hes poor. Hes black. And hes gay. The miracle of the movie is how its interested in none of that. The only condition it cares about is the human condition. Not many movies about black men share that concern.

title: 2 U.S. Soldiers and 30 Afghans Killed in Kunduz Battle
description: KUNDUZ, Afghanistan  Two American soldiers and more than 30 Afghans were killed Thursday in the midst of heavy fighting around the northern provincial capital of Kunduz, officials and local residents said.

title: World Series Champions
Voters Express Disgust Over U.S. Politics in New Times/CBS Poll
description: An overwhelming majority of voters are disgusted by the state of American politics, and many harbor doubts that either major-party nominee can unite the country after a historically ugly presidential campaign, according to the final pre-election New York Times/CBS News Poll.

title: Summary of High Court Ruling on Article 50 and Brexit
description: The British government must consult Parliament before proceeding with formal negotiations over its withdrawal from the European Union, the High Court ruled. The legal action was brought in the name of several individuals.

title: An 80-Year-Old Model Reshapes Chinas Views on Aging
description: BEIJING  Before cranking up the techno music at his 80th birthday party, the man known as Chinas hottest grandpa paused from his D.J. duties to poke fun at the countrys staid traditional celebrations for the elderly.

title: Arizonas Scarred Generation
description: Two daughters of Mexican immigrants who crossed the border illegally. Two different futures for young Latinos. Which will we choose?

title: Review: A Revival of The Dresser in London
description: In a week that finds Glenda Jackson returning to the British stage for the first time in 25 years, and playing no less a role than King Lear, at least one thing is clear: Ken Stott in the wan London revival of Ronald Harwoods 1980 play The Dresser is offering little in the way of competition.

title: Why Are Ballot Measures So Confusing?
Los jvenes latinos de Arizona: una generacin marcada
description: Dos hijas de inmigrantes mexicanos que cruzaron la frontera ilegalmente. Dos diferentes futuros para los jvenes latinos. Cual escogers?

title: Will the Ax Fall on Nigerias National Parks?
description: Among the unfortunate headlines about Boko Haram and email scams, it is easy to overlook that Nigeria boasts seven national parks and some of the richest biodiversity in West Africa. Nearly all of that flora and fauna is concentrated in Cross River State in the countrys southeast corner, abutting Cameroon. There, the Nigerian government hopes to have the magnificent Cross River National Park listed as a Unesco World Heritage Site.

title: Thailand Court Clears U.K. Labor Activist of Defaming Fruit Company
description: HONG KONG  A British labor activist who accused a Thai fruit company of abusing migrant workers was cleared of a criminal defamation charge by Thailands highest court on Thursday.

title: California Today: An Invasive Beetle Threatens States Southern Palm Trees
description: Good morning.

title: What to Expect While Voting, a Short Guide
description: Voting may be a basic right, but it can be a complicated one to exercise.

title: Dont Bother With National Polls
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Whats Your Ideal Community? The Answer Is Political
description: The American political map that has emerged over the last half-century, with blue cities and red beyond, is a product of both the ideological realignment of the two parties and geographic sorting among voters. It also raises a fascinating question about how our politics are shaped by where we live.

title: Twitchy, Sweaty, but Triumphant: Cubs Go Home as Winners at Last
description: CLEVELAND  The game began with what sounded like an ax striking a tree as a Cubs leadoff batter hit a soaring home run to the deepest recesses of center field; it ended with a helplessly grinning Cubs third baseman scooping a slow-rolling bouncer and tossing it to first base.

title: Google Home vs. Amazon Echo: A Face-Off of Smart Speakers
description: TO get an idea of how annoying it can be to say O.K., Google multiple times a day, try replacing the word Google with another brand.

title: Is Donald Trump an American Hugo Chvez?
description: MEXICO CITY  To dramatic music, the video starts with a clip of the Republican nominee for president, Donald J. Trump, threatening to jail his rival, Hillary Clinton, before the words Te recuerda a alguien (Does this remind you of someone) pop up. The image switches to the former Venezuelan president Hugo Chvez, founder of the self-declared Socialist revolution, who steered his oil-rich nation to meltdown.

title: Transit Worker Fatally Struck by Subway Train in Brooklyn
description: A transit worker was struck and killed by a subway train in Brooklyn on Thursday morning while he was working on the tracks, officials said.

title: E.U. Official, Under Pressure for Having Disparaged the Chinese, Apologizes
description: BRUSSELS  Gnther H. Oettinger, a European commissioner from Germany, apologized on Thursday for describing Chinese people as slit-eyes and sly dogs, an about-face that came only after several days of pressure to acknowledge the offensive nature of his remarks.

title: Putting Sugary Soda Out of Reach
description: Can public health officials force Americans to break their soda habit?

title: In Italy, a Town Still Broken by a Quake. The One 7 Years Ago.
description: LAQUILA, Italy  As three big earthquakes rattled central Italy last month after a major quake there this summer, thousands more Italians were left homeless, and Prime Minister Matteo Renzi pledged anew on Wednesday that every stricken town would return to what it had been.

title: Donald Trump Cant Count on Those Missing White Voters
description: Donald J. Trump and his supporters hope to overcome sweeping demographic shifts by rallying the support of missing white voters  disaffected, conservative populists who sat out the 2012 presidential election.

title: Anatomy of a Scene | Trolls
description: The director Mike Mitchell and co-director Walt Dohrn narrate a musical scene from Trolls featuring Anna Kendrick.

title: Paris Is the New Calais, With Scores of Migrants Arriving Daily
