title: Mikheil Saakashvili Resigns Post in Ukraine, Citing Corruption
description: MOSCOW  Mikheil Saakashvili, a former president of Georgia who was brought into the Ukraine government to set an example of transparency and clean government, resigned on Monday and accused Ukraines president of supporting corruption.

title: Five Ways Republicans Are Threatening Voting Rights
description: Donald Trump has been claiming for months now that Tuesdays election will be rigged. But the only ones threatening the democratic process are Mr. Trump, with his thinly veiled calls for voter suppression, and Republicans in state governments doing their utmost to keep minority voters from the polls. Below are five ways the candidate and the Republican Party are working to suppress voting this year, drawn from recent editorials:

title: What Really Makes Us Vote? It May Be Our Parents
description: When it comes to casting our votes, we tend to assume that showing up at the polling booth is driven by the issues at stake. But theres some evidence to indicate that voting habits are just that, habits, shaped in part by the practices and routines of our parents when were still too young to vote.

title: Have a Martini
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Brit Awards Attempt to Address Lack of Diversity
description: LONDON  Britains leading pop music prize, the Brits, will shake up its roster of judges next year in an attempt to address a perceived lack of diversity.

title: Daily Report: More Fake Retail Apps Means More Users Are at Risk
description: After a bruising presidential campaign, more than a few of us might be looking forward to a festive holiday season. But the holidays are bringing their own problems, including a proliferation of fake retail apps that may be trying to trick you.

title: Erasing GPS Data From Photos
description: Q. I have some photos I copied from my phone to my Windows 10 PC for cropping and editing on a bigger screen. Is there a way to remove the GPS coordinates in the picture files before I post them online?

title: Hand-Harvested Salt for the Thanksgiving Host
description: You have a gazillion choices when it comes to sea salt, but the salt thats hand-harvested from natural ponds in Sonora, at the edge of the Sea of Cortez in Mexico, has a soft texture that sets it apart. Its on the coarse side, rustic, with a slightly bitter finish and is fairly moist. It comes in homespun bags that are hand-embroidered with mermaids, seashells and other motifs by women in a Sonoran village, work that permits these craftswomen to earn money yet stay at home with their children. Consider a modest sprinkling of this salt on your pumpkin pie (especially if store-bought). The bags make a lovely gift for a host: Sal del Mar, $14 to $15 for a 16-ounce cloth bag, saldelmar.com.

title: Court in Israel Sentences Palestinian Teenager to 12 Years for Stabbings
description: JERUSALEM  The two teenage cousins met after school, discussed the tensions surrounding the Aqsa Mosque and other issues angering the Palestinians. They decided to avenge their grievances with knives.

title: When Bats Look for Meals Near Wind Power, Bats Die
description: Wind power can help the world fight climate change, but its not so great for bats.

title: The Aging Eyes of Bonobos
description: Humans arent the only ones that suffer from farsightedness.  As bonobos get older, their eyesight goes as well.

title: Is the Plague Still Alive in Musty 14th-Century Tomes?
description: Q. Are people who work with books and manuscripts from the 14th and 15th centuries at risk from disease-causing bacteria or viruses from that time?

title: Do They Make Reading Glasses for Older Bonobos?
description: The scientific study of animal behavior has meant, among other things, that humans have had to accept that they are not the only animals that use tools, show emotions and recognize themselves in a mirror.

title: How to Make Holiday Travel Less Stressful
description: Traveling during the holiday season can be a less than enjoyable experience, said David Solomito, the vice president of marketing at the travel search engine Kayak. There are more cars on the road, longer lines at airports and an increased chance of flight delays and cancellations because of wintertime weather, he said.

title: Justice Department to Monitor Polls in 28 States on Election Day
description: WASHINGTON  The Justice Department said on Monday that it would deploy more than 500 people in 28 states on Tuesday to monitor Election Day practices and guard against intimidation and disruptions.

title: A Sunflower-Seed Oil From the Finger Lakes
description: For several years, the oils sold with the Stony Brook label have been pressed from organic squashes in western New York. The company has added a sunflower-seed oil to its portfolio. Made from locally grown sunflowers, the oil is cold-pressed and unrefined, with a charming, nutty flavor. And its reasonably priced, making it a fine alternative to extra-virgin olive oil: Stony Brook Organic Finger Lakes Sunflower Seed Oil, 12.7 ounces $8.95, 25 ounces, $12.95, wholeheartedfoods.com.

title: An Unfinished Presidency: Obama Passes the Baton
description: WASHINGTON  Barack Obama claimed the presidency eight years ago in Chicagos Grant Park, declaring a new dawn in American history and promising the enthusiastic crowd of a quarter-million people that we as a people will get there.

title: A Pan for the Turkey, and a Casserole Too
description: My childhood memories of Thanksgiving always include an oval, speckled-blue enamel roasting pan. Thats what my mother used. Now theres a new pan for new memories, a nine-quart beauty in heavy triple-ply stainless steel. The lid has no knob or handle on top, so it can be flipped and used alone on top of the stove, on an induction cooker, in the oven as a casserole or baking dish, or even as a sleek serving dish. The roaster comes with a rack: Viking 3-Ply 3-in-1 Tri-Ply Oval Roasting Pan and Rack, $149.95, Cooks Warehouse, cookswarehouse.com.

title: Harry Belafonte: What Do We Have to Lose? Everything
description: O, yes,

title: Overturning Election Day Tradition
A Cake Box That Stores Like a Baking Sheet
description: At holiday time, a secure carrier for cakes, pies, cookies and other treats becomes a necessity, but storing such a gadget can be a challenge. This new Chefn cake box folds flat and can be stored like a baking sheet. It pops open, snaps securely to hold its shape, comes with trays for cakes and two sizes of cupcakes, and has a handle for carrying: Chefn Sugar Cube, folding cake carrier, $39.99, chefn.com.

title: Gun Control and Gun Rights: Is Resolution Possible?
description: Op-Ed columnist Andrew Rosenthal leads a discussion with Charles Blow, Francis X. Clines and Terry Tang.

title: TV Networks Face a Skeptical Public on Election Night
description: Fox Newss elections guru will play his cello on Tuesday morning, to clear my head and get ready to do math. CNN is staging more than a dozen rehearsals with a 25-person on-air team. George Stephanopoulos of ABC News spent his weekend running drills in a studio, practicing swing-state calls with a former intern standing in for the pollster Nate Silver.

title: Its Late Night With President Obama
description: When youre nearing the end of eight years in a demanding and stressful job, what do you do for enjoyment? If youre President Obama, you hit the late-night talk shows. During the past few weeks, he has turned up on four of these programs  The Late Show With Stephen Colbert, Jimmy Kimmel Live!, Full Frontal With Samantha Bee and Real Time With Bill Maher  to take questions that are both sincere and silly, perform in comedy sketches, crack some jokes and be the butt of others.

title: Keep the Peace at the Childrens Table
description: There are several options for the right time to let children loose with crayons to decorate these turkey place mats. It could be a project that starts several days before the holiday, so the colored place mats can be ready when the table is being set, or they could keep youngsters busy during dinner: Coloring Turkey paper place mats, $28 for 12, Annies Blue Ribbon General Store, 232 Fifth Avenue (Carroll Street), Park Slope, Brooklyn, 718-522-9848, blueribbongeneralstore.com.

title: The End of Relaxation
description: We live in the golden age of wellness vacations, where taking time off is all about becoming a better person.

title: Grandma, Grandson ... Colleagues
description: If you have not, over the course of the last six decades, tuned in to various public television stations to watch The Open Mind, heres what you have missed: a 30-minute public-affairs-focused interview program that covers topics ranging from civil rights to pornography to baseball, and features guests running the gamut from blues musicians to judges to Nobel laureates.

title: Skip Credit Cards and Preload Monthly Payments Instead
description: Lets play a little game. Assume there is something you want to buy, and you will pay for it with a monthly payment plan. It could be a house, a car, tuition or something as simple as a new smartphone.

title: Suggest a To-Do List for the Next President
description: The election is finally here, and regardless of who the next president is, he or she will face major national and international problems. We invite you to list three things the new president should do in the first 100 days in office.

title: Larry Ellisons Hardball Tactics Win NetSuite for Oracle
description: Larry Ellison, Oracles founder, has stored some hardball merger and acquisition tactics in the cloud. He has won his $9.3 billion battle for NetSuite, even though T. Rowe Price, NetSuites biggest independent investor, made a strong case for a higher offer.

title: Earthquake and Aftershock: The Elections of 2008 and 2016
description: It was nearly eight years ago, somehow.

title: Jeezy Winds Up on Top in Three-Way Battle for Billboard No. 1
description: Three new albums vied for No. 1 on the latest Billboard chart, and the contest this week shows how complex the charts have become as the music industry juggles the multiple ways people consume their music.

title: U.S. Enforcing Insurance Law to Help Fight Opioid Abuse
description: WASHINGTON  In one of President Obamas last major health care initiatives, the administration is stepping up enforcement of laws that require equal insurance coverage for mental and physical illnesses, a move officials say will help combat an opioid overdose epidemic.

title: Mannequin Challenge Is the New Viral Video Sensation You Probably Cant Avoid
description: Remember the Ice Bucket Challenge? Or the Harlem Shake? Planking? Lip Dubs?

title: On the Trail: The Final Day of Campaigning
description: Candidates on the major-party tickets spent Monday visiting important states to try to put votes in their columns on Election Day.

title: N.B.A. Schedule: Heres What to Watch This Week
description: After two weeks and some change, were into the meat of the N.B.A. season and starting to see some results.

title: Janet Reno, Former U.S. Attorney General, Dies
description: Janet Reno, the first woman to serve as United States attorney general, died on Monday at 78. She died of complications from Parkinsons disease, according to her family.

title: After Dinosaur Extinction, Some Insects Recovered More Quickly
description: The asteroid that smashed into the Earth near Chicxulub, Mexico, some 66 million years ago annihilated the dinosaurs and obliterated about 75 percent of all plant and animal species on Earth. The devastation affected insects living thousands of miles north and south of the impact zone as well.

title: Determining a Punishment That Fits the Crime
description: One of the vexing issues in white-collar crime is figuring out the appropriate sentence for someone who usually has an otherwise spotless record and poses no physical threat to the community. Recent cases show how hard it is to determine a just punishment for defendants who have so much going for them yet engaged in criminal conduct.

title: What Ivanka Trump Cant Sell
description: Ivanka Trump can do it all. Throughout this interminable campaign, she has been able, with very little backlash, to promote for her $100 million apparel brand, which she markets with the female empowerment hashtag #womenwhowork, and also support her father, whose campaign is rife with misogynistic language, and who has been accused of sexual harassment by more than a dozen women.

title: Why Facebook Showed You That Ad for the Candidate You Hate
description: You may be a reliable Democratic voter in a solid-blue city. Maybe you have a graduate degree; maybe youre a member of an ethnic or religious minority; maybe you are a woman.

title: Woman Thrown in Front of Train at Times Square Subway Station Is Killed
description: A 49-year-old Queens woman was killed after being pushed in front of a subway train in Times Square on Monday, the New York Police Department said. The attack disrupted traffic at one of the citys busiest transit hubs as trains were diverted and emergency workers converged on the scene.

title: Debating the Dakota Access Pipeline
description: To the Editor:

title: Our Best Digital Storytelling of the 2016 Election
description: The New York Times has presented some of the most innovative digital storytelling of the 2016 presidential election. Heres a look back at some of our most notable projects.

title: Affecting Drawings by LGBTQ Prisoners
description: To create the group show On the Inside, Tatiana von Frstenberg worked with the prison-reform activist newsletter Black and Pink to solicit artwork.

title: What the Election Means for the Markets
description: What will happen to financial markets after the election? More so than usual, we have a decent idea.

title: A Moving, Diverse Show of Drawings by Incarcerated LGBTQ Artists
description: I made a pledge to do an act of love every day for 30 days between Martin Luther King Day and Valentines Day of 2012. It was a simple online pledge  it had to be an act of love not for friends and family, explains the filmmaker and musician Tatiana von Frstenberg. It was this promise that ultimately led her to create an arts initiative empowering LGBTQ prisoners  people who, as von Frstenberg notes, discovered art on their own and have been making art, sometimes before they were incarcerated and sometimes after they were incarcerated. On the Inside, the first group show of prisoner work shes curated through the initiative by prisoners around the country, is on view now at Abrons Arts Center.

title: A Letter from the Harvard Womens Soccer Team
description: You may have heard that Harvard cancelled the rest of its mens soccer season after reports that male players had discussed female players in crude sexual terms. Six members of one Harvard womens soccer team wrote this brilliant op-ed for The Harvard Crimson, and Im republishing it here with permission. I admired the op-ed for its cogency and eloquence, but also because I thought it might be effective in changing mores.Nicholas Kristof

title: Voting Guide: How, When and Where to Vote
description: [Heres how to vote in the 2020 election.]

title: Covering Elections: Hours of Boredom, Minutes of Terror
description: The plight of a political journalist on Election Day is akin to that of a pilot or a police officer: hours of boredom, minutes of terror. For most of the day, there is nothing to do. The only thing that matters is how you perform in a few frantic post-midnight moments, often with your bosses literally looking over your shoulder in a packed newsroom as you type.

title: This Time, There Really Is a Hispanic Voter Surge
description: Hispanic voters were largely credited with President Obamas victory in 2012, but they werent  as crucial  as many believed. Mr. Obama didnt even need to win the Hispanic vote to put him over the top, thanks to high black turnout and support among white voters in the North. The turnout among Hispanic voters didnt surge, even though exit polls implied that it had.

title: Are There Really Hidden Trump Voters?
description: Hillary Clinton is favored to become the next president of the United States. Yet many in Donald J. Trumps camp remain undaunted, arguing that hidden supporters will carry him to the White House. As the polls have narrowed in the last few days, the question of whether pollsters could be missing Trump voters has become paramount. Do these unseen supporters exist?

title: Zadie Smiths Swing Time Explores Friends Diverging Paths
description: Doubles  pairs of friends, rivals and families; contrasting ideologies and views of the world  animate Zadie Smiths novels, as surely as doubles and doppelgngers haunt many Hitchcock movies. Her astonishing debut novel, White Teeth (2000), recounted the story of two World War II vets  polar opposites and best friends  and their extended families, opening out into a teeming, Bruegel-esque portrait of a multicultural London. On Beauty (2005), another magical big-city novel (set mainly in Boston), also depicted two very different families with intertwined lives. And the disappointing NW (2012) used the diverging stories of two childhood friends to look at the potent and ever shifting dynamics of money and class.

title: Trump Campaigns in North Carolina
description: Donald J. Trump is holding a campaign rally in Raleigh the day before Election Day.

title: Captain Licorish, Agent Pickles, Swamp Justice: Highlights from the Bridgegate Trial
description: Start with a premise that should have seemed absurd: political operatives shut down access lanes to the worlds busiest bridge to punish a Democratic mayor who did not endorse a Republican governor who wanted to be leader of the free world. It was bound to be a colorful story  and trial  even without the New Jersey swamp setting and larger-than-life central figure, Gov. Chris Christie.

title: Theresa May, Daniel Ortega, China: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Justices Wont Revive Order Barring Voter Intimidation in Ohio
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Monday refused to intercede in a lawsuit brought by the Ohio Democratic Party against Donald J. Trumps presidential campaign. The justices turned away a last-minute bid from the party to reinstate a sweeping order from a trial judge that had barred the Trump campaign from harassing or intimidating voters in Ohio.

title: Did the F.B.I. Play the Email Controversy Right?
description: To the Editor:

title: China, Meet Hockey. Russia, Meet a Huge Untapped Market.
description: After 678 games with six N.H.L. teams, Alexei Ponikarovsky thought he had seen everything by the time he played three seasons with SKA St. Petersburg of the Kontinental Hockey League.

title: Hopes for U.K. Trade Deal With India Hit a Snag: Immigration
description: LONDON  It was supposed to be an auspicious moment: Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain traveling to India to prepare the ground for what could be the countrys first trade deal after it leaves the European Union, and show that Britain can thrive outside the bloc.

title: Splayed Turkey With Herbs
description: This cooking technique yields perfectly cooked Thanksgiving turkey.

title: A New (Faster, Juicier) Way to Roast a Turkey
description: Theres an age-old problem with roasting a whole turkey. How do you cook the dark meat to juicy tenderness without desiccating the white meat?

title: While Pregnant, Women Should Get Health Care 8 Times, W.H.O. Says
description: Women should see a doctor, nurse or trained midwife at least eight times during each pregnancy, with five of those visits in the last trimester, the World Health Organization said Monday as it issued 49 recommendations to prevent deaths in childbirth.

title: Tatiana von Furstenberg Curates an Exhibit of Art From Inside Prisons
description: Dressed in loosefitting pants, a military jacket and black-and-cream heels, her hair curly and buoyant, Tatiana von Furstenberg walked languidly through an exhibition at Abrons Arts Center on the Lower East Side on a sunny November afternoon.

title: Fired Up Obama Makes Final Push for Clinton, and His Legacy
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  President Obama was feeling a little sentimental.

title: Traveling While Muslim Complicates Air Travel
description: Passing through airport screening can be time-consuming for any business traveler. But Nafees Syed, a lawyer and writer in New York, has additional obstacles.

title: Review: Capturing Childhoods Wonder in Dance and Mime
description: In Bengali, chotto means small. And so Chotto Desh, the title of the Akram Khan work at the New Victory Theater, means small homeland but also signifies a smaller version of this celebrated British choreographers 2011 solo Desh. Its smaller in the sense that its an adaptation for children, but that doesnt mean its inferior. If anything, this adaptation is an improvement.

title: Donald and the Dead
description: At recent rallies, Donald Trumps warm-up playlist, the one the candidate famously insists on choosing himself, has featured Funeral for a Friend/Love Lies Bleeding, the opening medley from Elton Johns 1973 album Goodbye Yellow Brick Road. Like a lot of the playlist, its an endearingly perverse song for a political event, opening with a somber minor-key dirge performed on a chorus of analog synthesizers. The track played at least a couple of times at the Giant Center arena in Hershey, Pa., on Friday night, as we waited for Trump to arrive, and whenever the dolorous synths cut through the fried-dough-scented air, I felt as if I were at some hybrid of a monster-truck rally and a requiem Mass.

title: Election Day Weather Not Expected to Hurt Voter Turnout
description: If any events are likely to affect voter turnout on Election Day, the weather wont be one of them. Cold and rain are predicted in some key states on Tuesday, but nationwide the weather is expected to be mild enough to have little impact, forecasters say.

title: The Lighthouses of Ireland
description: Lighthouses in Ireland are finding new life not just for their beautiful vistas but for stories from people who illuminate pieces of modern history.

title: Washington Faces Breakdowns and Paralysis, and Thats Just the Metro
description: WASHINGTON  Usually when people talk of dysfunction and gridlock in Washington, they mean the relationship between the White House and Congress.

title: What You Should Watch Monday Night
description: Martha and Snoops Potluck Dinner Party, 10 p.m., VH1 (New Series)

title: What Time Will the Polls Close? (And When Will We Know Who Won?)
description: An hour-by-hour look at when states finish voting.

title: Optimism From Hillary Clinton and Darkness From Donald Trump at Campaigns End
description: Hillary Clinton and Donald J. Trump hopscotched from Pennsylvania to North Carolina to Michigan on Monday in the final, frenzied hours of the presidential campaign, offering clashing closing arguments as the sprawling map of the United States was reduced to a string of must-win states.

title: The Supreme Court Ruled That Voting Restrictions Were a Bygone Problem. Early Voting Results Suggest Otherwise.
description: Tomorrow, and the early voting leading up to it, mark the first presidential election since the Supreme Court clipped the protective wings of the Voting Rights Act. In 2013, speaking for a conservative majority of five, Chief Justice John Roberts effectively eliminated the safeguards created by a provision of the law called Section 5, saying that Congress could no longer require states and counties with a history of racial discrimination to get the approval of the Department of Justice before changing local voting rules and practices. Roberts said things had changed dramatically since the 1960s, and these jurisdictions, which are mostly in the South, didnt need oversight from the D.O.J. anymore. They could be trusted to treat minority voters fairly on their own.

title: So Close and Yet So Far Away: On the Trail With Michelle Obama
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this article, Julie Hirschfeld Davis, a Times White House correspondent, shares what counts as major access in the tightly controlled world of this beloved first lady.

title: Changing Time at The Times
description: Since arriving here nearly three years ago, Ive been turning over in my mind a line from Gay Taleses book about The Times, The Kingdom and The Power.

title: The Triumph of Tracy Flick?
description: You go, Tracy Flick.

title: Ezekiels Wheel Ties African Spiritual Traditions to Christianity
description: African-Americans have long been among the countrys most fervent Christians, from the choir to the pulpit to the affirming voices from every amen corner.

title: For Shirley Collins, a Folk Revival of Her Very Own
description: Fans of traditional British folk music used to find Shirley Collinss voice angelic. Now, the word they use is austere, Ms. Collins said with a laugh. Its not a bad word, but its not the voice I used to have in those days when I could just sing by opening my mouth.

title: Robert Durst Pleads Not Guilty to 2000 Murder in Los Angeles
description: LOS ANGELES  Robert A. Durst, the multimillionaire whose bizarre life of privilege and mayhem was the subject of a 2015 documentary, was arraigned here on Monday on charges of murdering a onetime confidante 16 years ago.

title: America on Election Day, and Beyond
description: To the Editor:

title: A Look at Gray Matterss First Collections
description: The independent designer Silvia Avanzi, whose shoes launched in stores last month, uses the same Italian factories as big fashion brands.

title: Brand to Know: Simple Architectural Heels, Made in Italy
description: Before putting pencil to paper  and nappa-leather uppers to outsoles  the designer Silvia Avanzi spent two years developing and fine-tuning the concept behind her shoe line. I asked myself, What do women want today, and what do we need, really? We feel everything has been done and redone, she recalls, and Im not the type of person who simply wants women to spend money. I want her to be happy with her purchases. Using a marketing-trained brain, the fashion branding and advertising vet noticed a gap: avant-garde heels. From there, Gray Matters  her line of sleek glove shoes, mules and flatforms that launched in stores last month  began to take shape.

title: Review: Makeup Tips Galore, but Not How to Handle Cancer, in Ultimate Beauty Bible
description: Caroline V. McGraws wry and artful Ultimate Beauty Bible, produced by Page 73 at the New Ohio Theater, is a play for anybody who has ever believed that the right lipstick, the right shoes, the right lover might meaningfully alter the course of ones existence. Which is a lot of us.

title: Review: Lost Voices Confronts the Rising Tide of Climate Change
description: Water is rising all around them, and its past time to flee. Two cousins are marooned on the rapidly diminishing patch of land where their families have lived for generations. They have no boat. They dont even know how to swim.

title: Funny and Eerie Vintage Images of Women Handling Snakes
description: Despite a longstanding fear of snakes, for many years the British artist Clare Strand sought out images of women with serpents. People usually collect what they like, not what repels them, she admits, but she felt somehow compelled.

title: Girl Plays With Snake
description: The artist Clare Strands new book comprises images of women with serpents found over a number of years, many from the archives of British tabloid newspapers.

title: How the Artist Adrian Ghenie Became an Auction Star
description: Many say it was the 2011 exhibition at the Palazzo Grassi museum in Venice that first ignited art buyers interest in a young Romanian artist named Adrian Ghenie, whose heavy palette-knife paintings are haunted by historical figures like Stalin, Hitler and the Nazi doctor Josef Mengele.

title: Sailing Couple Seized by Somali Pirates in 2008 Are Apparently Abducted Off Philippines
description: BERLIN  A ship in harbor is safe, but that is not what ships are built for, the old maritime saying goes. A German sailing couple, seized and held for ransom eight years ago by Somali pirates, apparently lived by that rule.

title: Clinton, Trump, Reno: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Contemporary Homes in Stunning Natural Surroundings
description: A new book features a collection of homes from around the world  from the Slovenian Alps to Montauk  all built with nature in mind.

title: If Janet Reno Had Lived to See Tomorrow
description: I got my first big story as a cub reporter at The Miami Herald in 1983, thanks to Janet Reno. Or rather, thanks to her familys peacocks.

title: Smog Chokes Delhi, Leaving Residents Cowering by Our Air Purifiers
description: NEW DELHI  For days, many in Delhi have been living as if under siege, trying to keep the dirty air away from their children and older parents.

title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

title: Environmentalists Target Bankers Behind Pipeline
description: In early August, just as protesters from across the country descended on North Dakota to rally against an oil pipeline near the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation, some of the worlds biggest banks signed off on a $2.5 billion loan to help complete the sprawling project.

title: Saving Refugees on the Mediterranean: a Luxury Yacht With a New Purpose
description: BARCELONA, Spain  A year ago, Oscar Camps, a Spaniard, was a lifeguard who traveled with a colleague to the Greek island of Lesbos to see what he could do to help as thousands of Syrian refugees washed up from Turkey.

title: Janet Reno Refused to Let Parkinsons Define Her
description: MIAMI  Janet Reno sat in a wheelchair with a blanket over her knees, her fingers curled inward so she could not shake hands. She was skinny  very skinny  almost unrecognizable as the prosecutor who had shot to fame as President Bill Clintons attorney general, the first woman to hold that position.

title: Cyprus: Why One of the Worlds Most Intractable Conflicts Continues
description: LONDON  It is home to one of the longest-serving peacekeeping missions in United Nations history. It has been called a diplomatic graveyard, having frustrated generations of negotiators. It has been compared  in complexity and duration, not bloodshed  to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.

title: Secrets of the Emoji World, Now With Its Own Convention
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The party felt like a text-message bubble brought to life.

title: How the F.B.I. Reviewed Thousands of Emails in One Week
description: WASHINGTON  Out of hundreds of thousands of emails seized last month from disgraced former Representative Anthony D. Weiner, a substantial number turned out to be copies of documents already reviewed by F.B.I. agents and analysts, allowing the agency to wrap up in days a review that some had feared would take weeks, if not longer.

title: New York Times Election Front Pages
description: Times front pages through the decades: a look at coverage since the election of Franklin Pierce, with observations by the presidential historian Michael Beschloss.

title: Clinton Campaigns in Philadelphia
description: Hillary Clinton is in Philadelphia with President Obama, the first lady, Bruce Springsteen and Jon Bon Jovi in an effort to get out the vote Tuesday. The audio may mute intermittently because of copyright concerns.

title: A Presidential Campaigns Toughest Challenge: Coping With Defeat
description: Shortly after the curtain fell on the 1976 election, Hubert H. Humphrey took his dejected friend Bob Dole, the Republican vice-presidential nominee, out for ice cream to try to improve his mood.

title: Florida, North Carolina and Ohio Lead the States to Watch
description: The election isnt decided by national popular vote  that would be too easy (and save a lot of money on maps).

title: Make-Believe Marriage in the Brooklyn Botanic Garden
description: Dear Diary:

title: Grandmothers Killing Lays Bare a Dilemma in Child Welfare Work
description: The girl named Heaven lay curled up asleep next to her grandmother on the mattress they shared on the living room floor. The woman, Carmen Irizarry, had been the 9-year-olds legal guardian for years, a stand-in for the girls troubled mother. Now, Heavens protector was sick, breathing from an oxygen tank after a long hospital stay for acute lung disease. It was early in the morning of May 11, quiet in the half-light in the eighth-floor apartment in the South Bronx.

title: Click, Run, Click Again
description: Spend a day on the Clinton campaign trail with the veteran Times photographer Doug Mills.

title: The Marijuana Election
description: I must be the most maladapted pothead in Maine. Since 2013, I have had a Maine medical marijuana authorization card, for treating painful nerve damage in my elbows and hands. The thing is, though, I dont actually like being high; it makes me feel a little sad, a little disengaged. I like everything about marijuana, you could say, except the being stoned part. Fortunately for me, the cannabis crme I use on my joints doesnt mess with my head.

title: How to Begin the Healing
description: The greatest country in the history of civilization has become dangerously uncivilized.

title: The Question for James Comey
description: Never mind.

title: Ralph Cicerone, Scientist Who Sounded Climate Change Alarm, Dies at 73
description: Ralph J. Cicerone, who as a researcher and the president of the National Academy of Sciences issued an early warning about the grave potential risks of climate change, died on Saturday at his home in Short Hills, N.J. He was 73.

title: Fear Is Driving Voting Rights Advocates and Vigilantes to Watch Polling Stations
description: Millions of Americans will cast their ballots on Tuesday under intense scrutiny both from vigilantes who fear the election will be rigged and from thousands of voting rights advocates who fear the tally will be distorted by intimidation and, perhaps, the suppression of a minority vote that may be crucial to the outcome.

title: If Trump Wins Florida, Its Because of These People
description: SARASOTA, Fla.  People started lining up at 4 a.m. to catch one last glimpse of their hero. It was Donald J. Trumps first campaign stop on his Monday push through battleground states, and his supporters here in Florida seemed to understand that the whole country would be watching them. So, what are the Trump voters in Florida thinking, and where does this movement  or whatever we should call it  go after Tuesday?

title: Spread of Early Voting Is Forging New Habits and Campaign Tactics
description: In 1977, a flood control measure on the ballot in Monterey, Calif., became what historians say was the first modern American election decided by people who voted before Election Day.

title: Chief of New Yorks Struggling Public Hospital System Is Resigning
description: The chief executive of NYC Health & Hospitals, which runs New York Citys public hospitals, is stepping down from his post atop the nations largest municipal health care system, a move that City Hall officials described on Monday as voluntary and expected.

title: In Rolling Stone Defamation Case, Magazine and Reporter Ordered to Pay $3 Million
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  A federal jury on Monday ordered Rolling Stone and one of its writers to pay $3 million in damages to a University of Virginia administrator over a discredited article two years ago about a supposed gang rape at the university.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Whatever credibility Ive earned after eight years as president, I am asking you to trust me on this one.

title: Review: Master Harold  and the Boys, a Searing Indictment of Racism
description: There is good reason that Master Harold  and the Boys ranks among the South African writer Athol Fugards most celebrated and popular plays. As the sterling new production that opened on Monday at the Signature Theater attests, this quiet drama remains a powerful indictment of the apartheid system and the terrible human cost of the racism it codified and legalized. At a time when systemic racism and its roots are once again a subject of national discussion in America, it feels particularly, and sorrowfully, pertinent.

title: South Korea Charges 21 With Match Fixing
description: SEOUL, South Korea  The South Korean police said Monday that they were pressing criminal charges against 21 people, including two professional baseball pitchers in the KBO League, on suspicion of match fixing.

title: Something Worth Waiting For
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  When we last saw Michael Doran in 2013, he and Will Shortz pulled a fast one by sneaking a single number into an otherwise normal revealer. Today he returns with a much different kind of theme, albeit one weve seen before.

title: Breakaway Group in New York Senate Becomes an Island of Power
description: ALBANY  As the fraught and expensive battle to control the New York State Senate comes to a climax on Tuesday, there is already one likely winner.

title: After the Champagne, Compliments Flow Theo Epsteins Way
description: In early November 2004, Theo Epstein walked into a small, wood-paneled bar in a South Florida hotel that was hosting baseballs annual general managers meeting. He proceeded to quietly receive handshakes and congratulations from many of his peers in the industry.

title: In New York, Homeless and Making Plans to Vote
description: At 7 a.m. on Monday, the line for the soup kitchen snaked through a hallway of St. Bartholomews Church in Midtown Manhattan as men and a few women, bundled in layers of worn jackets and sweatshirts, waited for a breakfast of mixed greens and egg noodles with beef donated by the nearby Waldorf Astoria.

title: Where to Vote Today
description: Tuesday is Election Day, and the presidential race is not the only contest on the ballots in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut. Voters in two states will be electing United States senators, in addition to representatives and various state and local officials. New Jersey residents will decide whether to expand gambling outside of Atlantic City.

title: Estonias Government Teeters on Verge of Collapse
description: Far from the sound and fury of Tuesdays presidential election in the United States, Estonias government has, with little international attention, reached the brink of collapse.

title: Mets Extend Qualifying Offers to Yoenis Cespedes and Neil Walker
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  During the next few days, the Mets and General Manager Sandy Alderson will have to weigh whether Yoenis Cespedes, one of the teams best players over the past year and a half, gives them the best chance of winning.

title: South Koreas Whistle-Blowers Sound Off at Their Own Risk
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Five years ago, South Koreans began calling a number in Britain in droves. They were trying to sway an international phone poll to name Jeju Island in South Korea  a verdant spur of volcanic rock famous for its fresh air and succulent seafood  one of the new seven wonders of nature.

title: Weakened South Korean President Allows Parliament to Pick Prime Minister
description: SEOUL, South Korea  President Park Geun-hye  of South Korea on Tuesday asked rival political parties to recommend a new prime minister, making a major political concession in her efforts to defuse an influence-peddling scandal that has crippled her government for weeks.

title: Madonna Gave a Surprise Pop-Up Concert to Support Clinton. We Were There.
description: The words Madonna and concert hardly conjure images of an intimate gathering, but on the eve of Election Day in the heart of Greenwich Village, that is what a few hundred people got.

title: Hillary Clinton, Ortega, Durst: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Corrections: Tuesday, November 8
description: NATIONAL

title: Seattle Seahawks Stave Off Late Rally to Beat Buffalo Bills
description: Jimmy Graham needed only one hand to catch two first-half touchdown passes from Russell Wilson, and the Seahawks held off a late rally for a 31-25 victory over the Buffalo Bills on Monday night in Seattle.

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: 2016 Election Night Coverage
description: Really, theres only one thing to watch tonight, and watch it we will until the very end. But if youd rather check out of reality  for an hour or for the evening  pick and choose from an assortment of election-based comedy specials or stream a few episodes from some of the years best series.

title: Word + Quiz: supple
What Does Life With Quadruplets Look Like?
description: A student photojournalist started out documenting the lives of a couple who gave birth to quadruplets. She now plans to stay with the story until they turn 18.

title: Election Day Choices
description: O.K., America, the buck stops here, today, with you. The choice on the presidential ticket is as stark and obvious as it has been in any of our lifetimes. And for some New York and New Jersey voters, we have excellent candidates to suggest, too.

title: Lets Not Do This Again
description: If I had to sum up the election of 2016 in one clause, I would say it has been a sociological revolution, a moral warning and a political summons.

title: The Real Voter Fraud
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  The casting of a ballot is the most fundamentally American act that any of us takes. It connects us to the Enlightenment ideals of the countrys founding  the once-radical notion that human beings should think for themselves, rather than merely obey kings and priests. Dare to know! Immanuel Kant wrote, offering a motto for the Enlightenment. Have the courage to use your own understanding!

title: What 2016 Has Taught Us
description: This election year has been an exhausting parade of ugliness. It has also highlighted some fundamental truths about the United States circa 2016, lessons that political leaders should heed beyond Tuesdays elections.

title: Its Better When All Politics Is Local
description: Arthur Brooks: So we finally made it to Election Day, Gail. The apocalyptic campaign is finished, and weve been given the Sign of the End Times  the Cubs winning the World Series. Now its Judgment Day.

title: Up in the Sky, Help to Keep Africans From Starving
description: Andrew Mude, a Kenyan economist, has a way of explaining satellites. When hes talking to pastoralists in his countrys north  people who roam the earth with a dozen head of cattle and very little else  he talks about the stars that dont act like other stars. Theyre actually taking pictures of the ground, Mude says. Herders, a stargazing people, understand.

title: What Does Life With Quadruplets Look Like?
description: Courtney Larson really wanted to have children. But after marrying her college sweetheart, Cameron Larson, in 2009, she learned she had fertility issues. The Larsons, who are Mormon, prayed, but, unable to get pregnant after a year, they turned to medical treatments, including intrauterine insemination. After several attempts  and thousands of dollars  she became pregnant.

title: Cast Your Vote
description: Voters in swing states will determine our next president. Step into voting booths in North Carolina, Ohio and Florida, where the race is tight.

title: Blue and Red Map, 2012
Questions for: Strangers Help a Wheelchair Racer (and Find Out Later Shes a Gold Medalist)
description: Article: Strangers Help a Wheelchair Racer (and Find Out Later Shes a Gold Medalist)

title: Choking in New Delhi
description: It is no longer safe to breathe in New Delhi, one of the most polluted cities in the world. The problem has grown steadily worse, but little has been done beyond stopgap measures like allowing cars with odd- or even-numbered license plates to be used only on alternate days.

title: Hillary Clinton Feels the Love on Her Campaigns Last Day
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  The shouts took Hillary Clinton by surprise.

title: Donald Trump Soaks in the Adulation in Improvised Final Stop
description: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich.  Gone were the lasers and the smoke machines.

title: Nicaraguas Electoral Farce
description: Nicaraguas first couple hailed Sundays election, which gave President Daniel Ortega his third consecutive term, and his wife, Rosario Murillo, her first as vice president, as nearly perfect. From their standpoint, that it was.

title: What Books Do You Think Every Teenager Should Read?
description: Have you read any books so gripping you couldnt put them down? Books that made you laugh, cry or even sweat as you read? Books that changed the way you think or see the world?

title: Presidential Election Live: Donald Trumps Victory
description: Donald J. Trumps victory in the presidential race on Tuesday night capped a remarkable election in which several Democratic Senate candidates fell short and Republicans retained their majority in the House of Representatives. Here are some key takeaways from a stunning result that upended conventional expectations and set the stage for a drastic reordering of politics in Washington:

title: Plan to Rein In New Yorks Street Fairs Prompts Unexpected Backlash
description: They hold the promise of vibrancy, the allure of a city thoroughfare repurposed with the tent-lined look of a traveling circus. But the street fairs that can sometimes clog the corridors of Manhattan are also the bane of many, from drivers caught in the resulting snarl to those grown weary of the fairs banal ubiquity.

title: In Remote Settlement High on Tibetan Plateau, Buddhist Spirituality Soars
description: YARCHEN GAR, China  Even by the standards of the phenomenal sights of Tibet, Yarchen Gar is a wonder on the high plateau: thousands of ramshackle homes clustered on a remote peninsula at the bend of a river, each one the domicile of a nun who has come here to study Tibetan Buddhism.

title: My Journey Into Aleppo: Watching a Moonscape of War Turn Into a Functioning City
description: I took this video while on what often felt like a surreal bus ride through war-torn Syria. The video begins on the edge of the city of Aleppo, its western, government-held half. The area we drove through is all government held but has been intensely fought over, again and again, and has changed hands several times. The route we took connects the city to a key supply route  whoever controls the road determines if the eastern, rebel-held part of the city is besieged or not.

title: What Russia After Putin?
description: Vilnius, Lithuania  If only because nothing lasts forever, because no one lives forever, the Putin era in Russia will eventually end. President Vladimir V. Putin is 64 years old, and those who oppose his regime are focusing their attention on imagining what will happen after him  especially since his governments ongoing crackdown makes it so difficult to focus on the present.

title: Student Winners From Our 2016 Editorial Cartoon Contest
description: We invited students 13 to 19 years old to submit their original illustrations to our second annual Editorial Cartoon Contest, and they responded by using humor, wit and irony to comment on the issues they care about: the 2016 presidential campaign, Syria, dress codes, gentrification, gender equality and more.

title: Unbury My Heart at Wounded Knee: A New Look at the Indian Wars
description: THE EARTH IS WEEPINGThe Epic Story of the Indian Wars for the American WestBy Peter CozzensIllustrated. 544 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $35.

title: How Do Dogs Recognize Us? And Why Do We Love Cats Anyway?
description: BEING A DOGFollowing the Dog Into a World of SmellBy Alexandra Horowitz323 pp. Scribner. $27.

title: Keeping the Fire of Irish Lighthouses Alive
description: To get to the Clare Island Lighthouse in County Mayo, in the west of Ireland, you climb up to the islands northern cliffs along a road of stones, past damp sheep chewing grass, around the bend through an alley of fuchsia hedges in bloom. Keep walking until you reach the lighthouse and slip your key in the lock, hang your parka by the door and take a seat beside the peat-burning fireplace. Someone may be nearby to take your drink order, and the reward for a long walk will be a cold gin and tonic and the soft heat of the fire.

title: Philippines Can Give Heros Burial to Ferdinand Marcos, High Court Rules
description: MANILA  The Philippines highest court ruled on Tuesday that the dictator Ferdinand E. Marcos may be granted a heros burial, resolving a divisive issue in a country where passions over his brutal 20-year rule still run high.

title: Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump, New Delhi: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: What Time Will the Presidency Be Decided?
description: It has been a very, very long election season. But we will soon know the result.

title: Rurik Jutting, British Banker, Convicted of Murdering 2 Women in Hong Kong
description: HONG KONG  A Hong Kong judge on Tuesday sentenced a British banker to life in prison for murdering two Indonesian women at his luxury apartment in 2014, bringing to a close a gruesome case that cast a spotlight on social inequality and the excesses of the financial sector in one of Asias richest cities.

title: The Secret Muse of the Downtown Scene? Turtles
description: I love her pace, the composer Meredith Monk said recently at her TriBeCa loft. She was describing her roommate, with whom she has resided for the past 38 years.

title: From Italian-Asian to Locavore Canadian: Food Adventures in Vancouver
description: In a breezy neighborhood west of downtown Vancouver, theres a tree-lined stretch of Denman Street where youll find what amounts to a global buffet: Korean, Chinese, Vietnamese, Middle Eastern, Spanish, African fusion, Italian, Mexican, Pacific Northwest (lest we forget where we are)  the list of cuisines served in this profusion of mostly small and unassuming restaurants is long.

title: New York Today: 104 Years Old, and Still Voting
description: Updated, 11:52 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Election Day, Paying for Crime, Whistle-Blowing in Korea
description: Its Election Day. Pleas have been made. Closing pitches have been delivered.

title: National Soccer Teams in Britain Fight to Wear Memorial Poppies
description: LONDON  And so the politicization of dress continues. Now it is the poppy  the sartorial commemoration of soldiers who lost their lives in wartime that Britons wear in the days before Remembrance Day, Nov. 11  that has generated controversy.

title: A Fat Dad Election
description: It was 1972, and George McGovern was running against Richard Nixon for president.

title: On Election Day, Little Chance of Changing That Early Vote
description: Perhaps you didnt gather enough information in the first year and a half of the campaign. Perhaps you thought you had made up your mind and cast your ballot early, only to have a last-minute change of heart.

title: 1966: Ten Dancers in Cuban Ballet Defect in Paris
description: PARIS  Ten dancers skipped away from the Cuban National Ballet this weekend and asked for political asylum in France because of the arbitrary persecution which has developed in our country. It was the largest group of artists to defect here in recent years. It was also an embarrassing blow to the Havana government, which had given the successful company a proud sendoff when it left to open in the prestigious Fourth International Dance Festival last Wednesday.

title: After These Days of Rage
description: LONDON  Whatever the result of the United States election, politics has been changed, changed utterly, to use the words of the poet W. B. Yeats on Ireland after the 1916 Easter Rising. And not just in America. Across the Western world, there is a rising anger at the system.

title: How Were Watching Election Day
description: How the end of a long campaign looks to Times Opinion writers across the country

title: Four Prominent Suffragist Grave Sites in the Bronx Anticipating a Surge in Visitors This Election Day
description: Susan B. Anthonys grave site, in Rochester, is a perennial destination for women celebrating their freedom to vote, but on Election Day, Woodlawn Cemetery in the Bronx would like to remind New Yorkers to share the love.

title: California Today: What to Watch For on Election Day
description: Good morning.

title: Why Long Voting Lines Could Have Long-Term Consequences
description: In Charlotte, N.C., the lines for the first wave of early balloting last month forced some voters to wait more than two hours. In Las Vegas last weekend, voters were still waiting outside a polling place in a Mexican grocery store two hours after it was set to close. In New York City on Election Day, voters who spilled out of polling sites snaked through schoolyards and around entire city blocks.

title: Prince Harry Denounces Media Coverage of His Girlfriend, Meghan Markle
description: LONDON  Prince Harry on Tuesday attacked the racial undertones of British news coverage and social media harassment of his new girlfriend, the American actress Meghan Markle.

title: Clinton vs. Trump: Voters Have Their Say on Election Day
description: In Harmony Township, Pa., west of Pittsburgh, early voters were rewarded with cinnamon rolls from Orams bakery, on sale to raise money for the volunteer fire department. Culinary Union members in Las Vegas knocked on doors to get out the vote. And in Exeter, N.H., voters arrived early at their polling place to avoid lines  only to find that scores of others had the same idea.

title: Whats the Top Issue Driving Your Vote Today?
description: Today is Election Day in the United States. Whether you cast your vote today or earlier in this election season, wed like to know: What issue is driving your vote, and why? Please tell us in the comments. Your response may be featured on the nytimes.com home page or on our social media channels, including Twitter and Facebook.

title: The Hoaxes, Fake News and Misinformation We Saw on Election Day
description: Fake stories and memes that crop up during live news events have been a problem on social media for years, but a wild election season has highlighted the news medias slow response to them.

title: On the Trail: Monday, Nov. 7
description: Candidates on the major-party tickets spent Monday visiting important states to try to put votes in their columns on Election Day.

title: Share Your Ballot Selfie
description: Did you take a ballot selfie? In 18 states and the District of Columbia, ballot selfies are legal. If you live in the nations capital or one of those states, share your ballot selfie using the hashtag #NYTballotselfie on Twitter, Instagram or Facebook. Also mention the state you voted in, and we may use it in a follow-up post.

title: Casting Ballots
description: People arrived at polling stations nationwide on Tuesday to vote on Election Day.

title: After the Election, a Nation Tinged With Racial Hostility
description: What happened to Americas progressive era?

title: Hungarys Lawmakers Reject Plan to Block Resettlement of Refugees
description: BUDAPEST  Lawmakers in Hungary on Tuesday rejected a proposed national ban on refugees relocated from the rest of the European Union, dealing a rare defeat to Prime Minister Viktor Orban.

title: How Ill Watch Election Night
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Are Selfies With Your Ballot Legal? Depends on Where You Vote
description: If youre tempted to take a selfie at the polls on Election Day, you may find yourself on the wrong side of the law.

title: Awaiting Word
description: At watch parties around the country, supporters kept their eyes on the results.

title: Your Election Day Questions, Answered
description: And now we wait.

title: A Hint of Alcatraz With 2 Inmates on the Run From London Prison
description: LONDON  It was a flourish worthy of the 1962 escape from Alcatraz.

title: Nick Caves Anthrocene
description: A line from Anthrocene, a new song by the Australian songwriter Nick Cave.

title: Michelle Obamas Challenge for Hillary Clinton
description: PHILADELPHIA  When Bill Clinton introduced the finest surrogate, supporter any candidate for president ever had, everyone on Philadelphias Independence Mall knew the person he was talking about.

title: Hillary Clinton Votes in Chappaqua: Its a Humbling Feeling
description: CHAPPAQUA, N.Y.  On a bright Election Day morning, Hillary Clinton cast a vote for herself for president, the final step of a turbulent 19-month campaign.

title: Stephen Currys 13 3-Pointers: Shot for Shot
description: Night after night, in good games and bad games, in wins and losses, Stephen Curry made 3s.

title: Election Night at The New York Times
description: Twelve Times journalists relay their most memorable anecdotes from election nights past.

title: Did Democrats Regain Control of the Senate? No. Here Are 10 Races We Watched.
description: Republicans and Democrats battled fiercely for control of the Senate. Here are 10 pivotal races we watched. Update: Republicans kept control.

title: Can The Times Relax Its Style and Still Be The New York Times?
description: Exactly what is fit to print? The standards editor, Phil Corbett, talks about language, the election and changing Times style. Susan Lehman is host.

title: The Appeal of Sporty, Lightweight Anoraks
description: Featherweight jackets bring a youthfulness to long skirts and studious turtlenecks.

title: An I Voted Sticker Can Get You Free Stuff, but It Shouldnt
description: Election Day is upon us, and that means (among other things) that the American voter is entitled to a bunch of free stuff: doughnuts, pizza, cheese dip, you name it. It is all provided by businesses looking to get a bit of publicity by encouraging everyone to fulfill their civic duty.

title: Can The Times Relax Its Style and Still Be The New York Times?
description: Donald J. Trump uses vulgar words to describe women; does The Times repeat the vulgarity in its report? In headlines? What about racial slurs? Does The Times reprint hate speech when it arises during a political campaign?

title: The Voting Booth Calls. Some, It Calls Early.
description: Its finally here: Election Day. People across the country are turning out to vote on Tuesday morning. We dispatched photographers throughout the country to meet the early birds among us  the first people in line  and asked what brought them to the polls.

title: A Love Letter to Drinking in Bars
description: From dingy dives to Old World establishments, watering holes are one writers paradise.

title: The Meaning of Selena
description: One morning last month, Maria Herrera, a 28-year-old makeup artist, got in line outside the MAC store in downtown Chicago. It was 1:30. There were already 18 people ahead of her waiting to buy a limited-edition makeup collection inspired by the Mexican-American singer Selena Quintanilla Prez. By 9:30, their numbers had grown by dozens.

title: Long Avoided by Tourists, Iran Is Suddenly a Hot Destination
description: TEHRAN  For all of Irans attractions  breathtaking scenery and numerous World Heritage sites, among other things  there are plenty of downsides to vacationing in the Islamic republic. Alcohol is forbidden. There is very little night life, at least in public. All women, including visiting foreigners, are obliged to wear a head scarf.

title: Splayed Turkey, Step by Step
description: Three simple steps to splaying a turkey for faster and more even roasting.

title: An Anthropocene Journey
description: If you need a diversion as theextraordinaryelection aftermath plays out in the United States, heres one option.

title: An Apron Made for Women by Women
description: Do you care whether your apron is flattering? The new wrap apron certainly is. Designed by Jenny Goodman, a founder of Tilit, a company on the Lower East Side that specializes in chefs gear, this apron is made from soft gray recycled hemp and cotton. It has an adjustable halter strap and a waistline tie that slips through one side to create the wrap effect. Ten dollars from the sale of every gray apron is being donated to the Bad Bitches Grant Fund in Charleston, S.C., for womens culinary education. The company also makes good-looking aprons for men: Wrap Apron, $75, tilitnyc.com.

title: Donald Trump, Amid Cheers and Jeers, Casts His Vote
description: Donald J. Trump cast his ballot at Manhattans Public School 59, a school just blocks from his home and office at Trump Tower, on Tuesday.

title: Make Your Phone Easier to Read
description: Q. Is it possible to make the text on my smartphone bigger so that I can read emails more easily?

title: Toblerone Alters Shape of 2 Chocolate Bars, and Fans Are Outraged
description: LONDON  The peaks are slimmer and the valleys are wider, but the price hasnt changed.

title: 1916: Herald in the Making Shown in Pictures
description: At the Broadway Theatre last night the spectators at the motion picture entertainment displayed a deep interest in A Newspaper in the Making, a part of the Paramount Pictograph, which was featured by itself. The remarkably close attention which the undramatic picture attracted seemed, judging by the comments of the spectators, to be caused by the clear exposition of a little understood and widely interesting subject  how the news gets from its happening onto the folded white pages of a newspaper.

title: Jim Harbaugh Gives Jabrill Pepperss Uphill Heisman Climb a Big Push
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  Early in the second quarter of No. 2 Michigans 59-3 demolition of Maryland on Saturday, the Wolverines Jabrill Peppers ran the ball 13 yards from Marylands 16-yard line, leaving Michigan, already up by 14-0 and clearly primed to be the victor, needing someone just to punch it in.

title: Tech Tools for Election Day
description: What a long road it has been. And now we are finally here: Election Day.

title: I Feel Very Happy to Be a Part of This: New Yorkers Flock to the Polls
description: The lines snaked through school hallways and public libraries and down sun-dappled sidewalks, filled with New Yorkers in business suits and exercise attire, alone and with relatives, as they cast their votes on Tuesday.

title: Jhumpa Lahiri Judges Books by Their Covers
description: In The Clothing of Books, a pocket-size treatise out this month, Jhumpa Lahiri takes on the visual language of book jackets and the search for the perfect fit. The right cover is like a beautiful coat, elegant and warm, writes the Pulitzer Prize winner. Her latest is a smart lapis blue with simple lettering. Here, she shares five of her all-time favorites.

title: Third Body Found in South Carolina After Chained Woman Was Rescued
description: Two more bodies were found Monday on the remote property in South Carolina where a missing woman was rescued from a storage container in which she had been chained and held captive, the authorities said.

title: At the Former Home to Borders Books, a Tech Hub Now Sprouts
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  A patch of sidewalk on the south side of East Liberty Street, four blocks from the main University of Michigan campus, has returned from the dead with remarkable speed.

title: Austrian Authorities Thwart Group Trying to Sell Fake Picassos
description: LONDON  Austrias criminal intelligence service announced this week that it had uncovered a group selling forgeries of high-profile art, including fakes that had been attributed to Chagall and Picasso.

title: Silicon Valley Style Puts Gloss on Teslas Bid for SolarCity
description: If Tesla Motors proposed acquisition of SolarCity wasnt a Silicon Valley deal through and through, it would have been dead on arrival.

title: How the 50 Million Early Voters May Shape the Elections Outcome
description: With the number of people who voted before Election Day expected to approach 50 million, a lot remains unknown about who these voters are and whether this surge of early voting will change the outcome of the election.

title: Can the Media Recover From This Election?
description: This has not been your typical presidential election  not for the voters, the candidates or the news media. James Poniewozik, chief television critic for The New York Times, and Jim Rutenberg, media columnist for The Times, discuss how the election season went, good and bad, for members of the press.

title: What to Read About The Crown
description: The first season of The Crown hit Netflix on Friday. Since then the new series, a luscious dramatization of the life of Queen Elizabeth II, has generated conversations about historical accuracy and about how we mythologize the British royal family. Netflix plans to dramatize six decades of the Queens reign, and the first season opens with Princess Elizabeth juggling her responsibilities and her relationship, like so many modern women.

title: Celebrities Are Voting, Then Putting Stickers on Their Faces
description: A decade ago the hip hop mogul Sean Combs, or P. Diddy as he was known then, sought to drive people to the polls with the slogan Vote or Die!

title: What Weve Learned About the Media Industry During This Election
description: When the 2016 campaign began, legacy news organizations already faced dim industry projections. Slides in print revenue at newspapers and magazines were accelerating; online advertising, the escape plan for these businesses, teetered.

title: How to Spot and Report Voter Intimidation
description: As many Americans endured long lines to cast their vote on Election Day, there was concern about voter intimidation. But some may be unsure about what exactly that entails.

title: Did Tom Brady and Gisele Bndchen Back Donald Trump? She Says No, and Hes Not Saying
description: The presidential election has divided the country, pitting friends against one another and even straining marriages.

title: Late-Night Comedians Get the Last Laughs of the 2016 Election
description: On Monday night, the late-night comics got their last crack at the 2016 election.

title: Fashion Election: Brock Collection Wins the CFDA/Vogue Fashion Fund Prize
description: So, I said to Steven Kolb, the chief executive of the Council of Fashion Designers of America, whos going to win?

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $18.65 MILLION

title: Obamas Election Day Ritual: Dribbling and Jump Shots
description: WASHINGTON  Dont jinx it now, President Obama thought.

title: Picturing the Next President
description: The images below are not real, but the scenes that Photoshop allows us to create today may become our reality after the election.

title: Valeants Struggles Are a Bad Omen for the Entire Industry
description: A disastrous quarter for Valeant Pharmaceuticals is a bad sign of things to come for a whole industry.

title: Behind the Famed Tartine Bakery, a Gluten-Free Talent
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Elisabeth Prueitt opened the San Francisco bakery Tartine in 2002 with her husband, Chad Robertson, she was already in on the cosmic joke: Here she was, a brilliant pastry chef who loved her work, married to a bread baker and collaborating on what would become one of Americas great bakeries. And she was gluten intolerant.

title: When Police Surveillance Violates Civil Liberties
description: To the Editor:

title: Why Locker Room Talk is No Excuse
description: I have never been in a mens locker room, but the news in recent weeks has offered a lesson in what to expect. First it was Donald Trump, who passed off the debasing remarks he was caught on tape making about women as mere locker room talk. Now its the Harvard mens soccer team that was found to have crudely sexualized members of the womens team, systematically and continually over many years. Once again, there are some who pass this behavior off as the stuff of locker rooms. Like who, you might ask? The New York Times, for one.

title: Ohio State University, on Alcohol Sales
description: To the Editor:

title: Spice Market Chef Puts His Spin on Chinese Food at Chaan Teng
description: CHAAN TENG The versatile chef Pichet Ong is best known for his Asian-fusion desserts, especially at Spice Market (which closed recently). But this Bangkok native has done plenty on the savory side, with Thai and Western food. His latest venture, for which he is the creative director, is in Hells Kitchen, turning out Chinese dishes, a cuisine thats not new to him since hes part Chinese and has worked at 66, Jean-Georges Vongerichtens Chinese restaurant in TriBeCa. Its never been a better time to open a Chinese restaurant now with the awareness of ingredients, he said. And hes having some fun making his own versions of the old standards: chicken skin dumplings, moo shu pulled beef, crispy mapo tofu, Singapore chile crab cakes and General Tso fried chicken. Desserts like flourless chocolate cake with green tea are not the usual banal afterthoughts. The room has atmosphere to spare, with lacy dark wood trellis work and Portuguese tile on the walls and underfoot. (Opens Thursday): 698 Ninth Avenue (48th Street), 212-235-1886, chaantengnyc.com.

title: His Play Is Set on Election Night. He Still Hasnt Finished It.
description: Talk about writing on deadline: The acclaimed playwright Richard Nelson is crafting a drama that is set tonight and opens tonight, pegged to this crazy election.

title: What the Election Could Mean for the Markets
description: Investors generally do not like uncertainty. Now, the biggest unknown hanging over the markets  the outcome of the United States presidential election  is about to be known.

title: 7 Great Reads to Distract You From the Election
description: This anxiety-inducing campaign season is at long last done. As we process the results, this is a great time to take a virtual escape. Thats where we come in. Here are seven articles that will mentally transport you off the grid or into a great yarn. Take advantage of  the temporarily paywall-free New York Times to dive into some great reads.

title: How Does the Electoral College Work?
description: What is the Electoral College?

title: Acquittal of the Bundy Gang
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Stranded. And Dont Expect Help From Those Animals.
description: Hush, the movies starting.

title: Manhattan School in Zoning Battle Is Struggling, but It Has Its Fans
description: When Andrew Chu first took his son to prekindergarten at Public School 191, he was unsure of what he would find: How good would the teachers be? Would parents show up for school events?

title: Japan Uses Speed, Not Size, to Take Womens Basketball to New Heights
description: TOKYO  For two quarters during a game at the Rio Olympics in August, Japan made the vaunted United States womens national basketball team appear mortal. Late in the first half of their quarterfinal game, Japan even cut the Americans lead to 2 points, at 48-46, on a layup by Ramu Tokashiki.

title: Julian Assange Releases More Emails and Defends WikiLeaks Mission
description: Julian Assange operates from the Ecuadorean Embassy in London, where his internet connection was recently cut off. But that has not stopped him from being one of the most significant and unusual players in the 2016 election campaign in the United States.

title: Suicide Attempts in Prison

title: Suspect in Fatal Subway Attack Pleads Not Guilty to Murder Charge
description: A Queens woman admitted pushing another woman to her death in front of a subway train in Times Square, prosecutors said in court on Tuesday, but the woman denied that she had confessed.

title: How a Mastodons Teeth Found in Michigan May Tell Us How It Died
description: Seth Colling, who teaches children with developmental disabilities at an outdoor learning center in Michigan, was walking along a creek looking for fish with his students in 2014 when they saw something odd sticking out from the water.

title: How I Mastered the Art (and Politics) of Cornbread Dressing
description: ATLANTA  I just wanted to learn how to make good cornbread dressing. Instead, I stepped on the third rail of Southern home cooking.
