New York State now requires that all prescriptions be filled electronically with a monitoring program targeting narcotics. Over the last several months Ive been keeping track of exactly how many opioids I prescribe.

title: 7 Lighthouses Around the World to Inspire a Trip
description: Whether they are functioning towers casting a beam over the sea or simply historic landmarks, lighthouses are full of intrigue. Their isolated locations, vantage points over cliffs and open water or associations with tales of storms and shipwrecks  whatever the reason, they capture the imagination. Here are seven examples outside Ireland that might inspire a trip.

title: Fugitive Whose Escape From London Prison Had Shades of Alcatraz Is Recaptured
description: LONDON  One of two men who escaped from a London prison in an audacious breakout has been captured and arrested after three days on the run, the police said on Thursday.

title: Review: Billy Lynns Long Halftime Walk: Ang Lees Super-High-Definition Take on the Iraq War
description: In 2004, George W. Bush was in the White House, Beyonc was in Destinys Child and more than 100,000 American troops were in Iraq. Whether or not this could be called a more innocent time, innocence is the central idea  the premise, the moral, the scarlet letter and the white whale  of Billy Lynns Long Halftime Walk, which takes place in that not-so-distant year.

title: New York Today: Veterans Day, on the Heels of a Bitterly Fought Election
description: Updated, 10:51 a.m.

title: Abe to Meet Trump to Press Japans Case on Security and Trade
description: TOKYO  Japans prime minister, Shinzo Abe, did not take long to recover from the shock of Donald J. Trumps victory. By Thursday morning  Wednesday night in the United States  Mr. Abe had called the president-elect and arranged to meet him in New York next week.

title: Women Actually Do Govern Differently
description: Fed up with the government shutdown in 2013, Senator Susan Collins took the floor, presented a three-point plan and implored colleagues on both sides of the aisle to work with her.

title: Hong Kong Venue Cancels Screening of Protest Film, Citing Political Concerns
description: BEIJING  The filmmaker Evans Chan was delighted when an educational center in Hong Kong agreed to screen his new documentary about the Umbrella Movement, the pro-democracy demonstrations that convulsed the city in 2014.

title: A Moment of Great Peril: Foreign Observers on Trumps Success
description: Editorial writers and opinion columnists around the world have reacted to Donald J. Trumps election as the 45th president of the United States. Below is a sampling of their views.

title: Questions for: Donald Trumps Victory Is Met With Shock Across a Wide Political Divide
description: Article: Donald Trumps Victory Is Met With Shock Across a Wide Political Divide

title: Alibaba, Amid Intense Hype, Confronts a Slowdown on Singles Day
description: HONG KONG  Singles Day in China has become the worlds biggest shopping day. Yet its most impressive aspect is not the millions of packages shipped or the billions of dollars spent, but the fact that it exists at all.

title: Word + Quiz: stockade
California Today: Secessionist Groups Seize the Moment
description: Good morning.

title: How the Polling Let Us Down
description: Its 48 hours later and a kind of acceptance sets in, guided by the familiar rituals of a peaceful transfer of power. A defeated candidate graciously concedes. And an outgoing president invites us to keep an open mind.

title: Ahmad Rahami, Manhattan Bombing Suspect, Makes His First Court Appearance
description: Ahmad Khan Rahami, the man accused of carrying out bombings in New York City and New Jersey in September, appeared for the first time in court in Manhattan on Thursday, with his lawyer expressing concern about whether his health problems could be addressed adequately in the jail where he is being held.

title: What Democrats Need to Do
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Parallels Between Europes Antitrust Cases Against Google and Microsoft
description: Google disputed on Thursday claims made by Europes antitrust officials that it had used Android, the companys dominant mobile operating system, to unfairly promote its own services like online search and its smartphone application store over those of rivals.

title: 8 More Pro-Democracy Lawmakers in Hong Kong May Lose Seats
description: HONG KONG  The number of pro-democracy lawmakers elected to Hong Kongs Legislative Council who may lose their seats has grown to 10, after a court was asked to rule whether eight people did not make proper oaths of office.

title: Contemporary Art in Turin
description: Thousands of art lovers, dealers, collectors and museum officials attended the 23rd edition of the Artissima art fair this month.

title: In Once-Tolerant Mosul, a Social Unraveling That Feels Permanent
description: ERBIL, Iraq  More than two years ago, a Christian farmer in his 70s named Mosa Zachariah fled his village near Mosul with, as he put it, only the pants he was wearing. He left behind his house, tons of wheat and a BMW.

title: Trump and Obama Hold Cordial 90-Minute Meeting in Oval Office
description: WASHINGTON  For months, President Obama said that Donald J. Trump was unqualified, temperamentally unfit and a threat to the republic who should never be president.

title: Why Netflix Lets Movie Lovers Down, and What to Do About It
description: Almost half a century ago, if you had enough disposable income and a certain amount of technical agility, you could have your own YouTube channel. Sort of. You could share your videos with friends who came over to your place to watch them, or you lend them to pals who had hardware similar to yours.

title: For Europe, Trumps Election Is a Terrifying Disaster
description: WASHINGTON  No one in Europe truly believed Americans would elect someone who seems so obviously unfit to lead the most powerful nation in the world. And yet, that is precisely what has happened, and now, across the Continent, people are trying to figure out what this will mean. Many fear that Donald J. Trumps election might mean the end of the West as we know it.

title: Russian Officials Were in Contact With Trump Allies, Diplomat Says
description: MOSCOW  The Russian government maintained contacts with members of Donald J. Trumps immediate entourage during the American presidential campaign, one of Russias top diplomats said Thursday.

title: Campuses Confront Hostile Acts Against Minorities After Donald Trumps Election
description: The fliers depicting men in camouflage, wielding guns and an American flag, appeared in mens restrooms throughout Texas State University: Now that our man Trump is elected, they said. Time to organize tar and feather vigilante squads and go arrest and torture those deviant university leaders spouting off that diversity garbage.

title: Donald Trump Could Put Climate Change on Course for Danger Zone
description: WASHINGTON  For a look at how sharply policy in Washington will change under the administration of Donald J. Trump, look no further than the environment.

title: 1916: Montana Elects a Woman to Congress
description: NEW YORK  Miss Jeannette Rankin, Independent candidate, has been elected Representative from Montana. This is the first time in the history of the United States that a woman has been elected a member of Congress. Miss Rankin is the suffrage campaigner through whose untiring efforts the women won the fight for the ballot in Montana. The Representative-elect had a strong lead on both the Democratic and Republican candidates.  The New York Herald, European Edition, Nov. 10, 1916

title: A One-of-a-Kind Pendant, From a Fashion Favorite
description: Great jewels are made to be noticed, but in the hands of the young French designer Elie Top, the art becomes one of concealment. The elegant and mustachioed Top, who had for years designed Lanvins fashionable baubles, engineers much of his own namesake haute joaillerie with a mechanical precision that allows the wearer to change personalities as vividly as a peacock. Two round medallions that stud this one-of-a-kind Makassar ebony pendant are sculptured from gold. With the opening of a clasp, they rotate into the wood to reveal an intricate underside set with diamonds and colored stones like malachite, lapis, topaz and amethyst. Part of a collection called Desdmone, after the wife of Shakespeares passionate Moor, this substantial necklace evokes a warriors shield or delicate medieval stained glass.

title: 1 Police Officer Dead, 1 Wounded After Western Pennsylvania Shooting
description: One police officer was killed and another was wounded when they were ambushed while responding to a domestic dispute in western Pennsylvania, the authorities said on Thursday. Hours later, a man and a woman were found dead inside a home nearby.

title: Are There Limits to Trumps Power?
description: When Donald J. Trump takes office on Jan. 20, he will have immense but not unlimited power at his disposal. Back in June, I wrote that he could  even without congressional consent  execute much of his vision. He could, for example, shift enforcement priorities against unauthorized immigrants, probably bar Muslims from entering the country, raise tariffs, withdraw forces from the Middle East, and tear up trade treaties and military alliances.

title: Business Leaders Examine a Post-Election World
description: On Thursday, Andrew Ross Sorkin talked to the nations top business leaders for the first time since the election results. The annual DealBook conference, held this year in the Time Warner Center in Manhattan, featured conversations with chief executives and other thought leaders, who gave their reactions to the election of Donald J. Trump.

title: Giving Newlyweds Tools for Entertaining
description: Most people who are getting married already have basic dishes and flatware, so consider giving unusual serving tools.

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the Post-Election News
description: Dont give up. The Opinion Columnist Andrew Rosenthal on the election and related news. Susan Lehman is host.

title: Trump Victory Alarms Gay and Transgender Groups
description: The election of Donald J. Trump to the presidency sent panic through much of the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community, which for the first time in eight years will face an administration hostile to its civil rights goals and a president-elect who has expressed a desire to reverse many of its political gains.

title: Good, Bad and Mad: Andrew Rosenthal on the Post-Election News
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Andrew Rosenthal, a Times Op-Ed columnist, talks about the news  the good, the bad and that which makes him mad.

title: Martin Shkreli Releases Parts of Wu-Tang Clan Album After Trump Victory
description: Martin Shkreli, the pharmaceutical executive who was denounced for raising the price of a prescription drug by more than 5,000 percent, has released music from the only known copy of a Wu-Tang Clan album he owns exclusively. He had promised to do so if Donald J. Trump was elected president.

title: Trumps Policies May Bring Fresh Wave of Deals
description: With a man who is co-author of The Art of the Deal as president-elect, deal making can be expected to increase.

title: Jerry Seinfeld Extends Beacon Residency Into 2017
description: Care for a second helping of nothing? Jerry Seinfeld is extending the comedy residency he began at the Beacon Theater this year and will be doubling up on shows, with 12 more planned performances in the first half of next year, the Madison Square Garden Company announced on Thursday.

title: The 10.30.16 Issue
description: RE: KESHA

title: Resort Fashion in the Spanish Badlands
description: The countrys desert terrain provides a dramatic backdrop for the seasons elemental pieces.

title: Thousands Mourn Police Sergeant Fatally Shot in the Bronx
description: MASSAPEQUA, N.Y.  On a street lined with split-level homes, small storefronts and trees in fall colors, thousands of New York City police officers stretched out for blocks, standing in formation as they waited in the morning chill for the hearse carrying their fallen colleague to arrive.

title: Spains Most Inhospitable Landscape  as Dramatic Fashion Backdrop
description: PICTURE, IF YOU WILL, SPAIN.

title: The Art of the Quran, a Rare Peek at Islams Holy Text
description: WASHINGTON  The Art of the Quran: Treasures From the Museum of Turkish and Islamic Arts, at the Arthur M. Sackler Gallery here, is the first major United States display of handwritten copies of Islams holy text. Its a glorious show, utterly, and like nothing Ive ever seen, with more than 60 burnished and gilded books and folios, some as small as smartphones, others the size of carpets.

title: Zadie Smiths New Novel Takes on Dance, Fame and Friendship
description: SWING TIMEBy Zadie Smith453 pp. Penguin Press. $27.

title: Crowds Line Up at Indias Banks to Exchange Banned Rupee Notes
description: NEW DELHI  Thousands of security forces were deployed on Thursday to keep the peace at Indias banks, where crowds of people had formed jittery, snaking lines in the early morning, desperate to exchange now-useless currency notes.

title: Daily Report: The Valley Awakens to Trump
description: Silicon Valley loves disruption  just not, it turns out, disruptions of a certain kind.

title: Recognize Callers and Texters by Sound
description: Q. On an iPhone, is there a way to assign specific text alert sounds to different people so that you can tell who is texting without looking at the screen? The Sound settings let you assign only one text tone and one ringtone for everyone.

title: Russia Prepares to Block LinkedIn After Court Ruling
description: LinkedIn, the social networking site for professionals that will soon be bought by Microsoft, is to be blocked in Russia after a local court ruled on Thursday that it had breached the countrys data protection rules, a sign of growing tensions for American tech companies operating in the country.

title: With Trumps Election, a Bonanza for Washington Lobbyists
description: WASHINGTON  Trent Lott, the former Republican senator from Mississippi, had gleefully flown back from Florida, where he had been working for the campaign of Donald J. Trump. Now a powerful lobbyist, his phone had been buzzing nonstop and he was busy helping to organize a briefing Thursday morning for dozens of corporate clients.

title: President of Boxings Governing Body Knew of Loan, Documents Show
description: The president of boxings international federation was closely involved in guiding a $10 million loan to the organization, a transaction that ultimately led to such financial disarray that investigators from an auditing firm recommended that the group find a criminal lawyer, according to documents recently obtained by The New York Times.

title: Trumps Victory Bodes Well for Investors  for Now
description: To the long list of pundits who called the election all wrong  as well as its likely consequences  add Wall Street analysts.

title: My Liberal University Cemented My Vote for Trump
description: MIDDLETOWN, Conn.  As the needle on the New York Times presidential predictor swung from a certain victory for Hillary Clinton to an upset win for Donald J. Trump on Tuesday, I began to think about how my campus, Wesleyan University, would react to the news.

title: High Triglycerides Tied to Pancreatitis Risk
description: People are often advised to keep levels of triglycerides, a type of blood fat, in check to lower the risk of a heart attack. But high triglyceride levels may be linked to another problem as well: acute pancreatitis, a sudden and potentially fatal inflammation of the pancreas.

title: Thursday Kitchen
description: Glowing cocktails and a Korean-leaning menu designed for sharing in the East Village.

title: At Thursday Kitchen, Cocktails Glow and Korean Food Relaxes
description: The soju cocktails come in plastic pouches with straws thrust in, like debauched Capri Suns. The cubes inside look like ice but glow. In the long, dark dining room, they double as votive candles, lighting faces from below: dinner as sance.

title: Clicks to Bricks: Online Retailers Find the Lure of a Store
description: Online shopping gets all the attention these days. But sometimes, theres still no beating a physical store.

title: Thomas Ricks on the Seasons Military History
description: A good measure of a work of history is whether it changes the way we understand its subject. By that measure, David J. Silverman succeeds admirably in THUNDERSTICKS: Firearms and the Violent Transformation of Native America (Belknap/Harvard University, $29.95).

title: Hillary Clinton, a Woman Dogged by Mens Misdeeds
description: When millions of women cast their votes for Hillary Clinton on Tuesday, they may have been thinking about male power as much as female equality  about the sleazebags who never heard no, or the male bosses who lowballed them in salary negotiations, or those men in positions of authority who patronized them or ignored them altogether. There was a sense of collective curiosity and anticipation: Would having a woman serve in the most powerful role in the country make any of those scenarios less likely for women going forward?

title: Over 50 Reusable Activity Sheets to Teach Any Days Times
description: Warm-up activities, curriculum extensions, skill builders, literacy games, substitute lessons, or just for fun: this collection of reusable activity sheets in PDF is one-stop shopping for all of these purposes and more.

title: Oh, for the Joy of a Tickled Rat
description: Theres just something about a rat jumping for joy when its been tickled that can change your whole outlook on rats, and neuroscience.

title: What Are Some Period Dramas With Diverse Casts?
description: Are you trying to figure out what to watch next? (Or maybe what TV show to give up on completely?) Watching is here to help. Send your questions to watching@nytimes.com.

title: Rosamond Bernier, Art Insider Who Turned Lectures Into Theater, Dies at 100
description: Rosamond Bernier, who transformed the museum art lecture into a dazzling entertainment by blending scholarship, a flair for the dramatic and tales of her days as a free-spirited journalist and friend to Picasso, Matisse and other 20th-century artists, died on Wednesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 100.

title: Squirrel Nutkin Could Have Had Leprosy, Study Finds
description: Some British red squirrels  cute and pointy-eared, like Beatrix Potters Squirrel Nutkin  carry a medieval form of human leprosy, scientists have learned.

title: Denis Villeneuve of Arrival Leans In to Strong Heroines
description: Arrival, the new aliens-have-landed film with Amy Adams (which opensFriday), is the first science-fiction picture directed by Denis Villeneuve, and, despite its ominous overtones and the heartbreak at its core, it also counts among Mr. Villeneuves lighter fare.

title: Venezuelan Soccer Official Pleads Guilty; Promises to Repay Millions in FIFA Case
description: The Justice Department announced on Thursday the 21st conviction in its world soccer corruption case focused on FIFA, the sports governing body, and affiliated regional soccer organizations. With 42 defendants publicly charged to date, the conviction marked a halfway point.

title: Should Designers Trust the Wisdom of the Crowd?
description: New Zealand issued an open call for flag-redesign ideas, joining what has become a quiet trend.

title: How Furniture Makers Are Catering to Millennials
description: A new wave of companies is trying to win over younger consumers  by considering their emotional needs as much as their material ones.

title: Inside the 21st-Century Craze for Redesigning Everything
description: For todays designers, any object, symbol or pool of information is just another problem awaiting a new solution. Is that a good thing?

title: Why Is It So Hard to Make a Website for the Government?
description: When a team of young idealists tried to make a website for Californias food-stamp system, they learned just how complicated it can be to redesign the public sector.

title: Six Designers Take On Some of the Worlds Toughest Redesign Challenges
description: Reimagining the cell tower, the hospital gown, the toilet, the airport baggage-delivery system, the bike lock and the prescription-medicine label.

title: Our New Urban Oases
description: American cities have embraced a host of inventive new methods to create public spaces. But are they as public as they should be?

title: How an Indian Innovator Reverse-Engineered the Making of Sanitary Pads
description: A health care revolution in developing nations started with some uncomfortable trial and error.

title: Make It New
description: A little-known fact about The New York Times Magazine is that it is printed on the weekend before the one on which it is distributed. This means that the contents of this weeks issue were finalized several days before Election Day. You will find no direct reflections on the results of the voting in these articles. And yet, the uncertainty of the outcome at the time we published them suits the theme of this special issue: our current mania with redesigning, tweaking, optimizing, improving, refreshing and updating everything. In the age of branding, the quadrennial choosing of an American president has come to feel like an exercise in product relaunch, and both candidates  Hillary Clinton and the eventual victor, Donald Trump  each represented a new and unprecedented proposal for the face we would show the world.

title: Law Firm Arnold & Porter to Merge With Rival Kaye Scholer
description: Two prominent law firms, Arnold & Porter and Kaye Scholer, winding up months of talks, announced on Thursday that they would combine to become a firm with more than 1,000 lawyers effective Jan. 1. The new firm will be called Arnold & Porter Kaye Scholer.

title: An Outerwear Brand Finds Its Place in Fashion  and in SoHo
description: Lately Canada Goose, the 59-year-old outerwear brand best known for its fur-trimmed black parkas, has been found not just in wintry climes but on runways. In February, Marc Jacobs paired one of his floor-grazing sequined skirts with a mens Manitoba coat, adding feathers, while Vetements deconstructed and puffed up two classic styles. Opening Ceremonys (slimmer) takes were eye-catching for their use of color and print  think purple paisley. This month, Canada Goose becomes a full-fledged member of the downtown scene with the inauguration of a SoHo flagship. (It opens on the heels of a Toronto outpost, the companys first stand-alone store.) Amid raw marble detailing sourced from British Columbia, shoppers can rest on soft maple benches by the Ontario millworker DB Johnson and other seating from the Montreal-based Montauk Sofa company. Theyll also find a celebration of soapstone-carved polar bear sculptures by the contemporary Aboriginal artist Jason Carter. Storytelling was a crucial part of the design, says chief executive officer Dani Reiss. Stories like how we were there when Laurie Skreslet was the first Canadian to summit Mt. Everest. Add to that tales of the brands fashion-world ascent.

title: Review: They Cant Kill Us All Tallies the Unarmed Black Men Shot by Police
description: The reporters who covered the civil-rights struggle in America in the 1950s and 60s were said to be working the race beat. A new generation of reporters has risen to cover a grim and new-seeming iteration of that beat: police shootings of unarmed black men.

title: Interpol Names Chinese Police Official as Its New President
description: HONG KONG  Interpol has chosen a top Chinese security official as its new president, raising alarms from human rights groups concerned that the appointment will lead to abuse of the global police organizations powers to issue international arrest warrants.

title: R. A. Dickey Isnt Done; Signs One-Year Deal With Atlanta Braves
description: R. A. Dickey, the 42-year-old knuckleball pitcher, signed a one-year free-agent deal to pitch for the Atlanta Braves, a team with a rich history of knuckleballers.

title: For Locally Owned Stores, Head to NoLIta
description: Start exploring NoLIta with a little fuel from Caf Integral at 149 Elizabeth Street. Nicaraguan coffee is roasted in New York, and nut milks like almond, cashew and coconut are made in-house. The Almond Milk Latte ($6) has been life changing, tasting not like store-bought almond milk, but like warm, creamy almonds. Youll also rarely find a line here, which makes starting your day that much better.

title: Yahoos Breach Gives Verizon Leverage in Deal Talks
description: Yahoo is providing more wiggle room for Verizon Communications.

title: Highlights of Rick Owenss and Michle Lamys Furniture
description: The couple has collaborated on structural pieces which will be the focus of a new show at MOCA in Los Angeles.

title: Rick Owenss Monumental  if Not Entirely Cozy  Furniture
description: Plenty of people dont realize that Rick Owens creates furniture, as well as fashion, and that hes done so since 2007. Thats partly because Owens consciously keeps the pieces out of most of his stores; and partly because, even in situ, it doesnt look like furniture. Instead, they resemble angular, faceted rocks made of materials as diverse as Carrara marble or plywood, maybe embedded with a moose antler. Owenss own bed  one of an edition of three  is a monumental tomblike structure of alabaster slabs which, when combined with its matching daybed, weighs two tons.

title: Low-Key Greenpoint Has a Little of Everything
description: Adaptations (109 Franklin Street) is a vintage furniture store that focuses mostly on pieces from the 1970s: boxy wooden cabinets, platform sofas, macram wall hangings and eight-track-friendly stereo receivers. Arranged like a home, with a bedroom nook in back, the store has an unintimidating atmosphere and prices that are not astronomical for items that are in excellent condition. To pair with the vintage finds there are new, plush upholstered ottomans, which the shop makes to order in a variety of fabrics.

title: Aaron Schock, Ex-Illinois Congressman, Is Indicted
description: Aaron Schock, the former Republican representative from Illinois whose taste for first-class travel and a Downton Abbey-themed office design led to questions about his judgment and adherence to spending rules, was indicted on Thursday by a federal grand jury on 24 counts, including wire fraud and theft of government funds.

title: Chuck Schumer Prepares for His Next Challenge: Leading Senate Democrats
description: WASHINGTON  In 2012, Senator Chuck Schumer, Democrat of New York, made an arresting offer to Senator Scott Brown, the Massachusetts Republican whose 2010 special-election victory had upended President Obamas agenda. Help Democrats pass legislation to blunt the force of money in politics, he said, and they would not mount a serious challenge to Mr. Browns re-election.

title: Lower East Side, Effortlessly Cool
description: Start south of Delancey Street on Orchard and slowly make your way north. Its easy to spend a full day here, as there are also numerous galleries. The Tenement Museum (103 Orchard Street) is also not to be missed. It offers excellent tours of the neighborhood that provide an even more immersive experience.

title: Clinton Hill, a Welcome Stroll
description: Joya Studio (19 Vanderbilt Avenue), near the Navy Yard, produces scented candles for more than 100 brands, from tastemaker designer labels to Nike. Since February, the front section of its manufacturing facility has been transformed into a boutique thats evocative of a high-end art gallery, with hanging oak display cases backed with slabs of hot-rolled steel. (Periodically, the cases slide aside, making room for the delivery trucks that pull into the cavernous space.) Joyas owner, Frederick Bouchardy, fills the store with personal picks, including the Claude Galien cologne his grandfather wore, Le Baigneur beard and face oil, thick leather coasters and a selection of art books.

title: 9 New Books We Recommend This Week
description: However you feel about the results of this weeks election, theres no arguing that it was a long and brutal campaign season. Lets take refuge in stories, and in the long view of history.

title: A Wriggle in Time: Historical Artifacts of Belly Dancing
description: The belly dancer Serena Wilson was so fascinated with the dance form that she wrote books about it with her husband, Alan. In their 1994 study, The Legacy of Little Egypt: A History of the Belly Dance in America, they described how Middle Eastern and North African performers drew crowds at Chicago and New York theaters in the 1890s and early 1900s, and how entrepreneurial Americans started learning the moves.

title: It Is America. But I Want to Play in Mexico.
description: EL PASO  Night fell, and the thick, heavy air was cut by a sharp, chilling breeze, the sort of West Texas wind that made it feel as if the whole city had a fever. Was it hot out, or cold? The children on the field at Pico Norte Park  little more than a bumpy, narrow strip of grass lined for soccer  wore uniforms and quickly broke a sweat; the parents ringing the sideline wore jeans and long sleeves as they watched and cheered and occasionally shivered.

title: Mending Fences (Even When You Really Dont Want To)
description: My problem? You and idiots like you, full of straight white male privilege, who never understood the life-or-death stakes of sexism, racism and homophobia in our recent election. I heard you on the radio last week, sounding like a fool, telling people who had fought over the presidential election (and cut ties with family and friends) to look for the best in each other and talk it out. Why is it always on the victims to explain ourselves to straight men and white people? Ive had it! After this election, I want nothing to do with any jerk who voted for Trump or limousine liberals like you. Why should I?

title: Taliban Strike German Consulate in Afghan City of Mazar-i-Sharif
description: KUNDUZ, Afghanistan  Taliban insurgents struck at the German Consulate in the northern commercial hub of Mazar-i-Sharif late Thursday night, killing at least two people and wounding at least 90, Afghan officials said.

title: The Divide Between Red and Blue America Grew Even Deeper in 2016
description: Sixty percent of all voters in the nation live in a county that was won in a landslide in 2016.

title: A Guide to Exploring Four Dynamic New York Neighborhoods
description: New York offers some of the worlds most famous stores, but if you want to break the chain habit, its also home to many locally owned businesses. Its worth going to neighborhoods just a bit off the usual path. If you want to spend the day exploring, with a mix of stores and great food, these four neighborhoods will keep you satisfied.

title: How to Deter the Deer
description: To the Editor:

title: In China-U.S. Trade War, Trump Would Have Weapons
description: SHANGHAI  As a candidate, Donald J. Trump aimed some of his most blistering words at China, declaring that we already have a trade war and suggesting ominously that we have the power over China, economic power.

title: Comparing Health Systems: The U.S. and the Rest
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: Juilliards Fast Takes on French Baroque
description: If Italy sang, the early-music guru William Christie said in a master class at the Juilliard Schools Paul Hall on Tuesday afternoon, Paris and France danced. The comment seemed germane to the moment, with an excellent group of period-instrumentalists from the schools historical performance program poised to play Jean-Fry Rebels Les Caractres de la Danse, a madcap tour of 18th-century French dance forms.

title: A Study Tests the Safety of Women Using Abortion Pills Sent by Mail
description: When the abortion pills arrived in her mailbox this summer, she felt anxious but also in control, knowing she could end her pregnancy entirely in the privacy of her own home.

title: A Pasek and Paul Primer
description: The history of musical theater is rich with collaborations between lyricists and composers, who jointly write the songs that power the shows. Over the last decade, Benj Pasek and Justin Paul have established a strong reputation for the versatility and intelligence of their work, and now, with their first original musical opening on Broadway (Dear Evan Hansen) and a major Hollywood movie for which they wrote the lyrics opening around the country (La La Land), they have fully emerged as a significant new creative force. Here is a video sampler of material from their growing songbook:

title: What Impact Will Trump Have on Tourism?
description: With Donald J. Trump set to become the 45th president of the United States, the spirit of openness that has permeated everything from our increasingly global economy to how we travel may be poised to change.

title: What Its Like to Make It in Showbiz With Your Best Friend
description: They met at 18, the worst dancers in a college ballet class, and sought refuge in a basement practice room, taking a first stab at songwriting with a tune about adolescents playing hooky and footsie at a suburban diner.

title: Review: Uncle Kent 2, Hows Your Tolerance for Hipster Milquetoasts?
description: Nobody Saw the First One. So Hes Back for a Second. That tag line appears on a poster for Uncle Kent 2, and its not entirely accurate. As it happens, I  saw the somber and weirdly self-congratulatory 2011 film Uncle Kent, directed by Joe Swanberg and starring Kent Osborne as the title character. Uncle Kent 2, directed (for the most part) by Todd Rohal from Mr. Osbornes script, is a funnier and more imaginative film than its predecessor, but its still what you might call a niche proposition.

title: Video Review: Buick Envision, a Crossover With a Chinese Heritage
description: THE new Buick Envision might seem like any other two-row crossover sport utility vehicle available in the United States, but for a crucial distinction. It is the first mainstream vehicle to come to this country from China.

title: Donald Trump, Shinzo Abe, Interpol: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Photographs from Carla Sozzanis Personal Collection
description: For more than 40 years, the founder of 10 Corso Como has built a collection of over 650 photographs representing 70-plus artists.

title: Stunning, Rare Images Collected by a Fashion-World Force
description: As a longtime editor and the creator of 10 Corso Como, Milans high-end retail and dining complex, Carla Sozzani is a well-known figure in the fashion world; and as the founder of the gallery there that bears her name, shes been a longtime force in the art world as well. What many dont know is that she is also a passionate collector of photography. For more than 40 years, she has built a collection of over 650 works, mostly in black and white, representing more than 70 artists from the 19th century to today: big names like Helmut Newton, Alfred Stieglitz, August Sanders and Irving Penn, but also lesser-known photographers like Xanti Schawinsky, an experimental artist from the 1920s.

title: Review: U.S.S. Indianapolis, a War (Yawn) Catastrophe
description: The lack of subtlety in its title tells you what you need to know about U.S.S. Indianapolis: Men of Courage, a dramatization of an almost unbelievable World War II catastrophe. The film, directed by Mario Van Peebles, brays the story in broad strokes and clichs as if the horror of it didnt speak for itself, which it most certainly does.

title: Review: In Lazy Eye, Yakking Ex-Lovers Reconnect
description: The title of Lazy Eye is the common name for amblyopia, an ocular problem afflicting Dean (Lucas Near-Verbrugghe), a successful Los Angeles graphic designer with a second home in the Mojave Desert. As a child, he recalls, his condition was diagnosed, but he never bothered doing the recommended eye exercises to correct it.

title: An American Muslim Womans Heartbreak, and Hope, After the Election
description: To the Editor:

title: A Dinosaur With a Beak and Feathers Unearthed in China
description: It had feathers and a beak.

title: Review: Disturbing the Peace Profiles Israelis and Palestinians United Against Violence
description: How much bloodshed can a divided populace stand? In Stephen Apkon and Andrew Youngs documentary, Disturbing the Peace, we meet Combatants for Peace, an advocacy-activist group comprising Israelis and Palestinians who have reached their limit and renounced violence. Most are former military or paramilitary personnel seeking a two-state solution to Israels agonized convulsions. Their stories are compelling  and persuasive.

title: Review: Come and Find Me. Then Again, Maybe Not.
description: During his tenure on the television series Breaking Bad,  the actor Aaron Paul, as the foil to Bryan Cranstons Walter White, showed an adroit skill at portraying the haplessness that can lie just below the surface of a brash game face. Mr. Pauls role in the thriller Come and Find Me, as a man befuddled by the unexplained disappearance of his girlfriend (Annabelle Wallis), does not expand his performing parameters.

title: Review: To Sam Kim, One Is the Most Narcissistic Number That Youll Ever Know
description: The contemporary choreographer Sam Kim believes that the dance solo is, well, gross. (Take that, Anna Pavlova and all your dying swans.)

title: The Rage of White, Christian America
description: Between Barack Obamas 2008 election and 2016, America has transformed from being a majority white Christian nation (54 percent) to a minority white Christian nation (43 percent).

title: Moving On, After a Rancorous Election
description: To the Editor:

title: Review: In Iron Moon, Poets Who Know What Work Is
description: The Qin Xiaoyu and Wu Feiyue documentary Iron Moon has a slowly mounting, but lingering, impact. The film concerns poets in Southern China who, while enduring arduous, sometimes hazardous conditions in working-class occupations, preserve their spirits with verse. Its inspiration is Xu Lizhi, the 24-year-old poet and laborer at a Foxconn electronics factory in Shenzhen, Guangdong Province, who leapt to his death in 2014. Mr. Xu was one of the countless workers from the countryside who travel to Chinas growing cities seeking employment, only to be eaten alive by the tedious, pitiless demands of industry.

title: Giving Todays Car a Well-Tuned Interior
description: IT can make engines sound like purring pussycats  or growling tigers.

title: Put That Punt a Little to the Left of the Flutists
description: When Lachlan Edwards punts during Jets games, he tries to give the opposition poor field position. When he punts during those final few moments before kickoff, Edwards has a different objective.

title: Workout Gear for When Youre Not Breaking a Sweat
description: Athleisure, the high-performance sportswear originally designed for workouts but now worn everywhere, represents a populist, street-up phenomenon that got its start like this: Women loved wearing comfortable and sleek leggings to the gym. Sweat-eliminating wicking fabrics allowed them to add layers before heading to brunch. And sometimes, they didnt even work out at all.

title: Ts New Travel Issue: Editors Letter
description: In her Sign of the Times essay, Sadie Stein writes about how we rarely take the kind of holidays many of our parents enjoyed  to a resort where we are coddled like children and the most taxing activity is deciding between reading and napping. Instead, now we strive for self-improvement at every opportunity, even in our down time. We cleanse, do yoga, climb mountains and so on.

title: Review: A Pianist Adrift Encounters a Cougar in Dreamland
description: Dreamland might look from its credits like a vanity project, but it certainly doesnt play like one. Its a smart, understated sex comedy, a description that suggests a certain maturity. Youd never suspect it was the first feature from its director, Robert Schwartzman.

title: Review: Aspergers Are Us Delivers Smart, Perplexing Humor
description: Aspergers Are Us rarely stretches to be funny or poignant or touching, and that makes this documentary all the more of each. Theres plenty of emotion in this story of four young men who sometimes have trouble expressing their feelings.

title: Who Is Chuck Schumer?
description: Senator Chuck Schumer, who will take over as the leader of the Senate Democrats after the retirement of Harry Reid, is known as a hard-charging Brooklynite.

title: Review: The Anthropologist Tells a Mother-Daughter Story, With Rising Seawater
description: At this point no documentarian can possibly have a fresh take on climate change, right? Wrong. The Anthropologist, a stealthily insightful film by Seth Kramer, Daniel A. Miller and Jeremy Newberger, improbably mixes that topic with a mother-daughter story to produce a distinctive study of change and human adaptability.

title: Constipation May Increase Risk of Kidney Disease
description: Constipation may increase the risk for kidney disorders, new research has found.

title: Fantasy Football: Players to Start in Week 10
description: The Sablich brothers have provided award-winning fantasy football advice for The New York Times since 2010. See their weekly player rankings and visit 5thDownFantasy.com for more fantasy analysis. You can also ask them questions through their Twitter account, @5thdownfantasy.

title: Picassos Picassos Unpacks Paintings From the Family Vault
description: Diana Widmaier-Picasso is used to hearing that she physically resembles her grandmother Marie-Thrse Walter, Picassos muse and mistress.

title: Review: Almost Christmas, a Home-for-the-Holidays Comedy
description: The family comedy-drama Almost Christmas is an often disarmingly entertaining picture, in spite of its being a not particularly well-thought-out cinematic contrivance. After a brief opening montage showing the history of the Meyerses, a middle-class household in Birmingham, Ala., the movie alights on the five days before Christmas 2016. We soon learn that one of its main characters is running for Congress. Even though its the middle of December. This is a little distracting.

title: Canadas Big Dams Produce Clean Energy, and High Levels of Mercury
description: OTTAWA  Protests. Hunger strikes. Sit-ins that disrupt construction. At the immense Muskrat Falls hydroelectric dam project in a remote and rugged part of Labrador, the indigenous people who live nearby have been raising louder and louder alarms.

title: Cooper Hewitt Museum: A Mommy-and-Me Hot Spot
description: Ashley Carlson called out homework instructions across a large lawn to her first grader, who was leaving with a babysitter after having practiced cartwheels on the grass, and then turned her attention to her 3- and 4-year-old sons. The two boys, with matching white-blond hair and blue polo shirts, were clambering up a low stone wall and leaning on a painstakingly restored early-1900s ornate iron fence.

title: Review: National Bird Follows Whistle-Blowers in Americas Drone War
description: If we can eliminate enemy threats without placing boots on a battlefield, then why not do so? Thats one of the unspoken questions raised, and largely unanswered, by  National Bird, Sonia Kennebecks elegantly unsettling documentary about the United States reliance on aerial combat drones.

title: What to See in New York Art Galleries This Week
Calder and Picasso in Parallel, and as They Diverge
description: Almine Rech Gallery

title: Haunting Ruins and Rituals Begins A Year of Yes at Brooklyn Museum
description: A stirring show of the African-American artist Beverly Buchanan kicks off A Year of Yes: Reimagining Feminism at the Brooklyn Museum, a rallying cry of events and exhibitions devoted to art by women. In some ways, this ruminative exhibition, Beverly Buchanan  Ruins and Rituals, is an odd fit for this powerfully affirmative program; Ms. Buchanan (1940-2015) made haunting sculptures, earthworks, photographs and drawings inspired by the architecture of the rural South and its deeply embedded histories of injustice, poverty and loss.

title: Review: Watch the Road, and the Driver, Too, in The Monster
description: Aliens may attack while serial killers rev their chain saws, but few monsters seem as reliably scary as mommy dearest. Whether shes slumped (and dead) in her rocking chair, as in Psycho, or pulling a knife on her daughter, as in Carrie, theres just something about mothers that brings out the worst and sometimes the best shivers. For Freud, Medusas head, with its writhing snakes, represents the mothers genitals. The terror of Medusa is the terror of castration, which occurs when a boy sees that his mother doesnt have a penis  voil, anxiety!

title: A Vehicles Sound System Can Be a Matter of Life and Death
description: Adjusting the acoustics of modern automobiles is not only about comfort or pizazz. There are safety considerations, too.

title: Review: A Lost Folk Musicians Haunted Dreamland in A Star Has Burnt My Eye
description: Popular music is rife with one-album wonders and oddball trajectories, but Elizabeth Eaton Converse, known as Connie, is a textbook cult artist. When her lone record, How Sad, How Lovely, came out in 2009, she had been gone for 35 years. One day in 1974, she got into her VW Beetle and left her Ann Arbor, Mich., home. She had recently turned 50, and was never heard from again.

title: A Nasty Woman of Contemporary Art Fearlessly Renders the Body
description: After a presidential campaign that underscored various womens rights issues, what better art exhibition to review than one devoted to provocative images of female independence at its most intimate, centering explicitly on the body.

title: A Lesson for India in a Fog So Thick It Could Kill a Cow
description: In December 1873, London was blanketed for a week in a yellow fog so thick that people could not see their feet. Ladies & gentlemen, Mark Twain said in a public lecture at the time, I hear you, & so know that you are here  & I am here, too, notwithstanding I am not visible.

title: Review: In Elle, Isabelle Huppert Subverts the Role of Rape Victim
description: The opening scene of Elle is a shocker: a brutal sexual assault witnessed by a house cat and filmed with pitiless detachment. The opposite of a trigger warning, as a friend of mine said. Everything that follows is, in some ways, even more shocking, as the movie  a masterpiece of suave perversity, directed by Paul Verhoeven  leads its audience through a meticulously constructed maze of ambiguity, scrambling our assumptions and expectations at every turn, dispensing discomfort and delight and daring us to distinguish one from the other.

title: Review: Aliens Drop Anchor in Arrival, but What Are Their Intentions?
description: In whats perhaps the first science-fiction film  Georges Mliss 1902 marvel A Trip to the Moon  a group of astronomers lands in the Man in the Moons eye. Theyre soon taken prisoner by moon men, but a quick-witted astronomer clobbers the king and they escape, with one earthling vanquishing moon men with an umbrella. Humans have been zapping extraterrestrials ever since. Its so easy to fight the unknown, at least in movies.

title: This Weeks Movies: Nov. 11, 2016
description: The New York Times film critics review Arrival, Elle and Billy Lynn's Long Halftime Walk.

title: Theater Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A critical guide to productions in New York City, including shows in previews.

title: Spinning Goes to the Movies at ImaxShift
description: Jaclyn Cohen, a sales director for a wedding dress and footwear designer, had no desire to join her peers in the spinning fad.

title: Charles Wolf Jr., Who Clashed With Pentagon Papers Leaker, Dies at 92
description: Charles Wolf Jr., an economist, a founding dean of the RAND Corporations graduate school and the supervisor who tried to oust Daniel Ellsberg in 1969 before he leaked the secret Pentagon Papers, died on Oct. 24 in Los Angeles. He was 92.

title: High Class Geometry
description: The elegant furniture of the French designer Herv Van der Straeten.

title: One Designers Unexpected, Powerfully Lyrical Furniture
description: Herv Van der Straeten transforms heavy metals into works of surprising delicacy.

title: Donald Trump, Marijuana, Rolling Stones: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Boerum Hill Bar Where the Old Days Live On
description: Everybody at Hanks Saloon in Brooklyn may not know your name, but Jeannie probably does.

title: Honky-Tonk Brunch Spot for Brooklyns Hellbound
description: On a recent Sunday afternoon, holiday lights strung from the tin ceiling of Hanks Saloon  shone on Jeannie Talierco as she grabbed a cigarette and hustled toward an open door. She planted one foot indoors and one on the sidewalk, keeping an eye on the bar while taking a break.

title: J.K. Rowling Says Fantastic Beasts Grew Out of World Events
description: Hours before the premiere of Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them, the author J. K. Rowling, acknowledged that she ground through several revisions of the screenplay, her first, and said the rise of populism around the world in recent years had influenced the storys direction.

title: RZA Accompanies The 36th Chamber of Shaolin
description: RZA watched the Shaw Brothers martial arts classic The 36th Chamber of Shaolin for the first time on television when he was 12 years old. Two years later, he saw the 1978 movie on the big screen in a seedy Times Square theater on 42nd Street, he recalled. He went with his cousin Russell Tyrone Jones, who would grow up to become the rapper Ol Dirty Bastard.

title: Comedy Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A selected guide to stand-up, improv and comedy shows in New York City.

title: Glamorous Vintage Photos of Leonardo DiCaprio, Audrey Hepburn, Warhol and More
description: A new documentary celebrates the career of the legendary paparazzo Rose Hartman. Here are a few of her most indelible images.

title: Movie Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: Read reviews of new releases and search our full database of thousands of films at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

title: Reading, Writing, Drawing: The Brooklyn Childrens Book Fair
description: In recent years, Brooklyn has become famous for trailblazers: inventive artists, artisanal food and beer makers and, of course, New Yorks original hipsters. But this weekend the Brooklyn Museum will celebrate a pioneering but probably lesser-known borough species: childrens book creators.

title: At Home and in the Kitchen With Jori Jayne Emde
description: Making kimchi, fermented chilies, salted chilies, completed vinegars, syrups and cordials.

title: Fermentation, a Love Story
description: There are invisible forces at work in Jori Jayne Emdes farmhouse.

title: Classical Music Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A critical guide to performances of classical music in the New York City area.

title: Pop & Rock Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A selected guide to concerts in the New York City area.

title: Jazz Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A selected guide to jazz performances in New York City.

title: Girls Can Be Anything, Just Not President
description: Shes a good girl, Betsy Ebeling, Hillary Clintons best friend since childhood, recently told me of Mrs. Clinton, whom she met in the sixth grade. She works hard, she is loyal, she listens.

title: Fraud Charges for Flophouse Operators
description: The New York State attorney general filed Medicaid fraud and money laundering charges on Thursday against a lawyer who runs two outpatient substance-abuse programs in New York City and a couple who ran flophouses that forced residents to seek help from those programs.

title: Dance Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A selected guide to dance performances in New York City.

title: Museum & Gallery Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A critical guide to exhibitions and installations in the New York area.

title: Around Town for Nov. 11-17
description: A listing of discussions, film screenings, cultural activities and walking tours in New York City.

title: Spare Times for Children Listings for Nov. 11-17
description: A select guide to cultural events for children, teenagers and families.

title: Cuomo Strikes Deal to Revive Affordable Housing Program
description: For the second time in three months, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has forged a deal with developers and union construction officials to revive a program designed to create apartments for poor and working-class New Yorkers.

title: Review: Megyn Kelly Tells Tales Out of Fox News in Her Memoir, Settle for More
description: Even had there been no news in Megyn Kellys new memoir, Settle for More, the book would have drawn a considerable audience. Ms. Kelly, the 45-year-old anchor on Fox News, has emerged as this presidential elections unlikely feminist heroine and Hildy Johnson, the intrepid gal reporter who made herself indispensable to the brass and resisted the herd mentality of the men around her. She was the hen in the Fox house, taking it upon herself to ask at nearly every turn: Shouldnt we be concerned that the Republican nominee for president is profoundly disrespectful of women in his public discourse? And accused of being a sexual predator at that?

title: Subway Sticky Notes Offer Post-Election Therapy
description: New Yorkers are finding catharsis for their post-election emotions in an unexpected place: a subway station. The street artist Matthew Chavez took sticky notes and a pen into the Sixth Avenue station at 14th Street and told passers-by to write messages to stick on the wall.

title: U.N. Warns of Starvation Peril in Rebel Side of Aleppo
description: The United Nations implored all sides in the Syria conflict on Thursday to allow food deliveries to rebel-held eastern Aleppo, where roughly 250,000 residents, under siege for months, just received their last rations.

title: White Women Voted Trump. Now What?
description: Around the country women weep, wondering how the glass ceiling still stands. But now is not the time to bury our faces in our hands. For white women in particular, now is the time to look in the mirror.

title: Tajik Police Commander, Trained in U.S., Appears to Rise in Islamic State Ranks
description: MOSCOW  In a propaganda video released last year, an Islamic State militant wearing a black bandanna and cradling a sniper rifle made the usual grim threats against the United States. Now, there may be a new twist to his warnings.

title: David Bowies Seal of Approval Bolsters Art at Auction
description: LONDON  One of the most influential musicians and style icons of his generation, David Bowie, who died in January, was less well known as an art collector. But as he told Michael Kimmelman, The New York Times critic, in 1998, Art was, seriously, the only thing Id ever wanted to own.

title: As Ratings Plummet, N.F.L. Considers Reducing Ads and Length of Games
description: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said on Thursday that the league was looking at a variety of ways to shorten game broadcasts, including trimming some advertising, to keep the action moving.

title: Online, Everything Is Alternative Media
description: Breitbart, the website at the center of the self-described alternative online media, is planning to expand in the United States and abroad. The site, whose former chairman became the chief executive of Donald J. Trumps campaign in August, has been emboldened by the victory of its candidate.

title: Trump Wants to Drain the Swamp, but Change Will Be Complex and Costly
description: WASHINGTON  After President-elect Donald J. Trump promised to drain the swamp that he sees in the nations capital, his millions of supporters are expecting vast changes in the sprawling federal bureaucracy, and conservative activists are drooling at the chance to remake, resize or reduce the reach of government.

title: Manhattan Subway Passage Becomes Emotional Outlet After Election
description: To learn how New Yorkers feel in the wake of the presidential election, you may want to visit a certain tunnel between two Manhattan subway stations.

title: A Silent Agreement on York Avenue
description: Dear Diary:

title: Mets Jeurys Familia Pleads Not Guilty in Domestic Violence Case
description: Dressed in a light blue suit and occasionally speaking through an interpreter, Jeurys Familia, the Mets top relief pitcher, made his first court appearance Thursday in connection with a domestic violence incident last month in which he was charged with scratching the chest and bruising the right cheek of his wife.

title: Roy Cooper Holds Thin Lead Over Gov. Pat McCrory in North Carolina
description: RALEIGH, N.C.  Roy Cooper, a Democrat, held a razor-thin lead on Thursday in North Carolinas bitterly contested race for governor. If it holds, it would be a rare bright spot for his party this week, one that has much to do with Mr. Coopers call for repealing a state law limiting transgender bathroom access that has subjected North Carolina to a gale of international criticism, boycotts and cancellations.

title: Andy Murray and Novak Djokovic: Old Friends in a Role Reversal
description: Andy Murray and Novak Djokovic played their first matches against each other on indoor courts in early 2001, when they faced off in two European junior events that Murray, in a poor bit of foreshadowing, won in a hurry.

title: Denounce the Hate, Mr. Trump
description: In his victory speech early Wednesday morning, Donald Trump pledged that he will be president for all Americans, and he asked those who did not support him for your guidance and your help so that we can work together and unify our great country.

title: Janet Reno Was Unafraid of Science That Could Exonerate the Innocent
description: A phone call to the office of Jeremy Travis, new in Washington: The attorney general wants to talk with you.

title: Female Clinton Supporters Are Left Feeling Gutted
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  It was visceral. Women felt gutted, shocked, appalled, afraid. The prospect of celebrating the election of the nations first female president had been crushed by a man whom many women viewed as sexist.

title: Leonard Cohen, Epic and Enigmatic Songwriter, Is Dead at 82
description: Leonard Cohen, the Canadian poet and novelist who abandoned a promising literary career to become one of the foremost songwriters of the contemporary era, died on Monday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 82.

title: Never Trump Becomes Maybe Trump in Foreign Policy Sphere
description: WASHINGTON  Like no other part of the Republican establishment, the partys foreign policy luminaries joined in opposition to the idea of a Donald J. Trump presidency.

title: The Women Who Helped Donald Trump to Victory
description: NAZARETH, Pa.  Debbie Biro became a Republican to vote for Donald J. Trump.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Yeah, there will be some disruption, but look at the bright side: the holidays are coming anyway, Midtown is going to be all messed up anyway.

title: In Democratic Stronghold of New York City, Trump Finds Support Among Orthodox Jews
description: In the blue sea of New York City, where Hillary Clinton crushed Donald J. Trump in the election on Tuesday, there were still some districts  working-class areas in the southeast Bronx, Mr. Trumps childhood neighborhood in Jamaica Estates, Queens, and most of Staten Island  that did not go Mrs. Clintons way.

title: Judge Orders That Bottled Water Be Delivered to Residents of Flint, Mich.
description: A federal judge in Michigan on Thursday ordered that bottled water be delivered to residents of Flint, Mich., more than two years after the citys switch to an untreated source resulted in contaminated and undrinkable water.

title: Once Associated With Bad Spirits
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  So its Friday and were all exhausted, so the last thing you want is a crossword that is too hard to solve and doesnt have anything interesting in it.

title: Dylans 1966 Tapes Find a Direction Home
description: THATS it  that sounds like the original, Richard Alderson said, with a knowing nod.

title: Trump Tower, a Site That Drew Tourists, Now Draws Heavy Security
description: New York City has gained a native son in the presidency and lost one of its busiest crossroads in the bargain.

title: New Charges for 2 Flophouse Operators Accused in Medicaid Fraud Scheme
description: The New York State attorney general filed Medicaid fraud and money laundering charges on Thursday against a lawyer who runs two outpatient substance-abuse programs in New York City and a couple who ran flophouses that forced residents to seek help from those programs. Their arrangement was detailed in an investigation by The New York Times last year.

title: Man Pleads Guilty to Using Bribes to Obtain Handgun Licenses
description: A member of a volunteer security force in Brooklyn pleaded guilty on Thursday to charges that he paid Police Department officials thousands of dollars in bribes to obtain expedited handgun licenses for clients.

title: Donald Trump, Leonard Cohen, Afghanistan: Your Friday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Corrections: November 11, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: 2nd Night of Trump Protests Brings 29 Arrests in Oregon
description: Thousands of demonstrators filled the streets in several cities across the country for a second night on Thursday in protests against the election of Donald J. Trump as president.

title: Whats on TV Friday: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie and Imelda Staunton in Gypsy
description: Pop the cork on the Bolly already! Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie is the perfect post-election mood lifter for those who need one. Red Oaks returns for more mid-1980s shenanigans at a New Jersey country club. And Imelda Staunton makes Momma Rose her own in the West End revival of Gypsy.

title: For Chinese Women, a Surname Is Her Name
description: BEIJING  Well, of course I kept my name when I married, said Yang Huiping, mystified at being asked about it as she polished the glass doors of an apartment block in Beijing.

title: Trump Campaigned Against Lobbyists, but Now Theyre on His Transition Team
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump, who campaigned against the corrupt power of special interests, is filling his transition team with some of the very sort of people who he has complained have too much clout in Washington: corporate consultants and lobbyists.

title: Word + Quiz: anneal
The Week in Pictures: Nov. 11, 2016
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

title: After the Election
description: Scenes from around the United States on Thursday.

title: The Week in Pictures: Nov. 11, 2016
description: Photos from The New York Times and photographers from around the world.

title: After Leonard Cohens Death, Hallelujah Lives On
description: Leonard Cohens most well-known song has found new life through film, television and other musicians.

title: Trumps Economic Prescription. First: Do Harm.
description: Donald J. Trump is positioned to achieve the most radical reshaping of economic policy since Ronald Reagan. Even under Reagan, Republicans never controlled both houses of Congress.

title: Voters Drive Sheriff Arpaio Out of Town
description: Some good news from Tuesday, a point of sanity on a day when the nations electoral judgment went catastrophically astray: Voters in Maricopa County, Ariz., sent Sheriff Joe Arpaio packing. He lost his bid for a seventh term. After 24 years, Americas Toughest Sheriff is done.

title: Resist Much
description: This is a very dangerous man, our next president. Dangerous in his certitude about what he doesnt know. Dangerous in his ignorance of history, his antipathy toward reading, his inability to sort fact from fiction. The last man to play things by the gut while in control of the worlds most powerful military left a mortal mess.

title: America Needs a War on Terror Veterans Memorial
description: WASHINGTON  Fifteen years ago, I heard the explosion and saw smoke billowing from the Pentagon. This was the beginning of a war, I thought. Maybe most of us did. It was, and after all this time, after thousands of service members have been killed and tens of thousands wounded, there is still no end in sight.

title: The View From Trump Tower
description: If your social circles are like mine, you spent Tuesday night swapping miserable texts. Not all, but many of my friends and family members were outraged, stunned, disgusted and devastated. This is victory for white supremacy, people wrote, for misogyny, nativism and authoritarianism. Fascism is descending.

title: The Wrong People to Drain the Swamp
description: Donald Trumps ethics proposals didnt get much notice when he unveiled them late in the campaign. (At the time, his claims that the election was rigged were dominating the news.) Now that President-elect Trump is assembling an administration, his plan deserves attention. It goes well beyond existing restrictions to slow the revolving door to riches for government insiders.

title: Thoughts for the Horrified
description: So what do we do now? By we I mean all those left, center and even right who saw Donald Trump as the worst man ever to run for president and assumed that a strong majority of our fellow citizens would agree.

title: Trying Out a Forgotten (and Free) Service: Personal Shoppers
description: Would you change the oil in your car or assemble an Ikea kitchen yourself if you didnt have to? Neither would I.

title: Have Some Art With Your Handbag
description: When Louis Vuitton opens its revamped store in SoHo in December, one notable part of the design will be the floor-to-ceiling installation by the Japanese artist Shuji Mukai.

title: A Narwhals Life
description: The narwhal is not an aquatic unicorn. Its not magical or mythical. Its just a whale with two teeth, one of which happens to be really long on males.

title: Questions for: New Item on the College Admission Checklist: LinkedIn Profile
description: Article: Questions for: "New Item on the College Admission Checklist: LinkedIn Profile."

title: On Staten Island, Pantsuit Nation Met Its Match
description: For a certain kind of woman in Manhattan or Brooklyn, or Santa Monica or Minneapolis, for that matter, Tuesday began with a bright spirit, a pantsuit  a popular show of sartorial support for Hillary Clinton  and a promise to children brought into voting booths that the next morning they would wake up in a country that had elected its first female president.

title: Trump Floats an Olive Branch: Might Keep Parts of the Health Law
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump overhauled his transition team from top to bottom on Friday, expanded his outreach to more establishment Republicans, and even offered an olive branch to President Obama  albeit a narrow one.

title: Jerusalems Latest Argument Over History Is About Fried Innards
description: In Jerusalem, where arguments about history are a municipal pastime, a debate has been revived about the origins of a local delicacy.

title: Hard Choice for Mitch McConnell: End the Filibuster or Preserve Tradition
description: WASHINGTON  Before the election, it was clear that Democrats were looking at the very real prospect of scrapping the filibuster to keep Republicans from blocking the Supreme Court nominees of a President Hillary Clinton.

title: The Closet as Workspace, Bedroom or Bar
description: Some New Yorkers have a use-what-you-have mentality that allows them to see an ordinary old coat closet as a gift of more square footage in a city where every inch of interior real estate counts. With a little work and a lot of vision, theyve discovered that the smallest and most unassuming space can become a bedroom, a work space, even a secret cocktail bar.

title: His Job? To Power Up the Grand Canyon
description: GRAND CANYON NATIONAL PARK, Ariz.  He has two offices. One is made of cinder block. The other is made of jagged rocks hundreds of millions of years old.

title: Donald Trump Says He May Keep Parts of Obama Health Care Act
description: Just days after a national campaign in which he vowed repeatedly to repeal President Obamas signature health care law, Donald J. Trump is sending signals that his approach to health care is a work in progress.

title: Powering Up the Grand Canyon
description: Kevin Hartigan, who works for the largest energy utility in Arizona, keeps the lights on at Grand Canyon National Park.

title: Do Your Parents Spy on You?
description: Do your parents keep track of your whereabouts through the location-tracking feature of your phone? Do they look at your social media accounts or read your texts or emails? And if so, do you mind?

title: With a Cuckoos Journey From China, a Mystery Is Solved, and Cheers Go Up
description: BEIJING  When Flappy McFlapperson and Skybomb Bolt sprang into the sky for their annual migration from wetlands near Beijing, nobody was sure where the two cuckoos were going. They and three other cuckoos had been tagged with sensors to follow them from northern China.

title: Teaching With: Kids of New York City
description: What makes a New York City kid?

title: Donald Trump, Leonard Cohen, Arrival: Your Friday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: London Bridges Lighting Up
description: Illuminated River project aims to transform the Thames into a glowing spectacle.

title: Morning Agenda: A Fresh Wave of Deals Ahead
description: The United States president-elect didnt write a book called The Art of the Deal for nothing.

title: In Southern California, Hot Steaks With a Cool Vibe
description: When David LeFevre set out to develop his third restaurant in Manhattan Beach, just south of Los Angeles, he focused on steak. The inspiration is both personal and refreshingly simple. I wanted a great American neighborhood steakhouse, Mr. LeFevre said. Food that is soulful makes me remember growing up in the Midwest. The result is the Arthur J, which opened in June 2015.

title: Family Travel in a Time of Fear
description: My 7-year-old daughter scampered over the cobblestones of a narrow Paris street, proudly holding a bag of fresh cherries. She had asked for them herself: Des cerises, sil vous plat! Meanwhile, a few steps away, my 4-year-old was offering her finest Merci to the carousel attendant collecting tokens for the next ride. She squealed every time she caught sight of the Eiffel Tower in the distance, convinced she had stepped into the pages of a Madeline story. At that moment, my husband and I felt fortunate and happy to be in France as a family, to be able to share with our girls a place that has been formative to us.

title: A Year After Paris Attacks, Challenges for Hotels and Restaurants
description: Nov. 13 marks one year since the terrorist attacks in Paris, which left 130 people dead.

title: An American Rain Forest and Its Charming Neighbor
description: I was motoring along Route 101 in northwest Washington State in my little rental car, getting a kick out of the fact that I frequently drive the same highway in Southern California, where I live. There were few other similarities, though: The air in Washington had a refreshing bite to it, cold and clean. The sweet smell of wet earth seemed to follow me wherever I went, indoors or out. And soon after I left Port Angeles  a small town on the 101 thats a quick 90-minute ferry ride to Victoria, British Columbia, across the Strait of Juan de Fuca  and entered Olympic National Park, it began to rain and didnt stop until I left the park seven hours later.

title: New York Today: A Championship of Chess Prodigies
description: Updated, 10:05 a.m.

title: Advocates for New Yorks Working Poor Push for Discounted Transit Fares
description: At a time when New York City can seem unbearably expensive, advocates for the poor are targeting a rising cost that many people struggle to afford: a MetroCard.

title: London Bridges Are Lighting Up
description: LONDON  Londons bridges will slowly fill with light as the tide rises. Luminous colors will wash across their surfaces. Beams will shoot out from each bridge, pierce the sky and then drop, connecting with a beam on a neighboring bridge to trace the path of the Thames. The bridgess underbellies will glow gently; the banks will offer floating stages for performances; waterfalls will create a screen for projections; a weave of projected light planes will hover over the surface of the Thames, creating a ghostly river of light.

title: Which Milk Is Most Nutritious: Soy, Cashew, Almond or Coconut?
description: Question:

title: The Risks of Frances Big New Database
description: The government of President Franois Hollande has moved to combine existing information on at least 60 million French citizens into a single sprawling  database. The government says the goal of merging data from French passports and national identity cards is to prevent identity fraud. But the measure risks opening the door to mass government surveillance of the entire country and increases the danger that private information about citizens could be hacked.

title: In the Shadow of Art Basel and Frieze
description: TURIN, Italy  Art and truffles.

title: Blake Irving of GoDaddy: At the Top, You Get to Set the Tone
description: This interview with Blake Irving, C.E.O. of GoDaddy, a domain name and web hosting company, was conducted and condensed by Adam Bryant.

title: World (or at Least Brooklyn) Stops for Lost Dog
description: Bailey, a 2-year-old goldendoodle, lived a placid, largely uneventful life on a block of handsome brownstones in Carroll Gardens, Brooklyn, until 7:15 on the morning of Oct. 24.

title: After Trump, Fear and Gloating in Pakistan
description: KARACHI, Pakistan  There is dread, and fear and loathing. But mostly there is gloating. Those who are gloating here in Pakistan have a convincing enough narrative: Everything we already knew about ugly America just got a chest-thumping confirmation from Americans themselves.

title: Can You Legally Tell an Employee to Stop Giving Customers an Earful?
description: Send your workplace conundrums to workologist@nytimes.com, including your name and contact information (even if you want it withheld for publication). The Workologist is a guy with well-intentioned opinions, not a professional career adviser. Letters may be edited.

title: Donald Trump Gets to Work
description: A wall of a thousand miles begins with one brick.

title: Stella McCartney Presents Her Mens Wear Line
description: LONDON  Stella McCartney has long been defined by fashion, music and her family name. So it was fitting that for the introduction of her first mens wear collection last week, the 45-year-old British designer chose Abbey Road Studios, made legendary as the recording venue of choice for her father, Paul McCartney, and the rest of the Beatles during the 1960s.

title: The Glass Ceiling Holds
description: It took Hillary Clinton a while to talk about the first-woman-president idea. She didnt stress it early in her 2008 campaign. But people kept coming up to her with pictures of their grandmothers who got to vote for the first time in 1920. Others begged her to get the job done so they could see a woman in the White House before they died.

title: When Melania Trump Met Michelle Obama, Their Clothes Did Some of the Talking
description: So the reconciliation continues. Kind of.

description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Zadie Smith on Dance: It Brings Such Intense Joy
description: Among the weighty subjects pondered by literary intellectuals, dance seldom rates very high. The dance critic Arlene Croce once started an essay with the quip, Worlds thinnest book: English and American Literary Men Speak About the Dance. So it might come as a surprise that dance is at the heart of Swing Time, the fifth novel by one of todays most prominent literary figures, the British writer Zadie Smith.

title: Going Down the Pinterest Rabbit Hole
description: It started with three little words: Bold. Front. Door. I typed them into Pinterest and the colors rolled in  turquoise, magenta, chartreuse  with captions shouting Purple is the new red, You had me at the door, and Dont be afraid to make a statement with color.

title: What Is Lost by Burying the Trans-Pacific Partnership?
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional leaders confirmed this week what seemed inevitable with the triumph of Donald J. Trump: The far-reaching trade agreement with 11 other Pacific Rim nations that President Obama hoped to leave as a major legacy, but which Mr. Trump called a terrible deal, is dead.

title: Japans Nuclear Industry Finds a Lifeline in India After Foundering Elsewhere
description: TOKYO  Despite objections from antinuclear campaigners, Japans government cleared the way on Friday for companies that build nuclear power plants to sell their technology to India  one of the few nations planning big expansions in atomic energy  by signing a cooperation agreement with the South Asian country.

description: BEIJING  At the gallery opening of Chinas hottest-selling artist, Zeng Fanzhi, in Manhattan a year ago, Chinese billionaires mingled with the upper crust of New Yorks art world. Mr. Zeng had flown in with his well-to-do pals, and after dinner at a clubby Chelsea restaurant, the Chinese crew retired to the Park Hyatt for late-night drinks in the lobby bar.

title: Chatting With Bowie
description: In 2013, David Bowie published a widely circulated list of his 100 favorite books. William Burroughs was not among them, but the Beat writer did make an impression on the rock star. In 1974, Rolling Stone published a talk between the two at Bowies home in London. Its one of several interviews collected in the recently published David Bowie: The Last Interview and Other Conversations. Bowie told Burroughs that his novel Nova Express blew my head off, noting similarities between it and his own futuristic creation, the concept-album character Ziggy Stardust: Maybe we are the Rodgers and Hammerstein of the 70s, Bill!
