title: Some Review! Adam Gopnik on an E.B. White Biography for Kids
description: An illustrated book for children about a writer who wrote childrens books with illustrations seems an oddly special and self-enclosed genre, but Some Writer!, Melissa Sweets book about the life and work of E.B. White, is still a pretty good one. Despite a title that feels a bit too coyly obvious  mirroring, as it does, the most famous line in Whites book Charlottes Web, where Charlotte the spider writes Some Pig! in her web to promote the doomed Wilbur  Some Writer! certainly will fulfill kids natural curiosity about the author of a classic that, unusual thing, still really works for them.

title: Handouts With a Twist: Rebuilding Americas Infrastructure
description: Describing the relentless pace at which machines were replacing horses a century ago, the economic historian Gregory Clark noted that if horses could have been hired at a certain price, they would have remained competitive. Unfortunately, he said, that price had dropped so low that it did not pay for their feed.

title: Lush Morsels From an Artists Erotic Imagination
description: If I paint a glass of water, people think its erotic, the artist Marilyn Minter said during a recent visit to her studio in New Yorks Garment District. She laughed ruefully, but theyd have reason. Outrageously beautiful and irresistibly disturbing, Ms. Minters increasingly monumental paintings invoke a spectrum of human desires: for sex, food, affection and, hardly least, for being seen.

title: Vice President-Elect Pence to Take Over Trump Transition Effort
description: WASHINGTON  Vice President-elect Mike Pence will take over as the leader of Donald J. Trumps transition effort, pushing aside Chris Christie, the governor of New Jersey, as Mr. Trump moves quickly to assemble a government after his stunning upset victory, the transition team said on Friday.

title: Bingo? Pass. Bring on Senior Speed-Dating and Wine-Tasting.
description: NOTHING about Mathers-More Than a Cafe looks as if its aimed at people over 50. But the Chicago cafe, which could easily be mistaken for a large Starbucks, is much more than that, serving as a community hub, mostly for older people, with dozens of classes on topics like flower arranging, Egyptian history and digital safety.

title: 1964 | Rightists Buoyed by the Election
description: Times Insider shares historical insights from The New York Times.

title: Building a Cross Platform 360-degree Video Experience at The New York Times
description: Over the past few months, 360-degree videos have gained a lot of traction on the modern web as a new immersive storytelling medium. The New York Times has continuously aimed to bring readers as close to stories as possible. Last year we released the NYT VR app with premium content on iOS and Android. We believe VR storytelling allows for a deeper understanding of a place, a person, or an event.

title: David Plouffe: What I Got Wrong About the Election
description: Like many people around the world, I expected a comfortable Hillary Clinton victory on Tuesday. But Im not a random pundit when it comes to understanding presidential races and the electorate  I managed one Obama presidential campaign and oversaw another from the White House. So of all the forecasts that got it wrong, my prediction that Mrs. Clinton was a 100 percent favorite was a glaring miss.

title: The Election Highlighted a Growing Rural-Urban Split
description: Donald J. Trump fared very poorly in American cities in Tuesdays election. Hillary Clinton did just as badly among rural voters. The political divide between the two groups has been growing more stark in America for years, and 2016 showed an even sharper split than 2012.

title: The Long Haul
description: As I said in todays column, nobody who thought Trump would be a disaster should change his or her mind because he won the election. He will, in fact, be a disaster on every front. And I think he will eventually drag the Republican Party into the abyss along with his own reputation; the question is whether he drags the rest of the country, and the world, down with him.

title: Michelle Dockery Used to Be a Lady, Now Shes a Con Artist
description: For every Downton Abbey fan who longed for Lady Mary to let her bodice rip once and for all, Michelle Dockery has a series for you.

title: Grappling With the Language of Love
description: We often hear about how hard it is to be articulate in a foreign language, but when I began to study Arabic, what took me a long time to learn was not how to speak but how to listen.

title: A Chirp From Under the Logs: The Fall Field Cricket
description: As common as they are, field crickets often defy identification. Even experts resort to the plebeian measures any hiker might employ to recognize one; the plain fact is, crickets are often easier to identify with your ears than your eyes. So listening to a merry band of chirpsters singing from under a log in an empty field is often a simpler way to determine whos calling than catching one, killing it and tacking it to a board for examination.

title: My 10 Favorite Books: Trevor Noah
description: For his bookshop and website One Grand Books, the editor Aaron Hicklin asked people to name the 10 books theyd take with them if they were marooned on a desert island. The next in the series is The Daily Show host Trevor Noah, whose new book, Born a Crime: Stories from a South African Childhood is out next week. He shares his list exclusively with T.

title: Bookshelf: Oh, Baby!
description: New picture books include Old Dog Baby Baby and Hand in Hand.

title: ISIS Is Massacring Mosul Civilians as Troops Advance, U.N. Says
description: GENEVA  Islamic State militants have summarily killed scores of civilians in the Iraqi city of Mosul in recent days, sometimes using children as executioners, and have used chemical agents against Iraqi and Kurdish troops, United Nations officials said on Friday.

title: A Time for Refusal
description: It is a Sunday afternoon in a provincial town in France. Two men meet at a cafe. One of them, Berenger, is half-drunk. He is being berated by his companion, Jean. All of the sudden, they hear a great noise. When they and other townspeople crane their necks to figure out whats going on, they see a large animal thundering down one of the streets, stamping and snorting all the way. A rhinoceros! Not long after, theres another. They are startled. Its outrageous. Something must be done. What they begin to do is argue heatedly about whether the second rhino was the first one going past a second time or a different one, and then about whether the rhinos are African or Asiatic.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Cautious in Love, but Not in Life
description: When Lauren Sloss spied Alex Kleeman at a Bay Area bar she never guessed that she would be sailing the world with him.

title: A Solo Dream of Sailing Leads to a Dual Adventure
description: To fall in love with a sailor is to court a broken heart. But in 2009, when Lauren Sloss spied Alex Kleeman in a Bay Area bar, she never guessed he harbored a dream to sail the world.

description: New picture books include Owl Sees Owl and Faraway Fox.

description: DALLAS  Our country is in trouble  we all feel it. The pendulum of division and hate is swinging faster. I think, in many ways unfortunately and regretfully, I am uniquely qualified to provide this message of warning and hope.

title: The Story Behind This Weeks Best Sellers
description: The Crime Beat: With his Harry Bosch detective novels, Michael Connelly has always harked consciously back to the glory days of Los Angeles crime writing. Once, he even rented the apartment where Raymond Chandlers hero Marlowe lived in the 1973 film version of The Long Goodbye. So if you hear an echo of that title in the latest Bosch book, The Wrong Side of Goodbye (new at No.2 in hardcover fiction), youre not mistaken. I really wanted to go back to my elders with this book  the private eye novels and writers that inspired me, Connelly said via email. The title, the opening in Pasadena, the missing-heir case, much of the book is a tip of the hat to writers like Chandler and Ross Macdonald.

title: Bartolo Colon Leaves Mets; Agrees to a Deal With the Braves
description: Late in January 2006, Bartolo Colon received the plaque for the American League Cy Young Award. At the time, the Dominican-born Colon was 32 and playing for the Los Angeles Angels, and the man who presented the award to him was Juan Marichal, the first Dominican player to be selected to baseballs Hall of Fame.

title: Trump and the Presidential Look
description: The president-elect walked onto the stage before a crowd of euphoric supporters. It was his first public sighting since the networks called the election for him. Gone were his hoarse pleadings for support. His face bore a heaviness I had not seen from him before. Now he had won, and this was a different face.

title: The Problem With Coal
description: To the Editor:

title: Stream the Debut Film From the Director of Moonlight on Netflix
description: Moonlight has been rapturously received by audiences. The Miami-based drama about Chiron, a young, gay African-American boy, and his maturity into manhood has earned high marks from several critics, including The New York Timess A. O. Scott, who called it about as beautiful a movie as you are ever likely to see. Only the second feature film from the director Barry Jenkins, the movie is filled with vibrant color, gorgeous uses of light and deep wells of emotion  fear, love and betrayal.

title: Excerpt From Homecoming
description: An excerpt from Homecoming, which is billed as a psychological thriller.

title: Trumps Climate Contrarian: Myron Ebell Takes On the E.P.A.
description: The mug-shot posters, pasted on walls and lampposts around Paris by an activist group during the United Nations climate talks last year, were hardly flattering. They depicted Myron Ebell, a climate contrarian, as one of seven climate criminals wanted for destroying our future.

title: Before U.S. and Mexico Play, Fans Push for Respect in a Charged Atmosphere
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  On Friday night, just before the kickoff of a World Cup qualifying match against Mexico, the most ardent fans of the United States mens national soccer team unveiled a giant graphical display, known as a tifo, at one end of Mapfre Stadium to show their support for the Americans.

title: The Story So Far: Fiction Podcasts Take Their Next Steps
description: On one long August day, Eli Horowitz camped out in a cramped studio in Gowanus, Brooklyn, with Oscar Isaac, Catherine Keener, a microphone and a solitary Betta fish named Young Hollywood swimming laps around its little bowl. Mr. Horowitz was there to direct Ms. Keener and Mr. Isaac as they acted out the story of a strange and intimate relationship between a therapist and an army veteran who come together as part of a secretive  maybe even sinister  government program. Mr. Isaac played the vet, Ms. Keener the therapist. Young Hollywood served as scenery.

title: The Democrats Screwed Up
Teenager Seeks to Honor Veterans of War by Preserving Their Stories
description: As nations honored their war veterans on Friday  Armistice Day and Veterans Day a 19-year-old in California is trying to preserve as many voices of World War II veterans in the United States as he can.

title: The Playlist: The xx Return in a Brighter Mood
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter (coming soon!) here.

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: No matter how much free time you have this weekend, we have TV recommendations for you. Come back every Friday for new suggestions from our TV critic on what to watch.

title: Friday Mailbag: Politics, Politics, Politics
description: In this new weekly feature, we will surface some of the more thoughtful and provocative concerns that come into our office. The public editors column can only address so much and, though well reply to many of your comments, we unfortunately arent unable to reply personally to everything that lands in our inbox. By giving a weekly glimpse into our mailbag, we hope to give exposure to the fluctuating concerns of The Timess audience  and in doing so, help facilitate a better conversation between the Gray Lady and her readers.

title: Nasty Gals Path to Bankruptcy
description: With the rise of the nasty woman meme comes a decline in the fortunes of the Nasty Gal brand.

title: Painful Steps Help Egypt Secure $12 Billion I.M.F. Loan
description: CAIRO  The International Monetary Fund approved a $12 billion loan for Egypt on Friday, in a move intended to stave off economic collapse in the Arab worlds most populous nation as it grapples with a plunging currency, soaring inflation and shortages of staple foods.

title: Canada, Here I Come? First, Heres Some Advice
description: To the Editor:

title: What Is Donald Trumps Foreign Policy?
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump will enter the White House having promised to radically alter United States foreign policy, with ramifications for Americans and the world.

title: How Tiffany Warren, an Executive at Omnicom Group, Spends Her Sundays
description: As senior vice president and chief diversity officer of Omnicom Group, one of the biggest marketing, communications and advertising companies in the world, Tiffany R. Warren is the head of a team focused on advancing the careers of women, minorities and L.G.B.T. employees. And as founder and president of ADCOLOR, a nonprofit she started in 2005 to promote diversity in creative fields, she leads a community of professionals dedicated to helping one another and mentoring others. She is also a board member of GLAAD, the American Advertising Federation and the Ghetto Film School. On Sundays, Ms. Warren, 42, says, she is all about self-care. She lives in a five-bedroom house in the Claremont section of the Bronx.

title: Two Would-Be Yankees Reacquaint Themselves With Baseball
description: PEORIA, Ariz.  When Greg Bird gathered his equipment, getting a grip on his batting helmet, bat, batting gloves and a baseball proved a bit elusive. When he dropped a glove, he bent over to pick it up. As he did, he dropped a ball.

title: Robert Vaughn, Who Starred as Napoleon Solo in Man From U.N.C.L.E., Dies at 83
description: Robert Vaughn, the cleft-chinned actor who reached the peak of his fame in the 1960s playing Napoleon Solo, the debonair international agent tasked with saving the world each week on the hit television series The Man From U.N.C.L.E., died on Friday in Danbury, Conn. He was 83.

title: The Fix | Small Spaces
description: How some have made the most of their tiny apartments.

title: Getting Organized in a Tiny Apartment
description: As anyone who lives in a big city knows, space is a valuable commodity. Whether youre in a minuscule studio or a Classic 6 with too few closets, there is rarely enough of it. Most of us try to make the best of what weve got, embracing our tiny kitchens and eking out storage where we can. But what do designers who specialize in small spaces  and those who have made an art form of living in them  know that the rest of us dont? Below, some tips and tricks.

title: Donald Trump Could Move From Deal Maker to Deal Slayer
description: Donald J. Trumps election as the next president risks turning an era of mega-mergers into one of deal breakups by command.

title: Owner Was Target, but Restaurant Workers Are Swept Up in Immigration Raids
description: BUFFALO  Immigration enforcement agents were supposed to be targeting the restaurant owner. But Antonio Ramos Salazar, a cook, was the one with guns pointed at his head.

title: Home Sweet Warehouse
description: New Yorkers who run home businesses seldom have the luxury of a spare room, let alone a garage, but all Vinicius Vieira de Vieira has is a 225-square-foot bedroom.

title: Review: In Liz Gerrings Latest, Words Dance, Too
description: Liz Gerrings (T)here to (T)here begins with what seems at first to be an eye exam for the audience. We enter the Jerome Robbins Theater at the Baryshnikov Arts Center to find the letters DVSBLT projected on the back wall. As two dancers arrive leaping, more letters fade in, spelling DIVISIBILITI.

title: Rodrigo Duterte Takes Karaoke Diplomacy to Malaysia
description: President Rodrigo Duterte of the Philippines has a reputation for salty language. But at a state dinner in Malaysia on Friday, the leader  who once called President Obama a son of a whore  displayed a penchant for sappy melodies and dulcet tones.

title: Parents Navigate Tears and Cheers as Kids React to Election
description: In the Roethle household in Leawood, Kan., the children woke up on Wednesday to a family celebration. Donald J. Trump was the new president. But the excitement came with an admonition to be a good winner and not to gloat about his win at school.

title: 11 Fiction Podcasts Worth a Listen
description: The fiction podcast is having a moment. But modern audio dramatists have been turning out intriguing scripted podcasts for several years, and theyre showing no signs of slowing down. Take a guided tour through the past, present and future of audio drama with these fictional standouts.

title: Bidding to Own a Piece of David Bowie
description: LONDON  Waiters held trays of Champagne-filled glasses on the landing. Enormous photographs of David Bowie stared or smiled out from the walls. The soundtrack from Ziggy Stardust: The Motion Picture played, and a dim blue light filled Sothebys auction rooms in London as guests strolled in on Thursday night for the first of three eagerly anticipated sales of some 350 works from Bowies art collection on behalf of his estate. (The auction, called Bowie/Collector, had two more sales on Friday.)

title: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC
description: Its a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. This guide is a sampling of cultural highlights taking place in New York this weekend and over the week ahead. And theres much more where these came from.

title: American Companies Tailor Responses to Trump Election
description: Donald J. Trumps victory in the presidential race has presented some companies with a new challenge: how to find the right balance in their postelection messages to employees and customers.

title: Shooter Was Delayed After Real-Life Violence. As Shows Increasingly Are.
description: In the opening scene of the USA drama Shooter, the barrel of a snipers rifle is pointed right at the viewer.

title: Amid Tide of Red on Electoral Map, West Coast Stays Defiantly Blue
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The West Coast has long prided itself as an engine for reinvention and progressive ideals, distinct from the rest of the country. But after Tuesdays election, the states bordering the Pacific Ocean feel increasingly like an island unto its own.

title: Johnny Cash, the Poet in Black
description: Shortly before he died, Johnny Cash scrawled down eight short lines in a shaky hand, mortality clearly on his mind.

title: Religious Right Believes Donald Trump Will Deliver on His Promises
description: Donald J. Trump rarely goes to church, said hes never sought forgiveness for his sins, and in his acceptance speech early Wednesday morning, never mentioned God.

title: Why Did Facebook Say I Was Dead?
description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to attend your own funeral? On Friday, Facebook gave me that option by telling me that I was dead. Things got weirder when it also told me that most other people I knew were dead, too.

title: Facebook Will Stop Some Ads From Targeting Users by Race
description: As Facebook has grown, so too has its ability to slice and dice the habits of its hundreds of millions of users, and offer them up to advertisers that want to reach specific groups for specific reasons.

title: At Army, Winning Is No Longer a Jolt to the System
description: WEST POINT, N.Y.  According to Edgar Allen Poe  the wide receiver from Tucson, not the macabre poet  a much brighter aura surrounds the Army football team this season, and not just because the Black Knights are finally winning more games than they lose.

title: November Nights
description: Last weeks galas: Society of Memorial Sloan Kettering, Natural Resources Defense Council, the Metropolitan Museum of Arts Apollo Circle and the Aspen Institute.

title: November Nights
description: News of the Trump victory was still sinking in as the black-tie circuit carried on. The Society of Memorial Sloan Kettering held its fall party, sponsored by Valentino, Nov. 9 at the Metropolitan Club. The Natural Resources Defense Council had its Night of Comedy benefit that night, with Seth Meyers and John Oliver offering comic relief. Also that night, the Metropolitan Museum of Art hosted its Apollo Circle benefit for younger supporters in the Temple of Dendur gallery. And on Nov. 3, the Aspen Institute honored Melinda Gates and Robert K. Steel at the Plaza Hotel.

title: Review: The Killing Season Examines Long Island Case
description: It was only a matter of time before the television trend of turning real-life murders into immersive docu-series found its way to the Long Island serial-killer case.

title: On the Market in the New York Region
description: This weeks properties include a five-bedroom in Cream Ridge, N.J., and a six-bedroom in Garden City, N.Y.

title: Homes for Sale in New York and New Jersey
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in the New York region:

title: Canada Today: Dams, Fiddles and That New Leader Next Door
description: Because many parts of Canada rely on electricity produced by dams, hydro is often synonymous with electrical power and electrical utilities. The countrys efforts to cut emissions linked to climate change have, not surprisingly, renewed interest in hydroelectricity. But demonstrations in Labrador last month and research led by a Nova Scotia native now at Harvard that was published this week highlighted an often overlooked consequence of hydro dams  mercury buildup in the water behind them. Without costly and time-consuming remediation, they can poison indigenous people who live downstream.

title: The Transition to President Donald Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: On the Market in New York City
description: This weeks properties are in Murray Hill, on the Upper West Side and in Lefferts Gardens, Brooklyn.

title: Homes for Sale in Brooklyn and Manhattan
description: Click on the slide show to see this weeks featured properties in New York City:

title: Aileen Mehle, Gossips Grande Dame Known as Suzy, Dies at 98
description: Aileen Mehle, who titillated readers with her rapier wit for five decades as Suzy, the glamorous, nationally syndicated grande dame of tabloid society gossip columnists, died on Friday at her home in Manhattan. She was 98.

title: Dreaming Up a Mahler Symphony That Never Was
description: Mahlers 11th Symphony? There is no such thing. Mahler didnt really finish his 10th Symphony, which, aside from its great opening Adagio, was left in various states of sketchiness when he died in 1911.

title: After Trump Win, Parallel Path Is Seen for Marine Le Pen of Frances Far Right
description: HNIN-BEAUMONT, France  It was a moment of intense French patriotism on a sunny Friday, Armistice Day. A band blared La Marseillaise, the national anthem. Shouts of Vive la France! filled the chilly November air. And there, too, was Marine Le Pen, leader of the far-right National Front party, beaming.

title: Minorities Worry What a Law and Order Donald Trump Presidency Will Mean
description: On Tuesday night, Gwen Carr stood before a throbbing crowd at the Javits Center in Manhattan and talked about all the change Hillary Clinton would usher in.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Hmong Egg Roll Stuffing
description: In Junction City, Wis., Diane Yang and her family cook Thanksgiving dinner for a large Hmong community and use egg roll filling to stuff their turkey.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Eprax
description: In Nashville, the Tayyar family makes eprax, an elaborate layered Kurdish casserole, to go with the roast turkey and stuffing.

title: Russia Isnt Actually That Happy About Trumps Victory
description: MOSCOW  Donald J. Trumps shocking triumph in the American presidential election will have some unusual foreign-policy repercussions. During the campaign, Democrats frequently tried to damage Mr. Trumps standing by claiming that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia was working for and supporting the Republican nominee. Now many may believe that Americas huge political upset could even be described as a victory for the Kremlin.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Pumpkin Flan
description: Maggie Velasco, a resident of Miami, has created a pumpkin flan as a reminder of her childhood in Havana.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Jerk-Spiced Turkey
description: In Canaan, N.Y., Francine Turone brines her turkey with cinnamon, cloves, allspice and juniper berries, a recipe inspired by her upbringing in Kingston, Jamaica.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Bibingka
description: For Thanksgiving, Nicole Ponseca makes bibingka, a Filipino cake with cheese and salted eggs baked in a banana leaf.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Dudhi Kofta Curry
description: Raghavan Iyer makes a vegetarian alternative to turkey for his Thanksgiving in Minneapolis: dudhi kofta curry, crisp Indian squash dumplings in a bright, gingery sauce.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Cantonese Turkey
description: Dr. Carolyn Ling, a physician in Carmel, Ind., prepares her Thanksgiving turkey in a rich glaze of fermented soybean paste, garlic, ginger, soy sauce and alliums galore.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Blotkake
description: In Manhattan, Maren Waxenberg makes blotkake, an airy Norwegian cream cake, layered with cloudberry preserves and whipped cream.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Pan de Jamn
description: In Austin, Tex., Martha Beltrn makes a pan de jamn that reminds her of her time in Venezuela. She serves it alongside the turkey and roast vegetables.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Rotkraut
description: Every Thanksgiving, Debbie Himmler, who lives in Cincinnati, makes her grandmothers German rotkraut: red cabbage with red wine and apples.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Bariis Iskukaris
description: Ayaan and Idyl Mohallims grandmother taught them to cook Bariis iskukaris, an elegant Somali rice dish flavored with a mix of sweet brown spices and turmeric.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Spinach Stuffing
description: In New Jersey, Lisa and Carmela Conte make a spinach stuffing at Thanksgiving that is adapted from traditional Italian fillings for pasta and game birds.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Pork Neck Bones
description: In Atlanta, Erika Council makes a stockpot of pork neck bones as a reflection of the food cooked in the kitchens of enslaved Africans.

title: An Appraisal: Leonard Cohen, Master of Meanings and Incantatory Verse
description: Leonard Cohen, who was 82 when he died on Monday, was young once. That can be hard to remember after his years of public, silver-haired eminence: touring arenas while he was in his 70s and playing leisurely three-hour-plus shows that seemed to slow down time itself. He intoned his songs with serene gravity, revealing once again how carefully chiseled every one of his quatrains is. And with every line he shared, implicitly and in his lyrics, there was a humbling knowledge of mortality: one that grows even more significant on Mr. Cohens final studio album, You Want It Darker, which was released less than a month ago.

title: Republicans Expand Control in a Deeply Divided Nation
description: SOMERS, Wis.  It is the stunning paradox of American politics. In a bitterly divided nation, where Tuesdays vote once again showed a country almost evenly split between Democrats and Republicans, one party now dominates almost everything in American governance.

title: Why Def Comedy Jam Gets No Respect
description: Before Veep, Curb Your Enthusiasm and Sex and the City, there was Def Comedy Jam, one of the first hit comedies on HBO, often beating its network competition in ratings on Friday nights throughout much of the 1990s.

title: Review: Judy Collinss Clear, Pure Brook of Song
description: Its almost unheard-of for a pop soprano in her 70s to surpass her younger self in stamina, precision of intonation and vocal command. But that was what Judy Collins, 77, did at Thursdays opening-night show of her latest engagement at Caf Carlyle. The evening was particularly intense because of the death of her friend Leonard Cohen, which she only acknowledged after a performance that culminated with a somber rendition of his love song Suzanne. Her 1966 recording put him on the songwriting map.

title: Donald Trump, Leonard Cohen, Mosul: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Review: Shut In (Naomi Watts Should Really Get Out More)
description: If youre in any doubt as to the dearth of decent movie roles available to women of a certain age  certain never to see 40 again, at any rate  then buy a ticket for Shut In. In this achingly inept thriller, you will see Naomi Watts do what she can to sell a plot of such preposterousness that the derisory laughter around me began barely 20 minutes in.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: A Reporter Whos Not in Kansas Anymore Suddenly Is
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Anemona Hartocollis, a higher education reporter for The Timess national desk, shares what it was like for her to return to Topeka High School  a journalist now, on assignment  for the first time since she graduated.

title: We Couldnt Believe Our Eyes: A Lost World of Shipwrecks Is Found
description: The medieval ship lay more than a half-mile down at the bottom of the Black Sea, its masts, timbers and planking undisturbed in the darkness for seven or eight centuries. Lack of oxygen in the icy depths had ruled out the usual riot of creatures that feast on sunken wood.

title: Letter From Gwen Carr, Eric Garners Mother, to Loretta Lynch
description: On Tuesday night, Ms. Carr began writing a letter to Ms. Lynch, the attorney general, pleading with her to quickly decide how to proceed with the case of her son, who died in July 2014 after being placed in a chokehold by a police officer in Staten Island, before Mr. Trump takes office. Please hear my cry, dont allow my sons words and our tears to be in vain, Ms. Carr wrote before sending it off Friday morning.

title: No, Birth Control Coverage Wont Go Away
description: Hours after Tuesdays election results were final, tweets, Facebook messages and articles began bouncing around the internet urging women to go seek birth control right away. Get an IUD Before Its Too Late, advised a Daily Beast headline. Heres Why Everyone Is Saying to Get an IUD Today, explained a popular New York Magazine piece.

title: Chuck Schumer Backs Minnesota Liberal for Democratic Party Chairman
description: WASHINGTON  After his partys brutal Election Day loss, Senator Chuck Schumer, the presumptive incoming Democratic minority leader, threw his support on Friday behind a liberal member of Congress to be the next chairman of the Democratic National Committee.

title: In a Further Blow to Democrats, Republicans Increase Their Hold on State Governments
description: Republicans will control the governors office and both chambers of the state legislature in four more states  Iowa, Kentucky, Missouri and New Hampshire.

title: Lindsey Vonn Fractures Arm, Putting Her World Cup Season in Question
description: For the fourth time in the last five winters, a serious injury will interrupt Lindsey Vonns ski racing season. Vonn announced Friday on her Facebook page that she had severely fractured the humerus bone of her right arm in a training crash on Thursday.

title: Trumps Changes to the Tax Codes May Encourage Dynastic Wealth
description: If Donald J. Trump follows through on his campaign promises, a host of taxes that affect only the very richest Americans may be eliminated, along with almost all tax incentives to be philanthropic. As a result, wealthy families may find it much easier to amass dynastic levels of wealth.

title: You Must Serve Trump
description: Of all the conservatives who opposed Donald Trump during his campaign for the presidency, his most vehement opponents were the men and women who had served in past Republican administrations, and particularly in the departments of state and of defense. One hundred and twenty-two Republican foreign policy hands signed a letter denouncing Trump as a menace to American values and world peace. George W. Bushs C.I.A. director, Michael Hayden, suggested that Trump was a useful idiot for Russian interests. Both neoconservatives and realists  Robert Kagan and Paul Wolfowitz, Brent Scowcroft and Richard Armitage  indicated that they would vote for Hillary Clinton.

title: South Korean Presidents Leadership Style Is Seen as Factor in Scandal
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A police detective who worked in the South Korean presidents office filed a report in 2014 accusing relatives and associates of an unofficial presidential adviser of meddling in state affairs.

title: Season Is Almost Over, but Marin Cilics Work Is About to Begin
description: This year, it is Marin Cilics turn to push his limits in November.

title: Civic Masterpieces, and Nightmares, Unrealized
description: Most nonfiction books these days are emblazoned with audacious titles that demand an explanatory underline. Never Built New York (Metropolis Books, $55) doesnt need one.

title: Bernie Sanders: Where the Democrats Go From Here
description: Millions of Americans registered a protest vote on Tuesday, expressing their fierce opposition to an economic and political system that puts wealthy and corporate interests over their own. I strongly supported Hillary Clinton, campaigned hard on her behalf, and believed she was the right choice on Election Day. But Donald J. Trump won the White House because his campaign rhetoric successfully tapped into a very real and justified anger, an anger that many traditional Democrats feel.

title: After Election, Commander in Chief Soothes White House Workers
description: There has been weeping at West Wing staff meetings and a series of presidential pep talks, a tear-jerker of a Rose Garden gathering and anguished conversations about what will happen to President Obamas legacy and the job prospects of his aides.

title: Mike Pence Emerging as a Commanding Figure in Trump Administration
description: WASHINGTON  Vice President-elect Mike Pence made his name as a relentless conservative critic of the federal government. Soon he will essentially be running it.

title: Megyn Kellys Book Sheds New Light on Fox Inquiry Into Roger Ailes
description: It is no secret that Megyn Kelly played a role in Roger Ailess ouster as the chief executive of Fox News after she, and others, accused him of sexual harassment.

title: Corey Lewandowski, Donald Trumps Former Campaign Manager, Leaves CNN
description: Donald J. Trumps former campaign manager, Corey Lewandowski, resigned on Friday from his role as a CNN political commentator, ending a television deal that had attracted scrutiny and harsh criticism about the cable channels journalistic ethics.

title: Donald Trump Likely to End Aid for Rebels Fighting Syrian Government
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump said Friday that he was likely to abandon the American effort to support moderate opposition groups in Syria who are battling the government of President Bashar al-Assad, saying we have no idea who these people are.

title: World Chess Championship Kicks Off With V.I.P. Treatment
description: The long recovery of Lower Manhattan from Hurricane Sandy advanced a step on Friday with the start of the World Chess Championship, the first championship in the United States since 1995, at the Fulton Market Building. The 12-game match, which is scheduled to run until the end of the month, pits the champion, Magnus Carlsen of Norway, 25, against the Russian challenger, Sergey Karjakin, 26, who disheartened many American chess fans by defeating two higher-rated American players in the qualifying tournament in March.

title: A Newcomer Fits Rangers Prototype for the Fast Track
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  The Rangers used to have another player just like Michael Grabner. His name was Carl Hagelin.

title: Reports of Bias-Based Attacks Tick Upward After Election
description: In New York, men shouted, Youre next! at a black policewoman, making shooting motions with their hands. In California, a high school student told a classmate, You support Trump? You hate Mexicans! before throwing her to the ground and hitting her. Online, anonymous users wrote on Twitter, Just reported you to ICE. Expect a van at your door tomorrow to illegal immigrants.

title: Donald Trump Prepares for White House Move, but His Tower May Still Beckon
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump won the White House with an outsiders populist promise to drain the swamp of Washington.

title: Im Muslim, but My Roommate Supports Trump
description: When she outed herself to me as a Trump supporter, I realized I had finally found the silent majority. I looked at her, this suddenly strange girl who sleeps a few feet away from me, my college roommate. The silent majority has seen me put on my head scarf in the morning and take it off at night. The silent majority has touched my face, done my makeup, watches Gilmore Girls religiously. The silent majority occasionally enjoys sliced mango before bed.

title: Cella Irvine, Digital Media Pioneer Who Led About.com, Dies at 59
description: Cella Irvine, a Silicon Alley pioneer who led About.com and other new media companies in New York starting in the early 1990s, died on Tuesday at her home in Manhattan. She was 59.

title: Phil Jacksons Role for a Night: Film Critic
description: As he walked onto a darkened stage Thursday night with that bone-sore amble of his, Phil Jackson, the president of the Knicks, might as well have been trailed by angry producers waving critical notices.

title: How Federal Ethics Laws Will Apply to a Trump Presidency
description: Over the next few weeks, Donald J. Trump will be deep in the throes of selecting cabinet members, reviewing potential Supreme Court justices and deciding on the top priorities for his new administration.

title: What Trump Exposed About the G.O.P.
description: The election of Donald J. Trump will bring as sharp a turn to the right as this country has seen since at least the election of Ronald Reagan  thanks mainly to the rare conservative control of Congress, the presidency and, before long, the Supreme Court.

title: What Europe Needs to Hear from Trump
description: Munich  America owes Donald J. Trump an open mind and a chance to lead, Hillary Clinton said on Wednesday. So does Europe.

title: Trumps Racial Time Machine
description: On Election Day, while Americans were at the polls putting democracy to work, a black graduate student came to my university office to talk about race and time travel. This young man grew up in a fairly disadvantaged neighborhood, in a fairly disadvantaging city, in a very disadvantaging nation  all the result of our shared history of slavery and institutional inequality that allows American cops to choke blacks on Youtube and go home and play with the kids.

title: Solemnity and Defiance Dominate England-Scotland World Cup Qualifier
description: LONDON  As soon as the bugle picked out the first, plaintive note of the Last Post, Wembley Stadium seemed to freeze.

title: The World Waits and Wonders About Donald Trump
description: The forces that brought Donald Trump to victory were largely American. The repercussions of his election, however, have rocked Western democracies accustomed to seeing the United States as a beacon for democracy, progress and stability. If the president-elect wants to take seriously his responsibilities as head of the free world, he should waste no time in making clear how much of his campaign bluster was just that.

title: Duet
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  If you found yourself floundering in the center of todays puzzle, theres a good reason for it. All Ill say, in the interest of not giving it away here, is that punctuation matters.

title: Schoolchildren Left Behind
description: Politicians and voters often say they want better schools, but that doesnt mean theyre willing to pay for them. Voters this week largely rejected attempts to increase school spending through ballot initiatives.

title: Leonard Cohen, Vital to the End
description: News of the death of Leonard Cohen, musical poet and great Canadian, hit on Thursday like a punch to the gut, an early blast of winter. We can do the Leonard Cohen thing and brood. Or we can heed this spontaneous eulogy from another of our most admired songwriters, Rosanne Cash. Rolling through Iowa, she said on Twitter on Friday afternoon, in wonder and awe that we had such a man.

title: The Supermoon and Other Moons That Are Super in Their Own Ways
description: Shrug off the supermoon.

title: Protests of Trumps Election Continue Into Third Day
description: For the third day in a row since Donald J. Trump was elected president, thousands of people took part in protests that bloomed across the country, venting their frustration at the election results.

title: 2016 Election Thank You Notes
description: Such a surprise! So many people to thank!

title: Quotation of the Day
description: In so many ways, we are America. But we are just ahead of the curve.

title: Corrections: November 12, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Mexico Ends Its Soccer Frustration on U.S. Soil
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  For years, the score was so ingrained it became a mantra. A rallying cry. A marketing device, even.

title: Dionne Hoskins and Akino Brown: She Was Incensed. A Little Smitten, Too.
description: Dionne Lynette Hoskins and Akino Blade Brown were married Nov. 12. Tammy Cox Stokes, chief judge of the Chatham County Recorders Court, officiated at Dunham Farms, an event space in Sunbury, Ga.

title: Sydney Cohen and Adam Alperowicz: He Wasnt Shy. Just a Long Way Up.
description: Sydney Alexandra Cohen and Adam Evan Alperowicz were married Nov. 12 at the University Club in Manhattan. Rabbi Rachel Ain officiated.

title: Emboldened N.B.A. Coaches Rip Donald J. Trumps Rhetoric
description: The N.B.A. has become known in recent years for its political activism.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Seth Rogen in Sausage Party and Dave Chappelle on S.N.L.
description: A sausage, voiced by Seth Rogen, learns that the supermarket afterlife isnt what he expected in Sausage Party. 48 Hours reports on the case of Todd Kohlhepp, a suspected serial killer. And Dave Chappelle hosts Saturday Night Live for the first time.

title: Bomber Kills 4 Americans at U.S. Base in Afghanistan
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber managed to sneak onto the main American military base in Afghanistan on Saturday and kill four Americans, according to American and Afghan officials.

title: Because I Was a Girl, I Was Told
description: There will be no female president come January. But in the days leading up to the election, there was a distinct possibility that this 227-year-old gender barrier would be hurdled, and so we asked women to tell us about their own vividly recalled barriers. Almost 1,200 of you responded. Here are some of your stories.

title: They Broke It. America Bought It.
description: Here are the top 10 comments of the week on our digital platforms, as selected by our readers and the journalists who moderate nearly every comment.

title: Can Trump Save Their Jobs? Theyre Counting on It
description: INDIANAPOLIS  By the time the Chicago Cubs won the World Series for the first time in 108 years this month, Paul Roell was already asleep. He did not stay up to see Barack Obama win the presidency in 2008, or watch in 2000 as the margin of votes separating George W. Bush and Al Gore in Florida shrank to the vanishing point.

title: Living in Petworth, Washington, D.C.
description: Petworth, a neighborhood in the District of Columbia, is popular with young families  and flippers.

title: Petworth, Washington, D.C.: A Place of Porches
description: In 2009, Robert H. Mandle and his wife, Maria, were living in an apartment in Arlington, Va., and shopping for a single-family home. They were shown a 1919 three-bedroom townhouse in Petworth, a centrally situated neighborhood in the District of Columbia. The 1,775-square-foot house on Rock Creek Church Road NW was at the end of a row of attached buildings, which meant it had abundant light. And then there was the charming fact that President Lincoln had spent his summers across the road. But the property, which was listed at more than $400,000, needed cosmetic improvements and seemed expensive for the amount of space.

title: Recalling the Horror at the Bataclan
description: Ninety people were killed in a terrorist attack at the Paris concert hall on Nov. 13, 2015. Daniel Psenny heard the shots and leaned into the street. Listen as he describes the chaos that night.

title: In Paris, the Spirit of the Cafe Rises
description: The carnage at La Belle quipe was the worst of any at bars and cafes the night of the Paris terrorist attacks a year ago. Listen to the owner explain why he reopened five months after 19 people died there.

title: Breaking Up With Twitter
description: Twitter, the well-known but less-well-used social network of 140-character quips about the news, is polarizing. Youre either an addict, or you dont get it.

title: What Is a TinyLetter? Like Ye Olde Blog, but Less Public
description: If theres one silver lining in this whole thing: Donald Trump has cured my Impostor Syndrome, Maris Kreizman, the editorial director of the Book of the Month Club, wrote this past week in her personal email newsletter, The Maris Review. If he thinks hes qualified to run this country, I can do whatever I want.

title: There Is Life After American Apparel
description: Iris Alonzo was reflecting, with mock regret, on the success of the deep V-neck T-shirt she helped create for American Apparel years ago.

title: Is Fashions Love Affair With Washington Over?
description: On Wednesday, when Hillary Clinton stood in the New Yorker Hotel for her farewell speech, she did so in one of her signature Ralph Lauren pantsuits. Dark gray, with purple lapels and a matching purple shirt (and a matching purple tie for Bill Clinton), it underscored, as so many of her fashion choices did in the run-up to the election, a point: the way two colors/factions  red and blue  can unite to make something new.

title: Cold in Your Hotel Room? By Voice or Tablet, You Can Change That
description: Need to dial down the thermostat in the middle of the night? Want to open the curtains at daybreak? How about turning out the hall light at bedtime? These are some of the tasks that no longer require you to get out of bed in the new generation of automated hotel rooms.

title: What the Markets Are Really Telling Us About a Trump Presidency
description: If there was one thing financial markets commentators were confident about heading into the presidential election, it was that if Donald J. Trump pulled off an upset win, it would create a classic panic reaction: a drop in stocks and other risky assets and a rally in bonds and other safe-haven assets.

title: An American Mood
description: Art and emotion in Brooklyn on Election Day and the day after

title: Donald Trumps Cabinet Is Complete. Heres the Full List.
description: A list of appointees and nominees for top posts in the new administration.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Why Women Did Not Unite to Vote Against Donald Trump
description: Women were predicted to come out in force to vote for the first female president and against a man who demeaned them and bragged about sexual assault.

title: Secret Documents Show a Tortured Prisoner's Descent
description: Over 10 years, medical personnel at Guantnamo struggled to understand the psychiatric problems of Ramzi bin al-Shibh, who has admitted helping plan the Sept. 11 attacks and was tortured in C.I.A. prisons.

title: Where Even Nightmares Are Classified: Psychiatric Care at Guantnamo
description: Every day when Lt. Cmdr. Shay Rosecrans crossed into the military detention center at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, she tucked her medical school class ring into her bra, covered the name on her uniform with tape and hid her necklace under her T-shirt, especially if she was wearing a cross.

title: Farhads and Mikes Week in Tech: When the Tech Industry Lives in a Bubble
description: Each Saturday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry.

title: Pet Allergies in a Pet-Friendly Building
description: Q. I live in a pet-friendly co-op in Riverdale, in the Bronx. Unfortunately, I am highly allergic to dogs and cats. When pet owners wash their pets clothes and bedding in the common laundry room, some of them do not clean out the hair from the lint catchers in the dryers, leaving me to clean it out. This has triggered several allergic reactions. When I asked the board to set aside specific washers and dryers for the pet paraphernalia, it refused, saying pet owners should have unlimited access to all machines. Do any city rules address this problem? And what can be done to mitigate my problem?

title: How T. Boone Pickens Sits Tight in the Riskiest of Businesses
description: DALLAS  Do you enjoy risk? I asked T. Boone Pickens Jr.

title: A Deported Afghan Boy Returns to a Land Nothing Like Home
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Massoud Mosavi is a bright and funny little kid, although these days he is in grim humor. He speaks English well enough that he was able to be interviewed without an interpreter even though he is only 7  and an Afghan for whom English is his second language.

title: As Obama Exits World Stage, Angela Merkel May Be the Liberal Wests Last Defender
description: BERLIN  And then there was one.

title: Fleeing Gangs, Central American Families Surge Toward U.S.
description: TAPACHULA, Mexico  Leaving El Salvador had never been in Albertos plans. He and his wife had stable jobs and supportive friends and relatives, and their five children were happy.

title: International Readers on How a Trump Presidency Could Affect Them
description: David Parting, a reader in Germany, wrote that a Donald J. Trump presidency could mend ties between the United States and Russia, which would overall reduce the potential for international conflicts.

title: Donate to the New York Times Neediest Cases Fund
description: In its 105th year, The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund has provided direct assistance to those struggling in New York and beyond.

title: Jury Deadlocks in Trial of Ex-Officer in Killing of Unarmed Black Driver in Cincinnati
description: The murder trial of a white former University of Cincinnati police officer in the fatal shooting of an unarmed black driver last year ended in a mistrial on Saturday after the jurors told the judge they were unable to reach a verdict.

title: As Markets Waver, the Rich Park Money in Luxury Homes
description: Evan Kulman, a broker for the real estate firm Compass, was not surprised when the Amagansett luxury home that he listed for sale on the first of August sold in a swift six weeks  nearly four times as fast as similar homes were selling a year ago.

title: Scenes From Five Days of Anti-Trump Protests Across a Divided Nation
description: Thousands have turned out to protest in at least 52 cities across the United States in the days since the vote.

title: With Trump in Power, the Fed Gets Ready for a Reckoning
description: WASHINGTON  Paul A. Volcker, the Federal Reserve chairman, received an urgent warning two weeks after Ronald Reagan won the 1980 presidential election. Some of the president-elects advisers, he was told, wanted to abolish the central bank and replace it with a computer program that would manage interest rates and monetary policy.

title: Australia Emerges as the New Front in the College Recruiting Wars
description: Terrance Ferguson, a recent graduate of a charter school in Dallas, begins many days by taking in the view of Gulf St. Vincent from his three-story townhouse in Adelaide, Australia. He sometimes sees dolphins swimming in the waters below, which he considers pretty cool. He also likes to check in with peers back home who are preparing for classes as college freshmen.

title: New Type of Emissions Cheating Software May Lurk in Audis
description: FRANKFURT  The investigation into emissions fraud at Volkswagen widened on Saturday after the company acknowledged that United States and German regulators were examining why some Audi luxury cars and sport utility vehicles behaved differently during tests than they did on the road.

title: A 10-Digit Key Code to Your Private Life: Your Cellphone Number
description: The next time someone asks you for your cellphone number, you may want to think twice about giving it.

title: Where Cellphones Are Lifelines, Start-Ups Spy Opportunities
description: One-third of the worlds population, 2.5 billion people, have no credit score that might give them access to loans. But about a billion people in the developing world do have basic smartphones.

title: Trump and Congress Both Want Tax Cuts. The Question Is Which Ones.
description: Several economic issues divide many Republicans in Congress from Donald J. Trump, the Republican president-elect. Free trade versus tariffs to limit imports. Immigration reform versus a border wall. Cutting Social Security and other benefit programs versus protecting them.

title: The Trump Stock Rally: Calamity Averted With a Little Charm
description: The stock market is easily rattled, but it can also be easily seduced.

description: Michael Marrero discovered just how fragile his familys circumstances were when his wife and son were unexpectedly hospitalized with a rare disease.

title: Trumps Hires Will Set Course of His Presidency
description: WASHINGTON  Busy day planned in New York, President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Twitter on Friday morning, two days after his astonishing victory. Will soon be making some very important decisions on the people who will be running our government!

description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Who hasnt looked up in the sky and admired the beauty of birds and their ability to fly?

title: Joyful Donor to Womens Causes Teaches Other Inheritors
description: In charitable circles, Tracy DuVivier Gary is known as the Janie Appleseed of womens philanthropy. She has spent the last 40 years jump-starting dozens of organizations focused on improving the lives of women and girls.

title: Letters to the Editor

description: Jessica Duke, 30, is a jet engine mechanic at Pratt & Whitney in Middletown, Conn.

title: How Do You Tell the Story of the Paris Attacks? You Let Survivors Speak
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this piece, Alissa J. Rubin, The Timess Paris bureau chief, describes how an oral history project on the Nov. 13, 2015,  Paris attacks came together.

title: Paris: One Year On
description: The night of Nov. 13, 2015, Islamic State militants attacked eight places in and around Paris, killing 130 people and wounding nearly 500. It was the most lethal attack in France since World War II. Confusion gripped the city as two teams of attackers struck nearly simultaneously. One struck at the Stade de France, just outside Paris, while the other shot up cafes and bars in the hip 10th and 11th Arrondissements. About 20 minutes later, a third team of attackers entered the Bataclan concert hall in the same neighborhood, taking hostages and killing scores.

title: With Federer and Nadal Sidelined, Some See the End of an Era
description: The last time Roger Federer did not appear in the ATP World Tour Finals, the season-ending tournament was not even called the ATP World Tour Finals.

title: The Wealthy Ask Themselves: What Do We Have to Lose?
description: Even before Donald J. Trump defied the odds and was elected the 45th president of the United States, wealthy investors were feeling uneasy about the level of uncertainty in the global economy.

title: Ohioans, Tired of Status Quo, Flipped to Trump for Change
description: MASSILLON, Ohio  Gerry Noble, a 64-year-old electrician from northeast Ohio, voted for President Obama in 2012 because he was trying to help the common man.

title: The Myth of Female Solidarity
description: The dream of female solidarity is, and always has been, a myth.

title: How Erie Went Red: The Economy Sank, and Trump Rose
description: ERIE, Pa.  Sean D. Wiley recalled the moment it hit him, hard, that the people he had known all of his life and represented in the Pennsylvania State Senate were abandoning his Democratic Party.

title: Why You Should Always Lock Your Hotel Room Door!
description: My wife Sheryl WuDunn and I are in Philadelphia for a meeting of the American Philosophical Society, and this morning at about 7 I went down to the Franklin Hotel lobby to grab a cup of coffee. Sheryl was sleeping, so to reduce the sound I closed the door but didnt quite let it lock. A man emerged from somewhere at about the same time and also seemed to be waiting for the elevator, but when it came he said that he was waiting for his wife and I should go ahead.

title: Michigan Voters Say Trump Could See Their Problems Right Off the Bat
description: WARREN, Mich.  This state was one of the biggest upsets in last weeks jolting election, going narrowly to Donald J. Trump and giving the Republican Party its first victory in a presidential race here since 1988.

title: Facebook, in Cross Hairs After Election, Is Said to Question Its Influence
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Late on Tuesday night, as it became clear that Donald J. Trump would defeat Hillary Clinton to win the presidential election, a private chat sprang up on Facebook among several vice presidents and executives of the social network.

title: Rosberg May Claim Formula One Title, but Hamilton Still Holds Spotlight
description: SO PAULO, Brazil  As Formula One prepares to stage its penultimate race of the season at the Brazilian Grand Prix on Sunday, Nico Rosberg holds a comfortable lead in the series but faces considerable obstacles  mostly off the track.

title: What Are You Afraid Of?
description: This week, we asked nine artists to draw their deepest fears.

description: LONDON  In more than two decades working in the financial district here, Paul OConnor cannot recall a more uncertain time.

title: Guantnamo Deal Could Lead to Prosecution in Indonesia Terrorist Attacks
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is negotiating with Malaysia over a deal to repatriate and continue to incarcerate a Guantnamo Bay detainee accused of being an accessory to two major terrorist attacks in Indonesia, officials said.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Lies in the Guise of News in the Trump Era
description: IF you get your news from this newspaper or our rival mainstream news sources, theres probably a lot you dont know.

title: Speaking Up About Harassment
description: To the Editor:

title: How Donald Trump Will Divide American and Israeli Jews
description: The day before Americans voted for their next president, I met with Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz in the area she knows best  her district in southern Florida.

title: The Varieties of Anger
description: Bitterness. Hostility. Rage. The varieties of anger are endless. Some are mild, such as grumpiness, and others are powerful, such as wrath. Different angers vary not only in their intensity but also in their purpose. Its normal to feel exasperated with your screaming infant and scornful of a political opponent, but scorn toward your baby would be bizarre.

title: Three Priorities for the New President
description: We invited readers to draft a to-do list for the new presidents first 100 days. Hundreds did.

title: When Borders Close
description: The age of globalization generated great prosperity. As the flow of goods, money and people across borders surged, millions benefited. But the elite gained the most. And as inequality rose, it stirred pockets of fierce resentment among those left behind. When the great shock came, the discontented turned to nationalist firebrands, who promised to impose controls on free trade, global banks and immigrants. Globalization stalled. A new age of deglobalization hit full stride.

title: He Made America Feel Great Again
description: While I cannot verify its provenance, the following appears to be my Sunday column from Nov. 8, 2020, which slipped through a small rift in the space-time continuum while I was writing a panicked, Its the Trump Apocalypse! column this week.

title: When Republicans Take Power
description: Washington  On the morning of Nov. 8, Republicans in the nations capital were grim-faced and resigned to Hillary Clintons impending triumph, hoping only that Donald J. Trump wouldnt lose so badly as to cost the party the Senate. By midnight they were in ecstasy, as it became apparent that Mr. Trump would take the presidency and Republicans would maintain majorities in both houses of Congress. A few months from now, its all but certain that Mr. Trump will nominate, and the Senate will confirm, a new conservative Supreme Court justice. At that point, Republicans will control all three branches of government.

title: A Better Way to Safe Cosmetics
description: To the Editor:

title: Whats the Use of Regret?
description: A few weeks ago I was sitting poolside in Florida with a friendly retiree who was standing in the warm aqua water, beaming with friendliness. We started chatting, first about his hometown, Pittsburgh, and the many great athletes from there. Soon the conversation pivoted to Vietnam and his experiences as a draftee there. Embarrassed because I was spared from that jungle and moral crucible, I just listened. First it was a few madcap stories about his arrival in Nam, but then his thoughts swam along a darker current.

title: The Danger of Going Soft on Russia
description: Among the first world leaders to congratulate President-elect Donald Trump was Vladimir Putin. And why shouldnt he?

title: What Whiteness Means in the Trump Era
description: Donald J. Trump campaigned on the slogan Make America Great Again, a phrase whose great was widely heard as white. Certainly the election has been analyzed as a victory for white Christian Americans, especially men. Against Mr. Trump were all the rest of us: professionals with advanced degrees and the multiracial, multiethnic millions.

title: Gretchen Carlson: My Fight Against Sexual Harassment
description: Ive never been a good sleeper, but now more than ever, after having lost my job as a news anchor this past summer, I find myself lying awake at night thinking about my daughter  and your daughters, too. Ive been asking myself this simple question: Will our girls finally be the ones to have workplaces free from sexual harassment? This question became even more compelling during the presidential race, where offensive comments about women were dismissed as locker room talk.

title: Obama Lobbies Against Obliteration by Trump
description: WASHINGTON  YOU know how desperate President Obama is  as he contemplates all his accomplishments going down the drain at the hands of a man he has total contempt for  when he is willing to do something so against his nature.

title: What About the Customers?
description: To the Editor:

title: The Doll in the Blue Pantsuit
description: We got the Hillary Clinton doll sometime last spring. My wife saw it in the window of a toy store in our neighborhood and thought it would be amusing to give to our 2-year-old daughter, Sami.

title: After a Fraught Election, Questions Over the Impact of a Balky Voting Process
description: So few Americans cast ballots that a new president was elected by barely a quarter of Americans eligible to vote. Some of those who did vote waited in line for hours. Others were told they needed an ID to vote under a law the courts had nullified months ago  and sometimes, under laws that never existed to begin with.

title: In Brazil, Inward-Looking Investors Eye Opportunities Outside
description: RIO DE JANEIRO  It is said that Cariocas, people from Rio de Janeiro, like to think that the world comes to them, and that was certainly the case over the last several years as Brazil commanded the global stage like never before.

title: Protesters Take Anti-Trump Message to His Doorstep, and Plan Next Steps
description: Thousands of demonstrators filled public squares, parks and streets in the countrys three largest cities on Saturday to protest President-elect Donald J. Trump, part of a wave of dissent that has swelled since the presidential contest last week.

title: Hillary Clinton Blames F.B.I. Director for Election Loss
description: Hillary Clinton on Saturday cast blame for her surprise election loss on the announcement by the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, days before the election that he had revived the inquiry into her use of a private email server.

title: A Global Investor, Concerned by World Politics
description: Nicolas Berggruen is a German-American investor and philanthropist. For years, he was known as the homeless billionaire, for his peripatetic life in which he lived in fine hotels around the world but did not own a home.

title: Bombing at Sufi Shrine in Pakistan Kills Dozens
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  A powerful bomb blast ripped through a Sufi shrine in southwestern Pakistan on Saturday evening, killing at least 52 people and wounding at least 100 others, officials said.

title: South Koreans Rally in Largest Protest in Decades to Demand Presidents Ouster
description: SEOUL, South Korea  In one of the largest anti-government protests in recent decades, hundreds of thousands of South Koreans filled central Seoul on Saturday to demand the resignation of President Park Geun-hye, whose administration has been paralyzed by a scandal involving an unofficial presidential adviser.

title: Brain Implant Eases Communication by Late-Stage A.L.S. Patient
description: Researchers have designed a system that lets a patient with late-stage Lou Gehrigs disease type words using brain signals alone.

title: Canada Is in an Economic Slump, but Some Investors Are Hopeful
description: OTTAWA  An array of factors makes Canada seem like a less-than-attractive place to invest these days.

title: Obamas Policies and Broader Vision Face Reckoning With History
description: As he raced across the country before the election, President Obama warned supporters about the stakes. All the progress weve made over these last eight years, he said, goes out the window if we dont win this election.

title: Conor McGregor Delivers Knockout in U.F.C.s New York Debut
description: Conor McGregor, the brash Irishman who is the worlds biggest mixed martial arts star, became the first man to hold two Ultimate Fighting Championship belts at the same time when he unseated lightweight champ Eddie Alvarez at Madison Square Garden on Saturday night.

title: In Murky Russia, One Investor Finds Value in Thinking Small
description: MOSCOW  Theres no doubt Russia is a country with grandeur in its scale, sweeping across 11 time zones and home to gargantuan oil, gas and mining companies.

title: Trump Camp Refuses to Close Door on Campaign Pledge to Lock Her Up
description: WASHINGTON  Even as President-elect Donald J. Trump vows to unify a divided nation, he faces a momentous decision over whether to make good on his oft-repeated campaign pledge to have a special prosecutor lock up Hillary Clinton.

title: Clothes That Fit
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  If you work for a company that has a Casual Friday policy, you know that the extent to which you can dress casually is largely dictated by the company. Youre never going to come to work in your favorite sweats, but youre also freed from the more binding forms of corporate wear.

title: How Nandan Nilekani, an Infosys Billionaire, Invests His Money
description: NEW DELHI  Nandan Nilekani, a co-founder of one of Indias biggest information technology services companies, is an older billionaire but a young investor. In his nearly 30 years of starting and then building up Infosys, he did not have the time to focus on investing anywhere else, he said. Not to mention that most of his wealth was tied up in the company.

title: Trump and Identity
description: (Race/Related is a weekly newsletter exploring race and ethnicity. Scattered throughout this edition are views of some Brooklyn voters in artwork by Cari Vander Yacht. These illustrations are juxtaposed against extended conversations with a handful of white Trump voters about race, identity, and politics. Sign up. Tell us what you think racerelated@nytimes.com.)

title: Fund Chief Capitalizes on Chinas Split Personality Economy
description: BEIJING  Weijian Shan, chief executive of the Hong Kong fund management firm PAG, says the global economy is dangerous for investors these days. Years of easy money from central banks have helped inflate the prices of just about everything an investor can buy, like stocks or property.

title: Sea of Uncertainty
description: Its a stormy, turbulent market for the world investor. Here are 15 charts and graphs to help clarify your financial thinking in a time of global market confusion (or at least amuse and calm you down a bit).

title: Clinton Staff Memo Cites One Hurdle Too Many
description: Hillary Clinton's campaign staff distributed an internal memo on Thursday detailing why it thought the F.B.I. director, James B. Comey, had played a role in Mrs. Clinton's loss.

description: Trumps appointments over the next six weeks will be very significant because they can show whether he wants to create some unity in the country, or whether he really intends to deliver on his ideas.

title: Colombia Reaches New Peace Deal With Rebels
description: The Colombian government and the nations main rebel group said on Saturday that they had reached a new final accord to end their longstanding conflict, potentially reviving a deal that was rejected last month in a referendum.

description: SYDNEY, Australia  The Australian government said Sunday that it had reached a one-time agreement in which the United States would take in refugees who had been banished to a detention center on the tiny impoverished Pacific island nation of Nauru.

description: Croatias national team did not have any fans in its stands to cheer it on, but it did not seem to matter.

title: To Our Readers, From the Publisher and Executive Editor
description: When the biggest political story of the year reached a dramatic and unexpected climax late Tuesday night, our newsroom turned on a dime and did what it has done for nearly two years  cover the 2016 election with agility and creativity.

title: Dave Chappelle Hosts S.N.L. and Addresses the Protests Against Trump
description: In its first episode since Donald J. Trump won the 2016 presidential election, Saturday Night Live embraced the tension that many of its viewers surely feel, satirizing Mr. Trump, his controversial campaign and the uncertainty that surrounds him as president-elect, but also mocking the bewilderment of liberals who did not consider the possibility that Hillary Clinton could lose  or the conditions that gave rise to his victory.
