description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: A Souvenir Smuggled Home From Cuba: A Cancer Vaccine
description: Zuby Malik is an unlikely candidate to violate international law. A 78-year-old mother of four with a crown of silver hair, she is a retired obstetrician-gynecologist with a penchant for order.

title: Ant Obstacle Course
description: Scientists at the University of Colorado, Boulder, studied how ants collectively navigated around a variety of Lego blockades.

title: How Teamwork Brings Home the Tuna in Lego Land
description: How groups make decisions is a major puzzle. Not just for pollsters. And not just human groups.

title: Studies Show Little Benefit in Supplements
description: Americans spend more than $30 billion a year on dietary supplements  vitamins, minerals and herbal products, among others  many of which are unnecessary or of doubtful benefit to those taking them. That comes to about $100 a year for every man, woman and child for substances that are often of questionable value.

title: New York Today: Behold, the Supermoon
description: Good morning on this shining Monday.

title: Morning Agenda: Trump and the Battlegrounds Ahead, Samsung and the Auto Industry
description: Stock markets are easily rattled and they dont like uncertainty. But they have been on the up since election results came in, so does that mean we are in for more of the same this week and in the long term?

title: Night Owls May Face Special Challenges
description: Parents often worry about whether their children are getting enough sleep, about issues like young children who wake too early and adolescents who resist waking at all.

title: They Will Have to Die Now
description: Before dawn on a Sunday late last month, a battalion of pesh merga soldiers  about 600 Kurdish men, along with a few women  gathered in the shadow of Bashiqa Mountain, on the western edge of the autonomous region of Iraqi Kurdistan. They were sons, daughters, fathers, grandfathers. They wore an assortment of camouflage fatigues and traditional Kurdish flowing pants, waist sashes and head scarves. They carried antique Kalashnikovs and new assault rifles. Few had helmets, and fewer had body armor. Strapped to their backs and belts and legs were daggers, revolvers, axes. Some of them had received the call to duty only the day before and were driven to the front by family or rode overnight in taxis.

title: Politics Aside, We Know How to Fix Obamacare
description: President Obamas Affordable Care Act marketplaces were supposed to give consumers choices of health plans from insurers that compete to keep premiums down. But fewer insurers are participating, and premiums are increasing sharply.

title: Critic of Najib Razak, Malaysian Leader, Gets Prison for 1MDB Disclosure
description: BANGKOK  An outspoken member of Malaysias Parliament was sentenced on Monday to 18 months in prison for publicly disclosing classified information from an official audit into a scandal-plagued government investment fund.

title: Harvards Rank and File
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Two men sit in the dining hall, leaning over trays filled with stacks of pancakes and glasses of blue Gatorade.

title: What Acts of Kindness Have You Witnessed or Participated In?
description: Weve all heard of the heroic actions of bystanders and random acts of kindness.

title: Assange Is Questioned in London Over Rape Accusation in Sweden
description: LONDON  Six years after the Swedish authorities opened an investigation into a rape accusation made against Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, he was questioned about the matter on Monday.

title: Apples New MacBook Pro: Fast and Light, but Not for Everyone
description: When Apple unveiled its new MacBook Pro laptops at a media event last month, Adam Leventhal, a software engineer, was eager to learn about them.

title: California Today: Why More Community Colleges Offer Free Tuition
description: Good morning.

title: Stay On, for Your Country
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: NASA and FEMA Rehearse for the Unthinkable: An Asteroid Strike on Los Angeles
description: Imagine if scientists discovered that an asteroid was hurtling toward Los Angeles.

title: Trump and Xi Jinping, Chinas Leader, Hold Cordial First Phone Call
description: BEIJING  Donald J. Trump has called China a currency manipulator, threatened to impose stiff tariffs on Chinese imports and accused the country of inventing the idea of climate change to hurt American businesses.

title: How Did Donald Trump Win Over So Many Obama Voters?
description: Nate Cohn, The Upshots elections analyst, and Toni Monkovic, an Upshot editor, looked back at the election and posted a lightly edited transcript of their written exchange.

title: At Conference, Political Consultants Wonder Where They Went Wrong
description: DENVER  At the governors mansion here on Friday, past the columned entryway and the French chandeliers, Emmy Ruiz placed a hand on the shoulder of a fellow Hillary Clinton operative. Its like were at a funeral, said Ms. Ruiz, dressed  perhaps coincidentally  in black.

title: Kashmir Is Paralyzed by an Adored Band of Militants
description: TRAL, Kashmir  They hide in the forest, emerging occasionally to lure police officers into villages where they try to kill them with explosive devices. They steal weapons from the security forces. Then they disappear back among the trees.

title: Who Owns the Street in Mexico City?
description: Mexico City  To get about on a bicycle in Mexico City is an experience ranging from complicated to downright scary. The cracked and broken paving makes it torture to ride anywhere, specially if youre constantly dodging hostile cars and trucks. Its frequently said that Mexico City is not Amsterdam. Drivers in Amsterdam share the streets with bicycles and pedestrians as a matter of course; here, it seems we do so because were forced to. Nevertheless, we inhabitants of Mexico City have the same right as any Dutch citizen to enjoy a complete network of bike lanes to get around the city.

title: How Trump Is Good for China
description: SHANGHAI  Perhaps no country has taken more hits from Donald J. Trump than China. During the presidential campaign, Mr. Trump made it sound as if making America great again meant defeating China.

title: Perella Weinberg, Seeking Growth, Acquires a Rival Bank
description: The boutique investment bank Perella Weinberg Partners is taking an ambitious step for growth by buying a fellow bank known for its expertise in the oil patch.

title: Australias Addiction to Coal
description: CANBERRA, Australia  A world determined to limit climate change needs fewer coal mines. Burning coal is the largest single source of greenhouse-gas emissions, and the particles from its combustion are a major cause of air pollution, causing hundreds of thousands of deaths each year.

title: After a Trip Back in Time, Michael Stipe Is Ready to Return to Music
description: In 1991, the members of R.E.M. found themselves celebrating something new: A Top 5 hit. Losing My Religion, a mandolin-driven plaint from the bands seventh album, Out of Time, surpassed Stand as its most successful single and quickly became inescapable. For someone who had no real grand ambitions, to have a song of the summer was possibly the greatest possible gift that I could receive, the singer Michael Stipe said.

title: A Trip to Mars Signals a New Look for National Geographic Channel
description: LOS ANGELES  Over the last year, the National Geographic Channel has turned itself inside out.

title: Jackie Chan and 3 Others Collect Honorary Oscars
description: Jackie Chan was among four Hollywood players to receive honorary Oscars at the Governors Awards during a ceremony in Los Angeles this weekend.

title: 1966: Israelis Seize Town on Border With Jordan
description: JERUSALEM  An Israeli armored battle group backed by jet fighters smashed into Jordan today, captured a border village and attacked two others after clashing with crack Arab troops. It was the most serious Arab-Israeli confrontation since Israels invasion of Sinai in 1956 brought war with the United Arab Republic and triggered intervention by French and British troops.

title: U.S. Torture: Reporting on a Legacy of Ruined Lives
description: Times journalists provide insight into reporting on the human cost of Americas post-9/11 interrogation practices. Susan Lehman is host.

title: Cowboys Ezekiel Elliott Is an Old-Fashioned M.V.P. Candidate
description: When the Dallas Cowboys took Ezekiel Elliott with the fourth pick of the N.F.L. draft in April, there were those who mocked the team.

title: U.S. Torture: Reporting on a Legacy of Ruined Lives
description: Times Insider delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how news, features and opinion come together at The New York Times. In this podcast, Times journalists talk about the reporting they did on a series of articles about the legacy of Americas post-9/11 practices.

title: Vitamin D Linked to Longer Breast Cancer Survival
description: Higher vitamin D levels may be linked to longer breast cancer survival, a new study reports, and the effect is particularly strong among premenopausal women.

title: After Setbacks, Aiming to Go to College and Help Others in Need
description: Carlos Oviedo saw a future of limited options growing up in Lima, Peru.

title: In the Holiday Season, Supporting the Vilified
description: Some of the most forlorn, victimized, scapegoated and voiceless people in the world today are refugees, and that may be even more true in the next four years. So Im thrilled that The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund is expanding to embrace the cause of refugees.

title: A Positive Jam
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Bartlett Houses Pear Rosewater Muffins
description: How to make the new bakery and cafes seasonal breakfast treat.

title: From a Beauty Label to an Upstate Cafe and Bakery
description: The Fresh co-founders Lev Glazman and Alina Roytberg have always infused their skin and body line with food-based ingredients, from antioxidant-rich aa and exfoliating brown sugar to free-radical-fighting fermented black tea. So it should come as no surprise that they harbor culinary ambitions. Weve always dreamed about creating a business directly connected to food, Roytberg says. And now they have, with the recent opening of the kitchen, bakery and cafe Bartlett House, which serves farm-to-table fare, with a focus on local ingredients and sustainable practices.

title: A Question for Uncertain Times: What Do You Still Control?
description: Can I be honest with you for a minute? Ive struggled to write my column this week.

title: A Poll Tax by Another Name
description: Tuscaloosa, Ala.  Many people, of all partisan stripes, are still wondering, How did this happen? The fact is that a very small difference in net votes  around 100,000 votes in Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin  would have turned Hillary Clintons popular vote victory into an Electoral College victory as well. As people try to process what happened on Election Day, we need to consider carefully whether the difficulty of voting in our nations urban centers, in places like Detroit, Milwaukee and Philadelphia, might have played a decisive role.

title: We the People Arent Sure Who We Even Are
description: Who are we? This seems like a good time to ask. How did things get here? How did the country reach this place?

title: Safety Pins Show Support for the Vulnerable
description: The recent presidential election inspired a notable amount of accessorizing, with hats  and T-shirts, as impassioned voters wore their positions on their sleeves (or head or chest). The postelection atmosphere suggests this trend is not slowing down any time soon.

title: A Luxury Condo in a So-So Setting
description: At One Manhattan Square, an 823-foot-high condominium that will nearly abut the Franklin D. Roosevelt Drive, the Extell Development Company hopes that sensational views will help overcome a so-so location.

title: Choose Your Own Memoir
description: Building a memoir, one decision at a time.

title: Trumps Supreme Court List: Ivy League? Out. The Heartland? In.
description: WASHINGTON  When Donald J. Trump issued his final list of 21 potential nominees to the Supreme Court in September, he made a vow. This list is definitive, he said, and I will choose only from it in picking future justices of the Supreme Court.

title: A Cold and Flu Risk Thats a Real Eye-Opener
description: Q. As I commute by train and subway during the cold and flu season, can I cut my risk of infections by breathing through my mouth rather than through my nose?

title: After Election Surprise, Marketers Rethink How to Study Consumers
description: The presidential race was not far from the minds of executives from Americas biggest brands and advertising agencies last month in Orlando, Fla., at the annual conference held by the Association of National Advertisers. The industry leaders had traveled from cities like New York, Chicago and San Francisco, and any political conversation seemed to be premised on the assumption that Hillary Clinton would win.

title: Daily Report: Time to Guard Your Cellphone Number
description: If there is one thing that has caused me regret in last weeks election, it is including my mobile phone number in my voter enrollment form after moving back to California from the East Coast.

title: Conventioneers Add Charity Work to Golf and Speeches
description: On a recent rainy morning, a turquoise charter bus pulled up to a Chester County, Pa., construction site, where two dozen volunteers piled out to pick up hammers and paintbrushes.

title: Trumps Presidency Raises Questions on the Future of Wall St. Regulation
description: Last week, I posed a provocative question on a financial services discussion board: If the expected overhaul of financial regulations proceeds, do we still need to worry about planning for the failure of big financial institutions, including derivatives clearinghouses?

title: How to Stream Video on an Older TV
description: Q. I have an analog television in the kitchen that predates the digital HDTV revolution. Id like to attach an inexpensive streaming device like the Amazon Fire TV Stick to it, but the specifications say an HDMI port is required. Am I out of luck?

title: 2008 | Reince Priebus Predicts Wisconsin Will Go Red
description: First Mention is a Times Insider feature that considers the first appearance of people, places or things in The New York Times.

title: 2016 Likely to Top 2015 as Hottest Year on Record, Scientists Say
description: This year will be very likely the hottest on record, with global temperatures breaking the previous record, set in 2015, scientists with the World Meteorological Organization announced on Monday.

title: Refugees Discover 2 Americas: One That Hates, and One That Heals
description: DUNDALK, Md.  Raad and Hutham Lalqaraghuli are no longer sure which America theyre a part of.

title: Globalism: A Far-Right Conspiracy Theory Buoyed by Trump
description: Donald J. Trumps election victory was powered in part by forceful opposition to what he described as an economic and political system rigged against the American people for the benefit of shadowy forces in the news media, the banks and the government.

title: What to Read About the Big Westworld Reveal
description: Sunday nights Westworld reveal is already generating heaps of discussion. Even for the many viewers who saw it coming, theres plenty to process this morning. Once youve read Scott Tobiass recap, heres a handful of essential pieces on what the new development means, how the series creators and stars conceived the climactic scene, and where the reveal leaves the many fan theories currently in play.

title: In China, One Music Website Is Always No. 1
description: Unchanged for decades, Chinas music scene has been literally rocked in recent years by the internet.

title: Exploring Gender in America
description: Join Susan Chira and Claire Cain Miller, from the Upshot, for a conversation about gender issues around the 2016 election and beyond.

title: Frank Lampard Leaving N.Y.C.F.C.; Steven Gerrard May Also Exit M.L.S.
description: Frank Lampard announced Monday that he would leave New York City F.C. when his contract expires at the end of the year, ending his late-starting and sometimes exasperating two-year M.L.S. tenure.

title: Review: Kathleen Battle Returns to the Met After 22 Years. It Was Worth the Wait.
description: After the bitterness of the soprano Kathleen Battles rift with the Metropolitan Opera in 1994, it looked as if she would never return to the companys stage. That year, Joseph Volpe, then the Mets general manager, in an extraordinarily blunt statement, dismissed her from a production of Donizettis La Fille du Rgiment for unprofessional actions during rehearsals that were profoundly detrimental to artistic collaborations among cast members. She was dropped from the Mets roster for good, it seemed.

title: Trouble Heads for Broadway, With Transfer of The Play That Goes Wrong
description: Plenty of shows go badly on Broadway. But rarely does one do so intentionally.

title: The Pleasure (and Popularity) of Really Short Books
description: You may have noticed them at the register of your local bookseller  very small, handsome paperback books of irregular trim, with plain covers in bold colors. Often stopping short at a breezy 150 pages, they make a point of being concise, and are meant to be dispatched in one or two sittings. As soon as you have finished beginning, you begin ending.

title: Critics See Stephen Bannon, Trumps Pick for Strategist, as Voice of Racism
description: WASHINGTON  A fierce chorus of critics denounced President-elect Donald J. Trump on Monday for appointing Stephen K. Bannon, a nationalist media mogul, to a top White House position, even as President Obama described Mr. Trump as pragmatic, not ideological, and held out hope that he would rise to the challenge of the presidency.

title: Share Your Thoughts, and Questions, About Gender in America
description: Senior correspondent Susan Chira is writing about gender for The New York Times. What should she write about? Share your experiences and questions.

title: 20 Things Donald Trump Said He Wanted to Get Rid of as President
description: Some of the parts of the government that Mr. Trump promised to dismantle if he was elected.

title: Zika Infection in U.S. Is Still Rare So Far, Blood Donations Indicate
description: By the end of this week, all blood banks in the continental United States must begin testing donated blood for contamination with the Zika virus. Many banks are doing so already, and the early results indicate that the country has dodged a bullet  for now.

title: Bon Jovi Earns a No. 1 Album the Old-Fashioned Way: Sales
description: Hit albums and songs on the Billboard charts are now often determined based on their digital popularity on streaming services. But sometimes a No. 1 record happens the old fashioned way.

title: My ProPublica Move: From Blogging and Teaching Back to Deep Digging on Climate
description: To everything (turn, turn, turn), there is a season (turn, turn turn), and a time to every purpose, under heaven, as my departed friend Pete Seeger wrote and sang.

title: Marthas Vineyard, Off-Season
description: You live on Marthas Vineyard year round?

title: Martin Shkreli May Point the Finger at His Lawyers
description: Lawyers are ubiquitous in the business world, advising at every stage, from the formation of a company through its operating stage to its eventual demise, whether by acquisition or perhaps dissolution in bankruptcy. When corporate executives get in trouble, it is common for them to claim that their lawyers said it was permissible to act that way.

title: N.B.A. Schedule: Heres What to Watch This Week
description: In the midst of an eventful week in American life, the N.B.A. never stopped. And were starting to understand some key differences between this season and last season.

title: Gwen Ifill, Political Reporter and Co-Anchor of PBS NewsHour, Dies at 61
description: Gwen Ifill, a groundbreaking journalist who covered the White House, Congress and national campaigns during three decades for The Washington Post, The New York Times, NBC and, most prominently, PBS, died on Monday at a hospice in Washington. She was 61.

title: Britains Latest Export: Uncertainty
description: SUNDERLAND, England  Among the consequences Britain unleashed in voting to abandon the European Union was making Tom Hursts job vastly more challenging.

title: A Concerned Billionaire Develops a Plan for Retirements
description: Early last year, Hamilton E.  James, president of the private equity giant Blackstone, received a bit of a jolt. Mr. James, at 65, was eligible to collect Social Security payments, but when he went to check his benefits, he could not believe what he saw.

title: Poland Exhumes Ex-Presidents Body in Inquiry of 2010 Plane Crash
description: WARSAW  The bodies of Polands former president and his wife were exhumed Monday evening as part of an investigation into an April 2010 plane crash in Russia that killed the couple  after years of speculation, backed by little evidence, that the crash was not an accident.

title: Columbia Suspends Wrestling Season Over Lewd and Racist Text Messages
description: Columbia Universitys wrestling team, which bills itself as the nations oldest intercollegiate program, has had its season suspended by the university while officials investigate text messages sent by team members that included the frequent use of racist, misogynistic and homophobic terms.

title: Where Finance and Technology Come Together
description: The hub of the technology industry is Silicon Valley. In finance, the world capitals have long been London and New York.

title: Portrait of Czar Nicholas II Discovered Beneath Portrait of Lenin
description: On the eve of the centennial of the 1917 October Revolution, restoration experts at the Stieglitz Art and Industry Academy in St. Petersburg have uncovered a double portrait reflecting Russias diametrical history under both Imperialism and Communism: A full-size portrait of Vladimir Lenin from 1924 painted on the back side of a 1896 Imperial portrait of Czar Nicholas II. The portraits will be displayed, on opposite sides of the same canvas, beginning Nov. 29 on a stand in the Stieglitz academys entrance hall.

title: Leon Russell, From Rising to Resurgent
description: Theres some remarkable footage of Leon Russell from late 1970, the year he released his self-titled debut solo album. Taken from an hourlong special, Homewood, originally broadcast on Los Angeles public television, it circulated in bootleg editions for decades before the audio surfaced on CD this year in what appears to be a sanctioned release.

title: Obama Urges Donald Trump to Send Signals of Unity to Minority Groups and Women
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Monday that he had urged President-elect Donald J. Trump to reach out to minority groups, women and others who were alienated by his campaign, during the presidents first news conference since Mr. Trump won the election in a stunning upset that has imperiled Mr. Obamas legacy.

title: Donald Trump Trolled Us All. We Should Learn From It.
description: For more than a year, Americans were glued to their smartphones as Donald J. Trump tweeted and retweeted misogynistic, racist, anti-Semitic and xenophobic speech. It was not a strategy that any digital campaign expert would ever advise. Often, it felt more like a reality-show stunt than a real campaign.

title: After Trumps Win, an Anxious Mexico Asks: Whats Next?
description: MEXICO CITY  Ever since the election of Donald J. Trump to the American presidency, Juan Pardinas, a Mexican academic, has been thinking back to his childhood.

title: Review: Ballet and Modern Dance Meet, and Ultimately Embrace
description: Quite often, a star ballerina, itching to expand her repertory, hires a choreographer from outside of ballet. Quite rarely does anything good arise from such an arrangement. That track record gives the success of the collaboration between Sara Mearns and Jodi Melnick the freshness of a minor miracle.

title: Federal Watchdog Agency Steps Up Inquiry Into Home Contracts
description: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, the nations top consumer watchdog, is stepping up an investigation into seller-financed home sales that target lower-income home buyers unable to get a traditional mortgage.

title: Plans for Uncertain Times
description: What do you do when things dont turn out as you expected?

title: HBO Renews Westworld, Insecure and Divorce
description: And there will be Season 2s.

title: With Odes to Military March, China Puts Nationalism Into Overdrive
description: BEIJING  It took all of five minutes for Wang Lei, a gruff veteran of the Peoples Liberation Army, to start humming and stomping his feet.

title: Samsung Takes Sensible Course in Bid for Harman International
description: Samsung is riding a stallion instead of a unicorn into the driverless revolution. Despite no stated cost savings, the 28 percent premium the Korean electronics group agreed to pay for Harman International, a connected-car supplier, is reasonable. Companies like Google are investing heavily to invent the automotive future as General Motors and others bet on risky start-ups. This deal suggests there are safer ways to play a mega-trend in the making.

title: Ah, Finally, Ancient Clay Tablets for Dessert
description: If you spend your days amid ancient clay tablets with one of the earliest forms of written language, the thought might occur to you: Wouldnt it be fun to bake your own tablets out of gingerbread for the office holiday party?

title: In Michael Chabons Moonglow, Deathbed Stories Illuminate an Era
description: Storytelling matters desperately to Michael Chabons characters. Its a way to remake an unhappy reality and exert control (Werewolves in Their Youth), a means of grappling with personal or historical disaster (The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay), or, in the case of his elegiac and deeply poignant new novel, Moonglow, a tool for connecting the dots of a familys life and making sense of the past.

title: Review: With Good Behavior, Lady Mary Takes a Lowlife Turn
description: Good Behavior, a noirish new series beginning on Tuesday on TNT, about a sultry con artist, has a built-in pitch. See Lady Mary clean a toilet! See her make a crack pipe out of a light bulb! Devout fans of Downton Abbey will want to check it out just for the freak-show appeal.

title: As the Democrats Lick Their Wounds
description: To the Editor:

title: A Radical Feminist Hair Salon With Serious Cool-Girl Cred
description: Johanna Fateman is most famous as a musician  she was the founder, with Kathleen Hanna, of the germinal feminist dance-punk band Le Tigre  but she has always worn multiple hats. A mother, business owner and art critic, Fateman recently picked up the title of New Yorker columnist when the magazine invited her to write regularly for its Goings On About Town section. The majority of my time and mental energy is definitely spent in writing, Fateman says. Of course, Le Tigre will always be something people want to talk about.

title: Sermons on Trump
description: In the days following the election, religious leaders spoke to their congregations and communities about the future with Donald J. Trump as president of the United States.

title: Trumps Choice of Stephen Bannon Is Nod to Anti-Washington Base
description: WASHINGTON  In naming Stephen K. Bannon to a senior White House post, President-elect Donald J. Trump has elevated the hard-right nationalist movement that Mr. Bannon has nurtured for years from the fringes of American politics to its very heart, a remarkable shift that has further intensified concern about the new administrations direction.

title: Ten Things to Know About Californias Iconic Chez Panisse
description: A photographer hung out in corners of Alice Waterss legendary restaurant to create an intimate portrait of life there.

title: U.S. Forces May Have Committed War Crimes in Afghanistan, Prosecutor Says
description: The prosecutor of the International Criminal Court said Monday that she had a reasonable basis to believe that American soldiers committed war crimes in Afghanistan, including torture.

title: Donald Trump, Julian Assange, Gwen Ifill: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Brendan Dassey of Making a Murderer Is to Be Freed While State Appeals Ruling
description: Brendan Dassey, one of two Wisconsin men who were found guilty in 2007 in the sexual assault and killing of a photographer and who were featured in the Netflix documentary Making a Murderer, should be freed from prison while the state appeals a ruling overturning his conviction, a federal judge ruled on Monday.

title: Vast and Pristine, Russias Lake Baikal Is Invaded by Harmful Algae
description: LAKE BAIKAL, Russia  Yury Azhichakov set out early by bike for Senogda Bay, his favorite beach, on the northwestern shore of Lake Baikal in Siberia. The worlds oldest, deepest and most voluminous lake, Baikal holds 20 percent of the planets unfrozen freshwater. It is often described as the worlds cleanest lake.

title: Greece, Seeking Dose of Stability, Is Rattled by Trumps Win
description: PARIS  Before last week, Greece expected that it might benefit from what was supposed to be a triumphal valedictory lap by President Obama as he lands in Athens on Tuesday to kick off his final world tour.

title: Fannie and Freddies Status Continues to Provoke Criticisms
description: The presidential campaign that just ended was notable for a lack of debate about housing  in particular the uneven state of the United States mortgage market nine years since the start of the financial crisis.

title: Health Care Issues Loom in Politics, Payments and Quality
description: The health care industry was unprepared for the presidential victory of Donald J. Trump, and executives at insurance companies and hospital systems are now uncertain what their business is going to look like in the years ahead. A Trump administration, coupled with a Republican Congress, is likely to lead to a reversal of many of the policies put into place by President Obama, and could mean a repeal of his signature health care law.

title: Ryan Phillippe Talks Guns, Stunts and Shooter
description: Ryan Phillippe was so committed to his new show, Shooter, that he was willing to take a flying leap  off a fourth-floor balcony. The actor performed his own stunts in this conspiracy thriller, including a terrifying plunge, in the premiere, from an apartment down onto a car.

title: The Next Generation of Hedge Fund Stars: Data-Crunching Computers
description: Every five minutes a satellite captures images of Chinas biggest cities from space. Thousands of miles away in California, a computer looks at the shadows of the buildings in the images and draws a conclusion: Chinas real estate boom is slowing.

title: An Ecosystems Lifeblood, Flowing Through Gravel
description: MISSOULA, Mont.  They are beautiful, glistening icons of the West, filled with life and history. But there is far more to mountain rivers, scientists are learning, than the water churning between their banks.

title: Venture Capital Firm Navigates Uncharted Course to Success
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Betting on an automated driving start-up in 2015 may not have been the most intuitive gamble at a time when Google and Uber had already declared that self-driving vehicles were among their top research priorities.

title: Same Opera, Different Role: Karita Mattila Returns to the Met
description: Opera does not give its singers many chances to grow up. Unlike stage or film actresses, star sopranos dont necessarily move from playing girls, to women, to mothers, to grandmothers over the course of a career  and certainly not within a single work.

title: Mary Jo White to Step Down as S.E.C. Chief
description: Wall Street regulators began an exodus from Washington on Monday as Mary Jo White, the chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, announced plans to leave the agency.

title: Iran, Spending, Defense: Areas to Watch as Congress Reconvenes
description: WASHINGTON  Congress returns this week to finish the last of its business before a new year and era begin in Washington. Ebullient Republicans are eager to put some remaining legislation behind them and to try to fund the government through the rest of the year. Here are some areas to watch.

title: Review: A Tennis Rivalry That Just Might Sabotage a Friendship
description: At a pivotal moment of a heated tennis match between Brian and Russ, obsessive rivals whose entire season of amateur competition has been building toward this day, an obscenity-spiked command erupts from Brians mouth. Dont you _______ say a word, he barks, all aggression and rage. Instantly and irreparably, the mens relationship implodes.

title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

title: Russian Jet Crashes Off Syria While Trying to Land on Carrier Kuznetsov
description: MOSCOW  A Russian fighter jet crashed off the Syrian coast on Monday while trying to land on an aging aircraft carrier in the Mediterranean, Russian military officials said.

title: A Merger Lawyer Sounds Off on the Short-Term Quest for Profits
description: Martin Lipton, a founding partner of the New York law firm Wachtell Lipton Rosen & Katz, specializes in advising major corporations on mergers and acquisitions. Mr. Lipton, 85, has been instrumental in shaping corporate deal making for decades; he is particularly well known for his efforts to bolster management defenses against hostile takeovers.

title: John Alexander Skeltons Fall Collection
description: The British designer has crafted a unique collection by sourcing vintage fabrics.

title: Person to Know: The Designer Making One-of-a-Kind Pieces From Sustainable Fabrics
description: When it comes to finding inspiration, the designer John Alexander Skelton is more likely to turn to museums and archives than the internet. After all, he got the idea for his MA collection at Central Saint Martins  which earned him the schools prestigious LOreal Prize earlier this year  from the archives of Mass Observation, an extensive anthropological survey in the mid-20th century. The British Library is an amazing resource, Skelton says. I love research because you enter different worlds and its so enriching. Its interesting how intertwined textiles has been with politics and social history.

title: Stephen Bannon and Breitbart News, in Their Words
description: The appointment of Stephen K. Bannon as chief White House strategist for President-elect Donald J. Trump has been condemned by civil rights groups, Democrats and some Republicans, because of Mr. Bannons record as chairman of Breitbart News, the hard-right news and opinion site.

title: How Narendra Modi of India Plans to Wipe Out Black Money
description: MUMBAI, India  In one of the most audacious experiments in Indias modern history, Prime Minister Narendra Modi banned the two largest bills  of 500 rupees, or about $7.50, and 1,000 rupees  which account for about 86 percent of the currency in a country where 78 percent of financial transactions are done in cash.

title: Putin and Trump Talk on Phone and Agree to Improve Ties, Kremlin Says
description: MOSCOW  President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and President-elect Donald J. Trump spoke by telephone for the first time on Monday, agreeing to review what both consider the poor state of relations between the two countries, according to a statement from the Kremlin.

title: Shock Waves a Week After the Vote
description: To the Editor:

title: Climate Protection Advocates Fear a Rollback of Emissions Standards
description: Of all the climate policies the Trump administration has promised to undo, auto emissions standards could be the most consequential.

title: Georgia Father Is Convicted of Murder in Toddlers Death in Hot Car
description: ATLANTA  With local television programming interrupted and a camera trained on the defendants emotionless face, an Atlanta-area father was convicted of murder on Monday for causing the death of his young son by deliberately leaving him in a hot car more than two years ago.

title: Trump, Obama, Gwen Ifill: Your Monday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: When Reportage Turns to Cynicism
description: The election of Donald J. Trump has led to considerable soul searching in the news business, as journalists confront the role we played in his triumph. Much has been written about the billions of dollars of free media coverage Trump received, journalists lapses in challenging his outrageous falsehoods, and our clumsy grappling with how to treat his unconventional candidacy.

title: Neil Walker Accepts Mets Qualifying Offer; Yoenis Cespedes Rejects It
description: Second baseman Neil Walker informed the Mets just before a 5 p.m. deadline on Monday that he would accept a $17.2 million qualifying offer for 2017, a decision that keeps one of the teams two most important free agents in Queens.

title: Marvels Inhumans TV Series Will Arrive via Imax Theaters
description: LOS ANGELES  One of Marvel Entertainments most sprawling superhero mythologies, the Inhumans, is headed to the small screen in a major way.

title: Unprecedented Work Required to Open 2nd Avenue Subway by Years End, Officials Say
description: The Metropolitan Transportation Authoritys race to open the Second Avenue subway by the end of the year will require an unprecedented push by workers, officials said on Monday.

title: What Could Be Worse Than Repealing All of Obamacare?
description: Donald J. Trump made headlines on Friday by saying he would like to keep two components of the Affordable Care Act: allowing young people to stay on their parents insurance until age 26, and continuing the ban on the exclusion of pre-existing conditions by insurers.

title: Ahead of Trump Presidency, Global Investors Sell Bonds and Grab Stocks
description: Global investors have rendered their verdict on Donald J. Trump as president: Sell government bonds and pile into stocks that will benefit the most from a resurgent United States economy.

title: U.K.s Bridge to Trump? Nigel Farage, Who Pushed Brexit, Posits Himself
description: LONDON  Britain has long been anxious about its special relationship with the United States, but after some choice remarks about Donald J. Trump by members of the governing Conservative Party during the presidential campaign, the relationship needs a bit of nurturing. And who better to tend to that, in his own mind at least, than Nigel Farage, the beer-loving commodities-trader-turned-populist-leader of the U.K. Independence Party.

title: Nasdaq Names a New Chief Executive: Adena Friedman
description: Nasdaq on Monday named Adena T. Friedman its new chief executive, in the first changeover at the stock market operator in nearly 14 years.

title: 76 Experts Urge Donald Trump to Keep Iran Deal
description: Seventy-six national security experts urged President-elect Donald J. Trump on Monday to reverse his hostility to the nuclear agreement signed with Iran last year and to use it as a tool to ease other tensions with the country.

title: Israels Right, Cheering Donald Trumps Win, Renews Calls to Abandon 2-State Solution
description: JERUSALEM  Emboldened by the Republican sweep of last weeks American elections, right-wing members of the Israeli government have called anew for the abandonment of a two-state solution to the conflict with the Palestinians.

title: With His Idol Looking On, Kristaps Porzingis Shines in a Knicks Win
description: In the off-season, as the budding star Kristaps Porzingis prepared for his second season with the Knicks, his new coach, Jeff Hornacek, called his Dallas Mavericks counterpart. He wanted to arrange a meeting between Porzingis and Dirk Nowitzki.

title: Dear John: Brooklyn Bridge Discourages Token of Love, With a Smile
description: To some they are emblems of delight, reminders in steel of unbreakable connections. To others they are barnacles encrusting a beloved landmark. They are the so-called love locks, padlocks placed on the Brooklyn Bridge by lovers to signify their bond.

title: NBC Takes Over Thursday Night Football Amid Promising Signs in TV Ratings
description: NBC Sports will take over the Thursday Night Football franchise this week at a suddenly promising point in an N.F.L. season that has seen viewership plummet by double-digit percentages in prime-time games.

title: Google and Facebook Take Aim at Fake News Sites
description: Over the last week, two of the worlds biggest internet companies have faced mounting criticism over how fake news on their sites may have influenced the presidential elections outcome.

title: U.S. Hate Crimes Surge 6%, Fueled by Attacks on Muslims
description: WASHINGTON  The F.B.I. reported Monday that attacks against American Muslims surged last year, driving an overall increase in hate crime against all groups.

title: The Grace of Gwen Ifill
description: Those of us who worked even briefly with the journalist Gwen Ifill, who died on Monday at the age of 61, can attest to her deeply held sense of fairness, the preternatural grace she showed under pressure and the way she kept her composure in the face of both personal and professional slights that would have left many of us breathing fire and brimstone.

title: Colombias Revised Peace Accord
description: Six weeks after Colombian voters narrowly rejected a peace agreement between the government and the countrys largest guerrilla group in a plebiscite vote, President Juan Manuel Santos over the weekend unveiled a revised accord that is a testament to what can be achieved through dialogue and compromise, even in a deeply polarized society.

title: Mayor de Blasio, Seeking Re-election, Secures Backing of 2 Unions
description: In recent weeks, Mayor Bill de Blasio, a Democrat, has shifted into re-election mode, holding campaign events and fund-raisers, using separate Twitter accounts for political talk and mayoral messages.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Im personally offended that you think I would manage a campaign where that would be one of the going philosophies.

title: Bobby Wood and Jozy Altidore Step Forward as U.S. Team Is Set Back
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica  With about 15 minutes remaining in the United States game against Mexico on Friday night, Jozy Altidore settled under a looping pass at the top of the penalty area and, without even needing to look, chested the ball right into the path of Bobby Wood, who turned and whipped a blistering shot that the Mexican goalkeeper beat away.

title: What Donald Trumps Vow to Deport Up to 3 Million Immigrants Would Mean
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trumps promise to deport two million to three million immigrants who have committed crimes suggested that he would dramatically step up removals of both people in the United States illegally and those with legal status. If carried out, the plan potentially would require raids by a vastly larger federal immigration force to hunt down these immigrants and send them out of the country.

title: Donald Trumps Far-Flung Holdings Raise Potential for Conflicts of Interest
description: WASHINGTON  Just a few blocks down Pennsylvania Avenue from the White House sits the Trump International Hotel, one of the newest luxury additions to President-elect Donald J. Trumps real estate empire, and perhaps the most visible symbol of the ethical quandary he now confronts.

title: Billy Miller, Curator and Historian of Fringe Music, Dies at 62
description: Billy Miller, a rock n roll archivist and collector whose record label, Norton, gave new life to forgotten rockabilly artists and garage bands of yesteryear, died on Sunday at his home in Brooklyn. He was 62.

title: Claire Labine, Soap Opera Writer and Co-Creator of Ryans Hope, Dies at 82
description: Claire Labine, a nine-time Daytime Emmy Award winner whose dramatic plots and cliffhanger climaxes kept millions of television viewers returning day after day to Ryans Hope, General Hospital, Love of Life and other soap operas, died on Nov. 8 at her home in Somers, Conn. She was 82.

title: Michael Fulmer and Corey Seager Named Rookies of the Year
description: In Michael Fulmers first full professional season, with the Mets organization in 2012, he learned a changeup from the pitching coordinator Ron Romanick. Fulmer wrapped three fingers around the seams and started making his way up the Mets farm system, but it was not the changeup carrying him.

title: Review: Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812, on the Heels of Hamilton
description: The Imperial Theater, where the rapturous musical Natasha, Pierre & the Great Comet of 1812 blazed opened on Monday night, has never looked more imperial  or felt more intimate. Who would have guessed that Dave Malloys gorgeous pop opera, adapted from a slice of Tolstoys War and Peace, would land on Broadway with all its signal virtues intact, and in some ways heightened?

title: Targets of Close Shaves
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  Sometimes the universe sends you a reminder that there is still pleasure to be had and that miracles occasionally still happen, even in unsure times.

title: Hillary Clinton Wins New Hampshire
description: Hillary Clinton has won New Hampshires four electoral votes, The Associated Press reported on Monday night, nearly one week after she lost the presidential race to Donald J. Trump, the Republican candidate.

title: Rebuilding Our Infrastructure
description: Looking at infrastructure data from different sources provides conflicting pictures of what needs to be done.

title: A Minor Disturbance at the Met
description: Dear Diary,

title: Donald Trump, Barack Obama, Russia: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Giants Edge Bengals as Eli Manning Passes for Three Touchdowns
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  Instead of cheers, a nervous ripple coursed through the crowd at MetLife Stadium. The kicker had not left the sideline. Yes, the Giants were going for it. From the 3-yard line.

title: Edvard Munch Brings $54 Million Amid Thinner Sales at Sothebys
description: One could not help but feel that Helena Newman, the Sothebys auctioneer on Monday night, was almost begging for a bid of more than $50 million for Edvard Munchs 1902 painting Girls on the Bridge.

title: Corrections: November 15, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Whats on TV Tuesday: Good Behavior and Shooter
description: Michelle Dockery does a 180 from her best-known role, Lady Mary in Downton Abbey, to play a con artist who takes up with a hit man in Good Behavior. And Ryan Phillippe steps into Mark Wahlbergs shoes in the USA Networks long-delayed conspiracy thriller, Shooter.

title: Ever Wanted to Back a Start-Up? Indiegogo Opens the Door to Small Investors
description: Armchair venture capitalists will soon have a new place to hunt for intriguing start-ups: Indiegogo, the popular crowdfunding site for developers of creative ventures like movies, games and gadgets.

title: In a Late-Night Move, Russia Arrests a Top Economic Official in a Bribery Case
description: MOSCOW  Russians awoke to an extraordinary scandal on Tuesday with the minister of economic development detained on charges of soliciting a $2 million bribe  the highest-level official arrested in Russia in decades.

title: C.E.O.s Ponder a New Game, With Trumps Rules
description: If you were to look at our game board of all the possible outcomes of the election, this one wasnt even on the sheet.

title: A New Look at August Sanders People of the Twentieth Century
description: The Museum of Modern Art has enlisted scholars and artists to take a deeper look at Sanders ambitious effort to catalog the German people.

title: Hong Kong Court Bars 2 Pro-Independence Politicians From Office
description: HONG KONG  A court in Hong Kong ruled on Tuesday that two pro-independence politicians who inserted an anti-China snub into their oaths of office could not take their seats in the citys legislature, effectively ending a case in which Beijing had taken extraordinary steps to influence politics in Hong Kong.

title: Why Keeping Only the Popular Parts of Obamacare Wont Work
description: Before Obamacare, it could be hard to buy your own insurance if youd already had a health problem like cancer. An insurance company might have decided not to sell any insurance to someone like you. It might have agreed to cover you, but not cover cancer care. Or it might have offered you a comprehensive policy, but at some incredibly high price that you could never have paid.

title: Protect Democracy First
description: The most fragile part of the country right now is our democratic values. Yes, we face other serious problems  the physical condition of our planet, above all. But the fate of those other problems will be decided in the months and years to come. The condition of our democracy is acute.

title: The Life and Example of Gwen Ifill
description: Smartphones change death. When I heard that Gwen Ifill had died on Monday I pulled out my phone and scrolled through the photo album.

title: Steve Turn On the Hate Bannon, in the White House
description: Anyone holding out hope that Donald Trump would govern as a uniter  that the racism, sexism, anti-Semitism and nativism of his campaign were just poses to pick up votes  should think again.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Is in Denial
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C.  Donald J. Trumps supporters were probably heartened in September, when, according to an article shared nearly a million times on Facebook, the candidate received an endorsement from Pope Francis. Their opinions on Hillary Clinton may have soured even further after reading a Denver Guardian article that also spread widely on Facebook, which reported days before the election that an F.B.I. agent suspected of involvement in leaking Mrs. Clintons emails was found dead in an apparent murder-suicide.

title: There Are No Permanent Victories in Politics
description: Arthur Brooks: Hi, Gail. So just when we thought that 2016 couldnt get any more shocking, it did, with a Trump victory. I told you last week that strange happenings were afoot in the universe, what with the Cubs winning the World Series and all.

title: The Spanish Lesson I Never Got at School
description: LOS ANGELES  In the deepest reaches of my brain, there is a boy who speaks Spanish.

title: Should President Obama Pardon Hillary Clinton?
I Was Terrified: Inmates Say They Paid a Brutal Price for a Guards Injury
description: The inmates were just starting their day on July 6 when dozens of corrections officers burst into their dormitory, shouting for everyone to get down on the floor. The raid at Mid-State Correctional Facility, outside Utica, N.Y., officials said, was a surprise search for weapons made urgent after a bloody injury to a guard three days earlier.

title: Breathing and Stress
description: A popular Times article explains how to breathe deeply and slowly to reduce stress.

title: A New Look at August Sanders People of the Twentieth Century
description: When August Sander conceived of the structure of his ambitious portrait series, People of the Twentieth Century, his goal was to document the German people in a way that rejected the eras social divisions. Starting in the mid-1920s and through the rise of Nazism, he became keenly aware that the notion of cataloging a people sometimes took on different meanings.

title: Questions for: We Couldnt Believe Our Eyes: A Lost World of Shipwrecks Is Found.
description: Article: We Couldnt Believe Our Eyes: A Lost World of Shipwrecks Is Found

title: Living With a Hurricanes Devastation
description: More than a month after Hurricane Matthew ripped through parts of Haiti, some residents in the coastal town of Jrmie are still in their broken houses and waiting for aid. Visit the home of a survivor.

title: What Jesse Venturas Minnesota Could Tell Us About Donald Trumps America
description: Do political upheavals happen because voters care or because they dont?

title: The End of the Postracial Myth
description: Pundits are quick to say that it couldnt be about prejudice in states like Iowa, where Obama voters went for Trump. But racial anxiety is always close to the surface  and can easily be stoked.

title: Why Did College-Educated White Women Vote for Trump?
description: A mother and her two daughters in a Pennsylvania town choose a different sort of 21st-century feminism.

title: Were Looking at a New Divide Within the Hispanic Community
description: The Latino vote in Florida upended the Clinton campaigns strategy, and what we thought we knew about where politics is headed.

title: How Do I Comfort My Frightened Son After the Election? I Tell Him How Our People Have Survived.
description: My ancestors in South Carolina, a generation removed from slavery, always knew what their country was capable of.

title: A State That Is of Two Minds
description: A Maine road trip through a land of joy and optimism  and shock and fear.

title: My Mother Saw Danger in This Election. She Crossed State Lines to Try to Stop It.
description: Growing up black in Maryland, I thought of Virginia as the South. Why did my mother go there to volunteer?

title: The New Sheriff in Town
description: A changing of the Republican guard in Ohio.

title: It All Started Here
description: In New Hampshire, where Trump fever took hold in the first primary and never let go.

title: This Land Is Your Land: Reflections From Trumps America
description: Dispatches from various states of the union that show a country at odds with itself.

title: Black Deaths Matter
description: THEY CANT KILL US ALLFerguson, Baltimore, and a New Era in Americas Racial Justice MovementBy Wesley Lowery248 pp. Little, Brown & Company. $27.

title: Jean Kennedy Smith Remembers Growing Up Kennedy
description: THE NINE OF USGrowing Up KennedyBy Jean Kennedy SmithIllustrated. 262 pp. Harper/HarperCollins Publishers. $29.99.

title: Have You Ever Been Told You Couldnt Do Something Because of Your Gender?
description: Has anyone ever told you an activity, award or job was off limits because you were a girl  or a boy? Have you ever been teased or chastised because you dressed or spoke the wrong way for the same reason?

title: Westchester County Gets a New Gun Store, and a Battle of Ideas
description: HARRISON, N.Y.  When Louis Zacchio, a longtime gun enthusiast and hunter, decided to open a gun shop in the downtown business district here, which is dotted with ice cream parlors, karate dojos and pizza places, he figured fellow residents would do a double-take. He never expected an uprising.

title: Trump Transition Nominates No One  But Does Name Inaugural Committee
description: The jockeying for power in the incoming administration of President-elect Donald J. Trump and on Capitol Hill is exposing frayed nerves and lingering anger  but also the seeds of new leadership in both parties.

title: Yemeni Bankers Get in Trouble Over a Customer, Al Qaeda
description: AL SHIHR, Yemen  When fighters from Al Qaeda seized control of a stretch of southern Yemen in 2015, they looted millions of dollars from the central bank, spreading such fear that other banks shut down.

title: Wheres Gonzaga? Butler? Xavier? Blue-Blood Bias Creeps Into Showcases
description: When Duke, Kentucky, Kansas and Michigan State converged on Madison Square Gardens hardcourt on Tuesday night, mens college basketball fans were treated to the first-, second-, seventh- and 13th-ranked teams in the country. The event was a potential Final Four preview, five months early. It was also a vivid reminder that the sport remains an oligarchy.

title: Xi Jinping Wants to Be Comrade. For Gay Chinese, That Means Something Else.
description: BEIJING  To the 90 million or so members of Chinas Communist Party, President Xi Jinping has a message: Dont call me president. Dont call me party secretary.

title: Donald Trump, Stephen Bannon, Gwen Ifill: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Want to Take a Luxury Trip? Booking Sites Enter the Arena
description: Third-party travel booking sites such as Expedia.com and Booking.com are go-tos for travelers in search of wallet-friendly accommodations or deals on packages that include both airfare and a hotel stay. But as sites to book high-end vacations? Not so much  that is, until recently.

title: Gems, Hidden in Plain Sight in Macedonia
description: Every tourist to the Balkans has probably heard about the dramatic remaking of  Macedonias capital, Skopje. Twenty-five years after the country peacefully won independence from the former Yugoslavia, its capital is in the midst of a huge face-lift: the construction of some 40 monuments, sculptures, facades and buildings.

title: Secret Back Door in Some U.S. Phones Sent Data to China, Analysts Say
description: WASHINGTON  For about $50, you can get a smartphone with a high-definition display, fast data service and, according to security contractors, a secret feature: a backdoor that sends all your text messages to China every 72 hours.

title: Biggest Spike in Traffic Deaths in 50 Years? Blame Apps
description: The messaging app Snapchat allows motorists to post photos that record the speed of the vehicle. The navigation app Waze rewards drivers with points when they report traffic jams and accidents. Even the game Pokmon Go has drivers searching for virtual creatures on the nations highways.

title: In Charleston, Coming to Terms With the Past
description: In the spring of 1862, cloaked in the predawn darkness of Charleston Harbor, 23-year-old Robert Smalls stood aboard the C.S.S. Planter, a Confederate transfer and gunboat, and plotted his escape.

title: Morning Agenda: Government Bonds, Mary Jo White, Seller-Financed Home Contracts
description: Sell government bonds and pile into stocks that will benefit from a free-spending Trump presidency. Thats the verdict from global investors at the moment.

title: How (and Why) Maui Got So Big in Moana
description: Nobodys saying Maui, that most rascally of Polynesian demigods, isnt strong. He once beat the Sun into submission with a jawbone and yanked the Hawaiian Islands out from the bottom of the ocean. So yes, Mauis strong.

title: New York Today: Past Protests Against Mr. Trump
description: Updated, 7:12 a.m.

title: Mexico Awaits Trumps Next Move
description: MEXICO CITY  On Nov. 8, this mountain capital was soaked by a ferocious off-season thunderstorm, the type of tempest that can lead to jokes about the Aztec rain god Tlaloc being angry. At the same time, over the Rio Grande, a political storm raged worthy of the deitys fury: The United States elected a president who promised to build a border wall and make Mexico pay for it, deport millions of immigrants and rewrite or rip up a trade deal that Mexico depends on for almost a third of its income. Within hours, an economic storm also seemed to be brewing, with the peso losing value at the fastest rate since the tequila crisis of 1994.

title: Word + Quiz: disheveled
Germany Bans True Religion Muslim Group and Raids Mosques
description: BERLIN  A German organization that calls itself the True Religion and that is known for distributing German-language copies of the Quran was outlawed on Tuesday, after the authorities accused it of recruiting jihadists to fight in Iraq and Syria.

title: Options for Periods Include Cups and Special Underwear
description: Its a great time to get your period.

title: Suns Devin Booker Has a Knowledgeable Workout Guru: His Father
description: PHOENIX  Devin Booker can remember his alarm going off at 4:30 a.m. The idea was to beat the summer heat when he and his father arrived at the beach for their morning workout. So Booker would rub the sleep from his eyes and then go about the unpleasant business of becoming a better basketball player.

title: Weekly News Quiz | Nov. 9-14, 2016
description: Last weeks News Quiz covered an extra day in order to take in the results of Election 2016, and most of you did very well.

title: Dutertes Descent into Authoritarianism
description: MANILA  No Philippine leader since Ferdinand Marcos has held the democratic fate of his nation in his hands so decisively, yet so perilously, as President Rodrigo Duterte.

title: A Chinese Farmers Execution Shows the Pitfalls of Rapid Urbanization
description: BEIJING  The Chinese authorities said on Tuesday that they had executed a farmer convicted of killing a village official after the demolition of the farmers home, despite months of public outcry in sympathy with the farmer.

title: Steve Bannon at the White House
description: In an ominous sign of what the Trump presidency will actually look like, the president-elect on Sunday appointed Stephen Bannon as his chief White House strategist and senior counselor, the Editorial Board writes.

title: Painting the Arab World, From Afar
description: LONDON  Dia al-Azzawi was working at the Iraqi Antiquities Department in Baghdad in the early 1970s when he was assigned to install a new museum building in the northern city of Mosul. The artist and museum administrator spent a year and a half there, scrupulously overseeing the display of antiquities from the nearby archaeological sites of Hatra, Nimrud and Nineveh.

title: California Today: Latino Power Rising
description: Good morning.

title: Jackie Chan: The Fists, the Fury, the Oscar
description: On Saturday, Jackie Chan, a legend in martial arts cinema, finally received an Oscar.

title: Airstrikes on Aleppo Resume as Russia Begins New Offensive in Syria
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Warplanes resumed airstrikes on the besieged rebel-held sections of Aleppo, Syria, on Tuesday, as Russia began a major new offensive against insurgents battling Syrias president, Bashar al-Assad.

title: What a Trump America Can Learn from a Berlusconi Italy
description: MILAN  Good morning! says one of the guards on duty outside the Excelsior Hotel Gallia here, where the United States consulate general is hosting a postelection breakfast. Hardly a good morning, I reply.

title: Twitter Adds New Ways to Curb Abuse and Hate Speech
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Social media companies are under increasing  scrutiny for the amount of hate speech that thrives on their platforms, especially since the presidential election.

title: New York Curator Names Artists for Italian Pavilion at Venice Biennale
description: Giorgio Andreotta Cal, Roberto Cuoghi, and Adelita Husni-Bey will represent Italy at the 2017 Venice Biennale, the Italian Ministry of Cultural Heritage and Activities and Tourism announced on Tuesday.

title: How Germany Soured on Obama
description: BERLIN  When Barack Obama visited here as a senator in 2008, he was greeted by a crowd of 200,000 as a man in the image of John F. Kennedy, who in 1963 assured Berliners  that he was one of them. After eight years of George W. Bush, Mr. Obama seemed to promise not just a course correction, but a new enlightened era in American global leadership. The decision to award him the Nobel Peace Prize at the start of his presidency reflects the Continents initial high hopes that he would prove a more European president.

title: Firings and Discord Put Trump Transition Team in a State of Disarray
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trumps transition was in disarray on Tuesday, marked by firings, infighting and revelations that American allies were blindly dialing in to Trump Tower to try to reach the soon-to-be-leader of the free world.

title: Court in Egypt Overturns Mohamed Morsis Death Sentence
description: CAIRO  One of Egypts highest courts overturned a death sentence imposed on Mohamed Morsi, who was the countrys first democratically elected president and was ousted in 2013 by the military.

title: Rudolph Giulianis Business Ties Viewed as Red Flag for Secretary of State Job
description: WASHINGTON  Rudolph W. Giuliani, facing a flood of questions about whether his business dealings should disqualify him from being named President-elect Donald J. Trumps secretary of state, on Tuesday defended his lucrative 15 years in the private sector as a credential for the job.

title: Trump Campaigns Easy Answers Confront Hard Reality
description: The harvest had just begun when agents from the Immigration and Naturalization Service stormed across the onion fields of Vidalia, Ga., in 1998, sweeping up 21 immigrants who were trudging behind tractors without legal authorization to work in the United States, pulling onions out of the ground for 75 cents per 50-pound bag.

title: The Trump Effect on Tokyo
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan is making an urgent trip to New York this week to meet with the American president-elect, Donald J. Trump. The government in Tokyo is on high alert.

title: 1916: Mexican General Refuses to Free U.S. Spies
description: EL PASO, Tex.  General Francisco Gonzales, Carranzista commander of the Juarez garrison, has refused to release three American prisoners who are being held as spies in that town. The Carranzista leader persists in his refusal in spite of direct demands made by the United States Government.

title: Obama Visits Athens on Last Foreign Trip
description: During his final international tour in office, President Obama visited Athens on Tuesday and reassured leaders that the United States is committed to standing "shoulder to shoulder" with Greece.

title: Ivanka Trump Blurs the Line Between Professional and Political
description: In the week since Donald J. Trumps election as president of the United States, much has been written about the potential conflicts of interest a sitting president with a global business may encounter (among other things).

title: A Reporters Lesson: Giving a Voice to the Ignored
description: Nearly a quarter-century ago, as a junior reporter in our newsroom, I received one of the most significant assignments of my career: writing stories about the many people helped by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: After a Lifetime of Instability, Hoping for a Place to Touch Down
description: Gregory Manson has moved so many times that he struggles to remember all of the dates, the neighborhoods and the family members he has stayed with. There was his stepmother in Canarsie, Brooklyn, a sister in Jamaica, Queens, and his grandmothers apartment in the Farragut Houses in Brooklyn. It is all blended and blurred.

title: Hartford Kicks Open Its Doors to Innovators
description: HARTFORD  After Lelaneia Dubay developed an intolerance for the gluten and chemical additives in many alcoholic beverages, she went looking for a way to salvage her cocktail hour. Already skilled at making cranberry liqueur, which she bottled and gave as gifts at Christmas, she came up with a formula for a lavender liqueur, using sprigs from her garden. When she shared it with friends at a holiday party, their response was emphatic: Get this to market.

title: Everyone Shoots 3s Now. Even Brook Lopez.
description: Brook Lopez is not the stereotypical 3-point shooter. A 7-foot Nets center, he is thought of as a classic inside player, looking to create easy buckets.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Arroz Con Leche
description: Veronica Garcia, who lives in Houston, makes arroz con leche, a creamy and sweet Mexican rice pudding.

title: The American Thanksgiving: Sweeney Potatoes
description: Maura Passanisi, who lives in Alameda, Calif., makes Sweeney potatoes, a cheesy, creamy mainstay of her Irish grandparents Thanksgiving table.

title: Dwayne Johnson, a.k.a. the Rock, Is Peoples Sexiest Man Alive
description: People magazine has named Dwayne Johnson, a.k.a. The Rock, its Sexiest Man Alive for 2016, ushering him into an elite group of physically appealing men that over the years has included George Clooney, Matt Damon and David Beckham.

title: Study Shows Promise for Expensive Cholesterol Drugs, but They Are Still Hard to Obtain
description: If there is one thing decades of studies with tens of thousands of heart disease patients have revealed, it is that lowering cholesterol can reduce the risk of heart attacks and deaths. Now, with new drugs on the market that can plunge cholesterol levels lower than ever thought possible, researchers are eagerly waiting for an answer to the next question: Is there a limit to the benefits in high-risk patients? After a certain point, do benefits level off or even reverse?

title: Leaked Brexit Memo Says U.K. Is Unsure How to Proceed
description: LONDON  The government of Britain could need six more months to settle on a plan for negotiating the countrys exit from the European Union and an extra 30,000 civil servants to deal with the complexities of the task, according to a memo of uncertain parentage leaked to The Times of London on Tuesday.

title: At an Old Racetrack, a New Place to Get Away
description: Much attention has been given in recent years to the small-town charms of New Yorks Hudson Valley, where city folks have been escaping in droves on the weekends. But just a little farther north (about an hour from the town of Hudson itself), Saratoga Springs is starting to get a second glance by urbanites looking for something different. Known primarily for its famous racetrack (home to the Travers Stakes  one of the biggest Thoroughbred horse races in the country), the town also has a surprisingly rich cultural calendar, with a performing arts center that hosts several opera, ballet and symphonic acts throughout the year; and a spectacular collection of perfectly preserved Victorian, Federal and neo-Classical buildings that line its streets.

title: Daily Report: Twitter Addresses Troll Problem. Again.
description: It has been said before but it bears repeating: Twitters biggest problem is Twitter.

title: Times Photographer on How to Look as Dancers Leap
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. In this Q. and A., Andrea Mohin talks about everything from shooting dancers jumps for joy to shooting the breeze with Baryshnikov.

title: Give Children a Safer Searching Experience
description: Q. Children can type sex-related terms into Google and get explicit content, including images. What can be done about this?

title: TsuruTonTan Udon Noodle Brasserie
description: A Japanese chain opens its first United States location in the former space of Union Square Cafe.

title: TsuruTonTan, a Japanese Chain That Knows Its Noodles
description: The news reports filled the city with gloom. From out of a big Manhattan real estate firm had come a change that few locals expected or wanted. Reactions were apocalyptic. There was a shared fear that we were moving in the wrong direction, that the values of our community were being trampled by dark, hostile forces.

title: The Danish Ceramists Beloved by Award-Winning Chefs
description: Meet the artisans making elegant dishes for some of the countrys top restaurants.

title: Expect Medicaid to Change, but Not Shrivel, Under Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  The expansion of Medicaid, a central pillar of the Affordable Care Act, faces immense uncertainty next year, with President-elect Donald J. Trump and top Republicans in Congress embracing proposals that could leave millions of poorer Americans without health insurance and jeopardize a major element of President Obamas legacy.

title: N.F.L. Agrees to Stop Calling for Price Floor on Resold Tickets
description: The N.F.L. agreed not to push its teams to set minimum ticket prices on online ticket exchanges as part of a settlement with several state attorneys general.

title: Visiting Europe, Obama Warns Against Rise of Crude Sort of Nationalism
description: ATHENS  President Obama, in some of his strongest language since Donald J. Trumps election last week, on Tuesday warned against the rise of nationalistic tribalism, apparently a reference to Mr. Trumps decision to appoint Stephen K. Bannon, a hard-right nationalist, to a top position.

title: Presidential Forecast Post-Mortem
description: All models are wrong, the statistician George Box once said. This year was no exception.

title: Trump Won the Election, but 3 Manhattan Buildings Will Lose His Name
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump will not be sworn in for two more months, but as of next week, the big gold letters spelling out his name will be removed from three large apartment buildings on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, tenants were told on Tuesday.

title: Wagamama, Serving Asian-Influenced Dishes, Opens in NoMad
description: WAGAMAMA Its easy to understand why Asian restaurant groups that have come to New York  like Sugarfish from Los Angeles, Ootoya from Tokyo and now Wagamama from London  do not want to be called chains. These places are well designed, with interiors handsomely finished in fine materials. Wagamama, which started in 1992 and has 150 locations worldwide, has opened a two-story space in the NoMad area that seats more than 200, mostly at counters and communal tables. Some seats face the kitchen, though with a no-reservations policy, snaring one may be a challenge. The food, made fresh, is basically Asian, highlighting ramen but also offering soba noodle dishes, donburi rice bowls and curries, which the executive chef of the group, Steve Mangleshot, thinks will have special appeal for New Yorkers. This is the only location where spirits are poured and brunch will be served: 210 Fifth Avenue (26th Street), 212-920-6233, wagamama.us.

title: Exit Poll Oversimplification
description: This election year has often felt like one enormous swarm of poll numbers, vote forecasts and nonstop statistical analysis. And post-election coverage has provided little relief.

title: Probing Worst-Case Environmental Outcomes Under Trump and the G.O.P.
description: I was just interviewed by the English-language France 24 news service, and the video is here:

title: New York Lawmakers Will Not Get Raise, Commission Decides
description: ALBANY  It has been nearly two decades since New York State lawmakers have had an increase in pay, a period that has seen two recessions, three presidents and more corruption scandals than most people can count.

title: The Dream  and the Myth  of the Womens Vote
description: When Victoria Woodhull ran for president of the United States, she couldnt even vote for herself. If the women can be allowed to vote, The New York Herald claimed when Woodhull announced her bid in 1870, Mrs. Woodhull may rely on rolling up the heaviest majority ever polled in this or any other nation. After all, the paper said, women always take the part of each other. The Herald called for passage of a womens suffrage amendment, and then victory for Victoria in 1872.

title: Mourning Its King, Thailand Respectfully Cheers Its Soccer Team to a Tie
description: BANGKOK  Many expected there would be tears at the Rajamangala National Stadium on Tuesday when Thailand played Australia in a World Cup qualifier only a month after the death of the host countrys much-loved king. But it was a little surprising that they came at the end of the 90 minutes.

title: Congressional Republicans Project Unity While Democrats Scramble
description: WASHINGTON  Congressional Republicans, donning Make America Great Again hats on Tuesday, celebrated their impending control of government, sidestepping questions about disarray in President-elect Donald J. Trumps transition efforts while Democrats struggled to unify behind their leadership after a brutal election defeat.

title: Warren Buffett, in a Switch, Warms to Airline Industry
description: Warren E. Buffett beats up on few industries with the regularity he reserves for American airlines.

title: Canada Takes Steps to Address Discriminatory Policies Against Gays
description: OTTAWA  Canadian lawmakers introduced legislation to make the age of consent 16 for all forms of sexual intercourse, one of two overtures the government of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau took on Tuesday to combat a history of discrimination against sexual minorities.

title: As a Noxious Smog Descends, Tehran Tries to Ignore It
description: TEHRAN  This week, as a yellow blanket of smog settled in for what is typically a winter-long stay, Reza Shajiee, a prominent hipster socialite, posted a picture of himself on Instagram wearing a gas mask under his motorcycle helmet. The text reads, My city is better than yours, its air is better than yours, and is accompanied by an emoticon wearing a gas mask.

title: Stream This Documentary About Filmmaker Hayao Miyazaki
description: During the filming The Kingdom of Dreams and Madness, a 2013 documentary about the Japanese animation house Studio Ghibli, the beloved animator Hayao Miyazaki announced he would retire. Now Miyazaki, the creative mind behind Spirited Away, Princess Mononoke and My Neighbor Totoro has announced that he is working on a new film.

title: Russia Begins New Offensive in Aleppo
description: Russia's defense secretary, Sergei K. Shoigu, revealed some details of the renewed military strikes on Syria after a relatively calm few weeks.

title: Old Treaties and New Alliances Empower Native Americans

description: A Brooklyn man was charged with manslaughter on Tuesday in the hit-and-run death of a cyclist in July.

description: Thousands of truckloads of soil were used to fill a sinkhole that swallowed a busy street and left sewage exposed in Fukuoka.

title: Afghanistan Fires 7 From Cabinet in Intensifying Political Crisis

title: Political Divide Splits Relationships  and Thanksgiving, Too
description: WASHINGTON  Matthew Horn, a software engineer from Boulder, Colo., canceled Christmas plans with his family in Texas. Nancy Sundin, a social worker in Spokane, Wash., has called off Thanksgiving with her mother and brother. Ruth Dorancy, a software designer in Chicago, decided to move her wedding so that her fiancs grandmother and aunt, strong Trump supporters from Florida, could not attend.

title: John Kerrys Antarctica Visit Highlights a Continent, and Climate Policies, Under Threat
description: SCOTT BASE, Antarctica  A group of hikers in red parkas approached a half-dozen seals resting on floating sea ice. The leader of the entourage  Secretary of State John Kerry  raised his arms and ordered everyone to halt.

title: Trumps Capitol Hill Problem
description: When thinking about any new president, and the harm or good he might do, we usually begin with his legislative agenda. The achievements that define a presidency often come early, so in the traditional model, a president rides the momentum of electoral success by quickly moving an ambitious agenda through Congress.

description: After spending several years rushing to open their doors on Thanksgiving Day, retailers have been hit with a dose of reality: It may not be worth it.
