Musicians who excel in the personal, odd-numbered statements are often challenged, relatively speaking, by the formalistic, even-numbered works.

title: Review: Search Party Turns Up Clueless Sleuths of Brooklyn
description: In a television season full of nonconformist new comedies, TBSs Search Party, beginning Monday, is one of the odder ducks.

title: Heng on Democracy in Hong Kong
description: Beijings unilateral move to block two politicians from taking their seats in the Hong Kong Legislature is seen as an attempt to silence democratic voices.

title: Review: Marathon: The Patriots Day Bombing Focuses on the Struggle to Recover
description: Survivor documentaries are common, and many come with a triumph-over-adversity element that might make viewers tingle at the resilience of the human spirit. Marathon: The Patriots Day Bombing, airing Monday night on HBO, is no exception.

title: Laurent Hilaire Named Artistic Director of Stanislavsky Ballet
description: Laurent Hilaire, a former Paris Opera Ballet star dancer, who has been a contender for the artistic director job at both that company and La Scala Ballet, finally has a company to call his own. The Stanislavsky and Nemirovich-Danchenko Moscow Music Theater announced on Sunday that Mr. Hilaire would become artistic director of its 120-member ballet company on Jan. 1.

title: Luciano Benetton Presents Art Collection in China
description: BEIJING  More than 30 years ago, the United Colors of Benetton released a series of provocative advertisements about race and multiculturalism. But in recent years, Luciano Benetton, 81, the co-founder of that Italian apparel company, has sought a different medium through which to promote his feel-good, internationalist ideals: art.

title: Richard Rortys 1998 Book Suggested Election 2016 Was Coming
description: Three days after the presidential election, an astute law professor tweeted a picture of three paragraphs, very slightly condensed, from Richard Rortys Achieving Our Country, published in 1998. It was retweeted thousands of times, generating a run on the book  its ranking soared on Amazon and by days end it was no longer available. (Harvard University Press is reprinting the book for the first time since 2010, a spokeswoman for the publisher said.)

title: Review: Innocuous Remarks Double as Cutting Commentary in Abigails Party
description: Abigails Party may be the most uncomfortable comedy in New York right now, and Id sit through it again in a second. Here, humor and unpleasantness are intertwined, and that leads to laughs  many, many laughs  that are part gleeful and part appalled.

title: Jessica Chastains Miss Sloane Echoes Campaign Rhetoric
description: In the new political drama Miss Sloane, Jessica Chastains titular lobbyist explains how to win in Washington. You have to play your last trump card, she says, right after your opponents play their last trump card.

title: Review: Ballet Hispanico Adds Style and Bounce to an Apollo Homecoming
description: Eduardo Vilaro, the artistic director of Ballet Hispanico, looked out from the Apollo Theater stage and told the excited crowd, This is home. Since 2011, his company has appeared at that Harlem theater annually around this time of year, and these performances have offered the best expression of how Mr. Vilaro, at the helm since 2009, has been maintaining and transforming this 46-year-old troupe. The show on Friday evening continued that tradition. While not quite living up to the claims of reinvention and originality in the printed program, it was a festive affair with excellent dancing.

title: How an Extreme Underdog Wins
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  John Lieb is back, and his Monday puzzle has a theme element that cannot be reproduced in the online versions or the apps. If you are a print solver, however, you will see a bonus theme feature, which I discuss below. If not, this is still a very smooth and enjoyable Monday solve.

title: Anthem-Cigna Proposed Deal Goes to U.S. Federal Court
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week.

title: Mondays N.F.L. Matchup: Houston Texans (6-3) vs. Oakland Raiders (7-2)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN

title: American Music Awards Red Carpet 2016
description: See what celebrities wore to one of musics biggest award shows.

title: Indian Business Partners Hope to Exploit Their Ties to Donald Trump
description: PUNE, India  It is a daunting proposition to put $2 million apartments on the market in Pune  a quiet industrial city in the west of India, where even the fanciest neighborhoods are lined with squat housing blocks.

title: American Music Awards Red Carpet 2016
description: See what celebrities like Gigi Hadid, Selena Gomez, Taraji P. Henson and more wore to one of musics biggest award shows.

title: Forget Filling Ad Breaks; Some Marketers Make the Podcasts
description: FOR a brand seeking to reach the podcast-listening public, there is one thing better than sponsoring a hit series: creating your own. General Electric pulled it off last year with its quaintly named GE Podcast Theater. Its eight-part science-fiction thriller The Message, produced with the Panoply podcasting network, hit No. 1 on the iTunes podcast chart and had nearly five million downloads.

title: Microsoft Spends Big to Build a Computer Out of Science Fiction
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Microsoft is putting its considerable financial and engineering muscle into the experimental field of quantum computing as it works to build a machine that could tackle problems beyond the reach of todays digital computers.

title: Milt Okun, Who Turned John Denver Into a Pop Star, Dies at 92
description: Milt Okun, a producer and arranger who helped turn acts as diverse as Peter, Paul and Mary, John Denver and Plcido Domingo into pop sensations, and who founded Cherry Lane Music Publishing, one of the worlds largest independent music publishers, died on Nov. 15 at his home in Beverly Hills, Calif. He was 92.

title: The Penguins Steady Ascent Shows the Way for the Rest of the N.H.L.
description: Sidney Crosby had three weary Islanders right where he wanted them early in overtime on Friday at Barclays Center.

title: As U.S. Soccer Weighs Jurgen Klinsmanns Future, He Says, Im Not Afraid
description: Jurgen Klinsmann, whose status as coach of the United States mens national team is under intense scrutiny, said Sunday night that he was very comfortable with his position and that he believed those calling for him to be fired were being disrespectful and ignoring the facts about his tenure as the teams leader.

title: The Future of Health Care Mergers Under Trump
description: The proposed health insurance mega-merger between Anthem and Cigna heads to court on Monday, as the companies face off against a Justice Department seeking to block their $48 billion deal. It will be followed in just a few weeks by the trial for another proposed insurance mega-merger, between Aetna and Humana.

title: Trump, Though Critical of Nuclear Deal, Could Offer Opportunities for Iran
description: TEHRAN  At first blush, the election of Donald J. Trump would seem to be bad news for Iran. But there is a chance that on balance, things could work out surprisingly well for the clerics.

title: The Old Ways Are Sometimes the Only Ways
description: Dear Diary,

title: Estonias New Premier Comes From Party With Links to Russia
description: TALLINN, Estonia  Juri Ratas, the new leader of a party whose strongest support comes from the countrys ethnic Russians, has been named the next prime minister of Estonia.

title: Knicks Patch Things Up, Then Fix Some Problems Against the Hawks
description: The Knicks came together Saturday for a team meeting, which offered them an opportunity to air their grievances. Although they had played only 12 games, their patchy start had left them in need of introspection.

title: Nicolas Sarkozy Is Out as Franois Fillon Takes Surprise Lead in French Primary
description: PARIS  A taciturn, tradition-minded former prime minister, Franois Fillon, emerged as the surprise front-runner in the first round of presidential primary voting among center-right candidates in France on Sunday, advancing to the second round next week against another former prime minister, Alain Jupp, who came in second.

title: Perseverance Pays Off for Andre Ward, an Old Hand and a New Champion
description: LAS VEGAS  The lights were back on at T-Mobile Arena. The ring ropes had been taken down, cables for the vast broadcast apparatus had been disconnected, and almost all of the crowd, announced at more than 13,000, had cleared out.

title: How to Avoid Drug Testing in Russia: Radio Silence and Secure Perimeters
description: GLASGOW  Russian athletes, under intense scrutiny after revelations of widespread doping, remain elusive to antidoping authorities, failing to provide updates on their whereabouts and training inside military areas that are inaccessible to drug-testing officials, according to the global watchdog for sports doping.

title: Mark Zuckerberg and Facebook Must Defend the Truth
description: Friday night, the Facebook co-founder Mark Zuckerberg went on his vast social network to convince an expanding chorus of critics  including the departing president of the United States  that he honest-to-goodness wants to combat the fake news that is running wild across his site and others, and turning our politics into a paranoiac fantasy come to life.

title: Many in Milwaukee Neighborhood Didnt Vote  and Dont Regret It
description: MILWAUKEE  Four barbers and a firefighter were pondering their future under a Trump presidency at the Upper Cutz barbershop last week.

title: What You Didnt Know About Things That Go In Your Mouth
description: In 1933, in the midst of the Great Depression, President Franklin Delano Roosevelt sat down to a meal that cost less than 8 cents. The first lady, Eleanor Roosevelt, wanted to provide an example for hungry Americans, to demonstrate how a family could survive on a pittance. It was a carefully chosen combination of calories and nutrients. The meal marked the start of the first government program that distributed food to the hungry.

title: Phil Jackson Perches Atop the Knicks, and a Soapbox
description: Like the guy behind you in a theater, chattering away during a movie, Phil Jackson seems to have lost the ability to hear himself.

title: Melania and Barron Trump Wont Immediately Move to White House
description: President-elect Donald J. Trumps wife, Melania, and their 10-year-old son, Barron, will not immediately move to the White House after Mr. Trump takes office in January, out of concern for uprooting Barron in the middle of the school year, transition officials said on Sunday.

title: Jimmie Johnson Ties Record With Seventh Nascar Championship
description: HOMESTEAD, Fla.  Jimmie Johnson pulled off an improbable last-place-to-first-place drive in Sundays Nascar Sprint Cup season finale at Homestead-Miami Speedway to claim a record-tying seventh series championship.

title: On These French Ski Slopes, Youre on Your Own
description: LA GRAVE, France  As I lowered myself by rope down a 100-foot cliff into Trifides 1, a marquee ski run here, I remembered the words of the mountain guide Joe Vallone: Skiing in La Grave will change your life.

title: Dallas Stares Down a Texas-Size Threat of Bankruptcy
description: DALLAS  Picture the next major American city to go bankrupt. What springs to mind? Probably not the swagger and sprawl of Dallas.

title: In Amsterdam, the Story of Jewelrys Beginnings
description: The story of jewelrys beginnings was told in a 75-item exhibition at the Sieraad International Jewelry Art Fair Nov. 10-13 in Amsterdam.

title: Donald Trumps Swamp Gets Murkier
description: Now that he is president-elect, Donald Trumps anti-corruption promise to drain the swamp of Washington lobbyists and powerful insiders seems to be rapidly dissolving in the swamp itself. An untold number of lobbyists and special interest players have been helping the Trump teams transition to the White House, their path made easier, according to news reports, by vague and porous ethical standards.

title: Alt-Right Gathering Exults in Trump Election With Nazi-Era Salute
description: WASHINGTON  By the time Richard B. Spencer, the leading ideologue of the alt-right movement and the final speaker of the night, rose to address a gathering of his followers on Saturday, the crowd was restless.

title: In Lebanon, a Jeweler Modernizes a 19th Century Setting
description: As a boy in Beirut, Lebanon, Selim Mouzannar roamed the incense-scented halls of the souk, where members of the citys Christian community ran its hundred jewelry workshops  Mr. Mouzannars father and grandfather among them.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: America was until this last generation a white country designed for ourselves and our posterity. It is our creation and it belongs to us.

title: Aleppo Bombs Leave Quarter Million Living in Hell and Without Hospital Care
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The remaining hospitals on the rebel-held side of Aleppo, Syria, have been badly damaged and forced to stop providing care amid an intensifying bombardment, according to the World Health Organization.

title: Custom Jewelry, Mini Size
description: Tarang Arora, president of Amrapali Jewels, described how he pored over a set of charcoal and colored pencil sketches of an anklet and a headpiece for an 11-year-old girl. He said it was late, well past store hours, and his many workers, including 12 designers, had left the 3,500-square-foot showroom for the day.

title: Deciphering Jewels From the Maghreb
description: PARIS  A couple visiting Morocco in the 1970s gave in to the temptation of the Marrakesh bazaar and bought a silver brooch, never dreaming that the purchase would lead to many more over the years in other North African souks or from dealers in Paris. Now, the collection of the Swiss couple, Jean-Franois and Malou Bouvier, is being shown for the first time at Wearable Treasures: Jewelry and Accessories, an exhibition through Jan. 8 at the Institute of the Arab World in Paris. The museums director, Eric Delpont, spoke recently about the exhibition curated by Djamila Chakour. This interview has been condensed and edited.

title: Opportunities Create Quite a Wild Month for Bangkok Jewelers
description: The second half of 2016 has been busy  and especially globe-trotting  for Kavant & Sharart.

title: At De Grisogono, Its All Gems and Glamour
description: Fawaz Gruosi, founder and owner of the luxury jewelry and watch maker De Grisogono, flashed a ready smile as the last security door opened on Level 1 of the company headquarters outside Geneva, a bunker-style atelier where watchmakers, designers, gem setters and marketers work in a cluster of white-walled labs and offices.

title: Many Insured Children Lack Essential Health Care, Study Finds
description: Margo Solomon has health insurance for herself and her four children.

title: Rally in Brooklyn Park Condemns Swastikas and Go Trump Graffiti
description: On Friday, swastikas and the words Go Trump were discovered in graffiti on a jungle gym in Brooklyn Heights. By Sunday, the scrawl had been erased and in its place was a pile of marigolds, chrysanthemums and tiny paper hearts as a rally echoed across the playground, condemning the failure of President-elect Donald J. Trump to address a rash of hate crimes linked to his name.

title: Wedding Gold
description: Traditional Emirati jewelry is regaining favor among young brides.

title: In the Emirates, Traditional Wedding Jewelry is Back in Style
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  Tassels hung from the disc-like headpiece, called a tassa, tinkling like wind chimes when they touched and looking something like a golden waterfall, interspersed with pearls and flashes of red and green stones. The pearls are real, and important gems, Ayesha Al Khoori, 25, said  but the stones, she added with a smile, dont have to be real, because no one cares about these.

title: Review: A Thoroughly Modern Sweet Charity Who Abandons Hope
description: In keeping with the dominant mood of New York City these days, the dance hall hostess known as Charity Hope Valentine has finally shed her middle name. As compellingly portrayed by Sutton Foster, in an archetype-shattering performance, the title character of the 1966 musical Sweet Charity has never before seemed so hopeless.

title: The Walking Dead Season 7, Episode 5: Maggie Takes Charge
description: On Sunday! Sunday! Sunday! The Walking Dead unveiled its unconventional new treatment for abruptio placentae: A monster truck rally.

title: Patricia Kutteles, Driven by Tragedy to End Dont Ask, Dont Tell, Dies at 67
description: Patricia Kutteles, whose relentless efforts helped reverse the militarys dont ask, dont tell policy a decade after her son was beaten to death by a fellow soldier who presumed he was gay, died on Nov. 14 in Kansas City, Mo. She was 67.

title: Insecure Season 1, Episode 7: Whos Daniel?
description: Nearly every woman I know has had a friend breakup that left a mark. In many ways, the endings of these decade-spanning friendships haunt us more than the romantic ones.

title: The Affair Season 3 Premiere: Tough Times for Noah
description: Welcome back, ladies and gentlemen, to the mishegas that never ends! The Affair embarked on its third season Sunday night on Showtime, and Im looking forward to sharing another 10 weeks (down from last seasons 12) of the shows special brand of crazy with our loyal cadre of commenters and kibitzers.

title: $10 Million Contract Details Cost of Defending Mayor de Blasio in Inquiry
description: Inside New York Citys Law Department, the case is named Matter No. 2016-013018. It goes by an even more mysterious title in the citys $10 million contract with outside criminal defense lawyers: John Doe Investigation.

title: Angela Merkel, Donald Trump, Andy Murray: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: No. 1 Duke Hands Rhode Island Its First Loss
description: Luke Kennard scored 24 points on Sunday to lead No. 1 Duke to the title at the Hall of Fame Tip-Off Tournament with a 75-65 win over No. 21 Rhode Island in Uncasville, Conn.

title: Corrections: November 21, 2016
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Whats on TV Monday
description: With Search Party, TBS conjures up a dark comedy for millennials, including the way its watched. Marathon: The Patriots Day Bombing follows some of those injured in the 2013 terrorist attack at the Boston Marathon. And Raised by Wolves begins a second season of mayhem.

title: Dont Blame Pharmaceutical Companies
description: To the Editor:

title: Westworld Season 1, Episode 8: Maeve Plays God
description: With the few fragments of brain we have left this deep into the first season of Westworld, let us try once again to remember the source of Jonathan Nolan and Lisa Joys series, the starting point of the maze in which we currently find ourselves. Because for as much as Michael Crichton tried to suggest the dangers of technology and the hubris of resurrecting a world lost to history, his original Westworld was also a diverting piece of genre entertainment. Mr. Crichton always wanted to advance big, alarmist ideas  about viral plagues, about Japanese business tactics, about the true nature of sexual harassment  but his instinct for pleasing his audience is why he had a career as a best-selling author, rather than another penniless purveyor of hard sci-fi.

title: Bleak Mysteries in Australias Outback
description: Matthew Abbotts large-format photos of the outback have an eerie, bleak quality, with imperfections from dust and grime only adding to the mystery.

title: The Harvard Square Kiosk
description: To the Editor:

title: Policing Flint
description: As filmmakers, weve always been interested in exploring different mediums to combine intimate, character-driven stories with a strong sense of place. We employed this approach while making our first feature documentary, T-Rex, about the two-time Olympic gold medal boxer Claressa Shields, who is a native of the once thriving, now struggling, city of Flint, Mich. After spending four years in the city and getting to know its residents, we felt there was more that needed to be told about the challenges Flint is confronting. So last fall, we began production on an episodic documentary series about an institution at the core of the city, the Flint Police Department.

title: Violence in Prison
description: To the Editor:

title: Its Time to Take Action Against Distracted Driving
description: To the Editor:

title: A Dreamers Deportation Nightmare
description: PORTAGE, Ind.  I was working the night of the election  helping ship merchandise to convenience stores around Indiana  so I kept up on the news by texting a friend. Should I worry? I asked around 10 p.m. Not yet, he said. An hour later, the response had changed: Pressing the worry button now. I got off work at midnight, and listened to the radio as I drove home. It was by then Nov. 9, and the election was coming to an end. But it didnt hit me until I saw my mom.

title: A Foolish Power Grab in Congo
description: Joseph Kabila, the president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, is the latest power-hungry leader to try to extend his rule beyond his elected term, which ends next month. His obstinacy is putting an already battered country at risk.

title: A Spotlight on Torture at Guantnamo
description: To the Editor:

title: Build He Wont
description: Steve Bannon, Donald Trumps chief strategist, is a white supremacist and purveyor of fake news. But the other day, in an interview with, um, The Hollywood Reporter, he sounded for a minute like a progressive economist. Im the guy pushing a trillion-dollar infrastructure plan, he declared. With negative interest rates throughout the world, its the greatest opportunity to rebuild everything.

title: Trump: Making America White Again
description: This may well be the beginning of the end: the early moments of a historical pivot point, when the slide of the republic into something untoward and unrecognizable still feels like a small collection of poor judgments and reversible decisions, rather than the forward edge of an enormous menace inching its way forward and grinding up that which we held dear and foolishly thought, as lovers do, would ever endure.

title: A Retreat From TPP Would Empower China
description: The limits of President Obamas ability to reassure the world about Americas future role in the international sphere was apparent at the summit meeting of Asia-Pacific leaders in Lima, Peru, on Sunday. There is no way to ease the concerns of those leaders about Americas retreat from the 12-nation Trans-Pacific Partnership trade pact, a casualty of anti-globalization fervor, American politics and, in particular, the objections of President-elect Donald Trump, who has called it a disaster.

title: Finding Hope in the Flint Police Department
description: Flint, Mich.  I joined the Flint, Mich., police force nearly 20 years ago because I believed I could make a difference. Police officers are problem solvers. But sometimes it seems as if the problems have no end. How can a city fall so far that we lose sight of the possibility of solutions?

title: There Is No Such Thing as Nonconsensual Sex. Its Violence.
description: Well before the election of Donald J. Trump, the mainstreaming of misogyny during his campaign caused justified outrage and fear. Now, with the alarming reality of his coming presidency and his choices for a number of cabinet posts, that fear has been multiplied among the nations vulnerable, and those who stand to defend their most basic rights.

title: Bayou Shipyards Race Political Clock to Build New Yorks Ferries
description: BAYOU LA BATRE, Ala.  In a busy boatyard in this Gulf Coast capital of shrimping, more than 100 laborers have been putting in long hours shaping and welding a set of shiny, silver hulls  not for fishing trawlers, but for New York Citys new fleet of commuter ferries.

title: Bleak Mysteries in Australias Outback
description: Its amazing how quickly the landscape changes, driving from Sydney and over the mountains, Matthew Abbott, an Australian photographer, said. Suddenly, its all dust and dryness.

title: Gender Colors Outrage Over Scandal Involving South Koreas President
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A popular South Korean singer, Lee Seung-chul, recently posted on Twitter what he called a sad joke that reflected public outrage over a scandal involving the countrys president, Park Geun-hye.

title: The Identity Politics of Whiteness
description: Three years ago, I read Adventures of Huckleberry Finn to my daughter. She smiled as she heard about Hucks mischief, his jokes, his dress-up games, but it was his relationship with the runaway slave Jim that intrigued her most. Huck and Jim travel together as Jim seeks his freedom; at times, Huck wrestles with his decision to help. In the end, Tom Sawyer concocts an elaborate scheme for Jims release.

title: Glenn Beck Is Sorry About All That
description: Youve recently been talking a lot about wanting to warn liberals, based on your experience, now that Donald Trump is president-elect. I dont imagine that many liberals listen to your show, but here you are on the back page of The New York Times Magazine. Here is your liberal audience. What do you want to say to them? Please be better than I was. Please learn from my mistakes. Lets just take it from 2000: George W. Bush was called an idiot, among other things. It got so bad that Republicans and conservatives just stopped listening to the media, because we made everything about jingoism. And so what happened? The pendulum swung back so far the other way that the next guy who was elected president offered hope and change, but all a lot of people saw was that he, for a while, wasnt wearing a flag pin. They stopped listening to people on the left. Now were here in crazy town. What we need now is for reasonable people to sit down with each other and say: O.K., your guy wasnt the end of the world. My guy wasnt the end of the world. How can we talk to each other?

title: The Passion of Martin Scorsese
description: Aman was on a train in Japan, reading a novel set in Japan. The train slid past the mountains, bound for Kyoto, where the man, bearded, bright-eyed, was headed. The year was 1989. The train was a bullet train.

title: Reince Priebus, Normalizer in Chief
description: Ten days removed from the still-fresh shock of Donald Trumps election, around lunchtime on a Friday, I navigated the jagged lines of steel barriers, police officers and Secret Service battalions with big dogs and big guns surrounding Trump Tower. The glass-and-marble shopping mall, tourist trap and TV set had been transformed into the unlikely plotting ground for the nations immediate future. It was anybodys guess what was taking shape inside the gilded bunkers. Clots of media people, passers-by and protesters crowded the lobby and nearby streets for the occasional clue, or at least glimpses of Marla Maples and Prime Minister Shinzo Abe of Japan. Kellyanne Conway posed for a selfie with a few lucky cops.

title: A List of Priorities From Trump, and Kris Kobach Tips His Hand
description: With Thanksgiving approaching, the transition team is putting the last touches on President-elect Donald J. Trumps national security leadership even as Mr. Trump pivots to his domestic and economic policy cabinet posts. One visitor to Trump Tower on Monday is of note: a Democrat, Representative Tulsi Gabbard of Hawaii. Another, Secretary of State Kris Kobach of Kansas, let the world see part of his plans for the Department of Homeland Security.

title: White Nationalism, Explained
description: A question has been posed in a puzzled whisper in many of the nations living rooms and newsrooms ever since Donald J. Trumps triumph in this months presidential election: What, exactly, is white nationalism?

title: Medical Marijuana Is Legal in California. Except When Its Not.
description: SANTA ROSA, Calif.  Californias multibillion-dollar marijuana industry, by far the nations largest, is crawling out from the underbrush after voters opted to legalize cannabis in this months election. In Sonoma County alone, an estimated 9,000 marijuana cultivation businesses are operating in a provisional gray market, with few specific regulations, and are now looking to follow the path of the wine industry, which emerged from its own prohibition eight decades ago and rose to the global prominence it enjoys today.

title: Dead Before the Fire Even Came Through
description: Trees hit by drought and disease are contributing to a longer, more extreme forest fire season in California.

title: Telescope That Ate Astronomy Is on Track to Surpass Hubble
description: GREENBELT, Md.  The next great space telescope spread its golden wings this month.

title: Cocka-Tools
description: Cockatoos can make simple tools out of a variety of materials, like bamboo and even cardboard.

title: Figaro, the Toolmaking Cockatoo
description: The Goffins cockatoo is a smart bird, so smart it has been compared to a 3-year-old human.

title: In One Avid Collectors Home, a World of Wonder
description: Brian Sawyer's West Village aerie is layered with treasures fine and feathered.

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | Nov. 21, 2016
description: Updated: Nov. 23, 2016

title: Islamic State Again Strikes at Afghan Shiites, Killing at Least 30 in Kabul
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  A suicide bomber struck a crowded gathering of Shiite Muslims in the Afghan capital on Monday, officials said, killing at least 30 people in the latest assault against religious minorities here to be claimed by militants loyal to the Islamic State.

title: Donald Trump, Aleppo, Kanye West: Your Monday Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Damascus Diary: A Syrian City Filled With Life, and Hints of Brutal Death
description: There is always a rush of tension and excitement driving into Damascus, a city inhabited for thousands of years, where cultures and influences have mixed and accumulated like coral on a reef.

title: New York Today: A Busy Time for Butchers
description: Updated, 10:11 a.m.

title: Morning Agenda: Dallas Bankruptcy Threat, Italys Crisis, Change in the Air
description: The scenario: elected officials promising workers nice pensions based on wishful thinking. Sound familiar?

title: Word + Quiz: colossus
Questions for: Hamilton Casts Appeal to Pence Ignites Showdown With Trump
description: Article: Hamilton Casts Appeal to Pence Ignites Showdown With Trump

title: How Have People at Your School or in Your Community Reacted to the Presidential Election?
description: In todays article, youll read about a turbulent week of tears, fury and demonstrations at an Iowa high school.

title: Lets Say Obamacare Is Repealed. What Then?
description: The election of Donald J. Trump gives the Republicans in Congress a chance to act on their often-stated desire to get rid of Obamacare, a wish that Mr. Trump mostly says he shares. Aaron E. Carroll and Austin Frakt, the health policy analysts for The Upshot, discuss: Then what?

title: Should the President Be Able to Block You on Twitter?
Why U.K. Is Struggling to Find the Path to Brexit
description: LONDON  A recently leaked memo from a consultancy firm has highlighted cabinet divisions over Britains withdrawal from the European Union, while suggesting that the government may need six additional months to settle on a plan and to recruit tens of thousands of extra civil servants.

title: California Today: More Than 100 Million Trees Are Dead. What Now?
description: Good morning.

title: Identity Politics and Its Defenders
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive more briefings and a guide to the section daily in your inbox.

title: Fashion Begins to Speak Out About Dressing and Covering the Trumps
description: American fashion is emerging from its shellshocked postelection state and is beginning to wrestle with how it is going to handle the advent of Donald J. Trump as the 45th president of the United States. And just like everything else affected by the recent vote, a great divide has opened up.

title: Philippines to Declare Marine Sanctuary in South China Sea
description: HONG KONG  Philippine officials said Monday that President Rodrigo Duterte planned to declare a marine sanctuary and no-fishing zone at a lagoon within Scarborough Shoal, a reef China seized in 2012.

title: From Elton John, Photographys Greatest Hits
description: Elton John famously collects eccentric eyewear. He is less widely known as a collector of photography  and yet the singer-songwriter owns close to 8,000 pieces dating from 1910 to the present.

title: Pope Francis Extends Priests Ability to Forgive Abortion
description: VATICAN CITY  The Roman Catholic Church will allow priests throughout the world to grant absolution for abortion, the Vatican said on Monday, making permanent a policy that Pope Francis announced a year ago.

title: Instagram Introduces New Features That Mimic Twitter and Snap Tools
description: SAN FRANCISCO  For the last six years, Instagram has been a repository for users most picturesque moments. But 2016 has been a year of reinvention for the photo-sharing social network, which has broadened what it lets people do with their images.

title: Londons New Design Destination
description: Its been a busy year for Londons design world. Fall marked the citys inaugural Design Biennale, and now the Design Museum is entering an ambitious era in its new home on Kensington High Street, on the edge of Holland Park. The interior of the former Commonwealth Institute building, reimagined by John Pawson, will triple the museums exhibition space. Despite the soaring, vast scope of the space (crowned with a dramatic paraboloid roof), Pawson aimed to create a welcoming environment. I used lots of warm wood and made sure there were benches and seating areas to encourage people to stay for a while.

title: Special Diets Can Heighten Tensions at the Holiday Dinner Table
description: Lisa Yates has a 13-year-old who cannot eat nuts and an 18-year-old who will not eat gluten. When the family hops on a train on Thursday to visit relatives for Thanksgiving, Ms. Yates will be carrying nut-free chocolate, gluten-free banana bread and two containers of stuffing  a nut-free version and a gluten-free version.

title: Raising 5 Sons Alone, 3 With Autism, Takes a Toll on a Mothers Body
description: Though Melissa Ferrer moved into her new home in July, she has refused to paint her sons bedroom walls blue. She does not dare get too comfortable, a symptom of her years of homelessness.

title: 1916: A Series of German Defeats
description: Following the official report issued yesterday of the military situation on the French front: November 13 to November 17: In the course of the past week the Germans made a powerful attempt to counteract our successes north and south of the Somme. The enemys attack opened the 15th, in the morning, on the Ablaincourt-Chaulnes Wood front, end in the afternoon was extended on the north bank from Lesboeufs to Bouchavesnes.

title: How Hard (or Easy) It Will Be for Trump to Fulfill His 100-Day Plan
description: He can accomplish some of his promises entirely on his own, but others require Congress or pose other significant obstacles.

title: New Feature of the College Tour: First-Class Campus Hotels
description: Before Christian Bolles decided on Oberlin College in Ohio three years ago, he and his parents traveled to Oberlin from their home in San Francisco to visit the campus and the town.

title: U.S. Dementia Rates Are Dropping Even as Population Ages
description: Despite fears that dementia rates were going to explode as the population grows older and fatter, and has more diabetes and high blood pressure, a large nationally representative survey has found the reverse. Dementia is actually on the wane. And when people do get dementia, they get it at older and older ages.

title: Michael Sherwood, Goldman Sachss Co-Head of Europe, to Step Down
description: LONDON  Michael S. Sherwood, a Goldman Sachs vice chairman and co-head of its European division, will retire from the Wall Street firm at the end of the year.

title: N.B.A. Schedule: Heres What to Watch This Week
description: Dont look now, but it seems as if the enthusiasm for small ball may pall in the N.B.A. this fall.

title: The AIDS Fight: Andrew Sullivan on a History of the Movement
description: HOW TO SURVIVE A PLAGUEThe Inside Story of How Citizens and Science Tamed AIDSBy David FranceIllustrated. 640 pp. Alfred A. Knopf. $30.

title: Which Supplements, if Any, May Be Worth Your Money
description: Hardly a day goes by that people dont tell me that one or more dietary supplement has cured or prevented an ailment of theirs or suggest that I try one to treat a problem of my own. And I am not immune to wishful thinking that an over-the-counter vitamin, mineral or herb may help to keep me healthy or relieve some distress without having to see a doctor.

title: We Are Thanksgiving Adjacent
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: 6 Ways Pretend Investors Differ From the Real Ones
description: Do you remember playing pretend when you were little? Maybe you were a superhero, a dinosaur or a princess. Its normal when youre little, and its usually harmless. Most children know the difference between pretending to be a superhero and jumping off the roof thinking they can fly.

title: Into the Dead Zone: A Sports Writer Heads for Obits
description: When Robert Eidelbergs journalism class at John Bowne High School in Flushing, Queens, convened in September, 1972, our first assignment was to write an obituary about ourselves. We were all about 15 years old, without much life experience (I was months from my first paying job at a supermarket), so the task was to invent our futures.

title: France Detains 7, Saying It Has Thwarted a New Terrorist Attack
description: PARIS  Seven men who French authorities say were planning a terrorist attack have been arrested in France, the government announced on Monday, sounding an alert about the continuing threat from terrorism barely a year after the attacks that killed 130 people in and around Paris.

title: Kanye West Cancels the Rest of His Saint Pablo Tour
description: After two bizarre concerts last week during which Kanye West came out in support of President-elect Donald J. Trump and ended a set early after a fiery but discursive 17-minute monologue, the rapper has canceled the rest of his tour dates for 2016.

title: Diamond Jewelry With Everyday Appeal
description: The extravagant stone feels modern and wearable with an emerald cut and simple, linear settings.

title: 16 Arrested at North Dakota Pipeline Protest
description: Tensions continued in North Dakota on Monday afternoon as law enforcement officials arrested 16 people at a demonstration, one day after hundreds clashed with the police over the Dakota Access Pipeline.

title: Brazils Surfers Lament Demise of Amazons Mighty Waves
description: The thundering waves of the Pororoca were legendary: Adventurers from the world over flew, drove, trekked, Jet-Skied and canoed to Brazils remote Araguari River to ride the Amazons stunning tidal bore that formed when water flowed in from the Atlantic.

title: Italys Last Bastion of Catalan Language Struggles to Keep It Alive
description: ALGHERO, Italy  The first Catalans reached Sardinia in the 14th century, when troops sailed from the eastern coast of what is now Spain as part of an expansion into the Mediterranean.

title: Making Movies With Windows 10
description: Q. Microsoft hasnt updated Windows Movie Maker in years. I have it on my Windows 10 PC from when I upgraded the computer from Windows 8, but will there ever be a proper app version for Windows 10?

title: William Trevor, Writer Who Evoked the Struggles of Ordinary Life, Is Dead at 88
description: William Trevor, whose mournful, sometimes darkly funny short stories and novels about the small struggles of unremarkable people placed him in the company of masters like V. S. Pritchett, W. Somerset Maugham and Chekhov, died on Sunday in Somerset, England. He was 88.

title: Jeff Koons Is Giving Sculpture to Paris to Remember Terror Victims
description: PARIS  Inspired by the Statue of Liberty, the American contemporary artist Jeff Koons is donating a monumental sculpture of a fistful of tulips to the City of Paris and the people of France to commemorate victims of the recent terrorist attacks here.

title: Daily Report: At Apple, U.S. Jobs That Go Beyond Manufacturing
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump said during the campaign that he would push companies to bring manufacturing jobs back to the United States. He named one tech company in particular  Apple  which is the worlds largest public company and makes many of its gadgets overseas.

title: Hot and Unhappy in Unwise Shoes: A William Trevor Sampler
description: Each character is somebody that I know very well  as well as I know myself, William Trevor once said. Here are excerpts from three of his short stories, originally published by the Bodley Head in Britain and Viking in the United States.

title: #HereIsMyAmerica: Your Perspective
description: A collection of images from across our country that helps create a more nuanced portrait of the increasingly diverse American experience.

title: Olympics History Rewritten: New Doping Tests Topple the Podium
description: After disclosures of an extensive, state-run doping program in Russia, sports officials have been retesting urine samples from the 2008 and 2012 Summer Olympics, in Beijing and London. Their findings have resulted in a top-to-bottom rewriting of Olympics history.

title: Cooking Up Conversation as Marthas Vineyard Quiets Down
description: WEST TISBURY, Mass.  The November meeting of the Marthas Vineyard Cookbook Club offered saffron-infused gin cocktails, a table of food, a tray of something called strong ginger cookies  and a few strong opinions.

title: Three Big American Banks Pose Greater Systemic Risk, Regulator Says
description: LONDON  Three of Americas biggest banks potentially pose a greater risk to the global financial system than they did last year if they were to fail, global regulators said on Monday.

title: This Thanksgiving, Be Thankful for Science
description: Look, were not saying you cant talk about politics at the Thanksgiving dinner table. But its been quite a November so far, following a seemingly never-ending campaign, and the anxiety in the air is thicker than your moms gravy. Some people are sitting out Thanksgiving with their loved ones altogether. Others are preparing themselves for acts of civil disagreement.

title: As Obamas Tour Ends, He Says U.S. Involvement Abroad Must Not
description: LIMA, Peru  President-elect Donald J. Trump, with his America First campaign slogan, sees an America that has for years been taken for granted by weaker nations and is too quick to intervene in intractable conflicts far away.

title: Dinner and James Joyce in New Adaptation of The Dead
description: The centerpiece of The Dead, a novella by James Joyce, is a family dinner in 1904 to celebrate the Epiphany. At the Irish Repertory Theaters staged adaptation, The Dead, 1904, presented with Dot Dot Productions, the audience joins in the meal. They mingle with the performers, including Kate Burton and Boyd Gaines, and are then seated for a multicourse feast during the performance. On the menu are beef tenderloin with fig sauce, honey-glazed ham, potatoes, bread pudding and drinks. It takes place at the American Irish Historical Society, a Victorian townhouse, and the meal is catered by Great Performances: The Dead, 1904 by the Irish Repertory Theater, through Jan. 7 at  991 Fifth Avenue (East 80th Street); $300 including dinner, $500 for premium seating ($1,000 after Dec. 7), 212-727-2737, irishrep.org.

title: A Tribe Called Quests Comeback Album Debuts at No. 1
description: A Tribe Called Quests comeback came at just the right time: Released the Friday after the election, the emotional and political We Got It From Here  Thank You 4 Your Service (Epic), the first album from the storied hip-hop group in nearly two decades, has topped the Billboard chart.

title: Broths to Restore and Revive at Brodo
description: No doubt about it, Marco Canora really started something when he opened his first Brodo takeout window at Hearth, his East Village restaurant. That was two years ago, and now bone broth, spruced up with the Brodo label, is everywhere. Mr. Canora has expanded with a kiosk in Bryant Park, and hes just opened a shop in the West Village where some basic broths are mixed and sometimes frothed with freshly milled herbs, Asian condiments, bone marrow, seaweed, butter and even cocoa. There are 11 preset seasoning combinations, $6 to $11, though customers can devise their own. Tom Yum, a combo with chicken broth, coconut milk, curry and chile oil, is becoming a favorite. The shop also sells basic broths, frozen, for home use: Brodo, 496 Hudson Street (Christopher Street), 212-366-0600, brodo.com.

title: Kickback Case Questions Whether Valeant Was Victim or Participant
description: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International is a onetime Wall Street darling that has become a punching bag for how pharmaceutical firms drove up drug prices and engaged in questionable sales practices, in the process losing 90 percent of its market value. The first case to emerge from multiple federal and state investigations of its conduct, however, portrays it as a victim, not a perpetrator.

title: Pope Francis, Trump, Japan: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Explaining the Other Side of Autumn Leaves
description: Q. As the autumn leaves change color, why is the top of a leaf the most colorful, sometimes bright red, while the underside is comparatively drab?

title: Your Money Weekly: Solving the Mystery of the Stockbrokers
description: I love a good mystery, but its rare that we get to solve one in the world of personal finance.

title: Cinematic Watering Holes
description: These bars are themed for sleeper hits and cult favorites.

title: These Bars Want to Be in the Movies
description: The Overlook Lodge, a bar in the Pleasant Ridge neighborhood of Cincinnati, looks cozy enough at first, with wooden rafters and a fireplace big enough to sit inside.

title: Travel Coloring Books for Grown-Ups
description: Forget coffee in the lobby and chocolates at turndown. Coloring books for grown-ups  where the illustrations are inspired by travel, fashion and Champagne wishes  are among the latest amenities being offered at hotels around the world.

title: A Kit to Make Restaurant Pizza at Home
description: The chef Laurent Tourondel, who makes pizza in the wood-fueled ovens of LAmico, is sharing the recipe with home cooks. With this kit you can nearly replicate the classic 12-inch pizza margherita from his Chelsea restaurant in a gas or electric oven. The dough is a breeze to handle, and =buffalo mozzarella, basil a tomato sauce with personality are included. Add a drizzle of good olive oil, chile flakes and whatever else you like on your pie with ingredients from your larder: Dough to Go, $14 for pickup only, LAmico, 849 Avenue of the Americas (West 30th Street), 212-201-4065, lamico.nyc.

title: Jurgen Klinsmann Fired as U.S. Soccer Coach
description: On Thursday, Jurgen Klinsmann, the coach of the United States national mens soccer team, dined with President Obama, Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany, a number of Nobel laureates and a couple of astronauts at a gala in Berlin. The sausages were excellent, he said.

title: Breakfast, Lunch and Dessert in Jars
description: Food served in jars is not new, but Chloe Vichot, who fled finance for food and studied at culinary schools in New York along the way, has opened a shop dedicated exclusively to it. Ms. Vichot prepares and sells breakfast fare, bright lunch salads, soups, stews and desserts in glass jars, $5 to $14. Her specially made wide-mouth containers are more convenient than the usual Mason jars that some restaurants use to serve pts, desserts or even cocktails. The idea is to cut down on trash, and customers get a $1 discount for each jar they return (there is no jar deposit). The salads, in compact layers, are generous 22-ounce portions: Ancolie, 58 West Eighth Street (Avenue of the Americas), 646-524-5929, ancolie.co.

title: Jeff Sessions Other Civil Rights Problem
description: In 1986, the Republican-dominated Senate Judiciary Committee torpedoed Ronald Reagans nomination of Jeff Sessions to the federal bench. As sworn testimony there revealed, Mr. Sessions, then the United States attorney for the Southern District of Alabama, had referred to the N.A.A.C.P. and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (founded by the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.) as un-American and Communist inspired. He had joked that he thought the Ku Klux Klan was O.K. until he discovered some of its members smoked pot, and had accused a white attorney who supported voting rights of being a race traitor.

title: A New Magazine Focuses on Food Preservation
description: Cured, a periodical about preserving food, is definitely a niche publication. An impressive roster of writers, including Betty Fussell, Jessica B. Harris, William Woys Weaver and Fuchsia Dunlop, covers a wealth of topics under the editorial direction of Darra Goldstein, an author and a founder of Gastronomica. Learn about a Swedish tradition of fermenting fish that dates back 9,000 years; making persimmon vinegar; the allure of stinky Chinese food; pickles in the Nishiki Market in Kyoto, Japan; and zur, a fermented Polish rye soup. As Ms. Goldstein put it, preserving is as important a development for humankind as cooking, a means of hedging our bets against hunger. The magazine is published by Zero Point Zero, the company that produces The Mind of a Chef and Anthony Bourdains Parts Unknown: Cured, $20 at some food shops, bookstores nationwide and from curedmagazine.com.

title: Where Donald Trump Stands on School Choice, Student Debt and Common Core
description: When it comes to predicting how President-elect Donald J. Trumps administration will affect Americas schools and universities, education experts say they are struggling to read the tea leaves.

title: Fully Buzzed, This Coffee Helps Veterans
description: Detonate this new full-bodied coffee in your mug in the morning, and youll be fueled for the day. Bomb Coffee was founded by four friends, two of them veterans, and through the end of November, 22 percent of all sales will go to the treatment of post-traumatic stress disorder and suicide prevention among veterans. The coffee, which they claim is high in caffeine, is grown in India and roasted in Rockford, Ill. The original is balanced, and the bourbon-infused variety has more complexity with a hint of booze: Bomb Coffee, whole bean or ground, $17.99 a pound or $19.99 a pound for bourbon-infused, $15.99 for 12 Keurig pods, bombcoffee.com.

title: We Shall Overcome Copyright Case Moves Closer to Trial
description: We Shall Overcome may be headed for a trial.

title: Four Womens Things T Editors Are Really Into Right Now
description: These pendants from Catherine Weitzman caught my eye among the endless pieces of jewelry and clothing I see every day in market appointments. The flowers within them are collected during trips around the world in places like the Canary Islands, Sri Lanka and Japan. And at Weitzmans studio in Hawaii, the dried blooms are then protected in glass, sealed with either gold vermeil or recycled silver, and strung onto necklace chains  all one of a kind. $100-$205, available at catherineweitzman.com  ANGELA KOH

title: Watch This 2006 Documentary About Rudy Giuliani
description: For those who didnt live in New York City under the two-term mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani, you might know him only as one of the heroes of 9/11. The man who held together a shattered metropolis. Americas Mayor. After a long stint out of the spotlight, Giuliani was back in the public eye on the campaign trail for Donald J. Trump. And now hes one of President-elect Trumps many candidates for a cabinet position.

title: Mercury Is Shrinking, a Great Valley Shows
description: A colossal canyon on Mercury may provide evidence that the tiny planet is shrinking.

title: New Victory for World War II PT Boat: Restored and Museum-Ready
description: NEW ORLEANS  There was one hairy moment during PT 305s slow-motion jaunt through downtown here on Saturday morning.

title: Review: Lyon Opera Ballet Showcases Beethoven and Female Choreographers
description: LYON, France  Three dances. Three major choreographers. Three renditions of Beethovens Grosse Fuge. Thats the simple yet audacious idea behind the Lyon Opera Ballets Trois Grandes Fugues, which offers two pieces, by Anne Teresa de Keersmaeker and Maguy Marin, already in its repertory, and a new work by the American choreographer Lucinda Childs.

title: Bayers Essure Contraceptive Implant, Now With a Warning
description: Kim Myers used to compete in rodeo-style barrel horse races, but after being sterilized with an implantable device called Essure, the pain was so intense that she had to stop.

title: Market Reaction to Deal May Bode Ill for Energy Transfer Partners
description: Energy Transfer investors are in another tangle. The pipeline partnership Sunoco Logistics Partners wants to buy Energy Transfer Partners for $21 billion, based on Fridays closing prices. Energy Transfer Partners parent, Energy Transfer Equity, tied itself in knots trying to buy rival pipeline operator Williams Companies last year, before walking away on a technicality. The sour reaction to the latest deal suggests E.T.P. may also be headed for trouble.

title: Made in Sporting: Lisbon Clubs Youth Academy Sets It Apart
description: LISBON  The way they tell the story at Sporting Lisbon, they did not even have to watch Cristiano Ronaldo play to know he was special. Seeing him with a ball at his feet, the quiet, skinny 12-year-olds every effortless touch proof of his masterly control, was enough.

title: Truman Capotes Black and White Ball
description: Scenes from the iconic party of the 1960s, held at the Plaza hotel.

title: 50 Years Ago, Truman Capote Hosted the Best Party Ever
description: What if you gave a party and everybody came? That is precisely what occurred on the drizzly night of Nov. 28, 1966, when 540 of Truman Capotes nearest and dearest turned out for what the writer insisted on calling his little masked ball for Kay Graham and all of my friends.

title: Earthquake Off Fukushima, Japan, Triggers Tsunami
description: TOKYO  A powerful earthquake triggered a tsunami off the coast of Japan early Tuesday, near where three nuclear reactors melted down at a plant in Fukushima after a quake and tsunami in 2011.

title: Jason Moran, From the Venice Biennale to the Village Vanguard
description: A decade ago, when Jason Moran released Artist in Residence, it might have been possible to see that album as an outlier. Made up of selections from several large commissioned works  with a percussive cameo by the performance artist Joan Jonas, and a spoken-word sample of the conceptual artist Adrian Piper  it framed Mr. Moran as not only a pianist and composer but also a fluent traveler in the realm of contemporary art.

title: What You Should Watch Monday Night
description: Search Party, 11 p.m., TBS (New Series)

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Music, Movies and More
description: From Pioneers of African-American Cinema and Freaks and Geeks to the sounds of Kris Kristofferson and assorted Bad Boy artists, these gift ideas may enlighten, invigorate or simply stir up nostalgic memories.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Technology
description: It is often daunting to sort through the newest technology products to find something fitting for your gadget-savvy family and friends. Fret not: Here are some of the most useful and entertaining tech gifts of the year.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - T Magazine
description: Delightful presents big and small from the editors of T Magazine.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Wirecutter
description: We put in thousands of hours researching and testing products each year so we can make our readers' lives easier. Here we've collected a few of our favorites to make your gift giving just as simple, whether the people you love appreciate the practical or the whimisical.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Style
description: Buying gifts for your most stylish friends is harder than trying to get your teenage sister a Kylie Jenner lipkit. We got you, though. Here is a selection of items that will satisfy the women who has (nearly) everything and the man who is up on the latest trends.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Kids
description: A retro sled, a cozy hat, a build-it-yourself Bluetooth speaker  these are just a few of the fun, creative gifts we picked out for your little ones this holiday season. A selection of toys for children up to 12 years old.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Home
description: Gifts for the home are especially fitting during the holidays, as many of us open our doors to welcome family and friends. The following 15 new products go beyond the ordinary to offer equal parts functionality and delight  and, hopefully, a little extra joy throughout the year.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Food and Cooking
description: Food and the holidays go hand in hand, with everyone spending time happily eating or cooking or both. These gifts  from a sous-vide cooker for the tech-savvy gourmand to an adorable radish baby rattle for the teething future chef  celebrate those delights.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Travel
description: From a portable tea set to a sketchpad that saves your in-flight doodles, these gifts are guaranteed to become indispensable for your jet-setter friends.

title: Find the Whale and the Bathroom With the Natural History Museum App
description: Weve never camped out on its floors, as some people do, but my family has long had a fascination with the American Museum of Natural History. When I was 8 and 9 years old, I lived 21 blocks north of the fortresslike structure on Central Park West in Manhattan. And in those days, when not everyone had a television set, it became a delightful source of entertainment and what passed at that tender age for enlightenment.

title: Exxon Mobil Accuses the Rockefellers of a Climate Conspiracy
description: Exxon Mobil, under fire over its past efforts to undercut climate science, is accusing the Rockefeller family of masterminding a conspiracy against it. Yes, that Rockefeller family.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Books
description: Books can transport us to exotic lands or ground us in sobering truths. Here, we have art catalogs, nonfiction books and novels, one of which might just be the right fit for someone on your list.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Experiences
description: Experiences make unique gifts, especially for those who are not crazy about things. Here's a selection that ranges from cultural to culinary, from the East Coast to the West. Or consider giving a donation to a group whose work is meaningful to your recipient.

title: Review: Furry!/La Furia! Goes Inside the Head of a Times Square Elmo
description: The young woman onstage is nervously glancing at the hulking Cookie Monster, who is standing way too close. He silently reveals a box cutter. The blade comes out: Click, click, click. He makes a stabbing motion. She lets out a profanity under her breath.

title: 2016 Holiday Gift Guide - Credits
description: Present ideas, from technology to home goods, to make shopping easy this season.

description: Present ideas, from technology to home goods, to make shopping easy this season.

title: Review: Absolutely on Music Gives a Maestro a Stage for Ideas
description: If theres anything good about a major illness, the Japanese conductor Seiji Ozawa writes in an afterword to the oddly titled Absolutely on Music, its that it gives you more time than you know what to do with. He is referring to physical ailments that have plagued him since 2010, when he underwent surgery for esophageal cancer.

title: Slain San Antonio Detective Was Targeted, Police Chief Says
description: A San Antonio police detective who was shot to death while sitting in a squad car was apparently killed just for being on the force, the citys police chief said on Monday, a day after the detective and three officers were shot in separate episodes around the country.

title: New York Seeks to Jump-Start College Savings by Giving Cash to Kindergartners Parents
description: Starting next fall, the administration of Mayor Bill de Blasio will create college savings accounts for thousands of New York City kindergartners, in a three-year pilot program intended to increase the number of low-income children who go on to attend college.

title: Letter from Alan Garten
description: A letter from Alan Garten, executive vice president and general counsel for the Trump Organization, stating that no funding for the Trump University settlement would come from Donald J. Trump's charitable foundation.

title: Trump Foundation Wont Pay Any of $25 Million University Settlement
description: Donald J. Trumps charitable foundation will not be paying any of the $25 million settlement to resolve a series of lawsuits concerning Trump University, the president-elects defunct for-profit education venture that drew customer complaints about price gouging.

title: Judges Find Wisconsin Redistricting Unfairly Favored Republicans
description: A panel of three federal judges said on Monday that the Wisconsin Legislatures 2011 redrawing of State Assembly districts to favor Republicans was an unconstitutional partisan gerrymander, the first such ruling in three decades of pitched legal battles over the issue.

description: Simple cellphones can tell one type of mosquito from another by their hums, which may be useful in fighting mosquito-borne diseases, according to new research from Stanford University.

description: William Trevor, the Irish novelist and master of the short story who died at 88 on Sunday, began his prolific writing career when he was in his mid-30s.

title: At Least 5 Children Die in School Bus Crash in Chattanooga
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn.  At least five children were killed on Monday afternoon when a school bus carrying nearly three dozen elementary school students overturned and crashed into a tree in Chattanooga, according to local officials.

title: Review: Among the Dead Deals in War and Family Mysteries
description: A shaggy white guy in a bellboy uniform knocks on the door of a hotel room in Seoul, South Korea, a little bumbling and out of place. Hes come to deliver a package to an American woman named Ana, but she thinks there must be some mistake: No one knows shes there.

title: As Donald Trump Picks His Cabinet
description: To the Editor:

title: ISIS Used Chemical Arms at Least 52 Times in Syria and Iraq, Report Says
description: WASHINGTON  The Islamic State has used chemical weapons, including chlorine and sulfur mustard agents, at least 52 times on the battlefield in Syria and Iraq since it swept to power in 2014, according to a new independent analysis.

description: MOSCOW  Russias Defense Ministry said Monday that Ukrainian Security Service operatives had abducted two of its servicemen, who were later described by Kiev as deserters from the Ukrainian Army.

description: To make partner at a big law firm is to grab a brass ring of prestige, wealth and security.

title: Trump, on YouTube, Pledges to Create Jobs
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump on Monday released a two-and-a-half-minute infomercial-style video, turning to social media to deliver a direct-to-camera message in which he vowed to create jobs, renegotiate trade agreements, end restrictions on energy production and impose bans on lobbying.

title: A Rude Shock: Indians Describe Life After Narendra Modis Currency Ban
description: A student in Malegaon in Indias western state of Maharashtra said he had to stand in line for six hours to exchange rupee notes banned by the government this month. By the time he got to the front, Junaid Ahmed said, the bank had run out of new bills.

title: The Art of the Protest
description: Poland has one of the strictest abortion laws in Europe. Recently, a government-backed bill sought to go further, punishing women who had abortions with up to five years in prison. Last month, Polish women responded with a one-day strike. On Oct. 3, tens of thousands of people, most of them women dressed in black, protested in major cities.

title: Times Insider Photo Challenge: Caption This!
description: Times Insider shares insights into how we work at The New York Times. Occasionally we have some fun.

title: Brooklyn Man Arrested, Accused of Supporting Islamic State
description: A Brooklyn man who tried to join the Islamic State and later told an informer that the group wanted to stage an attack in Times Square similar to the one that killed 86 people in Nice, France, last summer was arrested in New York on Monday, the authorities said.

title: Mayor de Blasio Vows to Shield New Yorkers From Trumps Policies
description: Faced with a Republican president-elect willing to draw hard lines on immigration, policing and funding for social programs, Mayor Bill de Blasio in a formal address on Monday drew some of his own, presenting New York City as a national model of resistance and a better way.

title: With a Meeting, Trump Renewed a British Wind Farm Fight
description: LONDON  When President-elect Donald J. Trump met with the British politician Nigel Farage in recent days, he encouraged Mr. Farage and his entourage to oppose the kind of offshore wind farms that Mr. Trump believes will mar the pristine view from one of his two Scottish golf courses, according to one person present.

title: U.N.s Syria Envoy Suggests Donald Trump Has Limited Window to Work With Russia
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The United Nations special envoy to Syria offered unsolicited advice on Monday to President-elect Donald J. Trump: Pay attention to what happens between now and January in Syria, particularly in Aleppo, the storied city at risk of obliteration by Russian-backed Syrian forces.

title: The 12 Classical Pieces Times Editors Recommend This Week
description: Its been a long slog of a November. And you might not exactly be looking forward to the conversations pending over the Thanksgiving table.

title: Brooklyn Woman Is Found Guilty of Cruelty to 100 Rabbits
description: A Brooklyn woman charged with abusing the residents of her sprawling rabbit colony was convicted on Monday of 100 counts of animal cruelty  one for each rabbit the jury found to have suffered under her care.

title: Review: My Name Is Gideon: Im Probably Going to Die, Eventually
description: The first time I encountered Gideon Irving, he was accosting my wife.

title: Fake News Onslaught Targets Pizzeria as Nest of Child-Trafficking
description: WASHINGTON  Days before the presidential election, James Alefantis, owner of a local pizza restaurant called Comet Ping Pong, noticed an unusual spike in the number of his Instagram followers.

title: Civil Rights Groups Call on Trump to Denounce Racism of Alt-Right
description: WASHINGTON  Civil rights groups called on President-elect Donald J. Trump on Monday to publicly condemn extremist movements that are espousing racism in his name after hundreds of white nationalist sympathizers spent the weekend in Washington debating ways to preserve white culture.

title: Jurgen Klinsmann Promised a Lot for U.S. Soccer. But Did He Deliver?
description: About two years ago, during an interview at a country club in Southern California, Jurgen Klinsmann spoke at length about what he considered to be success when it came to his job as coach of the United States national team.

title: Trump Summons TV Figures for Private Meeting, and Lets Them Have It
description: It had all the trappings of a high-level rapprochement: President-elect Donald J. Trump, now the nations press critic in chief, inviting the leading anchors and executives of television news to join him on Monday for a private meeting of minds.

title: Donald Trumps Business Dealings Test a Constitutional Limit
description: WASHINGTON  Not long after he took office, President Obama sought advice from the Justice Department about a potential conflict of interest involving a foreign government. He wanted to know whether he could accept the Nobel Peace Prize.

title: Investors Make Bullish Bet on Trump, and an Era of Tax Cuts and Spending
description: Two weeks after Donald J. Trump swept to victory, investors from around the world are betting that his promises of tax cuts, fewer regulations and a spendthrift federal government can recharge the American economy.

title: Grievances and Grumblings, Long Before Chris Christies Fall in Donald Trumps Circle
description: The critical weekend before Election Day was set to be a busy one for Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey; he was to campaign for Donald J. Trump in the battleground states of New Hampshire and Pennsylvania.

title: Myanmars War on the Rohingya
description: Myanmar has long persecuted the countrys Rohingya Muslim minority, denying it basic rights to citizenship, to marry, to worship and to an education. After violence unleashed in 2012 by Buddhist extremists drove tens of thousands of Rohingya out of their homes, many risked their lives to escape in smugglers boats; more than 100,000 others are living in squalid internment camps. Now, a counterinsurgency operation by Myanmars military is again forcing thousands of Rohingya to abandon their villages.

title: Stars to Remember, Even if First Time on Hall of Fame Ballot Is Their Last
description: There are 19 new names on the Hall of Fame ballot, released Monday and landing soon in the mailboxes of more than 400 veteran baseball writers. There are also 15 holdovers still seeking the magic threshold  75 percent of the vote  needed for election.

title: Trumps Focus on Generals for Top Jobs Stirs Worries Over Militarys Sway
description: WASHINGTON  Donald J. Trump ran for president boasting that he knew more about fighting terrorists than Americas generals.

description: I wanted to use as many diamonds as possible, Tarang Arora, the creative director of Amrapali Jewels, said about the showpiece he had in mind for Jewelry Arabia 2016.

description: The dean of Yale College, Jonathan Holloway, announced on Monday that he was stepping down at the end of the academic year to become provost of Northwestern University.

title: Moving Jewelry Sales Online in India
description: BANGALORE, India  When Sushma Sonty wanted to buy herself some jewelry for her birthday, she didnt head to a traditional jeweler, as is the custom in India, or even to a local store. Instead, she turned to Melorra, a new website that marries Western fast-fashion trends with wearable fine jewelry.

title: Louisa Guinness, a Life in Art Jewelry
description: It started almost as a whimsy. Then it took over her life.

title: Suit Calling War on ISIS Illegal Is Rejected
description: WASHINGTON  A federal judge on Monday dismissed a lawsuit that accused President Obama of waging an illegal war against the Islamic State, clearing the way for the conflict to continue under President-elect Donald J. Trump without explicit congressional authorization.

title: Boghossian Keeps Jewelry in the Family
description: GENEVA  From their small, unmarked headquarters, the Boghossian family looks out over the Rhne River, directly facing the globally recognized jewelers of Geneva and their logo-emblazoned waterfront towers. The competition, though colossal, seems to mean little to them and their young high-jewelry brand.

title: Review: This Day Forward, a Weird Wedding Night and What Comes After
description: Nicky Silver is driving with the brakes on in This Day Forward, his bumpy and tentative new comedy, which opened on Monday night at the Vineyard Theater. Usually, for better or worse, this mordant playwright can be relied on to go tearing through the barricades of good taste, good manners and sane plotting into his own ecstatic no mans land of misery.

title: But So Delicious
description: TUESDAY PUZZLE  This may come as a surprise to some, but in addition to being totally delicious, BACON was used in World War II to manufacture bombs. Thats right; when the fat was rendered and turned into glycerin, you could blow up a lot of things with it.

title: Lack of Protocol Added to Chaos During J.F.K. Scare, Inquiry Finds
description: A joint New York State and federal investigation into how false reports of gunfire at Kennedy International Airport in August led to mass panic found security protocols seriously lacking, with poor coordination between agencies and widely divergent levels of training for security personnel exacerbating the chaos.

description: Its sad to say, but a lot of times when you go to these competitions, youre like: Just get close enough to top three because you never know whos going to test positive.

description: New Yorkers have been known to queue up for many a hot-ticket item: dinner reservations, iPhones, Cronuts.

description: LOS ANGELES  The Walt Disney Companys smallest theme park resort, Hong Kong Disneyland, which lost money amid declining attendance last year, will get $1.4 billion in enhancements as part of a colossal six-year growth plan.

description: A new book features the photography of Jack London, along with his words, chronicling poverty in London and the aftermath of the San Francisco earthquake.

description: Chuck Tingle took an unlikely route to heroism. He had built a small but devoted following for his self-published erotic e-books when he was nominated in the spring for a Hugo Award, one of the highest honors in science fiction and fantasy writing.

title: A Jolt of Blue-Collar Hope
description: NEW CASTLE, Del.  The nearby factory that made Dodge Durangos closed eight years ago. The General Motors Boxwood Road Plant  open since 1947  closed the next year. So did the oil refinery in Delaware City.

title: Fellow Trump Critics, Maybe Try a Little Listening
description: Ive been thinking a lot about the best imaginable Trump voter. This is the Trump supporter who wasnt motivated by racism or bigotry. This is the one who cringed every time Donald Trump did something cruel, vulgar or misogynistic.

title: Not Your Grandmothers Wisconsin
description: Milwaukee  I love telling people Im from Wisconsin. Maybe its my defense mechanism for when people accuse me of being a coastal elite, out of touch with Real America. I like fulfilling all the Wisconsin stereotypes. I love cheese and cheese curds, of course. I love our sports teams out of a vague sense of homerism. And my accent (all hard As) comes out in full force after ah couplah beers.

title: Dont Retreat Into Fortress America
description: Former Secretary of State Dean Achesons memoir, Present at the Creation, is a classic account of how a durable and productive Atlantic alliance, based on common values and a cleareyed judgment of Americas strategic interests, rebuilt Europe after World War II and produced international institutions responsible for the security and expanding economic opportunities that have been of such benefit to the United States.

title: Donald Trump Rages, at the Wrong Target
description: Millions of Americans are justifiably frightened by the tide of racism, anti-Semitism and xenophobia that has swept the country since the election of Donald Trump, whose campaign stoked these views and who named Stephen Bannon of Breitbart News his chief strategist in the White House.

title: Daimler Executive Is Removed After Accusations of Insulting Chinese
description: BEIJING  A single spark can start a prairie fire, Mao Zedong said. And being accused of a bigoted outburst can start a wildfire on the internet in China, as a manager for Daimler, the German automaker, has learned to his regret.

title: How to Stop the Spread of Fake News
Rarely Seen Photos by Jack London
description: One hundred years ago today, Jack London died in Sonoma County, Calif., at the age of 40. He was famous for novels, like the The Call of the Wild, which were based on his adventures, trekking through the Klondike or sailing the South Pacific. He was the archetype of the macho writer  before Ernest Hemingway  having been, among other things, a Socialist, a hobo, a sailor, a war correspondent and an oyster pirate.

title: Thanksgiving Traditions
TransAsia Airways of Taiwan Closing After 2 Deadly Crashes
description: HONG KONG  TransAsia Airways, the Taiwan-based airline that had two fatal crashes within seven months of each other, said in a stock exchange filing on Tuesday that it was shutting down.
