title: A Laugh Factory Looks Back
description: In a 2006 interview with The A.V. Club, Conan OBrien talked about his time as president of The Harvard Lampoon, the famed satirical magazine, in the 1980s. I was the idiot king. When a king dies suddenly, he said, and a 16-year-old is elevated to the throne and immediately declares purges of everyone around him  that was my reign at The Lampoon.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: The Earth Is Weeping

title: An Uncertain Future for East Village Rowhouses
description: The life of a building has many chapters, weaving a tale that bends and twists with the arc of history. One of the chapters in the life of the powder blue rowhouse at 264 East Seventh Street in the East Village took place in 1984, when the illustrator Felicia Bond was a struggling 31-year-old artist living with her boyfriend in a garden apartment there.

title: The Story Behind This Weeks Best Sellers
description: Bernie Prose: Sooner or later, most people who run for president cobble together some kind of campaign book  part policy manifesto, part inspirational autobiography  to help sell themselves on the trail and, maybe, earn a few royalties along the way.

description: Suggested reading by editors at The New York Times Book Review.

description: Seven new paperbacks to check out this week.

description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Calvin Trillin on the Scariest Word
description: I was disappointed when the website of Oxford Dictionaries called off its search for the worst word in the English language before I got a chance to have my say. When the survey was halted  the Oxford folks said that too many people were sending in offensive or insulting words  the word moist was in the lead. If a sort of yucky association was the criterion for what the survey officially called your least favorite word, I would have gone for membrane over moist. I can think of some pleasant uses for moist  a moist chocolate cake springs to mind  but I never encountered a membrane that didnt make me shudder.

title: Many in Florida Count on Obamas Health Law, Even Amid Talk of Its Demise
description: MIAMI  Dalia Carmeli, who drives a trolley in downtown Miami, voted for Donald J. Trump on Election Day. A week later, she stopped in to see the enrollment counselor who will help her sign up for another year of health insurance under the Affordable Care Act.

title: What 9 Shoppers Wore While Browsing Madison Avenue
description: Bleecker Street and lower Broadway may get the downtown buzz, but Madison Avenue remains the swankiest of the citys retail thoroughfares. As temperatures drop and the holiday season approaches, the sedate and stately street gets an influx of energy, with well-heeled shoppers and tourists mixing on their post-brunch strolls. Last weekend, a stylish uptown crowd could be spotted peering through windows and looking to replenish their wardrobes. Heres what they wore.

description: Researchers have long known that social class is one of the most powerful predictors of health, more powerful than genes, smoking, alcohol intake, or other health risks.

description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump filled two lower-profile but influential White House staff jobs on Friday, while his high-profile candidate for secretary of housing and urban development, Ben Carson, continued to deliberate about whether to join the administration.

description: The N.F.L. schedule makers havent exactly delivered a holiday weekend of big-ticket items.

title: A Warlords Reality Show
description: The notion of Ramzan Kadyrov, the leader of Chechnya, seeking to remake his image through a Donald Trump-like reality show would be mildly amusing if his rule were not so obscenely brutal and corrupt. The Team, in which the losing contestants name is scrawled with a gold pen  the equivalent of Youre fired  doesnt even begin to approach reality. Bludgeoning would be more like it.

description: BLACK POWER 50Edited by Sylviane A. Diouf and Komozi WoodardIllustrated. 144 pp. The New Press. Paper, $24.95.

title: Getting Your Home Holiday-Ready
description: Having everyone over for the holidays may have seemed like a good idea when you agreed to it last year. Back then, there was plenty of time to redo the guest room, fix the leaky kitchen faucet and upgrade the powder room. But with just a few weeks to spare, the thought of opening your home to family and friends might start to feel a bit overwhelming.

description: Police commanders began an investigation immediately after a New York City officer fatally shot a mentally ill man on Oct. 3, 2014, inside his parents home in Brooklyn. Over more than a year they compiled several reports on what happened, which culminated in one sent to William J. Bratton, then the commissioner.

title: Investing in Creativity, and in the Greater Good
description: LORRIE MEYERCORD wants her portfolio to be made up entirely of investments that aim to do social good while earning a return. But in addition to established categories like the environment, clean energy and organizations benefiting women and girls, she invested in arts and creativity. And she hopes others will follow her lead.

title: England to Restore a House With Ties to Jane Austen  or Not
description: LONDON  When the chancellor of the Exchequer announced this week that the British government planned to pour 7.6 million, about $9.48 million, into restoring Wentworth Woodhouse, an English stately home said to be the inspiration for Pemberley in Jane Austens Pride and Prejudice, he probably didnt expect a backlash.

title: Israel Arrests 22 Over Wildfires, as Arson Is Suspected
description: JERUSALEM  Twenty-two people have been arrested on suspicion of arson or incitement to arson, security officials said on Friday, as Israel continued to battle its worst wildfires in years.

title: Flossing and the Art of Scientific Investigation
description: Its bad enough that expertise is under attack these days from populist political movements that dismiss specialist opinion as just another establishment ruse. But lately expertise is being criticized from another direction, too  from would-be defenders of science.

title: In Scotland, Fences Make for Irate Neighbors
description: Neighbors of President-elect Donald J. Trumps exclusive golf course in northeastern Scotland have been opposed to the development for nearly a decade. Fences and trees have gone up, blocking the sweeping view of the rugged coastline, says David Milne, a resident.

title: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC
description: The artist Charlotte Moorman (1933-91) was a classically trained cellist who became a catalytic figure in the international avant-garde. As a musician, she collaborated frequently with the video pioneer Nam June Paik. As a charismatic organizer, she produced the Annual Avant Garde Festival of New York from 1963 to 1980 and persuaded city officials to let it happen in such places as Grand Central Terminal and Shea Stadium. A great spirit, she gets her due in this retrospective, which is closed until Tuesday but will continue through Dec. 10. A not-to-be-missed concurrent show, Charlotte Moorman: Dont Throw Anything Out, runs through Dec. 9 at the Fales Library & Special Collections. HOLLAND COTTER

title: Angels in Autumn
description: Last weeks galas include: Guggenheim International Gala, Gabrielles Angel Foundation, the Humane Society and the American Museum of Natural History.

title: The Playlist: New Songs From Prince and Garth Brooks, if You Can Find Them
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new songs and videos  and anything else that strikes them as intriguing. You can listen to this playlist on Spotify here. Like this Playlist? Let us know at theplaylist@nytimes.com, and sign up for our Louder newsletter (coming soon!) here.

title: The New Workplace Is Agile, and Nonstop. Can You Keep Up?
description: Whether you like it or not, your boss may want you to start acting more like a programmer.

title: Angels in Autumn
description: The Guggenheim International Gala, sponsored by Dior, was held on Nov. 17 and drew fashion luminaries and Hollywood stars. Gabrielles Angel Foundation for Cancer Research raised nearly $3.7 million at its annual ball on Nov. 21. More than 700 guests attended the American Museum of Natural Historys gala on Nov. 17. And the Humane Society of the United States honored Hugo Boss and Georgina Bloomberg at its annual gala on Nov. 18.

title: Michigans Jim Harbaugh, an Update From the Bo Schembechler Line
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  While not quite as famous as Babe Ruths called shot or Joe Namaths pledge to win the Super Bowl, the promise Jim Harbaugh, the University of Michigan football coach, made 30 years ago is remembered even more fondly around these parts.

title: Inside a Fake News Sausage Factory: This Is All About Income
description: TBILISI, Georgia  Jobless and with graduation looming, a computer science student at the premier university in the nation of Georgia decided early this year that money could be made from Americas voracious appetite for passionately partisan political news. He set up a website, posted gushing stories about Hillary Clinton and waited for ad sales to soar.

title: A Latina Disney Movie Princess? The Wait Isnt Over
description: Im not part of Disneys target audience for its latest princess movie, Moana, but I dont care. Ive been excited about this film since Dwayne Johnson previewed it last year at the D23 Expo for all things Disney. As much as the new Lin-Manuel Miranda music sounds promising, whats really exciting is the chance to see a Disney princess who doesnt look like those we have already.

title: Dylann Roof Found Competent for Trial in Charleston Church Killings
description: Dylann S. Roof, the self-avowed white supremacist who is accused of killing nine black parishioners at a Charleston, S.C., church in June 2015, is competent to stand trial, a federal judge ruled Friday.

title: How Cassini Will Begin Its Date With Death on Saturn
description: Its the beginning of a spectacular, almost circuslike end for NASAs Cassini mission. For 12 years Cassini has been buzzing about Saturn, its rings and its moons. As a result we know that there are methane lakes on Titan and jets of water shooting from Enceladus, and the rings themselves have warps, ripples, hills twists and braids.

title: College Towns Can Be Attractive Later in Life
description: WILLIAM RIFFER, 70, hopscotched around the country during a career in the Navy and later as a manager in the nuclear power industry, moving 19 times. So its not surprising that it took him a little time to figure out where he wanted to retire about a decade ago.

title: Holiday Books About Pearls, Parties and Peace
description: As Perry Como used to tell us, No matter how far away you roam / For the holidays you cant beat home sweet home. And all the more so if there are attractive books on the coffee table.

title: Canada Today: Algae Blooms, Fighter Jets and Fund-Raising Trouble
description: Among the many issues that kept the Liberal Party of Canada in the political wilderness until last year was the lingering odor of what came to be called the sponsorship scandal.

title: Shenzhen Connect Offers Chinese Stocks. Will the World Buy?
description: HONG KONG  Global investors in two weeks will get direct access for the first time to the stock market in the Chinese city of Shenzhen, giving them a chance to bet on a tech-heavy clutch of private companies on an exchange sometimes called Chinas Nasdaq.

title: Johnson & Johnson Has Its Eye on Actelion
description: Actelion could give Johnson & Johnson hypertension.

title: A Long-Gone Parasite Returns to Florida, Leaving a Trail of Dead Deer
description: BIG PINE KEY, Fla.  The first signs seemed baffling: deer stumbling around in confusion, howling in pain, found with their heads hideously disfigured  as if eaten alive.

title: Erykah Badus Beautiful Braids Take Time
description: Sometimes you think you are at the end, and you are just further deep in. Like a relationship, Erykah Badu said while untangling a pile of gold and beaded necklaces on a recent cold night in New York City. And when you finally come to an end, you feel bad about it.

title: Value of Payments Provider Stripe Doubles to $9.2 Billion
description: Stripe Inc., a start-up that offers software and services that process payments for businesses, has raised another round of private funding that values the company at just under $9.2 billion, according the companys investors.

title: From Putins Hands: A Russian Passport for Steven Seagal
description: Steven Seagal, the American actor whose career peaked in the 1990s with movies like Under Siege  and whose specialty was portraying action figures who spoke softly but blew up buildings and assassinated bad guys, has taken on a new role off screen: that of a Russian citizen with the passport to prove it.

title: Auburns Iron Bowl Hopes Are on Firm Footing
description: AUBURN, Ala.  It is the season of non-offensive touchdowns for No. 1 Alabama. The Crimson Tide have scored 12 of the so-called NOTs, those touchdowns by the defense or by special teams. The wish of many Alabama football fans heading into Saturdays Iron Bowl is to add a particular NOT to the Crimson Tide portfolio: the return for a touchdown of a short Auburn field-goal attempt. It would offer not only 6 points, but also some cathartic payback.

title: Review: In Dear Zindagi, a Conflicted Woman in Search of a Truer Life
description: The issues in Gauri Shindes sharply observed drama Dear Zindagi are suggested in its opening scene: A woman walks with her boyfriend, disgusted with his infidelity, while he pleads for forgiveness, professing his love. A director calls cut, and we realize we are watching actors on a Mumbai movie set. The young cinematographer Kaira (Alia Bhatt) suggests shooting another take, this time with the woman surreptitiously checking out a passing male bicyclist. Her director approves.

title: What Were Reading
description: Get recommendations from New York Times reporters and editors, highlighting great stories from around the web. What Were Reading emails are sent twice a week. Sign up

title: New Designs in Vende Globe Offer More Speed, and Danger
description: LES SABLES DOLONNE, France  A tear appeared at the corner of Morgan Lagravires eye as he was interviewed before the start of his first Vende Globe, a solo, nonstop around-the-world race.

title: Living in Takoma Park, Md.
description: Founded in 1981, the Takoma Park-Silver Spring Food Co-op captures the community spirit of Takoma Park, Md.

title: A Candidate Rises on Vows to Control Islam and Immigration. This Time in France.
description: CHASSIEU, France  A patriotic sea of supporters, waving red, white and blue flags, greeted the newly ascendant presidential hopeful Franois Fillon this week at a soulless conference center in this suburb of Lyon.

title: Remember When Figaro Was Set in Trump Tower?
description: The scenario sounds eerily familiar: A plutocrat on a high floor in Trump Tower wields enormous political power, while a woman in his employ worries that he believes that his wealth and position entitle him to do anything he wants with her.

title: Build Your Own Computer
description: Q. I have seen advertisements for those do-it-yourself computer kits for kids, but what can these machines actually do? Do they run Windows?

title: Fighting iOS Calendar Spam
description: Q. I have been getting spam invitations to my iOS calendar recently. They come from Chinese accounts and their subjects are for super-discounted Ray-Bans and the like. Is there any solution to this?

title: Florence Henderson, Trump, Israel: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Girl Power? For Lara Croft, Its a Complicated Legacy
description: Lara Croft set off on her first Tomb Raider adventure in 1996, traveling the globe in search of ancient artifacts amid dark and dusty ruins. She pushed that video game into a multibillion-dollar franchise that included several sequels, two feature films (starring Angelina Jolie), an animated series, apparel and merchandise. Now, the Academy Award-winning Swedish actress Alicia Vikander is set to  portray Lara Croft in a reboot of the series.

title: The Two Putin Problem
description: WASHINGTON  With a single phone conversation this month, Donald J. Trump and Vladimir V. Putin have started talk of another reset in ties between Russia and the United States. A new president, of course, has every reason to seek improved relations. But what could make this reset work? Mr. Trump rightly believes there may be opportunities in the relationship. Theyre just not the ones he thinks.

title: A Navajo Chef Looks to History in His Homage to Native Cuisine
description: WASHINGTON  It took 12 years for the nations pre-eminent Native American restaurant to hire its first Native American executive chef. Yet the chef, Freddie Bitsoie, is feeling a more particular pressure.

title: A Filmmakers Belief in Himself Pays Off
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif.  Shawn Levy quickly made a name for himself in Hollywood. Maybe too quickly.

title: Betsy DeVos and the Wrong Way to Fix Schools
description: NEW ORLEANS  President-elect Donald J. Trumps selection of Betsy DeVos as secretary of education has sent shock waves through the educational establishment. Understandably so, since this is a clear sign that Mr. Trump intends a major national push to direct public funds to private and charter schools. But this is more than just a political or financial loss for traditional public schools. It will also most likely be a loss for students.

title: Cliff Barrows, Billy Grahams Longtime Musical Director, Dies at 93
description: Cliff Barrows, a farmers son and ordained Baptist minister who for more than 70 years was the musical voice and program manager of the Rev. Billy Grahams global Christian evangelistic crusades, died on Nov. 15 in Pineville, N.C. He was 93.

title: One-Bite Recipes
description: Sick of leftovers already? Try these midnight snacks my husband and I make. No utensils, plates or kitchen needed.

title: Donald Trumps Caldron of Conflicts
description: In the short time Donald Trump has been president-elect, hes already shown that he will freely mix his business affairs with his activities as president. Federal ethics rules are not a deterrent, since they cannot be enforced against him. The situation practically invites foreign governments and businesses to try to influence American policy by currying favor with him through his business empire.

title: A Hard Journey Toward Independence
description: It wasnt until she was 3 years old that Shatiana Vanterpool received a diagnosis. Unable to walk or talk, she was taken by her mother, Shayntte Johnson, to three different doctors, and finally it was discovered that she had cerebral palsy, which affected her muscle tone and motor skills. She didnt learn to walk until she was about 5. And doctors said she would never be able to speak.

title: Taiwan as a Same-Sex Marriage Pioneer
description: As same-sex marriage laws have expanded in the past decade in Europe and the Western Hemisphere, the movement to legalize such unions has faced staunch resistance in Asia.

title: Stalking Black Friday Bargains
description: RIVERDALE, N.J.  With a baby strapped to her front, a knapsack on her back and a Donald Duck coffee mug in one hand, Christi Mulder arrived at the Target here, about 30 miles northwest of Manhattan, early Friday morning. She and her sister, Erica Renaud, who brought her 7-week-old son, were on the hunt for holiday gifts for the 11 children they have between them.

title: Trump Leans on Carrier to Keep 2,000 U.S. Jobs From Moving to Mexico
description: The value of the bully pulpit of the president of the United States cant be measured on a corporate spreadsheet or the Excel file of a Wall Street analyst.

title: Two Black Women Embrace Their Chance to Be Hockey Role Models
description: Three years ago, girls from the Hockey in Newark youth program were invited to meet the Princeton womens hockey team.

title: U.S. Officials Defend Integrity of Vote, Despite Hacking Fears
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration said on Friday that despite Russian attempts to undermine the presidential election, it has concluded that the results accurately reflect the will of the American people.

title: Long Island Village Votes to Disband 6 Years After Incorporating
description: MASTIC BEACH, N.Y.  It was only six years ago that residents here on Long Island took a leap into the unknown, shunning the Town of Brookhaven, where Mastic Beach was a lowly hamlet, and incorporating as a village.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: Its all Trump. People go nuts for it.

title: Islanders Moved to Brooklyn, but the Players and Their Dogs Stay on Long Island
description: GARDEN CITY, N.Y.  When Casey Cizikas and Calvin de Haan of the Islanders meet up off the ice, there is much running, stick throwing and shouting  with nary a puck in sight.

title: Ukraines Ex-Leader Regrets Not Breaking Up Protests That Led to His Fall
description: ROSTOV-ON-DON, Russia  In a rare public appearance, Viktor F. Yanukovych, the former president of Ukraine, said Friday that he regrets he did not impose martial law and order troops to disperse the mass protests that toppled his government and forced him into exile in Russia.

title: Paul Sylbert, Oscar-Winner Who Gave Movies Their Look, Dies at 88
description: Paul Sylbert, an Oscar-winning production designer who created the look of films as various as Alfred Hitchcocks The Wrong Man, Robert Bentons Kramer vs. Kramer and Warren Beattys Heaven Can Wait, died on Nov. 19 at his home in Jenkintown, Pa., near Philadelphia. He was 88.

title: Vulture or Phoenix? Wilbur Ross, Risk-Taker, Is Eyed for Commerce Post
description: Wilbur L. Ross, the billionaire investor expected to be nominated as the next commerce secretary, has made his fortune through the tricky business of buying deeply troubled companies.

title: Putting a Skyscraper on a Pedestal
description: In the city within a city rising west of Pennsylvania Station are many astonishing sights.

title: Snackable Treat on a Stick
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  What an interesting looking grid we have today. Its a 66-word puzzle by Paolo Pasco and lots of fun to solve, as long as you keep pushing at it.

title: Records Show Complaints About Driver in Deadly Tennessee Bus Crash
description: ATLANTA  The 10-line report, written on wide-ruled notebook paper by an elementary school student in Chattanooga, Tenn., arrived on Nov. 16.

title: Shining a Light on Cities Abandoned Buildings, From the Inside Out
description: ALBANY  On a recent evening, Cameron Payne found himself walking along a row of empty and deteriorating homes and businesses in his neighborhood, but suddenly their windows were lighted.

title: Carmelo Anthonys Game-Winner Serves Notice That Knicks Are Still His Team
description: Carmelo Anthony has been a star in the shadows this season. He remains one of the N.B.A.s marquee players and the face of the Knicks, but Anthony has been pushed off center stage often enough this month by the emerging Kristaps Porzingis. It has not been an unruly exchange, and Anthony seems to appreciate his new co-star after so many years of toiling away in New York with much acclaim but few wins.

title: Scott Dayton Identified as First American to Die in Syria Combat
description: A 42-year-old Navy sailor whose many decorations included the Bronze Star has been identified as the first member of the American armed forces to be killed in combat in Syria, the Defense Department said on Friday.

title: Double Points in Racing? Not After What Happened Last Time
description: The 2014 Abu Dhabi Grand Prix was the only race in Formula One history in which the teams and drivers contended for double points. It quickly became apparent that the rule was one of the worst ideas the series ever had, and it was immediately discarded.

title: A Final Contest for Two of Racings Most Experienced Drivers
description: For two of Formula Ones oldest, most experienced and successful drivers, the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix is a series farewell.

title: A Roller Coaster of a Track That Demands Precision
description: A lap of the Yas Marina Circuit in a road car is enough of a thrill to imagine what it must be like for the fastest drivers on earth.

title: Formula One Turns the Corner on a Troubled Era
description: The Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday marks not only the end of the 2016 Formula One season  it is also the final race in a three-year formula that has changed the sport.

title: At Mercedes, Racing Is Business on Steroids
description: Toto Wolff, 44, is the chief executive, team principal and part-owner of the Mercedes Formula One team. He is also the director of the Mercedes motor sport program.

title: The Mercedes Saga: From the Top, to Out, to Back at the Top
description: At the end of this years season, the Mercedes Formula One team has cemented its reputation like no other road car manufacturer before it. It won a third constructors and drivers title, more than any major road car manufacturer in the series history.

title: Owner of a Brooklyn Brownstone From Crooklyn Sees Herself Caught in Airbnb Crossfire
description: The doorbell rang. On the steps of the brownstone in the Bedford-Stuyvesant section of Brooklyn were two police officers, two firefighters and two Buildings Department inspectors. The one who did the talking said to get out immediately, not because there was a gas leak, not because anyone was suspected of selling illegal drugs, but because the brownstone was being used as a bed-and-breakfast.

title: Stan Huntsman, Track and Fields Mentor and Passionate Defender, Dies at 84
description: Stan Huntsman, who coached outstanding college track and field teams for 39 years, led a dominant United States mens team at the 1988 Olympics in Seoul, and fought tirelessly against cuts in financial support for the sport, died on Wednesday in Austin, Tex. He was 84.

title: My Three Days With Fidel
description: Richard Eder, a former New York Times foreign correspondent, recalls interviewing the Cuban leader.

title: Fidel Castro, Cuban Revolutionary Who Defied U.S., Dies at 90
description: Fidel Castro, the fiery apostle of revolution who brought the Cold War to the Western Hemisphere in 1959 and then defied the United States for nearly half a century as Cubas maximum leader, bedeviling 11 American presidents and briefly pushing the world to the brink of nuclear war, died on Friday. He was 90.

title: Whats on TV Saturday: Batman, Superman and an S.N.L. Star
description: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice, Zack Snyders bloated and sober comic-book mash-up, arrives on the small screen and streaming services. And Michael Che, a co-host of Weekend Update on Saturday Night Live, flies solo with his own Netflix comedy special.

title: Corrections: November 26, 2016
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Fidel Castro, Cuban Revolutionary
description: Mr. Castro was seen as a ruthless despot by some and hailed as a hero by others.

title: Fidel Castro, Cuban Revolutionary
description: Mr. Castro was seen as a ruthless despot by some and hailed as a hero by others.

title: The Timess Coverage of Fidel Castro
description: Articles include an exclusive Times interview with the young guerrilla leader in 1957 and coverage of the revolution, the Bay of Pigs invasion and the 1962 missile crisis.

title: Castros Revolution, Illustrated
description: Thousands of posters were commissioned by the government to promote his vision of a socialist society.

title: Fidel Castro: 1926-2016
description: A master of image and myth, Mr. Castro believed himself to be the messiah of his fatherland, an indispensable force with authority from on high to control Cuba and its people.

title: Solving a Mystery Behind the Deadly Tsunami of Molasses of 1919
description: It was January. The place was Boston. And when 2.3 million gallons of molasses burst from a gigantic holding tank in the citys North End, 21 people were killed and about 150 more were left injured. The wave of syrup  some reports said it was up to 40 feet tall  rushed through the waterfront, destroying buildings, overturning vehicles and pushing a firehouse off its foundation.

title: For Interracial Couples, Growing Acceptance, With Some Exceptions
description: When I was a new mother living on the Upper West Side of Manhattan in 2010, I often forgot that my infant son, Harper, didnt look like me. As I pushed him around the neighborhood, I thought of him as the perfect brown baby, soft-skinned and tulip-lipped, with a full head of black hair, even if it was the opposite of my blond waves and fair skin.

title: Enter the Ring at Gleasons
description: Gleasons, the oldest boxing gym in New York, is moving at the end of this month. Visit the gym where Muhammad Ali and Mike Tyson trained.

title: Ral Castros Inner Circle
description: Who will really call the shots in Cuba in the years to come? Here is a glance at some civilians and military figures who have Mr. Castros ear.

title: A 98-Year-Old Yoga Celebrity Tells All
description: On a recent Monday, To Porchon-Lynch was teaching her 90-minute yoga class in Hartsdale, N.Y., combining elements of Iyengar, meditation and vinyasa for a dozen or so regular students.

title: Where Beauty Means Bleached Skin
description: ACCRA, Ghana  Semiratu Zakaru was standing in the hot sun on a crowded noontime street explaining why Ghanas new ban against certain skin-bleaching creams was unlikely to work, when her friend, Desmond Kwamina Odonkor, walked up and interrupted our conversation, oozing confidence and game.

title: From Moguls to Mortals
description: LOS ANGELES  Some out-of-work Hollywood moguls handle the transition from general to civilian with grace.

title: In Havana, Castros Death Lays Bare a Generation Gap
description: HAVANA  At the Salon Rojo, one of Havanas most popular nightspots, where the reggaeton usually blares into the early hours, the music stopped abruptly.

title: With One Castro Gone, Questions About What the Other Castro Will Do
description: MEXICO CITY  For half a century, as Fidel Castro transformed Cuba into a Communist state and sparred with the United States, his brother Ral worked in his shadow, the authoritarian leaders disciplined, junior partner.

title: Protest Against South Korean President Estimated to Be Largest Yet
description: SEOUL, South Korea  Hundreds of thousands of South Koreans filled central Seoul on Saturday to demand President Park Geun-hyes resignation, in what appeared to be the largest turnout yet in a series of weekly protests against the embattled leader.

title: Trump, and Great Business Ideas for America
description: A businessman with a lifetime of experience in management has been elected president of the United States. Donald J. Trumps administration may be viewed as an experiment  an opportunity to discover whether one particular businessmans perspective and skills will be assets in governing a nation.

title: A Little Variety
description: VARIETY PUZZLES  This weeks puzzles include:

title: Officials to Close Standing Rock Protest Campsite
description: Citing public safety concerns, federal officials plan to close access to a campsite where demonstrators have protested the construction of a crude oil pipeline near the Standing Rock Sioux Reservation in North Dakota and create a free speech zone.

title: Vagrants in the Building Lobby
description: Q. Two people who appear to be drug addicts regularly sleep in the lobby of my rental building in East Flatbush, Brooklyn. They sneak in every afternoon behind someone who leaves the door open and stay out of the view of the cameras. The super, who lives nearby, clears them out in the morning. They are generally amiable and accommodating, but when they are high they become agitated and accost me, threatening harm  if I call the police. I am scared to report them, especially because I know they will probably be back the next day. Whats the best way to handle this?

title: Chipping Away at a List of Goals, and Bonding Over Cupcakes
description: Andie Gratereaux sat under the autumn leaves at DeSalvio Playground in Manhattan a year ago, peeled away the wrapper from a salted caramel cupcake and started to put her life back together.

title: Anger Rooms: A Smashing New Way to Relieve Stress
description: When she was a teenager on the South Side of Chicago in the late 1990s, Donna Alexander fantasized about setting up a space where stressed-out people could relieve their tension in a safe, nonviolent way  by smashing mannequins, televisions, furniture and other objects. She was confident in her idea, but she wasnt sure how to turn it into a business.

title: U.S. Seeks Death for Charleston Shooting Suspect. Victims Families Prefer Mercy.
description: CHARLESTON, S.C.  The Rev. Sharon Risher often thinks these days about what she calls her humanness: the passing impulse to crave the execution of the white supremacist accused of killing her mother and eight other black churchgoers last year.

title: A Donald Trump-Led Trip Back to the Gold-Plated 80s
description: The American wealthy are about to enjoy a giant back-to-the-1980s party, hosted by the new billionaire in chief, Donald J. Trump.

title: Pakistan Names New Military Leader
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif of Pakistan on Saturday chose Lt. Gen. Qamar Javed Bajwa, a military commander with a solid soldierly reputation and a firm belief in civilian supremacy, to lead the countrys powerful army.

title: Keeping the Electricity Grid One Step Ahead of the Storm
description: Chuck Willis, 60, is a senior emergency preparedness administrator at Baltimore Gas & Electric.

title: Variety: The Acrostic
description: VARIETY PUZZLE  Todays acrostic has nothing to do with my beloved Monty Pythons Flying Circus (a shame, in my opinion), but our constructors have lovingly planted an entry that is of great interest to me, even if, as they say below, its not in the dictionary.

title: Miamis Cuban Exiles Celebrate Castros Death
description: MIAMI  It did not matter that it was the middle of the night, or that it began to drizzle. When this citys Cuban-American residents heard the news, they sprinted to Little Havana. They banged pots and pans. They sang the Cuban national anthem and waved the Cuban flag. They danced and hugged, laughed and cried, shouted and rejoiced.

title: Betty Bui and David Purcell: Instant Chemistry With a Brief Plot Twist
description: Betty Uyen Bui, a daughter of Huong N. Bui of San Jose, Calif., and the late Phuong V. Bui, was married Nov. 26 to David Elliott Purcell, a son of Carol Burke Purcell of McLean, Va., and the late Francis E. Purcell. The Rev. Timothy Mills, an American Baptist minister, officiated at a nondenominational ceremony at the Ritz-Carlton in San Francisco.

title: Grammar Lesson on the Upper East Side
description: Dear Diary:

title: Jenna Kauffman and Jonathan Grinberg: Dont Send Flowers. Pizza Will Do.
description: Jenna Shane Kauffman, a daughter of Janis Rosenthal Kauffman and Robert J. Kauffman of Philadelphia, was married Nov. 26 to Jonathan Grinberg, a son of Sima Davidson and Dr. Isaac Grinberg of Huixquilucan, Mexico. Cantor David F. Tilman led the ceremony in the planetarium at the Franklin Institute, the science museum in Philadelphia.

title: In Madagascar Test, Drone Delivers Medicine by Air
description: When drones are in the news these days, the context is typically war or surveillance or the speedy deliver of packages to impatient consumers. Here, Heidi Hutner of Stony Brook University offers a Your Dot contribution on a recent test in a roadless region in Madagascar that could signal an exciting new frontier for this technology  helping deliver health care to some of the worlds poorest, most isolated communities.

title: Fate of U.S.-Cuba Thaw Is Less Certain Under Donald Trump
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama said on Saturday that the death of Fidel Castro was an occasion for Americans to extend a hand of friendship to the Cuban people and acknowledge the powerful emotions the revolutionary leader had evoked in both countries, seeking to use Mr. Castros fraught legacy to underscore his own efforts to bury decades of bitterness between the United States and Cuba.

title: One City. Two Soccer Clubs Split by War.
description: MITROVICA, Kosovo  Even among the flags and the sponsored jerseys and all the other trappings of the modern game, Bardhec Seferi could close his eyes and still see the waist-high grass.

title: As Soda Taxes Gain Wider Acceptance, Your Bottle May Be Next
description: For more than a decade, Coca-Cola, Pepsi and other beverage companies have fought mightily against efforts to tax sugary sodas, defeating more than three dozen such proposals around the country.

title: Trumps Next Battle: Keeping These Republican Senators Happy
description: WASHINGTON  While much of the attention in Washington is on who will fill the Trump cabinet, it is already clear who some of the most important people will be when it comes to fulfilling the Trump agenda.

title: The Strip
description: A weekly comic strip featured in the Sunday Review.

title: Plight of Houthi Rebels Is Clear in Visit to Yemens Capital
description: SANA, Yemen  Before the war, the Officers Club in downtown Sana was a prime recreation destination, known for its pool and garden cafe.

title: After Stops and Starts in College, a Rookie Receiver Latches on With the Jets
description: FLORHAM PARK, N.J.  Just two years ago, Robby Anderson had been dismissed from college and was back home in Florida. He applied for jobs at Walmart and a rental car company, without much luck. This, in his words, represented rock bottom.

title: Hillary Clintons Team to Join Wisconsin Recount Pushed by Jill Stein
description: WASHINGTON  Nearly three weeks after Election Day, Hillary Clintons campaign said on Saturday that it would participate in a recount process in Wisconsin incited by a third-party candidate and would join any potential recounts in two other closely contested states, Pennsylvania and Michigan.

title: Potential Conflicts Around the Globe for Trump, the Businessman President
description: MANILA  On Thanksgiving Day, a Philippine developer named Jose E. B. Antonio hosted a company anniversary bash at one of Manilas poshest hotels. He had much to be thankful for.

title: David Gray
description: David Gray is a British singer-songwriter  currently on tour in North America, where he has been playing his eclectic folk-rock and experimental repertoire at sold-out shows.

title: Why Not Smart Guns in This High-Tech Era?
description: The Department of Justice has issued official guidelines for the manufacture of smart guns  weapons that, like smartphones, have technology to allow only the rightful owners to use them. The guidelines aim to shape the future of gun safety technology, as called for under an executive order issued in January by President Obama, in the face of Congresss refusal to deal with the nations horrendous toll of gun deaths.

title: Definitions of America
description: Readers discuss identity politics and how it promotes or impedes our coming together.

title: The Soldier Donald Trump Called a Traitor
description: The case of Sgt. Bowe Bergdahl, an American soldier who, after leaving his post, was held hostage by the Taliban for five years, became a recurring theme of Donald Trumps unruly campaign speeches.

title: The Privileged Immigrant
description: Berkeley, Calif.  Girls, Mrs. Danilewitz called to her daughters, Girls, I want you to meet this extraordinary lady! My mother stood unsuspecting in the foyer, hardly taller than the two children who gazed at her now. Id been studying for a biology test with their older brother, Justin. Did you know, Mrs. D. went on, that this lady arrived in this country with no more than $6 in her pocket? And look what shes made of herself today! She clasped my mothers hand. Nimmu, what an inspiration!

title: His Holiness Declines to Answer
description: This is not normal  so say Donald Trumps critics as he prepares to assume the presidency. But the American republic is only the second-oldest institution facing a distinctively unusual situation at the moment. Pride of place goes to the Roman Catholic Church, which with less fanfare (perhaps because the papacy lacks a nuclear arsenal) has also entered terra incognita.

title: Will Guys With Guns Replace the Agency Elizabeth Warren Created?
description: Brandon Wilson is a former armed robber who, after serving roughly a decade in prison, reinvented himself as a successful debt broker. Basically, he makes a living buying and selling old, unpaid debts.

title: Election Therapy From My Basket of Deplorables
description: WASHINGTON  First I had to deal with the president-elect scolding.

title: Actually, Lets Not Be in the Moment
description: Im at the kitchen sink, after a long day of work and kids and chores and the emotional exhaustion of a toxic election season, attempting to mindfully focus on congealed SpaghettiOs. My brain flits to the Netflix queue. I manhandle my thoughts back to the leaky orange glob in front of me. My brain flits to the president-elect.

title: The Saloon, Americas Forgotten Democratic Institution
description: Frothy lager on tap. A communal mustache towel hanging by the bar. Partisan debate rattling the glassware. Americas saloons once served as boisterous poor mans clubs, where 19th-century laborers could make their political voices heard. In the wake of the 2016 election, with both parties struggling to connect with a disaffected working class, and just about everyone in need of a drink, Americans might want to belly up to the once-maligned saloon.

title: Can Senate Democrats Save the Party?
description: Having had more than two weeks to ponder one of the most humiliating presidential defeats in its history, the Democratic Party is moving to apply its lessons to the legislative battles ahead, as well as to the daunting but essential task of rebuilding the partys fortunes.

title: What Unions Got Wrong About Trump
description: For the nations labor unions, the day after Election Day was going to be a victory lap. They planned to boast to the world that their vaunted get-out-the-vote operation had delivered the White House to Hillary Clinton by winning three crucial Rust Belt states for her: Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin. But the unions, to their shock and horror, failed to deliver those states  or victory  to Mrs. Clinton.

title: Memories of Another Mosul
description: CHICAGO  The ancient Assyrians considered the Tigris River the division between East and West, and the city I come from in Iraq is called Mosul  connection point, in Arabic  because it connects these two sides. Nineveh, which lay on the eastern bank of the Tigris, was a capital of the great Assyrian empire. When Arabs arrived in the seventh century, they preferred to live at a distance from it, on the western bank, where the modern city of Mosul is today.

title: An Indian Protest for Everyone
description: Every protest contains a contradiction: people stand up  through speech, demonstration, violent or nonviolent action  and urge the state to change. They break the rules in order to convince the rule-makers that they need to change the rules, which is itself a kind of state-approved process. However, at Standing Rock in North Dakota, Indians from all over North America have been protesting for seven months in some ways never before seen.

title: Why I Left White Nationalism
description: I could easily have spent the night of Nov. 8 elated, surrounded by friends and family, thinking: We did it. We rejected a multicultural and globalist society. We defied the elites, rejected political correctness, and made a statement millions of Americans have wanted to shout for decades.

title: The Pretend Populism of Donald Trump
description: For a politician who won the White House by railing against the elites and demonizing the establishment, Donald Trump presented an odd argument for why Americans should believe, as he does, that his adviser Steve Bannon is no racist, anti-Semitic ally of the alt-right.

title: For Democrats, a Last Faint Hope to Gain a Senate Seat
description: NEW ORLEANS  The punk club was dark and packed, the lead singer of the band Hurray for the Riff Raff warming up a crowd of the young, the bearded and the well-tattooed. A little after 9 p.m., in came the headline act: a necktie-wearing cattle rancher, public service commissioner and United States Senate candidate from Elm Grove, La., who owns a half dozen hunting dogs and five times as many shotguns.

title: U.S. Statement on Reliability of Election Results
description: Following is the full text of a statement from a senior administration official, issued to The New York Times on Friday in response to questions about the federal governments investigation into the integrity of the Nov. 8 presidential election. The government issued the statement to The Times on the condition that it be attributable only to a senior official.

title: Finger Pointed at Russians in Alleged Coup Plot in Montenegro
description: PODGORICA, Montenegro  After multiple but unproven accusations that President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is working hard to destabilize Americas friends in Europe, a pro-Russian mercenary detained in Montenegro is slowly spilling his guts  and providing the first insiders account of what the authorities in this tiny Balkan nation say were Russian efforts to sow mayhem.

title: Talks to Heal Catholic Rift in China Gain Momentum Under Francis
description: BEIJING  Pope Francis has spoken of his admiration for Chinese culture. He has greeted a delegation from China, accepting a silk imprint of an ancient inscription about Christianity. And he had his picture taken with a Chinese bishop in St. Peters Square last month.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Sports Editor:

title: No. 2 Ohio State Defeats No. 3 Michigan in Overtime Thriller
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio  Generations of Ohio State and Michigan fans will debate the latest episode of one of college footballs most impassioned rivalries, a 30-27 Ohio State victory in two overtimes on Saturday, the Buckeyes fifth straight win over the Wolverines.

title: The Election and the Market Rally
description: You Cant See the Future in a Stock Surge, by Sendhil Mullainathan of Harvard (The Upshot, Economic View, Nov. 20), said the market rally that followed the presidential election was not necessarily an indicator of how the economy would perform under Donald J. Trump.

title: Tessa Worley of France Wins Giant Slalom in Vermont
description: KILLINGTON, Vt.  The World Cup of skiing returned to the Eastern United States for the first time in 25 years Saturday and was greeted by a clambering sea of fans who had hiked a quarter of a mile up the hill next to the racecourse to glimpse the worlds fastest female skiers.

title: An Unimaginable Day Arrives in Miami
description: Miami  The first time Fidel Castro died was around my birthday in 2006. I was in Miami when the announcement went out that Castro had had an operation and was temporarily ceding power to his brother. This being the first time Castro had voluntarily stepped away from his dictatorship, speculation ran wild. Miami Cubans took to the streets to celebrate the death of a tyrant, a symbol of death and loss for Cubans of all races and faiths.

title: Mixology
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  Everyone has a special purpose in life, as Steve Martin was told in the movie The Jerk, and crossword constructors are born to recognize odd patterns in words and phrases, then point them out for our entertainment.

title: Justin Trudeau Criticized for Praising Fidel Castro as Remarkable Leader
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada would like the world to know that he was rather fond of Fidel Castro. Or at least, that is the message that many people took from his unusually warm statement on the death of the Cuban dictator, whom he hailed on Saturday as a remarkable leader.

title: Half a Million Children Are Trapped in Syria, United Nations Says
description: With violence escalating in Aleppo and elsewhere across war-ravaged Syria, the United Nations said Saturday that the number of children trapped in besieged areas had doubled in less than a year to half a million.

title: Magnus Carlsen and Sergey Karjakin in Dead Heat in Chess Championship
description: With one game remaining in their World Chess Championship match, Magnus Carlsen and Sergey Karjakin are in a dead heat, after a quick but tense draw on Saturday.

title: South Carolina Romps Over No. 18 Syracuse in Brooklyn
description: Sindarius Thornwell scored 16 points, and South Carolina never trailed in its 64-50 victory over No. 18 Syracuse on Saturday in the Brooklyn Hoops Holiday Invitational at Barclays Center.

title: London  and Paris and New Delhi  in Silk Scarves
description: LONDON  Nearly five years ago, the textile designer Helen Chatterton was searching for a way to celebrate London. She had been fashioning mens and womens scarves with materials like tweed from Scotland and velvet from France but needed a way to create pieces with more of a London DNA for an exhibition of handmade British crafts that the OXO Tower gallery planned.

title: Gems Between Book Covers
description: Jewelry books are having a sparkling moment: More titles, more vivid illustration and easier than ever to find.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: There was such sadness to think of all the people, and what everyone went through, and the people who arent here today to celebrate and witness this.

title: A Glittering Ride
description: LONDON  It took more than 200 hours to create: For sale this Christmas, a rocking horse sparkling with 82,000 Swarovski crystals.

title: Joy of Giving
description: Creative executives at some of the worlds most influential, fashion-centric stores describe what they consider the best gifts theyve ever given.

title: More Than Just a Suitcase
description: LONDON  If youve ever felt a tinge of embarrassment when picking up your old suitcase from the carousel, now is a good time to upgrade. And when it comes to a good gift, luggage might not be what immediately comes to mind  but as companies re-evaluate the potential of the sector, things are changing.

title: Experiences, With a Bow on Them
description: HONG KONG  Gretchen Smelter wanted to surprise her husband, Frdric Lagrange, when he returned after a monthlong assignment in the remote northern reaches of Afghanistan  and to make the most of their time together before his next trip.

title: Going Beyond Time
description: Every year has its new watches and novelties that wow with good looks and mechanical wizardry. But among those timepieces are a few that give a little more, their brands pledging to donate a portion of sales to good causes, such as helping impoverished communities or protecting the environment.

title: The Art of the Arctic
description: Rime-encrusted trees on the high fells of Lapland look like surreal sculptures.

title: In Lapland, Natures Outdoor Sculpture Park
description: AKASLOMPOLO, Finland  I strapped on snowshoes and wriggled into multiple layers of spandex and fleece to trek up Kukastunturi, a 1,555-foot-high Arctic fell, a word derived from the Old Norse fjall, for a high, barren landscape.

title: In Jewelry, the Personal Connection
description: Julie Pellerin lives with her boyfriend at his stud farm in Normandy, has an apartment in Paris and adores New York.

title: Paper Cuts
description: WENGEN, Switzerland  My husband, Paul, surprised me with a special gift this year: a handmade Swiss Scherenschnitt, or scissors cut.

title: The Plush Pleasure of Velvet
description: LONDON  Tis the season for wearing velvet  or so it would seem during a browse through the Notting Hill branch of the high-end boutique Matches.

title: Amulya Nagarur, Muthu Vaduganathan
description: Dr. Amulya Nagarur and Dr. Muthu Vaduganathan were married Nov. 25 in Atlanta. Srinivasa Sarma, a Hindu priest, performed the ceremony at the Grand Hyatt Atlanta in Buckhead, with Manicka Bhattar, also a Hindu priest, taking part.

title: Stacey Kmetyk, Michael Burke
description: Stacey Christine Kmetyk and Michael Francis Burke were married Nov. 25 at the Prince Hall Lodge and Masonic Temple in New York. Celine Robinson, a Universal Life minister, officiated.

title: Noelle Kenel-Pierre, Michael Frisbie
description: Noelle Kenel-Pierre and Michael Thomas Frisbie were married Nov. 26 at the Immaculate Conception Roman Catholic Church in Jamaica Estates, Queens. The Rev. Christopher Cleary performed the ceremony.

title: Marixa Dygico, Michael Kaplan
description: Marixa Cada Dygico and Michael Louis Kaplan were married Nov. 26 at St. Patricks Cathedral in New York. The Rev. Dr. Joseph G. Marabe, the brides great-uncle and a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Norberto Eyule, another priest, taking part.

title: Melissa Marrero, Gustavo Camilo
description: Melissa Michelle Marrero and Gustavo Jose Camilo were married Nov. 26 at Parroquia San Jos de Calasanz, a Roman Catholic church in Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic. Peter Garrido, a friend of the couple and a Roman Catholic deacon, performed the ceremony.

title: Jessica Hof, Yaniv Soha
description: Jessica Rose Hof and Yaniv Eitan Soha were married Nov. 26 at the Green Building in Brooklyn. Rabbi Marc Katz officiated, with Cantor Shanna Zell taking part.

title: Kimberly Dixon, Gregory Kirschenbaum
description: Kimberly Rebecca Dixon, a daughter of Sherry L. Seeney of Dover, Del., and Gregory A. Dixon of Smyrna, Del., and a stepdaughter of Kimm L. Dixon, was married Nov. 26 to Gregory William Kirschenbaum, the son of Sherryl D. Kirschenbaum and George A. Kirschenbaum of New York. Rabbi Sue Levi Elwell officiated at the Carriage House at Rockwood Park, an event space in Wilmington, Del.

title: Aditi Maliwal, Jacob Stern
description: Aditi Maliwal, the daughter of Srividya Maliwal and Rajiv Maliwal of Singapore, was married Nov. 24 to Jacob Josephson Stern, the son of Nancy Josephson Sanitsky and David B. Stern, both of Los Angeles.

title: Whats on TV Sunday: 2016 Soul Train Awards and Divorce
description: Erykah Badu gets her groove on as host of the 2016 Soul Train Awards. The Affair flashes back a year in the life of Noah Solloway. And Season 1 of Divorce threatens to end on a high note.

title: Little Havana Reacts to Castro's Death
description: On Saturday night, hundreds of Cuban-Americans took to the streets of Miami to celebrate the death of Fidel Castro, who had ruled Cuba for nearly half a century.

title: One Family. Six Decades. Myriad Views of Fidel Castros Revolution.
description: HAVANA  When Fidel Castro rode victoriously into Havana on Jan. 8, 1959, Juan Montes Torre rushed into the streets to cheer. A poor, uneducated laborer from the eastern countryside of Cuba, he had arrived in the capital a few years earlier and, like most of his neighbors, could hardly believe what was happening.

title: Fidel Castro, Donald Trump, Cyber Monday: Your Weekend Briefing
description: Here are the weeks top stories, and a look ahead.

title: Subdued Cuba Prepares Memorial for Castro
description: HAVANA  Cuba is preparing for Fidel Castros final public appearance: a two-day memorial offering Cubans a chance to pay their respects.

title: Invoking Radicals of Americas Recent Past in a Politically Fraught Present
description: Shadows dissolved as the stage lights went up at the Public Theater in Manhattan, revealing Malik, a young man with a beret and an attitude to match. Alone, he summoned the spirit of the Black Panthers as he repeated his best defiant declaration: a gut-punching, all-purpose curse, practiced in anticipation of arrest.

title: Final Departure for 111-Year-Old Hudson Ferryboat
description: EDGEWATER, N.J.  The ferryboat Binghamton, a workhorse that served on the Hudson River for more than a century, will soon make its final departure.

title: Israel Defense Forces Kill 4 ISIS-Linked Attackers in Golan Heights
description: JERUSALEM  The Israeli military said it killed four militants linked to the Islamic State on Sunday after they attacked Israeli forces in the Golan Heights.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here.

title: Trump Claims, With No Evidence, That Millions of People Voted Illegally
description: WASHINGTON  President-elect Donald J. Trump said on Sunday that he had fallen short in the popular vote in the general election only because millions of people had voted illegally, leveling the baseless claim as part of a daylong storm of Twitter posts voicing anger about a three-state recount push.

title: Fidel Castro, Who Transformed Cuba
description: To the Editor:

title: Afghan Vice President Seen Abducting Rival
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  As heavy snow fell on the muddy arena in northern Afghanistan where a traditional game of buzkashi  two teams of horsemen fighting for a dead goat  was underway on Friday, a scuffle broke out near the stands.

title: Moana Has the Second Best Thanksgiving Weekend Opening of All Time
description: LOS ANGELES  With the mega-arrival of Moana over the holiday weekend, the reinvigorated Walt Disney Animation Studios cemented its status as cartoon-doms reigning powerhouse for non-sequel films.

title: South Korean Leader Digs In Against Rising Calls for Impeachment
description: SEOUL, South Korea  She is facing impeachment and prosecution over allegations of corruption and influence-peddling. One of her advisers is being likened to Rasputin by a shrill South Korean news media. Increasingly large crowds of protesters have taken to the streets, demanding her resignation.

title: Fidel Castro, Franois Fillon, Narendra Modi: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Nico Rosberg Takes Formula One Drivers Title Despite Lewis Hamiltons Win in Abu Dhabi
description: ABU DHABI, United Arab Emirates  Lewis Hamilton may have won the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix on Sunday, and he may have won 10 races this season compared to nine victories for his Mercedes teammate, Nico Rosberg.

title: Marianne Elliott to Direct Sondheim and Furths Company, With a Gender Twist
description: The Tony-winning director Marianne Elliotts new theater company will feature a gender-twisting production of Stephen Sondheim and George Furths 1970 musical Company, in London.

title: Mondays N.F.L. Matchup: Green Bay Packers (4-6) at Philadelphia Eagles (5-5)
description: 8:30 p.m. Eastern, ESPN

title: Obama Expands War With Al Qaeda to Include Shabab in Somalia
description: WASHINGTON  The escalating American military engagement in Somalia has led the Obama administration to expand the legal scope of the war against Al Qaeda, a move that will strengthen President-elect Donald J. Trumps authority to combat thousands of Islamist fighters in the chaotic Horn of Africa nation.

title: Gunfire Kills 1 in French Quarter of New Orleans
description: One man was killed and nine others were shot early Sunday morning on Bourbon Street in New Orleans, a teeming tourist destination that was more crowded than usual after the conclusion of a major college football game.

title: Giants Add to the Winless Browns Misery
description: CLEVELAND  Like pushing on an open door, the Giants handled the winless Cleveland Browns on Sunday afternoon, with wide receiver Odell Beckham Jr. overcoming a thumb injury early on to catch six passes for 96 yards and two touchdowns in a 27-13 victory.

title: At World Chess Championship, Familiar Overtones of East-West Politics
description: A Cold War battle has been playing out in Lower Manhattan for the last three weeks, in a soundproof glass chamber watched by partisans around the world. When the contest ends this week, victory will belong either to a resurgent Russia or to Norway, a wary neighbor along Russias increasingly militarized border.

title: As She Fights Cancer, a Woman Strives for Normalcy
description: For decades, Patricia Lewis toiled as a security guard for NYC Health & Hospitals, a duty she performed along with a second, and sometimes a third, job.

title: Treasury Auctions Set for the Week of Nov. 28
description: The Treasurys schedule of financing this week includes Mondays regular weekly auction of new three- and six-month bills and an auction of four-week bills on Tuesday.

title: Review: By Women Possessed, a Remix of a Flawed Eugene ONeill
description: The night that Eugene ONeills five-hour drama Strange Interlude opened on Broadway in 1928, the anxious playwright stayed away. He sent in his stead not his wife, Agnes, but a woman with whom he had lately grown obsessed and for whom he would soon abandon Agnes  the glamorous actress Carlotta Monterey.

title: In College Football, Getting the Right Coach Is the Top Priority
description: The eminent college football program puttered along for a decade. There were a couple of 10-win seasons, but mostly inferior ones. Over 10 seasons, the team had four interim and permanent head coaches and, not accounting for N.C.A.A. sanctions, went 67-82. The punishment did not help, but neither did a general feeling of malaise and inconsistency  in short, the effects of suboptimal coaching.

title: To Save Punks Soul, a Bonfire of Some of Its Vanities on the Thames
description: LONDON  Joe Corr, the son of Malcolm McLaren, the Sex Pistols manager who defined the bands direction in its brief heyday in the late 1970s, set fire to what he claimed was 5 million (about $6.25 million) worth of punk memorabilia aboard a boat on the Thames River here on Saturday.

title: Review: Pick a Nutcracker, One From Balanchine, the Other Reimagined
description: Tchaikovskys music for The Nutcracker is and isnt familiar. You think youve known it forever  its quoted all across popular culture  and yet you have only to listen to the overture, where the sprightly melody is soon irregularly punctuated by staccato chords, to hear how multilayered it is and how unpredictable. No single version has all the answers  not even George Balanchines The Nutcracker, which opened with New York City Ballet in 1954 and today is a holiday staple for multiple companies from Copenhagen to Seattle.

title: Combative, Populist Steve Bannon Found His Man in Donald Trump
description: When Julia Jones arrived at her office in Santa Monica at 8 a.m.  by Hollywood screenwriter standards, the crack of dawn  she found Stephen K. Bannon already at his desk, which was cluttered with takeout coffees. They were co-writers on a Ronald Reagan documentary, but Mr. Bannon had pretty much taken it over. He had been at work for hours, he told her, writing feverishly about his political hero.

title: Whitney Biennial to Miami Artists: Its Not Us, Its You
description: MIAMI  As the art worlds eyes turn toward this weeks Art Basel Miami Beach fair, you might imagine its homegrown artists relishing the moment. Yet more than a little grumbling can be heard here, much of it over the recent announcement of the 63 artists selected for the Whitney Museum of American Arts 2017 Biennial.

title: Childrens Game
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Everyone needs a reason to get out of bed on a Monday morning, and thats precisely what Kristian House has in store for us today.

title: The Lasting Legacy of a Fighter for the Amazon
description: Chico Mendes was hard to kill. No one knew that better than his enemies in Brazils Amazon rain forest. They had failed in half a dozen assassination attempts.

title: Nintendos New Console May Feed Your Nostalgia, if You Can Get One
description: When she heard that Nintendo was planning to reproduce its iconic Nintendo Entertainment System video game console for the holiday season, Emily Bradbury put a note on her calendar and set an alarm on her phone.

title: Even as Trudeau Reaches Out to First Nations, Mercury Rises
description: Billy Gauthier, an Inuk artist who lives in Labrador on Canadas remote northeastern coast, began his hunger strike on Oct. 13 after a plate of salmon. The meal was highly symbolic.

title: In India, Black Money Makes for Bad Policy
description: NEW DELHI  On Nov. 8, the Indian government announced an immediate ban on two major bills that account for the vast majority of all currency in circulation. Indians would have until the end of the year to change those notes for other bills, including newly minted ones.

title: The Little Fidel in All of Us
description: Oakland, Calif.  THE headline scrolled through the corner of my computer screen sometime after 10 on Friday night. Fidel Castro had died. It was news Id been waiting to hear my entire life, and yet I hesitated.

title: Cyber Monday Hits as the U.S. Awaits Jobs Data
description: Heres a look at whats coming up this week:

title: Franois Fillon Wins Center-Right Nomination for French Presidency
description: PARIS  French voters chose a socially conservative, budget-cutting former prime minister on Sunday to lead the center-right Republican Party in next years presidential election. Once again, the outcome upset pollsters initial predictions, and it paved the way for a likely face-off with the countrys far-right party in 2017.

title: Heng on Trump and the Trans-Pacific Partnership
description: A toxic political war over money, jobs and globalization killed the complex trade deal that was supposed to be a signature legacy of President Obama.

title: Cities Vow to Fight Trump on Immigration, Even if They Lose Millions
description: LOS ANGELES  Here in Los Angeles, where nearly half of the citys residents are Latino, Mayor Eric Garcetti has vowed to do everything he can to fight widespread deportations of illegal immigrants.

title: In Tougher Fall TV Landscape, New Rules Apply
description: Well, it could be worse.

title: In Europe, Is Uber a Transportation Service or a Digital Platform?
description: Ever since Uber showed up in Europe in late 2011, the American ride-booking service has faced vocal opposition.

title: When A.I. Matures, It May Call Jrgen Schmidhuber Dad
description: LUGANO, Switzerland  Jrgen Schmidhuber may be the Rodney Dangerfield of artificial intelligence research.

title: South Koreas Impeachment Process, Explained
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korean lawmakers will vote on Friday on the impeachment of President Park Geun-hye, who is accused of helping a friend commit extortion. If she is forced from office, it will be a first for South Korea, but the process is long and uncertain. Heres how it works.

title: Fritz Weaver, Tony-Winning Character Actor, Dies at 90
description: Fritz Weaver, a Tony Award-winning character actor who played a German Jewish doctor slain by the Nazis in the 1978 mini-series Holocaust and an Air Force colonel who becomes increasingly unstable as the nation faces a nuclear crisis in the 1964 movie Fail Safe,  died on Saturday at his home in Manhattan. He was 90.

title: Looking Spiffy, Except for One Thing
description: Dear Diary:

title: Animosity in a Burmese Hub Deepens as Chinese Get Richer
description: MANDALAY, Myanmar  From damp and drizzly London, the siren of British imperialism, Rudyard Kipling, wrote a poem that captured the palm trees, pagodas and temple bells of Burma during colonial rule.

title: Pauline Oliveros, Composer Who Championed Deep Listening, Dies at 84
description: Pauline Oliveros, a composer whose lifes work aspired to enhance sensory perception through what she called deep listening, died on Thursday at her home in Kingston, N.Y. She was 84.

title: Can Oil Help Mexico Withstand Trumps Attack on Trade? Its Hard to See How
description: CIUDAD DEL CARMEN, Mexico  The town that oil built is emptying out.

title: East or West, Hometown Favorite Mikaela Shiffrin Draws Cheers in World Cup Race
description: KILLINGTON, Vt.  Pauline Condron, the 95-year-old grandmother of the Olympic champion Mikaela Shiffrin, had never seen her 21-year-old granddaughter ski in a World Cup race until Sunday. Condron lives in western Massachusetts, and since 1991, skiings World Cup circuit had avoided the Eastern United States.

title: A Child Forged in Loss and Fury, in a City Far From Havana
description: MIAMI  I did not meet Fidel Castro in a history book like most American children. I met him in my house surrounded by early exile furniture, a term my mother favored. I bumped into him at the dining room table over a meal or in the living room while the grown-ups drank tumblers of whiskey or at the beach when my mother cursed him, toes in the sand, as she remembered Cubas idyllic beaches.

title: So Much More Than Laughing Out Loud
description: Its one of the most commonly texted acronyms: LOL. In fact, from a collection of more than 44,000 text messages sent by teenagers in New York City, LOL came up about 5,000 times. It ostensibly means laughing out loud  or lots of love if youre Winston Churchill  but a linguistics researcher from Columbia University challenges both of those meanings on this weeks episode of Tell Me Something I Dont Know.

title: Review: The Pigeon in the Taj Mahal, With a Bride-to-Be and a Trailer Park
description: The actor John Keating is a tall bag of bones with fright-wig hair and frightened-deer eyes, a look built for character parts. That he nabs the lead role in Laoisa Sextons The Pigeon in the Taj Mahal at the Irish Repertory Theater is reason enough to see it, even if the plays protracted execution wears out the prickly charm of its premise.

title: Ron Glass, Who Played a Dapper Detective on Barney Miller, Dies at 71
description: Ron Glass, who portrayed Ron Harris, the dapper and intellectual detective on the ensemble television comedy series Barney Miller and who appeared in numerous television shows and films, died on Friday at his home in Los Angeles. He was 71.

title: That Special Present
description: You always remember some gifts, the ones somebody really thought about. Or the ones you wish would appear. Here, some well-known figures in the art and business world talk about great presents.

title: Ryan Fitzpatricks Steady Hand Is Upended in Jets Loss to the Patriots
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J.  The Jets decided to introduce the offensive starters before Sundays game against the New England Patriots, and the final player announced was quarterback Ryan Fitzpatrick. One of their most popular players last season, Fitzpatrick may now be one of their least.

title: Under Fidel Castro, Sport Symbolized Cubas Strength and Vulnerability
description: On July 24, 1959, months after coming to power, Fidel Castro took the mound at a baseball stadium in Havana to pitch an exhibition for a team of fellow revolutionaries known as Los Barbudos, the Bearded Ones.

title: No Corrections: November 28, 2016
description: No corrections appeared in print.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: The president has no intention of stepping down, the people are fighting on the streets, and the government is paralyzed. We have no option but to impeach her.

title: I Remember Her: Questions Persist After Break in 70 Killing of Harlem Woman
description: A rabbit hunter found the body. But he went home to Queens and waited a day before calling the police because he feared trouble  it was not rabbit season.

title: Sexual Abuse Claims in English Youth Leagues Prompt Wider Inquiry by Authorities
description: Englands Football Association, which remained largely silent for almost two weeks as former players came forward with accusations of sexual abuse by coaches in the countrys soccer development system, announced Sunday that it was broadening an internal investigation into the claims.

title: Lawsuit Aims to Hold 2 Contractors Accountable for C.I.A. Torture
description: Nearly 15 years after the United States adopted a program to interrogate terrorism suspects using techniques now widely considered to be torture, no one involved in helping craft it has been held legally accountable. Even as President Obama acknowledged that the United States tortured some folks, his administration declined to prosecute any government officials.

title: The Walking Dead Season 7, Episode 6: Hey Look, Another New Group!
description: It was fringe character week on The Walking Dead on Sunday, as we left the main group behind entirely to spend an hour watching Tara and Heath scavenge, frolic in a zombie sandbox and negotiate post-apocalypse morality.

title: Insecure Season 1 Finale: Great Expectations
description: I miss you, Lawrence says over the phone to Issa toward the end of this weeks episode. This statement suggests that maybe Lawrence isnt all that interested in the single life his friends introduce him to, full of easy sex, nights at gaudy strip clubs and a startling lack of empathy for the black women they take on as romantic partners. His phone call provides enough of a glimmer of hope to prompt Issa to leave Kellis birthday trip and travel home in the middle of the night. But their phone call proves to be more of a wistful goodbye than anything else, proving once again that, for all its comedic trappings, Insecure is far more brutal than it originally appeared.

title: The Affair Season 3, Episode 2: Helen, Alison and Furkat
description: The Affair got back to multistranded business as usual following its Noah-centric season premiere. On Sunday night we got an episode that was about two-thirds Helen and one-third Alison, a ratio I think most of us here at recap central can live with.

title: With Shifts in National Mood Come Shifts in Words We Use, Study Suggests
description: In the wake of the election, its clear American society is fractured. Negative emotions are running amok, and countless words of anger and frustration have been spilled. If you were to analyze this news outlet for the ratio of positive emotional words to negative ones, would you find a dip linked to the events of the past few weeks?

title: Argentina Rallies Against Croatia to Win First Davis Cup Title
description: Argentina won its first Davis Cup title on Sunday when Federico Delbonis beat Ivo Karlovic in straight sets to complete a stunning 3-2 comeback win over Croatia. It was Argentinas fifth appearance in the final.

title: Fidel Castro, Formula One, Franois Fillon: Your Monday Briefing
description: Good morning.

title: Whats on TV Monday: Bob Dylan in Dont Look Back and HBO Visits Cuba
description: In Dont Look Back, D. A. Pennebaker captures a poet in the making as he follows Bob Dylan on tour. And just days after the death of Fidel Castro, two HBO documentaries capture Cuba on the brink of change.

title: Fidel Castros Sister, an Outspoken Critic, Takes No Joy in His Death
description: CORAL GABLES, Fla.  Juanita Castro considered her brother Fidel a traitor and had not spoken to him in 52 years, but, even so, she feels that a piece of her is missing now that he is dead.

title: What Castros Death Means for a Child of Mariel
description: Growing up, Id break into a cold sweat anytime the rumor circulated that Fidel Castro was dead. To me that meant returning to the island that was supposed to be home, but that I barely remembered. I dont know anyone there, Id think. Where will I go to school? Where will we live?

title: Westworld Season 1, Episode 9: You Broke My Mind
description: Among other things, Westworld is a metaphor for the act of creation  which, in essence, makes it a show about its own creation. We may have been promised the same thing as the guests: an Old West adventure, loaded with the sex and violence that weve come to expect from an HBO show. But the show has devoted itself to defying those expectations at every turn, by making pleasure another component to be analyzed, like a cold body on a slab. Westworld has a story to tell, but its also about storytelling, constantly forcing us to recognize the falseness of the stories that are given to us and the stories that we tell ourselves. Somewhere at the bottom of it all is the truth  the center of the maze, to use the shows expression  but not even that feels like terra firma at this point. It could be just another rug for the shows creators to pull.
